description:
Favorite place in the Bay Area to get pie. I always make an effort to get a slice of pie here whenever I'm in the neighborhood. Slices are currently $4.85 per slice, which is more than reasonable. I love that their pies are on rotation based on whatever fruits/nuts are in season, and that all of their pies are full of actual pieces of fruit...versus other places that just have some kind of artificial-tasting puree. My favorite, if I had to pick one, would probably be the peach blackberry (add a scoop of ice cream if you're feeling a bit indulgent!)...although I have yet to eat a pie that I didn't like.

They are open for long hours, so it's also a great place to get some work done in or to catch up with friends if you can get a seat.
author: Clarice C.

description:
Favorite place in the city for food/coffee/dessert. I have never had a pie there that I didn't like, and it's the perfect place to sit on a fall day with a friend and play games and chat. The staff is always nice and their prices are fair. I just wish they had more seating!

Make sure you always splurge for both the cream and the ice cream!!
author: Sam A.

description:
This is a great little spot if you want to get a bit of work done or catch up with a friend. They have a good amount of seating but on a typical day it's usually packed.

They have a nice selection of pies, usually including at least 2 vegan pies. Their vegan pies are pretty tasty and aren't too sweet which is good for me. Overall, I'm not blown away by their pies but I think it's a nice place to grab some food and chill for a bit. It's also a bit pricey for a slice that doesn't really fill you up (~$5 after taxes). I would recommend having them heat up your pie and also adding a scoop of ice cream on the side!

They also have salads and other treats on the menu but I have yet to try them!
author: Angelina H.

description:
Stopped in on a Saturday evening with a blazing craving for some peach pie. This place was super packed and the line couldn't move fast enough. The pies looked so good in the display. I wanted to buy a whole one, but seeing as this was my first time I figured I better try a slice first.

There were gigantic pieces of peach, fresh, very delicious, but then the crust was so thin, crispy and flaky. I was expecting a thicker and softer crust, certainly a crust that would be able to hold it's contents with each bite. The peaches were sliding out so easily, I had to place the crust back on top to eat them together.

So glad I didn't let my eyes get the best of me. For almost $5 a slice (and would have been $29 for a whole pie) it was just okay. Disappointed my craving wasn't satisfied.
author: Ash K.

description:
Pies galore!

Dude, this place is great. A perfect spot to cap off a days worth of adventuring The City. Been here a couple times in the evening after dinner to satisfy them sweet tooth cravings. My first visit was near closing time. Everything looked so good, and I couldn't decide, so I went wild and ordered four different pies to go. No regrets. The kind folks behind the counter stacked the to-go boxes up high and tied them up with some twine. I definitely broke some necks as I walked out the shop carrying a tower of pies by my side. Cool.

I've tried a bunch of their options, as seen in my photos, and every one was delightful. Dining in? Warm that slice up and get a scoop of ice cream (vanilla only), why don't you?! What goes good with pie, you ask? Coffee of course! They serve Equator coffee here. Nice!

Like pie? Of course you do. Fill your pie-hole at Mission Pie!
author: Roderick T.

description:
This place is one of my new favorite dessert spots in sf! They have plenty of different pies, as well as vegan. We got the banana cream pie and a double crusted apple pie topped with ice cream. It was sooo good.
Also, their hot chocolate is a must have! I highly recommend. Overall its such a chill location and the staff is very welcoming. No wifi, but there are bathrooms.
author: Kimberly M.

description:
Just an overall pleasant experience, and one of my favorite dessert shops in the city. The staff is always friendly and welcoming, and the flavors are always changing to incorporate whatever is in season. You can tell they make their pies from scratch from the first bite.

I highly recommend asking them to warm it up. They give you a cute lil placard and will bring the deliciousness straight to your table!
author: Rachel L.

description:
Mission Pie!!! How did I not know about you before?!?! I've been to all of these nice ice cream places in SF and I've been wondering where all the pie is...

Anyway, this place is warm and cozy. There's plenty of seating (even a dedicated kids table, which is adorable) and a sort of farm-to-table feel. I'm from the east coast, and there are tons of places like that. This definitely tasted like one of them.

We had the mixed berry/peach pie. The peach pie was pleasantly not too sweet, and the crust was perfect (I don't even like pie crust, but I did like this crust). The mixed berry was probably my favorite, it had a sugary-oaty topping and fresh fruit underneath. It's a small detail, but I like that they milk (in different sizes!) on their actual menu and not just the kids menu. I feel like too many places don't acknowledge the fact that who doesn't love a nice glass of milk with their baked goods??? They have other drinks too though if milk isn't your thing--pretty much your standard coffee and tea drinks. Also, they have a daily 'refresher'. Today's was watermelon and I'm pretty sure it was straight watermelon without the pulp. It tasted super fresh and like no sugar was added at all, which was amazing!
author: Claire C.

description: Adorable and delicious pie shop with great lattes (I recommend the lavender latte). I ordered a slice of the banana cream pie and my boyfriend ordered the PB+J slice-- we were both happy with our decisions!
author: Grace P.

description:
Located near a BART station
Parking is available (street and residential)
Monday nights they have live music 
A slice of pie here will run you $5 
- no tipping necessary because you seat yourself where available & grab your own utensils  
Water is complimentary

Is it the best pie I've ever had? No
Is it a nice place to catch up with friends in an unpretentious setting? Yes
author: Victoria X.

description:
The workers in here are so nice. And helpful. I was really impressed

We had a 

chocolate cream pie

And a
peach blackberry pie

Bother we're fantastic

We came here after the Lafayette wine and art festival, then dorado tacos at la tacqueria,  then went and looked at Open houses
author: Foodlover B.

description:
Drawn in by the great reviews, I checked this place out a few times when I lived in the neighborhood. It is good overall!

The ambience is low key and feels a bit like a retro diner mixed with a living room. They have games and some comfy chairs mixed in with metal tables of varying sizes. They also have some board games. It's a nice place to relax and pass some time! They have self serve water and utensils and you order at the counter. It tends to be busy but it's not usually difficult to find a seat when you need one. 

Food-wise, they serve a variety of sweet pies along with some savory pie and food options. They make excellent coffee drinks (love the Americano!). Everything is clearly made from scratch and the pie fillings are delicious. I have enjoyed the mixed berry and banana cream pie the most! I'm not a huge fan of their crust, which has a flaky, dry consistency as opposed to a more moist one. I think this is a preference mismatch as opposed to a failing, though. You can also add vanilla ice cream to your pie and the ice cream they serve is unusually good - it's creamy, indulgent and tastes like it is made with "real" ingredients. I also like that the portion sizes aren't overkill (they give you a size of slice that is just enough for you to feel satisfied, without feeling regretful! Haha!). 

Lastly, most of the servers have been very nice and helpful, but I've had occasional weird interactions that were off putting. For example, I once asked what chess pie was and got a judgey response for not knowing that in a pie context, it's apparently pronounced "chuss". What? Why make a thing of this? Also, I'll admit that I'm a person who throws down money for expensive food on the regular, but for some reason I always leave feeling like this is expensive for what it is.
author: Christine G.

description: The banana cream pie here is the best I've ever had! During the holidays it's best that you pre order. The line goes down the block. I was sad to see that they were closed at 8:55pm when yelp says they close at 10pm. The chicken pot pie was a little watery for me. But I still give 5 stars because the banana cream pie is bomb!
author: Mai N.

description:
The only place in SF that my wife and I can go to satisfy our occasional pie craving!

We always get the Mixed Berry Pie and it always hits the spot. The crust is buttery and flaky, the filling is sweet and gooey, and the the granola-like topping is crunchy (and nut-free for someone with nut allergies like me!). Definitely best enjoyed when warmed!

1 star deducted because everything else on the menu that I've tried was forgettable, and for lack of variety in general. I've tried the Banana Cream Pie, Peach Berry Pie, and Chicken Pot Pie and though they are good, I can't say I was wowed.

Overall, still a go-to for my wife and I. Hopefully it inspires more pie places to open up in the city!
author: Ryan M.

description:
Elbos on the table kind of place.
Great pie.
Coffee could be better.
author: M M.

description: Love love love Mission Pie!!!!! Seasonal favorites are strawberry rhubarb, shakers lemon, peach and apricot!!!! Price got higher in these years, but still my to-go pie place!
author: Sayuri W.

description:
I really don't like to give low reviews and I had high hopes for this place because of the high rating but my experience was truly underwhelming.

First, I would like to preface that I have tried pie bar in Seattle and it was a gamechanger so my expectation can be a wee bit high for pies now.

Where do I start...I have been wanting to try this place because of the high ratings and reviews then finally, I convinced my friend to come here with me. We decided to share one slice just to test/sample the pie (good call). I ordered one slice of banana cream pie. Everything was pretty straight forward and the staff was very friendly but when the pie came out, my initial thought was...it looked dry, hopefully it doesn't taste dry. The crust didn't look buttery at all. It looked dry and dull.  I put my doubts aside and tried the pie and within the first bite, I knew this wasn't for me at all.  The banana cream was decent but to me, it wasn't the best. It's not terrible, it's not good. It's mediocre.
author: Ngoc P.

description: Mission Pie definitely filled a gap in my soul with their potato tart. It was a rush of warmth with savory goodness. The potatoes were thinly sliced and were soft as they should be. Haven't had anything like it so far. If you've got a chip on your shoulder or just need a quick perk, I can guarantee you there's something for everyone and it will not disappoint!
author: Ryan K.

description:
I'm at a loss of words.  Their pie is just sooooo good!

I had a delicious mini banana cream pie to go the first time I went here.  My dad needed a pick-me-up, and banana cream pie is his favorite.  We usually go to Nation's in our hometown since that's the only pie place in our tiny city.  To no surprise, local bakery is far superior than mass-produced pies.  And the banana cream pie from Mission Pie is just beautifully made - a good crust with bite, sweet banana filling, with cream that didn't push the sweetness over the top.  I don't like whipped cream.  I usually push it off to the side.  Not for this pie.  It's all good, and best eaten in one bite.

I went again to take my friend because I knew she would love this place.  She got a walnut pie, which is like a pecan pie.  I got a peach-blueberry crumble.  Each bite was so heavenly.  The pie really showcased the fruit, and if they added sugar, then they added the right amount because it seemed like it the sweetness was all from the fruit.

They also have coffee, teas, and alcohol available, as well as savory pies, which I need to try.

It's also a cute date place, but not sickly cute.  Some of the tables can be shared, and two gentlemen on a date sat next to my friend and I.  They actually ordered the same slices as us!  Well, they were talking, holding hands, looking lovingly at each other.  And it wasn't awkward to sit next to them at all.  The place is just that welcoming for all walks of life to come together and enjoy a slice of pie.
author: Vira P.

description:
Love Mission Pie !!
Locally sourced , seasonal & delightful .
Staff exceptionally friendly and efficient. 
My friend had the chicken pot pie , I regret not having it , I had a bite & it was delicious , the crust , omg !
Smelled like heaven .
I had coffee and Banana cream pie , so homemade like & real tasting cream and filling .
Again , crust was awesome !
Nice art displayed also .
Check it out !!!
author: Ellie O.

description:
Love Mission Pie. I always eat any variation of peach/blackberry pie and it hits the spot. Warmed with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. A pot of tea on the side. 

Gets pretty busy, definitely sometimes hard to find a seat but oh man, is this place the best for catching up with an old friend. The pie is flakey and sweet- never old and crusty. We've been going through all the tea they have here and are definitely big fans of some of the caffeinated ones that we should not be drinking at 8pm.

Staff is extremely friendly/accommodating. My go to place for pie in the city.
author: Arezou A.

description:
As someone who really doesn't like pie, I was pretty disappointed when my friends decided to go to Mission Pie after dinner one night. I was pleased to find that they had a brownie sundae, so I ordered that. It was definitely tasty! Mission Pie also has salad, soup, pot pies, stew, wine + beer, cookies, pastries and some breakfast-y type items for pie-haters like me.

Otherwise, it seemed like a nice place to be, but it was completely packed so we had to stand and eat.
author: Kristin A.

description:
Really delicious. My recommendations:

-RASPBERRY CHESS PIE: I've never had a chess pie before, but was drawn in by the unique custard-looking consistency of the pie. Tasted like a firmer but equally as creamy egg tart, studded with tart raspberries. The neutral, salty crust complimented the sweetness of the filling quite well. 
-CHOCOLATE CREAM PIE: on the sweeter side. Same satisfying crust layered with a rich, chocolate cream then topped off with a generous layer of whipped cream. Liked the quality tasting chocolate -- deep and rich, no artificial chocolate pudding taste or anything. 

However, my friend tried the peach cobbler and another fruit tart but found them less appetizing. We both agreed those fell a bit flat, similar to putting macerated fruit on top of a dry crust. Would've been nice with some ice cream or custard filling.
author: Patricia Z.

description:
Finally gave this place a try!
We ordered Banana Cream Pie and Double Apple Pie to share. We chose not to have a scoop of vanilla ice cream with the apple pie and I'm regretting it! 

Banana Cream Pie: It seems to be what they are known for, so even though I'm not a huge banana fan, we had to get it. It was definitely delicious. It was creamy and smooth; not overly sweet. I was thinking, I probably could eat a whole pie by myself...

Double Apple Pie: This was a bit disappointing. It had large chunks of apples buy they were pretty loosely packed. The crust was thin and crispy, but we were not wowed by it. It was also a bit too sweet.

Overall, a cute place in the Mission; close to 24th Street BART station. We will be back to try their hop pies!
author: Alice L.

description:
We stumbled upon this place while looking for an after dinner dessert. And I'm so glad we did! 

Normally I don't really like pie, and I'm not a big fan of banana either. But their BANANA CREAM PIE IS TO DIE FOR! It was soo soo delicious. It wasn't too sweet and it tasted really fresh, not heavy at all. It is a must here. I highly recommend this.
I also tried the mixed berries pie. It was too sweet for me but it was still really good. 

The place was quite spacious and clean. The service was good. You pay for your food first then they bring it too you. We only ordered sliced pies, and they were pretty fast even though the place was crowded. A slice of pie is around $5. It is not a big slice or anything so it is a bit expensive in my opinion. But I would totally come back for the Banana Cream Pie again!
author: Veronica N.

description:
I always go to Nation's for their banana cream pie, but decided to be adventurous and try Mission Pie instead since I was in the neighborhood. First thoughts: small slice, but not too sweet. Nice light, smooth texture. I do not like it when my desserts are too sweet, so this was perfect!! My slice of BCP had less whip cream and definitely more bananas and filling than at Nation's, which is to my liking as well. They don't skimp on the bananas!!! My bf also ordered a slice of the walnut pie. Huge chunks of walnut and it wasn't too sweet either. It was pretty good! The pie crust wasn't anything fancy, but still worth eating. Also ordered a hot chocolate - came in a glass cup and homemade whip cream (which was literally a blob of cream lol). Nothing special.

We came here around 8:30pm, close to 9 on a Saturday evening. There was a short line and pretty much all the tables were full. The place was pretty popular and many small groups dining here, chillin'. Overall, I'm a fan of their BCP and I'd come back to try their other pies, such as the apple pie.
author: Debby N.

description:
I've been here a couple of times over the years and I really enjoy this place. Here are some reasons why I come here and why you should come here too! 
-friendly service 
-good pies that are homemade and not too sweet 
-a warm and comforting place to sit down and enjoy a light meal or dessert 
-a great place to meet and chat with friends 

I haven't had a chance to try their savory pies but I will in the future! The rhubarb is always a go to for me :) 

Parking can suck at times but in this type of area... you just need to have a bit of patience and circle around the block!
author: Joyce S.

description:
After a giant meal at El Farolito, my friend and I decided getting dessert was the best way to end the night so we walked down the block to Mission Pie. 

Mission Pie is so cute, it kind of has a home-y vibe and the smell of pastries baking is amazing! We ordered a strawberry rhubarb pie with whipped cream as well as a banana cream pie. 

The banana cream pie was good but I wish the banana flavor was a little more pronounced. There were slices of bananas in the pie but the cream was so rich, I couldn't really taste the banana.

Strawberry rhubarb pie was great! Really tangy, loved the whipped cream on top, and the crust was really good too.

We also ordered lemonade but it tasted like water, lemon, and nothing else. It was pretty whatevers.

Definitely a great dessert place to check out of you're in the area!
author: Shannon C.

description: Decent pie and friendly service. The apple pie a la mode was def better than the banana cream one. Stays open until 10, which is nice if you have late night sweet cravings like me.
author: Antonella H.

description: Mission Pie - an SF staple and the perfect place for dessert after dinner in the city. They're open late and have a ton of seating, with tables for small groups of 2-4 people. The last time I came in was on a Friday evening. All the tables were occupied so we ordered 4 slices to go. Being that it was my boyfriends first time there, he got excited and decided that he couldn't just choose one slice. The to-go boxes were stacked and tied together with twine, which was super convenient. Our overall favorite was the banana cream pie, though everything was delicious. They also offer beer!
author: Camille B.

description:
Been here twice but only had their pie once. A few years ago, we walked in and discovered that they were out of vegan pie. I was bummed but running out is usually a good sign. It's also competitive to find a place to sit. Another good sign!

On our last visit, we lucked out on getting vegan pies and finding a place to sit thanks to a nice elderly couple that waved us over to share the table with them. (Side rant: They were also sharing a table with a younger couple who apparently had issues with moving their stuff off the empty chairs so we can sit. You know, I get that they're gonna stay for hours studying, preventing new customers from being able to sit. But learn some manners and don't be a d**k by taking up extra chairs!!!)

I digress...

Mission Pie had two vegan flavors that Saturday evening:
- Apple Huckleberry http://bit.ly/2yQFvyw
- Pear Ginger http://bit.ly/2kGOIEK

Usually when faced with the decision between two things, the Meateater BF encourages me to "get 'em both!" But in attempt to watch my sugar intake per the doctor's orders, I veered toward Pear Ginger. These flavors together...omg YUM! I had to work really hard not to eat the entire slice. Friggin' doctor's orders!

The BF had a Chocolate Cream pie which I'm guessing he enjoyed because it disappeared very quickly.

I'm pretty sure that if we were in the area, we would stop by for a slice of pie again.
author: Harmonie T.

description:
Cute decor and branding, but the pies here are whatevs.

I've had Mission Pie multiple times on pi day, and always thought they were just ok. They emphasize more on the filling rather than the crust. If you're a crust lover like me, prepare to be disappointed. 

They also don't offer warming up the pie as an option here, which I thought was a bit odd considering the steep price (almost $5 a slice). I'm not a big pie person, but I'd honestly prefer Costco apple pie.

Also, yesterday was my first time visiting in-store, and the gal at the counter must've told us at least three times that they were closing soon. 

Once when we placed our order, again when we finished our pie, and also towards the tail end. Like ok, we get that you want to leave. If you're closing soon and are going to remind customers about it so many times, you shouldn't offer eating in as an option.
author: Shirley H.

description: Mission Pie makes THE best gluten free pies in the Bay Area...and possibly the best gf pie in the States. My life changed the day I found out they sell gluten free pies at the Grand Lake farmer's market- I now buy them frequently and bring them to events, get-togethers and holiday celebrations. The gluten free pie is SO good that I want to serve it at our wedding  in lieu of cake. If you are gluten free and tired of feeling like a sad puppy when you see pie, get on Mission Pie's gluten free delights.
author: S C.

description:
This is one of the most famous dessert places you can go to in mission they have a variety of selections of pie and ice cream's which taste great
If you are looking for a dessert place after your meal definitely D definitely give this place a try
author: Jay G.

description:
Mission Pie is great. The staff is super friendly and helpful. I called ahead to put a pie on hold for a party, then changed my mind about what kind of pie I wanted, called back, and they were more than happy to oblige.

When I went to pick up the pie, I wanted to try every single one they had on display! Maybe next time...

Now for the pie! The banana cream pie was amazing. Great flaky crust, not too sweet, and totally tasted like fresh bananas. Really delicious, I will definitely be back!
author: Parise S.

description: Their banana cream pie is still amazing. All their pies are still amazing. On this most recent visit I tried their savory pot pie as well as their quiche. My gosh. The crust on that quiche was amazing. I've never been big on quiche but this might have changed my mind. Then there was the savory pot pie. The beef curry was tender and melted in your mouth. Defintely will always be one of my go to places for pie
author: Celia Z.

description:
Comfort food with a wholesome touch. Pricey but - hey!  It's in SF!  Tried the chicken pot pie - fully crusted. Delish!  Dessert was decaf coffee w a slice of Frangipane pie. Mmmm ... 

Will have to return to try the curry pot pie!!!
author: jeannie l.

description: If you're a pie person then this is the spot for you. So many options to choose from. Definitely can taste the difference with the flakey crust and not overly sweet. The banana cream was pretty good and light. I wasn't a fan of the cream since its more of a filler. Plenty of seating to enjoy your dessert!
author: James H.

description: I've never seen a piece of pie disappear so fast from my plate. I am now ready to go order another piece. Dont skip the banana pie
author: Hareem K.

description:
Savory and sweet dessert pies!  So delightful and comfort to the soul! 

I'm more of the savory kind of eater rather than sweet, but you can't go wrong on either ones here! 

My chicken pot pie and banana cream pies are my favorites!  

It's not only pleasant, but also calming if stressed.  I usually have no appetite when stressed (not a stress eater), but each bite is undeniable.

Pie me!
author: Tiffany D.

description: First time here.  Did not disappoint,  great chicken pot pie... a little small only because I wanted more.  Walnut pie with Whip cream heated up made for a great dessert.  Also nice staff.
author: Paul A.

description: I was looking for a place to kill time in the Mission District.  This place had somewhat of a coffee shop vibe with a pretty robust menu of both sweet and savory pies.  Initially, I asked the staff at the register for some suggestions, but he seemed a little unsure what to tell me.  I ended up ordering slices of the rhubarb pie and the cherry chess pie.  The rhubarb pie was solid with a nice flavor and not too sweet.  The cherry chess pie was like a custard pie with cherries on the bottom which was also good.  Overall, I thought this place was a solid place for pie and a good place to hang out with a cup of coffee.  I'd come back but I think I need to try some of their more unique pie combinations.
author: Mitch T.

description:
Great pie. 


I had a slice of their peach blackberry pie. The vegan crust is quite good. I'll be coming back here
author: Benjamin C.

description: Amazing pie place in the Mission neighborhood! I came here with a friend at around 8pm on a Saturday and it was packed! Even though there was limited seating, there was a high turnover rate, so just wait your turn, and you're bound to grab a seat soon! There are plenty of pie options, from sweet to savory. I got the Shaker Lemon, which is a lemon peel pie with a crust that is used in apple pies and such. I didn't expect the pie to be made of lemon peels (which they added plenty of sugar to counteract the sourness), but it was delicious when eaten with the crust, so the filling isn't too overwhelming. The service was great and efficient. Overall, I would definitely come back if I'm in the area to try more of their pies!!
author: Lisa C.

description:
Very cute cafe-like dessert shop with a fair amount of seating!

Definitely order the banana cream pie--you won't be disappointed!! It was the right amount of banana paired with a handsome amount of cream and the crust was just right. The lemon shaker was also tasty but too tart for my liking. Both were fair on the sugar levels and it wasn't overkill.

The lemonade here was also really tart! It was a nice contrast to the sweetness of the banana cream pie but may be too sour to pair with the lemon shaker.

I'd definitely return to try the savory pies, the chicken sounds bomb!
author: Connie M.

description:
I normally do not favor desserts, having more of a savory palate.  However, one of the things that I do enjoy from time to time is a good piece of pie.  Growing up in the south, pecan pie and apple pie are two standards that I absolutely have grown to love.  That being said, when I was recommended to come here on a date, I leapt at the chance to not only meet someone new but to try out a very famous pie place in my new home here in the Bay.

I have to admit, I was blown away at this apple pie.  It came out warm and of course, I had to have it with ice-cream (a la mode).  The pie was very generous with the apple filling - to me this is very important.  If there is too much juice, it can make the pie crust somewhat soggy.  However, if the apple to crust ratio is just right, then you not only have a nice, rich, and abundant filling, you also end up with a ridiculously good and still flaky crust.

I'd totally come here again to get another slice.  It's difficult to find a good pie, especially one that is made fresh.  While definitely not something that is blowing my socks off, I am sincerely a fan.
author: Vera L.

description:
As a preggo lady, this place's neon sign up front was like a welcoming mirage in the desert after a long day trucking through SF.

A banana cream pie craving found it's way into my head and it was either here or Tartine. We ended up opting for Mission Pie and I'm glad we did (and glad we found parking right by the resto).The banana cream pie was perfect and the slice size didn't make me feel the least bit guiltily. Husband got the walnut pie, which was also good - though it wouldn't be my first choice.  

We definitely want to come back and try their other pies!
author: Danika H.

description:
This is such a cute and quaint bakery in Mission District! Like I always tell my friends, I don't want cake for my birthday, I want pie! My friend was essentially taking me on a dessert tour of SF and since we were at Anthony's, we walked a couple blocks to get to Mission Pie on a sunny beautiful Sunday. There was a small line and not too many tables available since there were two tables reserved for a party. It has a very cute coffeehouse feel to it and it's an order and sit down type of establishment. My friend said their banana cream pie was his favorite so we got that to share. The waters were conveniently placed near the cashier with the utensils and napkins. The bathroom is one stall unisex that is a little strangely located, where you need to walk through the bakery.

As for the banana cream pie, it was amazing! The crust was flaky and so buttery which contrasted the sweet banana pudding and banana slices. I think if I had a whole slice by myself, it would have definitely been a guilty pleasure but sharing it was perfect. I was so satisfied with my sweet tooth after the pie. I can't wait to come back to try their other pie flavors like chocolate cream pie!
author: Ada C.

description:
My boyfriend and I were out exploring SF when we found this cute little gem! Mission Pie flaunts a fun and relaxed atmosphere. Up front by the cash register, theres a section to purchase fresh flowers and fruit. Every Monday an artist is chosen to play live music. 

When we arrived, a bit of a line had already formed. Luckily, it wasn't long enough to make us feel too antsy. When we made it to the front of the line, we were greeted by a kind and quirky staff member who patiently answered all of our questions. I was pleased to see that there were plenty of vegan and dairy free options available for both pies and lunch. We ultimately sprang for the vegan mixed berry pie with vanilla syrup on top! Syrups are 25 to 50 cents extra, and a scoop of ice cream can be added for a dollar or so more. 

The pie was delicious! It wasn't as sweet as I expected, which I quite liked considering we had purchased the vanilla syrup to drizzle on top. As always, my favorite part of the pie was the crust! Perfectly flakey and a beautiful match for the juice of the berries. My only regret is sharing the slice with my boyfriend rather than fighting him for it. I totally could've taken him.
author: Kendall G.

description:
Before I head back home, I had to go for a slice of pie.  The closest place I know where to buy a slice is Mission Pie.  I know based on my experience that I couldn't bear to resist every time I think about having a slice of pie.  Back in Ferry Building Farmer's Market, I headed towards Three Babes Bakeshop vendor to buy a slice of key lime pie for $6, and it tasted sinfully delicious!  

I know I've gotten past Mission Pie; this time, I came to have a quick bite.  Mission Pie have been known to have Reem's Man'oushe every third Mondays off each month.  Everyday in Mission Pie turned out to be business as usual.  They made pies using locally sourced ingredients, and they placed every whole pies in the glass display along with other desserts.  Menus have changed right before I first came inside.  And whether or not they make gluten free pies, going vegan was the best choice for me and for our planet.  I had a slice of vegan mixed berry pie.  Despite how my slice came apart on my dish, it's still sinfully delicious!

I would love to come to Mission Pie to see what I can't wait to buy from the menu, though there might be some changes on my next visit.  According to Yelp, Mission Pie still retained its absolutely perfect health score.  Therefore, I will be back!
author: Jimmy C.

description:
Mission Pie is perfect place for a snack and to meet up with a friend. I got there around 6 pm after work and there were plenty of seats. 

I got the chicken pot pie and banana cream pie. Both were lovely!
author: Summer S.

description:
Yummm. After finishing dinner in the Mission we wanted to explore dessert options.. and found ourselves at Mission Pie. it's not a sit-down place, it's more like a cafe except they serve pie. So don't expect a hostess to seat you, and if there's no seats you just have to wait for one. 

We got a Raspberry Rhubarb mini pie with a scoop of Vanilla bean ice cream ($7 + 1.50 for ice cream + tax = $9.20 total). They give you a placard which you put on your table and they deliver the food to you. The mini pie was a good size for two people to share, and a better deal than getting two slices ($4.50 each) for two people. They should have put more ice cream though, we barely got a scoop. The ice cream made made the pie so much better. The pie itself had the nice buttery flaky crust I was looking for, but the rhubarb and raspberry combo was much too sour. I like that they use real ingredients as you can actually see the rhubarb cuts, but they should cut it smaller imo. I'm excited to come back and try their tons of other flavors, like banana cream pie, multi berry, strawberry rhubarb, and white peach tayberry!!

No free wifi even though their website says they do. They serve Equator coffee. Accepts credit card. Also really close to La Taq.
author: Shannon W.

description:
Cute little spot with delicious pie. I liked the large chunk a of fruit in the pear blueberry pie. 

I also got a mini pear ginger pie. It was delicious! The ginger and pear paired perfectly along with a nice crumble and flakey, buttery crust. 

I'm a stickler when it comes to pie crust and mission pie executed it perfectly. 

Very friendly and helpful staff!
author: Katy F.

description: Great place for some morning pie! Personally, I'm not a pie person but the blueberry apple pie was perfectly warm and fruity. The chocolate pie was also mouthwatering. It melted as you ate it. Perfect spot for coffee and morning boosts!
author: Stacy W.

description:
Apple Pie is hands down the best apple pie I have had so far...

Not too sweet, great crust, apples have just the perfect bite plus their glaze is to die for (I would buy a bottle...scratch that...a bucket full of it) 

Overall Thoughts

I may not like sweets but I will make an exception for Mission Pie's Apple Pie!
author: Eddie W.

description:
Excellent tea
Excellent pie - it's lighter but not light
More fruity than others
Crust is perfect 
We got the peach blackberry pie
author: Julian L.

description:
Three words: BANANA CREAM PIE

Ma dam, this pie is poppin. I wouldn't even try anything else, because this is where it's at. The pies here are a little expensive, but worth a splurge every once in a while.
author: Eva C.

description:
Pretty delicious pie. Their selection is intense but not overwhelming. I got the cherry apple pie and it was the best pie I have had in a long time. The fruit was fresh and sweet. I especially enjoyed the crust. 

The latte was pretty good but you come here for the pies. 

Lastly, the staff was very helpful with my many odd questions. Even when I changed my mind a couple times. (Don't worry there weren't any people behind me besides my friends). 

A total must if you're a fan of pies.
author: Juan Carlos H.

description:
Cute, charming neighborhood pie shop/cafe in the heart of the Mission. 

The peach raspberry pie and apple pie a la mode were amazing. The fruits were fresh and tender -- unlike many soggy, syrupy pies I've had before. Definitely check this place out, preferably anytime or after a delicious meal across the street.
author: Camille E.

description: Everyone talks about these pies, so I finally tried. I'm a huge of apple and pumpkin. Tried the apple blackberry pie with Strauss vanilla ice cream on top. Wow. Amazingly good. Takes pie a la mode to the next level. Ingredients fresh, huge chunks of apple and berries. Then tried the banana cream pie which many have told me is a must. I'm not a huge fan of cream in general so, it was ok for me. But would def go back and try their other creative pies. The shaker lemon looked interesting.
author: Linda H.

description: First time at this place waited 30 minutes for my order, and left with nothing. Thought they were baking it turns out they never even put in my order,but made sure to charge me. When I asked for my money she insisted I keep my order even when her coworker let her know they had sold my pie. She just seem more interested in the tip than me actually getting what I wanted. Didn't even offer a free slice for wasting my time.
author: Mara R.

description:
Everything here is my favorite. Staff is professional and has good recommendations if you don't know what to get or are feeling undecided. 

In a city full of delicious food, this is a must eat location! Mission pie sources local and organic ingredients which is beyond a huge bonus! Their coffee is excellent as well try it with a slice of banana cream pie in the afternoon and you will not be disappointed. Definitely have a slice while you are there and be sure to take a whole pie home you will probably regret it if you don't.
author: Ruby C.

description:
WTF is this hipster shit?

The Pie à la Mode is great. I tried rubarb with a scoop of Vanilla. The pie was good, sour, and sweet. The ice cream was almost too sweet. Together they were great.

A pot of tea is $3.50, and the staff asked to refill the water! That was the best deal of the whole experience! They also have beer

But what really gets me... are the little pot pies for $8.50, and whole pies for $27. Who the fuck in the Mission is buying this? God damn hipsters that's who. Want a Pie Box for $30? Don't forget to buy the $27 pie to go in the Pie Box! And don't forget the strap for your Pie Box, only $20! 

If your perception of value has been blurred because of your ignorant gentrification and overpaid tech job, fuck it, have a Mission Pie. 3 stars
author: Alex K.

description:
Damn good pie. Came in on a Friday eve and received great service. 

Chicken pot pie - 3 
Crust was great and filling was hearty, but flavor was lacking. 

Beef curry pot pie - 4
Crust was a little overdone, but flavor was rich and the broccoli and greens were a really nice touch. 

Banana cream pie - 5
Heavenly goodness. Enough said. 

Peach blackberry pie - 5
Perfection. Tart, sweet, balanced with just enough salt.

Cozy but bright ambiance. We didn't stay for long, but I could see this being a great place to meet a friend of get some work done.  

Would absolutely return!
author: Imani B.

description:
Mmm banana cream pie! I always get BCP whenever I see it in my dessert choice. We walked in here a few times in the past but nothing looked striking, until today I specifically went in looking for a slice of BCP and there it was!

My banana cream pie was so light and perfectly semi- sweet. The custard was good flavor with a hint of rum? Which I liked. The pie was perfectly crusty. The walnut pie hubby had was really good too. A lot of times pecan/walnut pie tend to be overly sweet but this one was not. 

While I will say that it it is not Tartine good, but it is pretty up there considering there in no wait in line.
author: Cartman P.

description:
Very good pie. Nice atmosphere. Good customer service. It's on a 'questionable ' side of town but overall still worth the walk.  Their pies are made fresh everyday and when one item is sold out they will pull the sign off the board. Better luck next time. 
It's a great place to people watching. Its a multi cultural community here. Love it.
author: Ping K.

description: Full disclosure - I'm a pie and cake lover and though I will eat them all, from frozen supermarket desserts, at restaurants and from friends who bake, I appreciate super good pastry/ crust and not overly sweet pies as Mission Pie offers. I've only been here twice, as I don't get here to the west coast often but what a taste/ impression it has left me...Perfect crust, not thick nor thin. Amazing flavors/ flavor combinations, crust is like no other. I've only had walnut pear in 2008 and blackberry peach in 2018 (10 years later).
author: Car S.

description:
Not that they need another four star rating but here goes. Stellar coffee, reasonable prices. Sweet pies are an amazing selection

But

I come for the quiche and potato tart. You know -- the savory pies. Quiche has great consistency and flaky crust. I've had both bacon and ham quiche. The meat was subtle in both. The potato tart is a show stopper with its fennel surprise. Yum. I'll have another slice please. 

I wasn't kidding. Another slice. Now. No don't bother hearing it up this time. Aw thanks.
author: Tim P.

description:
The Pie Pavilion of SF... my oh my we love Pie. There is something for you and you and me. So many great tasty choices we will never fight over one slice or another. CAUTION: the Plum Frangipane may make you cry tears of joy. Eating a Vegan Pot Pie now: corn, beans, squash, tomatoes tasty good sauce and great crust. Banana cream pie - so fresh and good. Scones, and if we stay here a few more hours after this brunch ... we can have local bees and wine, salads, soups and more pie. Oh my ...  get over here you'll be glad. 

BART and buses on Mission St, getting here is easy. Parking can be a hassle but weekend mornings are easy.
author: Jacqueline S.

description:
Brought my fiancé here for her first sweet pie (she's British and is used to chicken and mushroom pies) and according to her it hit 10,000 spots. Safe to say, she really liked the Vegan Apple Cranberry pie. 

Would recommend, especially for vegetarian / vegans! They have so many vegan options.

A slice of pie is also priced pretty reasonably at $4.15.
author: Michael C.

description:
A great spot for baked goods of all kinds, whether muffins, scones, or pies sweet and savory. There's often a long line and no room to sit here, but if you're willing to get your stuff to go, the line moves just reasonably enough. I particularly enjoyed tastes of the apricot frangipane tart and the mixed berry pie, as well as a slice of their quiche. 

If you can muster the willpower to limit yourself to just one or two slices, then it's an inexpensive, yummy treat that can turn into a fulfilling meal.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Swung in for a slice and glad I finally made it in! 

Ordered the banana cream slice. Not super sweet, but great texture and flavor. They did a great job on this classic! 

Staff are super friendly and helpful when there are so many great options to choose from.
author: Mandi W.

description:
I was so excited to try Mission Pie - but was sorely disappointed. We had the banana cream pie and apricot frangipane tart. The banana cream pie was pretty good - not mind blowing, not horrible - but for almost $5 a slice, I expected a little more. I was impressed by the custard (smooth, with a strong but not too strong vanilla flavor), but the crust was thick and bland. If they perfected the crust, it would certainly be worth the price.

The apricot frangipane tart, on the other hand, needed a lot of work. The crust was also thick and bland - but neither the apricots nor the frangipane were able to offset it. We left half of it uneaten.

I have the privilege of living with a baker, though - so I might be pickier than most. It's not a bad choice if you're in the area and wanting to catch up with friends over pie. There's ample seating, nice ambiance, and free water. It was packed when we dropped by on Saturday afternoon.
author: Larissa M.

description:
Always love the pie here!

Have been here a handful of times to meet friends in the mission and have never been disappointed.  You can read all the reviews about thebdifferent pies from other people but the reason for my review is my favorite pies--the vegan pies.  

The first time i went there and ordered a vegan pie, the cashier threw out a disclaimer that they taste a little "different," than the regular pies...and if by "different" they mean "better," I totally agree!  I actually couldnt tell the difference between the vegan and regular pies...taste, texture, anything...except better (and I am sure also healthier)!  I highly recommend you try them if you haven't already...you won't be disappointed that there aren't 2 sticks of butter in each slice ;-)

You can also get a scoop of ice cream (a pretty generous scoop) for $1.50 (obviously not vegan), which makes everything even better--best buck and a half you could spend in the mission!

Happy Eating!
Brad
author: Bradley H.

description: Pot Pie was terrible, the worst ive ever had. Watery, hardly any chicken or vegetables. I was still hungry when i left.
author: Marion M.

description:
We've been searching for a Pie Place and are thrilled to have discovered Mission Pie.

Bright, airy dining room with tall, full wall windows. Cheerful upbeat crew. Strong coffee. Reasonable prices. 

The raisin scone tasted like Irish Soda Bread. Stiff, crumbly, not very sweet, slightly salty.

The pie... we ordered an Apple Blackberry. It had a chewy oatmeal crumble, tender tart apple filling dotted with blackberries--we would have loved more blackberries! The crust was spot on. Served with a clot of freshly whipped cream.

Gregarious, considerate patrons rounded off the delightful experience.

Bussing your own table made me feel part of the community :)
author: Lu-Shien T.

description:
Mission Pie does not disappoint! They make fresh sweet and savory pies, quiches, other baked goods, and even offer some vegan options. They support local businesses and definitely give off that homey good feeling vibe. They're located at the corner of Mission Street so it's easy to find. 

I stopped in and picked up a banana cream pie since I read that it was a customer favorite. 5 stars can easily be given for their wonderful crust alone! The banana cream was creamy and not too sweet and overwhelming like other places I've tried. I wasn't even that hungry at the time I ate it but am glad I was able to find the stomach space for this delicious pie. A whole pie will set you back $27 but you really get what you pay for. I would like to come back to try their other pies and pot pies.
author: Steph F.

description:
Great place to pick up a pie on the way to your next party. Service is great, and the staff is really knowledgeable about the product. 

I'm new to the Bay Area and was looking for a pecan pie to bring to a pot-luck. I went to Mission Pie after realizing other places that had been recommended were not open. So glad I did. They didn't have a pecan pie so I got the Walnut Pie. It was a huge hit. Sweet but not overly sugary like some pecan pies I've had that are really just pecans and syrup in a crust. I would absolutely go back here. 

The pie was so good that as I was leaving folks took pictures of the box the pie came in so they could go back and get their own. 

Thx Mission Pie!
author: Nathan S.

description:
Mission Pie's such a cute place! Quaint and cheerful. Perfect for post-dinner dessert or afternoon tea time snack. It was crowded after dinner on a Saturday, so we waited about 10 minutes to get a table.

Being lactose-intolerant, I appreciate their vegan options. The vegan pear raspberry was delicious! Not too sweet and the filling was warm and moist. I liked the crust.

It was like 97% pear and 3% raspberry, which we didn't expect but it was fine and interesting. We don't get to have pear in a pie that often.

I'd recommend going for a slice or two instead of a mini pie. They're almost the same size. I must go back soon!
author: Melissa W.

description: Their chicken pot pie and dessert pies were so delicious. Worth the wait. Call ahead though to make sure they still have the pie you want.
author: Meesh V.

description:
Great homemade pies - the frangipane tart was marvelous with my herbal tea!
I tried the chicken pot pie - top only crust, but it was hefty, and the chicken filling was tasty.  Hit the spot.  A bit pricey ($9.75) though.
I will try the beef curry pot pie another time - after I've scraped together enough pennies!  
Nice vibe in the air - and people generally didn't stay too long.  Good lighting, and noise level, though it would be hard to have a conversation, and def not for older folks with hearing aids.
author: World T.

description: Dropped by earlier today to grab something for lunch. I was really craving something savory so I opted for the Chicken Pot Pie ($9.95). They do warm the pies upon your order and it takes about 12 minutes for them to warm in the oven. Upon first bite of my pot pie, I noted the warm, buttery, and flakey crust  - just the way I like it! However, I was slightly disappointed with the actual chicken soup aspects. It just didn't "wow" me as I had expected. Don't get me wrong, it was good, but not great. Next time I come by Mission Pie, I'll be sure to try out some of their other savory and sweet pie options.
author: Steven L.

description: The pies are expensive but worth it and the workers are extremely friendly and kind! I ordered the blackberry and peach pie and it was amazing! I definitely would recommend this place! I can't wait when I'm back in San Francisco to come again! Also the scones are exceptionally great! Everything was amazing
author: Christen Y.

description:
Located in the colorful Mission neighborhood, this is a great place to meet up with friends, read a book, and have good coffee and pie. 
All ingredients are seasonal, fresh, and local. 

Some of my favorites are:
Banana Cream,
Shaker Lemon, 
Apple Blackberry
Dutch Apple, 
Pear Raspberry, 
and Chess

Check out their savory food items if you're hungry: Quiche, Galettes, Soups, and granola.
author: Mitzi G.

description:
Came here for their lemongrass pot pie and it definitely did not disappoint! The pie crust was the perfect crunch, and the flavor of the lemongrass worked so well with the soft, tender pulled pork. Added in this pie were mushrooms, carrots, and thin slices of greens leafy vegetables. However, for $8.50, the price is a bit hefty. 

The environment of this place was very homey, a perfect way to wind down the night :)
author: Jacqueline T.

description:
Mission pie's original owner was a neon light maker, who made the pie signs for the restaurant! You'll learn about this neat little tale if you order and sit in the store for food because they will give you a neat little tag with the story of it behind the card.

We ordered the beef and broccoli pot pie for $8.50. It took roughly 15 minutes to bake in the oven and when it baked in the oven, the flakey goodness of the pie was smelt throughout the restaurant. The beef and broccoli were steaming hot and watered soup like inside the pie. You are able to sit wherever you like in the store. It's similar to a Food Court style where you grab your own utensils and place your dishes and cutlery in an area once you are done.

What I wasn't a huge fan of was, was the crust of the pie. I thought it was a little too thick and it was on the verge of tasting like it was burnt.

There are many other slices of sweet pies, fruits, soups and other delicious pie related foods here for around $4 if that's something you are interested in!
author: Kristy N.

description: The peach blackberry pie was good but not worth the price for a full pie. If you can take it home and eat it the next day it is more tasty.
author: Laura S.

description:
Dang it, I used to be enthralled by Mission Pie, but I think that it really is not what it was, even as the prices are increasing (as they do, not in and of itself a big deal).

Recent issues:

The sweet pies just aren't amazing anymore. The crust is drier and overall the filling is sweeter.  The exception seems to be the Shaker lemon pie, which is extremely bitter (it's traditionally sweet/tart). I will say that the pot pie remains delicious -  the chicken is far better than the others.

The last time I brought home a piece of pie it was less than half the normal size.  I mean it was almost shockingly small (if one can be shocked by pie).  That might have been a one time thing, but I'm not in a hurry to find out.

The portions of the set dinners, of entree/greens/grain, are too small, at least for takeout. I've had the same dinner (pork) twice and the first time it was super delicious, but the second time the pork was almost flavorless and kind of dry.  Which was just frustrating.

The iced coffee has a problem that is one of my pet peeves (mentioned in my other reviews). The coffee cubes - ice cubes made out of coffee - have an unpleasant aftertaste. Imho, coffee cubes need be to be made with filtered water, in a freezer with nothing that has an odor, and used almost immediately. But at least one of those things isn't happening.

I just generally get the sense that there's some carelessness and/or inexperience at play that's leading to a quality decline. I'll stop in when I'm craving chicken pot pie, but otherwise not so much.  I hope this is just a bump in the road and Mission Pie will return to its original excellence
author: Joe B.

description:
Although I was too full to have dessert, I ended up eating almost an entire piece of pie - it was that good! 

We tasted the banana cream pie with ice cream, mixed berry pie and rhubarb pie with vanilla ice cream, which was my favorite. I wasn't a huge fan of the banana cream pie, but that's of course a very personal taste - my friend really enjoyed it. I also heard that the walnut pie is a winner. 

The pies are freshly baked and the service was great, we only waited for a couple of minutes for our orders to arrive. On a Sunday afternoon the place was busy but not too crowded. The atmosphere is very cosy and the smell of pies baking in the oven is filling the cafe, so it's a great place to have dessert, a cup of coffee and just hang out for a while. The area around is great for an afternoon walk, especially if it's a sunny day. 

I noticed that you could also buy entire pies for take away if you're having guests over.
author: Silke H.

description: Cute place in mission district that's open late 10:30pm for after dinner drinks and dessert. After dinner at El Farolito we walk down the block and end up at misson pie. We had the chai latte and tea, both were good and banana cream pie and peach pie. The peach pie had big chunks of pie but was a little dry for me. We both really enjoyed the banana cream pie. Lots of seats, good for groups.
author: Ann S.

description:
Mission Pie is one of the magical places from my childhood. I remember coming here often, but I hadn't come here as an adult after I started living in San Francisco. I'm not sure how I made excuses for so long... probably because I never BART to the 24th and Mission station for anything anymore. I should, since it's so conveniently close by.

For my 26th birthday, one of my best friends made my dreams come true by buying me a strawberry apple pie from Mission Pie. My eyes lit up as she opened the box, and I had to stop myself from grabbing a fork and digging right in. I needed to grab the ice cream, of course. Caramel swirl ice cream sounded like it would go well with strawberry apple pie.

Like a decent human being that likes to share her pie, I cut it into slices, divvied it up, and scooped ice cream on top of all the servings. Totally worth the short wait. I was in heaven and wanted to cry out of happiness. I wouldn't want to eat Mission Pie ALL the time, for fear of losing it's appeal, but I do want to try more of their fruity pies, like apple and pear blueberry. It seems like some think Mission Pie is overrated, but it's my go-to place when I start feeling that pie craving coming on.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Every single time I go here I am straight for the Banana Cream Pie a la mode. THE BEST. You cannot go wrong with it. Staff is very friendly. Parking around the area isn't THAT bad but I guess that depends on what time you go. I have yet to try the quiche but I hear it's wonderful. 

If you plan on ordering a cake for a big holiday (Thanksgiving, Christmas) plan ahead and book online!
author: Ashley B.

description:
I come here ocasionally for some dessert.... JK! I come here all the time! This place has never disappointed... Not only are their pies good but what I love most is their WHIPPED CREAM......... My sister and I got some pie to go and was convinced to get the whipped cream on the side. We didn't eat the pies until after dinner ( we got them in the early afternoon) and the whipped cream was still whipped!!!!!!! You can tell it's made in-house because it's not that sweet and it's supppppper whipped! 

I guess I'm whipped by the whipped cream ;)
author: Mai W.

description: Cold, mashed up, mediocre apple pie. Waited 5 mins to get a warm pie. I think they served me an old refrigerated pie and thought i wouldn't mind. It's a pie not a cake! Glad i didn't tip for the cold service and below average apple pie. And i was looking forward to a nice dessert after having good tacos at la taqueria.
author: Ryan J.

description: I got an Iced Coffee and it is really worth the price. I recommend to order the coffee for here because the cup size is bigger and you get coffee ice cubes so when coffee melts, it won't lose it flavor.
author: Connie C.

description:
I had high hopes for this place but it didn't deliver. 

The staff was very friendly and helpful.

We ordered a chicken pot pie, a slice of apple pie, and hot chocolate.

The chicken pot pie was something you would buy in a freezer isle. Peas and carrots, potatoes, and tiny cubes of chicken. Tasted like canned chicken soup poured into a pie crust. The crust was nothing special. The ingredients looked like something out of a bag or can. 

The apple pie was better, but still lacking. At $4.75 a slice, it felt like a rip off. It tasted just like apple pie you get at costco. The only difference was the apples were softer, almost like apple sauce, which I enjoyed.

The hot chocolate was delicious. I added honey to mine and it really boosted the flavor.

All in all, meh.
author: Jawad E.

description: I've been curious to try this place for a while. It was kind of hard to find where exactly this location was but love the inside. Very dark. Not many menu options and a bit pricey. Good portions. Loved my drink and my food order. I would come to this place again.
author: C G.

description:
This is probably the best pie I ever had. The Raspberry chess is my favorite. Its not too sweet and is perfect amount of crisp and soft. The peach pie was too sweet for me but with the ice cream is great! 
The cashier was rude and wanted us to order more or was implying that I don't know, so that made our experience a bit bitter. But overall- must go for the pie! Worth it!
author: Parnika B.

description:
Simply the best pies I've ever had. Very special ones to look for:

Rhubarb pie -- huge chunks of rhubarb

Walnut pie -- like pecan pie, but way better (and less cloyingly sweet)

Chess pies -- a classic from the deep south with a distinct taste. Fillings seem to rotate, but it always mostly tastes like chess pie.

The staff are amazing too!
author: Blake A.

description: I honestly don't know why this place is so popular. It's out of place in the mission, the pies lack soul and depth, the servers look like this is their third job, their dishes are piling up, the place is filthy. I've said so many things, I should stop at some point.
author: Shoe C.

description: Swung by to pickup pie for a party and had such pleasant service. I picked up a slice of bacon quiche for my boyfriend and i to share and really enjoyed the crunch of the crust and the flavor of everything in the quiche, yum! The hot chocolate was also unique and not the typical instant powdered ones so i definitely appreciated that. The pear raspberry pie was an huge hit at the party. The flavor was perfectly sweet in the fruits and the crumbles added such texture to the pie - yum! Also a fan of their banana cream pie. Can't wait to try more!
author: Amanda C.

description: So cute and comfy for a pie spot. We got a slice of the White Peach & Rasberry, THE BOMB!!! I will for sure be coming back. The crust was perfect and the fruit was so fresh and nicely baked, which made the pie a perfect combination of deliciousness!
author: Leslie H.

description: Fabulous neighborhood pie shop with top notch pies!!! Tried the peach / berry pie ala mode and was not disappointed!!!! Friendly staff, fun vibe round out this special cafe which provides training to youth.
author: Alan W.

description:
Pies pies pies!! So happy I came across this place, many great dining options in the area and this was the most perfect dessert!! I got the walnut pie with ice cream and it was to die for, everyone working there was so kind and looked so happy, I'd be pretty happy too if I was surrounded by pies all the time. 

New goal in life, learn how to make pies.
author: Tony D.

description: Still craving their strawberry rhubarb pie! Was perfectly tart bm and sweet. It was falling apart though when it was served and want quite warm enough.
author: Dani T.

description: I liked this spot! Great choice of various pies, but they also offered food. Limited seating so my friends and I were fortunate to get 3 seats. Loved the vanilla ice cream offered on top. The raspberry pear was phenomenal! Next time I'll go during the day and get a cup of coffee to go with it :)
author: Elizabeth G.

description: Thanks to our lovely Baker Connie, we enjoyed both a mixed berry and a vegan crust peach blackberry pie that were out of this world. I especially loved the crust which has a delicate layer of oat flakes on top. All in all one or the best pie experiences in SF.
author: Jason N.

description:
I've been a Mission Pie fan for the last three years since my friend first introduced me to this place. Let me just say this, the pies aren't cheap but it's delicious and worth your money. My friend bought an apple pie from here couple years ago and it was literally love at first sight. The apple pie isn't super sweet which is good because the ones you buy at Safeway supermarket is just full on sugar and sweetness. After my first apple pie experience, I decided to order pumpkin pie for Thanksgiving. The pumpkin pie was $29 (it's a bit on the expensive end) but it's to die for. I've been ordering their pumpkin pie for Thanksgiving for the last three years now. The ordering process is super easy too. You just go on their website and you pick which pies you want then pay for it. After that, you pick which day you want to pick up on either Tuesday or Wednesday before Thanksgiving then you just show up and tell them your name then wait for your pie to come out. Super easy process! They have other things on the menu like quiche which I never tried but I would love to one day. 

The only downside to this place is parking sucks. Obviously you're in the Mission area so you'll have to park on the meters or if you're lucky in the neighborhoods couple blocks away but usually its pretty difficult to find one during the afternoon hours. But I definitely am excited again to order some more pies in the near future!
author: Monica W.

description:
To be fair, the only fruit pie I like is apple pie. When we went on a Monday night, they ran out of all pies except for the vegan peach-blackberry pie, which was made with canned fruit. Maybe it was the vegan crust, or maybe it was the sticky sweet taste of the peaches, but it just didn't float my boat. 

Just as we got to the front of the line, they took down the sign for banana cream pie. Doh! That would have been right up my alley. 

I'll definitely try this place again, just because I don't think I gave it a fair shot the first time around!
author: Sheewon B.

description:
I'm not much of a pie person, but let me tell you, the Banana Cream Pie here is to die for. Don't forget to add a scoop of Vanilla Ice Cream to top it off. Amazing combination and not too sweet at all. Each bite really melts in your mouth and it's worth the hundreds of calories! 

The last time I visited, my friend ordered the Chicken Pot Pie and it was quite tasty. My friend even mentioned that it was the best pot pie he's ever had in his life. That's a big statement!

I'm looking forward to coming back and trying their chocolate pie. :)
author: MyTien P.

description: Pleasant cafe near the southern end of the Mission (not far from 24th Street BART). I had both the chicken pot pie and a slice of the banana cream pie. The chicken pie had a nice crust and good flavor. I would have liked a little more chicken inside, but overall it was a pretty good amount of food for the price. Dessert pies were available by the slice, so I decided on the banana cream. It was very fresh and refreshing, and a bit of a different take from the likes of Bakery Tartine (where they incorporate chocolate in their banana cream pie). Outside of the pies, there was a great happy hour deal going on for $3 beers and $20 bottles of wine. The laid back cafe ambiance was nice, and this could be a cute spot for a little mid afternoon dining and drinking without breaking the bank.
author: Michael S.

description: OMG Mission Pie is a must visit when in San Francisco. Have the Chicken Pot Pie for lunch and save room for Mixed Berry Pie with ice cream for dessert. Take home a bag of the ultimate granola for your breakfast - you won't regret it! The staff are wonderful - this is the pie shop of pie shops and you will want to order the whole menu.
author: Joseph W.

description:
I visited San Francisco back in 2009/2010 and I went to Mission Pie. I remember thinking the banana creme pie was one of the best things I've ever tasted in my life. I would always remark to my friends, "Oh you should try Mission Pie!" even though I had only been there once, so many years ago.

Well, now it's 2017 and I finally returned to this shop to try the pie again. I did get the banana creme pie once more and thought it was quite tasty. It wasn't as good as I remembered, but it's quite possible my tastes have changed? The crust this time around was a little bit crunchy, and I think I was hoping for something more doughy or soft. The filling is good, a light fluffy mixture of creme and bananas.

I still recommend this place for some very good pie though.
author: Danielle C.

description: Man this place is delicious.  All of their fresh fruit pies rock!  The only reason I'm giving four stars instead of five is their lack of gluten free options.  Around the holidays they had a gluten free oatmeal crust pear/raspberry pie, and it was to die for.  My (non gluten free) family tried it and loved it!  It meant I got to enjoy the wonders of their delicious pie without having a stomach ache/ flu like symptoms the next day. Unfortunately, they don't usually sell non-gluten pie by the slice-- only option is to special order an entire gluten free pie 48 hours ahead of time.  They always have a vegan pie option available by the slice-- why no gluten-free?  Particularly since they are clearly talented enough to pull off a delectable gluten free crust.  Here's hoping they start offering this option, and gain many more celiac challenged regular customers!
author: Jordan K.

description: I loved the Chess Pie and Banana Cream Pie! Simply delicious! Quick service, pies that change daily. I would definitely recommend grabbing a slice if you're in the area!
author: Daniele H.

description:
THIS IS THE THIRD TIME I CAME IN. I really want to give this place a good review. I really do.. But how hard is it to give people the right piece of pie??? I ordered the apple blackberry TO-GO. It was crowded, so I didn't want to wait for a seat. I came home and I open the cute little tied box.. It was a pear raspberry pie. I probably sound super dramatic for complaining about a different slice of pie, but I'm not a big fan on pears so I was kinda disappointed. Also, they forgot my whipped cream. 

It'll probably take a lot of convincing for me to try this place again.
author: Rachelle Y.

description:
Goodness, I can still taste the delicious pie and I can't stop thinking about it! Their pies change depending on what's in season, but they've all been really good so far. Their space is a warm, intimate cafe style spot with a good amount of seating which tends to fill up most of the time. The staff are super friendly and the ambiance is awesome.

My favorites so far are the chicken pot pie, walnut or pecan pie, and banana cream pie. Can't wait to try a new flavor!
author: Jacqui C.

description:
Meh. 

We tried the chess pie and the crust was soggy. Felt like it was a pie I'd try at a family gathering not a professional bake shop.
author: Nicole W.

description: Came here on a whim due to other restaurants being closed and ended up trying to Beef Barley Pot Pie. The pot pie was quite decent and definitely freshly baked. The edge of the pie was slightly sweet but it complemented the savory flavor of beef. It's also relatively inexpensive so a good place to try! One thing to note is that the pies may be slightly small for a meal for those that eat a lot.
author: Galen W.

description:
I had the weekend special pie it was lemon custard and it was delicious. The crust was flaky and the filling was smooth and creamy. I also had some bites of the vegan strawberry and blueberry which was surprisingly good for a vegan dish. I also shared the rhubarb chess pie and that was rich and tart. I would come back if I ever have a craving for pie!

The shop was bright and sunny and had a lot of sitting. Most of the pies are on display so you have a good sense of what kind of pie you'll be getting. 
On the menu there was also savory pies and soups. You go up to the register, and you'll probably be greeted with a smile and tons of suggestion if you ask. If you have preferences and can't make up your mind, ask for help. Their recommendations are always spot on.
author: Brian N.

description: Great place for banana cream pie! Perfectly ripened banana and just enough sweetness in the end!
author: Wilfred W.

description:
Their pies are AMAZING!!!!! We picked up a blueberry and pear pie for our friend's birthday on a foggy Sunday morning around 9:30am. It was SUPER quiet. Parking was plentiful and free on the street. The ladies behind the counter were nice. Their display case has a crazy assortment of pastries and baked yummies.

After hours of sitting in the trunk of the car, the pie was still great. Huge juicy chunks of pear. Sweet blueberries. Soft crust. Deliciously sweet, but not too sweet.

If I lived closer in the area, I'd DEFINITELY be going here more often for breakfast and morning sweets...
author: Athena C.

description:
Such a great little spot in the mission with (duh) pies, cookies, other pastries, granola, soul and a handful of other edibles. 

Really cute location in an old building on a cool corner, with a quaint, neighborhoody vibe, good service and friendly staff.

Pies were really good. Shaker Lemon was tart and crust was flaky amazingness. Strawberry was sweet and delicious with a crumble crust. Cookies were also really good.

Definitely a great spot and some awesome pies.
author: Bob K.

description: Meh. Been here twice and both pies were super underwhelming (walnut and banana cream respectively). Nice people and all that but the pies themselves were kind of bland and dry. Skimpy servings of the Homemade whipped cream that really didn't have any sugar in it. Again, underwhelming.
author: Jeremy F.

description:
When it came to my wedding, I knew I wanted pie instead of wedding cake. We ended up ordering 14 pies from Mission Pie and having a friend pick them up the morning of.

Obviously, I love their pies. But Lisa, who coordinated our pie tasting and final order, made the process painless via email, phone, and in-person. We scheduled the pie tasting about a month out from the wedding and got to try over six flavors, and I mean full slices of pie that left us full to the brim. The tasting was so much fun and I highly recommend doing it even if you already know what flavors you want :)

We ended up going with Chess (my personal favorite), walnut, vegan apple strawberry (surprisingly good -- don't knock it cause it's vegan!), and a seasonal rhubarb pie. 

They even threw in some mugs and granola when my friend picked up the order. 

Super nice people, quality pies, and fresh, seasonal ingredients. Our guests loved them. If you're considering using Mission Pie for your wedding or event, DO IT!
author: Valerie L.

description:
This place is super enjoyable by yourself, with your friends, on a date, or even getting something to go. I oftentimes come here to buy a whole pie for family friends. It never fails to surprise me when people tell me they don't know about this place. The atmosphere is quaint, relaxing and prime for conversation. A whole pie costs $27, which I think is pretty reasonable as making the crust takes up quite a bit of time.

Their selections are pretty good and unique, and they even have a vegan pie! I have yet to try the vegan one, but I can vouch for their peach berry pie. But seriously, this place is definitely worth going to after work as a great way to end the day. It's open until late (except Mondays they close early). I recommend this to anyone and especially to those with a sweet tooth!
author: Katherine L.

description: I didn't want to go to Mission Pie. I wanted a burrito. My friend said shut your pie hole, it's delicious, so I gave it a try. In line, a sPIEtful patron complained about how there was no crust on his pie and sent it back. We ordered a stew and a pot pie at 8.50 each (cheaper than a burrito, truth be told) and the lovely cashier gave us the unwanted crustless pie free of charge! In the cozy atmosphere, we throughly savored each bite, and left throughly satisPIEed!
author: Alisa W.

description:
3.5 Stars

I'm a pie kinda girl, hence "Things I love" on my Yelp about me section...

1) Casual place
2) $4.50 for a slice of pie or $27 for a whole pie.
3) Plenty of seating
4) Open until 10pm every day except Monday.
5) Sweet and savory pies.

We ordered the mixed berry, banana cream, vegan peach berry, and walnut pies. Surprisingly the walnut pie was our favorite out of the four pies that we ordered. I was a little disappointed with the banana cream pie (honestly, I think Marie Callender's or Heidi's Pie is way better). 

Overall, not a bad place to grab a slice of pie when you're in the Mission.
author: Owie N.

description: honestly the best pies i have ever had. the dutch apple and the pear/rasberry are AMAZING!!! i love how they have a delicious oat crumble on top. I also appreciate how this apple pie didn't use green apples, im not a fan of those kinds of apple pies. The crust is delicious and the perfect texture. not overcooked and too crunchy.
author: Hayley Z.

description: This place is perfect to enjoy a cup of coffe with one of the best pies I've tried. Anytime I go to The Mission, this is a must-go spot.
author: Juanita J.

description:
This review is based primarily on the pumpkin pie. 

The pumpkin pie at Mission Pie was disappointing. It was goopy/runny and not all that tasty. It wasn't terrible, but I expected more out of a pie place. It was a far cry from my favorite at LA's Urth Caffe, but even a Costco pumpkin pie is better.

BUT...the pozole soup was tasty. 

The chicken pot pie had a delicious crust, but it was a little odd the crust didn't extend below the surface. Still, the filling was alright. 

Nice space, friendly staff, and many of the other pies looked delicious at least, so I look forward to a return visit.
author: Charles R.

description: I would typically say I am not a huge pie person, but trying this place definitely changed that. We got the banana cream pie and it was amazing. I wanted to try all the others, but we were already too full from eating here and a Papalote down the street (which I also recommend!)
author: Chelsea V.

description:
Pros: tasty pie, vegan options, live music

Cons: unfriendly cashier, pies are served luke warm, bit on the chilly side.

Verdict: prob won't return here, but the pie was really good despite not being served hot.
author: Nico S.

description:
Food:  PIES PIES PIES!  First off...the crusts are very thin which is impressive because they are able to hold all of the fillings.  I had the following three pies and thought they were all very well executed.  Very tasty and they did the trick for the night!

-Banana Cream Pie
-Pear & Raspberry
-Apple & Blackberry

Service:  I will say that the cashier was a bit out of it and wasn't super friendly but the person who brought out my order delivered with a smile.

Ambiance:  This had a nice little cafe feel to it.  Very spacious and it looked like people were there to enjoy the food along with doing a little bit of work or just chit chatting.

Overall:  Yep I'll be back to this place because they had a good mix of flavors in their pies.
author: Spencer Q.

description: Im not impressed other than preppy .com spot it has no feel of the mission district to it , just another place to get pie
author: Robert G.

description:
Game changer, life changer, crowd pleaser. This is an easy review to complete. Have you ever gone to a horrible concert? Paid almost an arm and a leg and then left thinking what the bloody heck?! Orrrr...you go the blond ambition world tour and are blown away by its all around amazingness!!! This was the Blod Ambition tour - blown away yummy.  AMEN to y'all, AMEN!  I picked this pie up for a dapper group of amazing friends to enjoy since I was on that side of town. We went with the White Peach with a berry (I cannot recall the berry) and as usual it was out of this world amazing.  Their crust is the best crust I have EVER had.  I am OG from the Bay,  but am not living in the South.  Let's just say the Texas jokers have a lot to learn from you!  Sheesh, happy lil tummies were in the house!
