Thank you so much for keeping your pies top notch!  We all were in piggy heaven....mmmmmmm'ing and oh my gosh this is so good'ing!!! 

Thank you Mission Pie godedsses and gods!
author: Juliet M.

description:
I was soo looking forward to having some delicious pie! I was sadly disappointed  the slice was hardly a slice...it didn't have a bottom crust...I feel cheated!!
Staff was friendly though...
author: Eunice M.

description:
$8.50 for a small chicken pot pie? $4.50 for a SLICE of apple pie? Hey why not? It's SF, everything else is expensive. 

**Chicken Pot Pie: not worth it. I mean come on it's chicken pot pie, ingredients are completely inexpensive. For $8.50 I could get a burrito or even a bowl of pho. Taste-wise, nothing grand or special; something you can make at home. Crust is pretty good though. 

**Apple Pie: probably one of the worst homemade Apple pies I have ever seen. Usually pies hold together fairly well when cut into slices but this is just a damn shame. Basically just crust filled with seasoned apples (which were cut terribly); filling was completely nonexistent. 

SERVICE: okay but needs improvement. We ordered a slice of apple pie, she asked if we wanted that first while waiting for our pot pies so we said yes. It never came, no biggie. We ate our pot pies first, finished it, 10 minutes after no apple pie so we went to politely ask. They apologized and said they'll bring it right up, 15 minutes later...we finally got the apple pie....only to see what it looked like. 

PARKING: in the mission so completely nightmare to find parking. Have both metered and unmetered residential. 

PRICE: expensive for what you get 

Basically yet another place in SF that is high priced, low quality.
author: Vivian S.

description:
Random combos
Sweet stuff is 5 stars
Slow service, Im waiting behind somebody who has been ordering for 5 minutes already, its OK to skip to next person & get something started.
author: Rigo J.

description:
I really want to give this place a 4 stars, the prices make me took 1 stars off.

I like the atmosphere of this place. Its a very clean nice little cafe that sells pies in the mission districts.  

Here are what i got:

Chicken pot pie: $8.50...you have to wait 12 minutes or longer if you order this dish. Its your typical pot pie but mini version....carrot, peas, chicken...it was kinda watery but the juice had some flavor. The crust of the pie was crispy in a way. It was a decent dish. Its best if you get their dessert pie. $8.50 is quite expensive for this dish.

I also had their Banana cream pie: $4.50 a slice. You can get whole pie if you want for $27. I would give this pie a 4 stars. It was very yummy. It was light, fresh, and creamy. They used real bananas. They give decent size if you eat it by slice

This place can gets really busy there was a nice before and after i came. Rarely any seats are open. Even if someone leaves, someone else will take it.

I will definitely come back here if i ever crave for their pies
author: Julie N.

description:
Now that I've had their sweet pies, I honestly feel like Mission Pie is overhyped. The pies are quite expensive at $4.50 per slice and I didn't find them to be that spectacular.

My friends and I got 2 sweet pies to share, both of which were very sweet.

* APPLE BLACKBERRY
Honestly just tasted like a very sweet apple pie. Not much blackberry. I'm usually good with sweet things but I found it to be too sweet.

* SATSUMA CHESS PIE
More creamy and custardy than a normal fruit pie. Pretty sweet too but not as sweet as the apple blackberry in my opinion, though my friends disagreed.

I've had their savory pies/galettes before too and enjoyed them a little more depending on the filling. I wasn't impressed enough by the pies here though to want to come back unless someone else really wanted to.
author: Jessie L.

description:
The short: fresh ingredients make for a wonderful pie

The menu changes based on what's in season, and there are so many flavors to choose from that made it a challenging choice. My friend and I decided to share a slice of the peach berry pie. We ordered, sat down with our number, and waited for someone to bring us a slice. We dug in and relished in the delicious crust and loved the large peach slices and berries. The only downside was that the pie tasted like it came out of the refrigerator and next time, I'll see if I can heat it up so it's a least room temperature or warmer. 

There's ample lighting, quite a few seats, and the metal tractor-type stools by the front are so fun. 

Can't wait to come back to try other flavors.
author: Catherine W.

description:
I love mission pie! One day I was just craving pie and stumbled upon mission pie. Off course with the help of yelp!

Incredible banana cream pie! I love banana flavored food and this one was just perfect. Not too sweet. I've come back a few times ever since
author: Carmen V.

description:
The best pie I've ever had, so I decided to give a review. The place is really nice and lit, feels really comfortable inside.
We got the Walnut pie with vanilla icecream on top. I didn't expect the vanilla to be any special, but it was the best vanilla icecream I've ever had! I'm guessing it's house made? Either way it's super delicious! 
The pie itself was fragrant, flaky, and the texture with the icecream is a mouthful of amazing tastes! 
It was so good that we got another Walnut pie! 
I will def come again to try the other pies because this place was beyond amazing!
author: Sun L.

description: Friendly staff and super cute place! You're in and out after you order because they're so efficient. The banana cream pie is a favorite. The cream is has the perfect lightness to it and compliments the banana so well. It's a must try! We also tried the mixed berry pie, which was a little too sour for us and the blueberry chess pie, which more of a danish and not what we expected for a dessert.
author: Karina T.

description: Ok but not mind-blowing. The chess pie was very solid. The mixed berry pie was good. The lemon pie was like eating lemon peels, which I guess was the point? I don't know-I only had 3-4 bites and decided it wasn't worth the calories.
author: Michael K.

description: Their pie crust is divine.  The shaker lemon is tart and amazing. But all their pies are so good. Not overly sweet.
author: Sara S.

description:
One of the handful of pie spots I've found in the Bay Area; wish there were more places like it. This one in particular has a nice, homey atmosphere to hang out by yourself or with others.

The Peach Blackberry was a great choice for a summer pie. Sweet peach with the tart blackberry topped with a delectable, buttery streusel. Dollop of homemade whip cream was a good idea. Raspberry Chess was not as good as I wanted it to be. Texture and sweetness was off, like there wasn't enough sugar and butter.

I'd be back to try some of their other pies. They have a large selection
author: Lindsey C.

description: I'm completely impressed with this pie! Not only was the crust the perfect amount of softness but it was tasty! I never liked pie crust on any pies until now at Mission Pie. I ordered the chicken pot pie, peach pie, chocolate pie and banana pie (definitely went overboard as a first timer here) but I actually loved almost everything I ordered. Wasn't too fond of the peach pie for some reason but all the other pies were fantastic. Had the perfect amount of light sweetness to them and that's what I love most when eating dessert.
author: Jenna C.

description: So good!!!  I recently came back to SF to eat at all the places I used to love and well, this place is still so so so LOVED!!  I had the Plum Frangipane and it was so delicate, tart and just YUM!!
author: Cindy B.

description: Been here several times and finally writing a review! Order at the cashier and grab a table. Tables are first come first serve. Yesterday, I decided to try the chess pie because I've never had one before. It's a southern pie made with buttermilk. If you love custard, this is the pie for you! It's not too sweet at all. The banana creme pie is also amazing. Inside the pie, you'll find slices of actual banana which is awesome. My boyfriend orders the coffee every time and he gets it black. The price is great! A slice of pie is just $4.50, which is the lowest price I've seen so far. Service is always friendly. Special shout out to one of the workers, Sharon for taking good care of my boyfriend and I last night.
author: Lexi R.

description:
Came here two years ago, and I'm back again 2 years later. If I'm around in SF in 2 years then I'll 100% make time to come down here. Insanely good pie, everything is lovely about this place to be honest. But the pie. Geez

If that isn't an endorsement then I dunno what is!
author: Kirit C.

description:
It's hard to ignore the neon Mission Pie sign, even if you're full. That banana cream pie is amazing. It's got a buttery crust set in wavy edges. The creamy filling tastes like pudding with fresh banana slices that blend in smoothly. Lastly, the pie is topped with surprisingly light whipped cream. It's sweet and satiating, but not too sweet. All this time I thought I wasn't a pie person (with the exception of pumpkin pies). Maybe I am a pie person. Maybe I've been eating the wrong pies all this time.

Slices are ~$4 w/ Straus whipped cream, $1.50 to add Straus vanilla bean ice cream.
Whole pies are $27.

The pies all look very rustic and homemade, not the perfectly uniform style. There are a lot of sweet pies - fruit & nut options. They also serve meat pies, vegetable galettes, and quiches. I'd be more interested in trying a savory option for a return visit.

For a small business, Mission Pie is a pretty large venue. It's very commendable that Mission Pie's business is so community-minded. They're all about sustainability. All the ingredients are sourced locally. They sell items from local distributors including fresh flowers and display local artists' work. They also hire interns in collaboration with non-profits, which is great, since it's getting harder for young people with little to no experience to enter the labor market. Why couldn't they have been around when I was a teenager looking for a job?
author: Joy W.

description: The rhubarb and strawberry pie will change your life. The lemon pie with fresh whipped cream can replace your boyfriend. The only downside is the price. I paid $30 for that lemon pie! I felt real physical pain while I inserted my credit card into the chip reader. The pies are just so good that I'll continue to insert my card.
author: Shay I.

description: I was really excited about this place because I love pie, but in the end I was a little disappointed. I thought that being a pie place their portion would be pretty good for one person... but no. This is my first time here I got the mixed berry pie. Don't get me wrong! It was really good as I got it with ice cream as well but the pie was so tiny.
author: Eileen G.

description: I came here with my boyfriend for our dinner, as we both love pie and crust and all other things delicious. Quite pricey, but worth the experience! Started out with the broccoli cheddar bacon quiche, which tasted like every other bcb quiche I've ever had, but was still delicious. Sampled the asparagus lemon ricotta quiche, and that was pretty light and fluffy, unfortunately not heated completely through so not as satisfying as I would imagine it would be freshly baked. Next, we shared the chicken pot pie, which I thought was so delicious! I only wish there was even more crust. We each finished off with a slice of the fruit pies - pear raspberry and apple boysenberry, both of which were great, but again wished the slices were heated and had more crust! The vanilla ice cream on the side made the pies that much more tasty.
author: Jenny L.

description: The pie was great. I never tasted a white peach raspberry pie before and it wasn't that sweet. Just right. My gf had the mixed berry pie. I must say that pie was delicious.
author: Jake W.

description:
Who doesn't love pies? Mission Pie lives up to their name. I love to come here and get a slice or two to take home after having tacos at La Taqueria. Every pie I've tried here has been solid. They have a good selection to pick from which makes it hard to choose. I can vouch for the fruit pies if you don't want something too sweet. $4.50 each. Whipped cream on top is extra. Always pay extra for whip cream. :)

Walnut tartlet is a steal at $3 as it is excellent. Don't wait to eat it like I did as my last one got soggy overnight and I had to throw it away! Sadness. It always is pretty busy in here but if you can find seating, it's a nice place to grab a little bite to eat and catch up with friends. Savory food options also available here like pot pies, quiches, and soups. Pastry case also full of muffins, scones, and cookies so they don't just do pies!
author: Kathleen S.

description:
DELICIOUS! I have only come here a handful of times but every time I do I fully enjoy my experience. The staff is a wonderful bunch of individuals that carry out the establishment's mission. 
The PIES are to die for. They have a wide variety of pies, from sweet to savory, breakfast pies to dinner pies. Made with fresh, local, wholesome ingredients that translate through each bite. Which can explain the reason why the pricing is the way it is. The best around. 
The mood is set with the natural light from all the windows, gives a very open community feel, cozy and comforting! Luckily for those who like their pie later in the day the hours more than likely work with your schedule. Love coming here and will continue to do so, enjoy.
author: Sabrina V.

description:
If I'm in The Mission, I'm making a pit stop here for their Banana Cream Pie.

It's the only pie I've ever had here in the four times I've been here - it was love at first bite, and I haven't wanted to date around since. So these five stars are for that!

It's the best banana cream pie EVER: buttery, flaky pie crust with the lightest, fluffiest homemade cream and the smoothest, most delightfully chilled banana custard. It's so hard to have just one slice! 

P.S. Love that the iced coffee here comes with frozen coffee ice cubes! 

Also, it is NOT cash only, they take cards now. Love Mission Pie. Love love love.
author: Ashley S.

description: Got a slice of banana cream pie today. It's a bit too heavy for me and I was looking for something has more banana flavor. But the ingredients are good and it's not too sweet.
author: Jade Y.

description: Cute corner spot with good variety of pies.you could tell they were fresh and real because the variety berry pie fell apart (no fake gelatin stuff). Delicious crumble on top! They even have a few beers!!
author: Nicole S.

description:
Oh Mission Pie, you are so good, that I will go to the Mission for you.  Just the smell when you walk in, butter, cheese, ham, and more butter.  This is one of the most comforting smells and gives you the overwhelming feeling that life is ok.  That everything is ok. Pumpkin pie was great, usually, I just scoop out the filling and avoid the crust cuz most places have crappy quality crust.  But this crust could not be discarded.  It demanded to be eaten.  

The apple and blackberry pie was tantalizing.  Sweet Sheeba that crumbly topping and crust. This is just some excellent pie. I am not a fan of having to go to the Mission, but I will gladly make this pilgrimage from time to time to express my reverence and adoration for pie.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
Amazing pies!! This 5 star is especially for the walnut pie. Even though I had the lemon shaker pie and apple pie as well...But the walnut one was just out of the world. 

They have a really great selection and I  will def. be back to try the others.
author: Anant A.

description:
Came here last night for a late-night sweet treat. This place has been on my bookmark list for maybe three years now and i finally got to come! It was a great call.

The shop has enough seating for people and I think is the best dessert location for night time around the Mission. They played nice mo-town music last night which set the mood. 

The menu contains about 6 different types of pies. Me and family ended up ordering Walnut, Banana cream, and Apple. A scoop of Straus ice cream is $1.50. The pies could've been a bigger slice for the price and could've also been a bit bigger in portion. Even though a lie was around $3-4, I still think the slices need to be a bit bigger for customer to enjoy.

I really liked my Walnut slice. It was identical to egg pie/pecan pie in terms of flavor and texture. The banana cream pie was also delicious with it's meringue top layer. 

I'm glad I got to finally come though which is important. I would also recommend this spot for people around the Mission. Thanks!
author: Allister D.

description: I asked for a sour pie and got the warm rhubarb pie with vanilla bean ice-cream. You can also ask for a bit of whipped cream to go with your pie. The savory pie options looked great too.
author: Alex L.

description: Good pie.  Nice that it is open late
author: Tracy R.

description:
Mmmmmmm.... Banana Cream Pies...

Finally got to try this place and I wasn't disappointed! I really like Bi-Rite's banana cream pie but the pies here are simple and classic. I usually don't like crusts but I liked the crust for this pie! 

Also ordered the pumpkin pie and it kind of caught me off guard because it was extremely moist and it almost tasted like flan because the egg taste was very overwhelming. Wasn't a big fan of this one. 

This place has very high ceilings so it makes it feel very airy and spacious. I also thought the menu was adorable. The wallpaper was cute and there was a quote that said "Good Food. Every Meal. Every Day" - I couldn't agree more :)
author: Leilani Y.

description: Do you love pie? Both their sweet and savory pies are delicious. Friendly staff & enjoyable shop.
author: Steph A.

description: Delicious pie, but the wait was a little long. They seemed a bit understaffed, as it took them forever to heat up the veggie pot pie I ordered, and they weren't that busy. The quality of the pie made up for that, though -- the crust was very good.
author: Kate J.

description: I ordered the Chicken Pot Pie which was pretty good, but could have been better if it was warmer. The price was a bit high.
author: America F.

description: Not bad for a latte. They had two vegan options for pie and some other more savory dishes. Was disappointed that the pie was not warm and they had no vegan ice cream to go with. My co adventurer had a lemon type pie that was mad bitter, non vegan btw. Will probably never go again. Timeless cafe is waaaay better. Might as well just get on bart to find better vegan desserts elsewhere.
author: Zin B.

description:
Oh my gawd. Their pies are so on point. 

My friend and I agreed that the chicken pot pie was the best, and my oh my it was such a great way to start the day. The chicken was just so tender and soft, and the overall flavor wasn't too heavy or overwhelming. The pie crust was flaky and buttery, and oh my goodness it was great. 

The pear raspberry pie was, in my opinion, a unique combination, and the balance between the tartness and the sweetness was just right. 

10/10 would come back!
author: Tiffany H.

description: I got their vegan pear blueberry pie and it was AMAZING! I'm not vegan and used to think any vegan desserts wouldn't compare to "regular" ones... but now I know that's not the case!! And the customer service was excellent. Nice ambience too.
author: Larissa C.

description:
Yum. Tried strawberry rhubarb, chess (with rhubarb), and strawberry apple. 

Strawberry apple was the clear winner. Perfect crust and taste. 

Chess pie was more custard than fruit. Sort of bland :(

Super friendly staff, fun space, good prices.
author: Ryan B.

description:
As I sit at home eating their petite $6 take-away "special salad," which consists of lettuce with chunks of avocado, pickled dates, and thick bacon, slices of apple, almonds, and the ignored bleu cheese dressing (not a fan of bleu cheese), I come to the realization that I should have ordered a pie.

But I also come to realize that dates in salads are really tasty. And all those protein-dense ingredients were quite filling for my lightly hungry appetite.

Now, I did have the option to choose 1 of their 2 daily savory salads: one was brown rice with lentils, beets, chard, squash, olives, and a herb vinaigrette over some frisée, and the second was a slaw with radish, carrots, sesame seeds, green beans, garbanzo beans, pickled watermelon rind, and tahini avocado dressing. All of their petite salads are proportionally priced at $3 for half, $5.50 for full.

As the name belies, the crème de la crème are the pies. Their BANANA CREAM PIE, $4.50 for a slice, pairs a luscious banana filling with a fluffy whipped cream. The pie crust was nothing to rave about, as my sweet tooth probably would have preferred a caramelized crust.

Mission Pie has taught me that dates in salads are good, as are salads with dates ;) And don't order regular salads when Mission Pie has so much more to offer.
author: Adele F.

description:
Although I wanted to love this place, I'll give it 3 stars for now. My chicken pot pie was served to me cold on the first run and the second time they brought it out to me it was hot, but the consistency of the pot pie was too liquidy. I almost felt like it was more of a soup than a hearty filling of chicken and veggies that I was expecting. For $8.50 a pop for their savory pies, prices aren't bad for SF prices. However, the pie itself was disappointing as only the crust was good. 

Maybe I ordered the wrong thing and should've just stuck with their sweet pies. My friends were all pretty happy with their selection.  Definitely another hipster spot in the city for sure. Would I come back? Yes..for dessert.
author: Diane T.

description:
This place is phenomenal. The best pie I have ever had. Their pies are AMAZING! I got the walnut pie with vanilla icecream on top and it was super delicious.
I'd be back to try some of their other  pies.
author: Angel O.

description: I don't even like pie but the banana cream pie here is freakin delicious. The flaky crust to cream makes it a perfect combo. I have tried other pie slices but I always come back to the banana one. Highly recommend any first timer or people who don't usually like pie to get the banana slice. Aside from the delicious pie most of the staff who takes my order are usually awkward af or their facial expressions just scream misery.
author: Luna C.

description:
This place is so cute and their pies are SO GOOD.  I bought one of their $7 mini pies (white peach raspberry) and it was divine! Perfect size to split for 2-3 and at an amazing price! 

The interior is like a cute little coffee shop. Looks like some ppl were working there so maybe they have wifi? They have savory pies as well (my friend loves their chicken pot pies) so you could hypothetically spend a whole day there!
author: Lucy W.

description:
I like pie more than cake so I love an establishment centered ENTIRELY around one of my favorite desserts. My cousin lives near here so I came here a while back & recently returned for dessert! They also have savory pies and soup as well as other treats (alcohol)

We shared the banana cream pie and the vegan berry pie because that was all they had left at 9 pm. The vegan pie was really tasty, even though you could tell the crust was vegan when comparing it to the crust of the banana cream pie, the flavors were all there!! The banana cream pie was yuuuuuum. I kind of liked the flavors of the vegan berry pie more than the banana cream.

They give away leftover baked goods if you come around closing :3
author: Hana S.

description:
I've driven past Mission Pie numerous times.  Finally had an opportunity to drop by for afternoon dessert.

Many different pie selections.  Since it was my first visit I had to go with apple pie. 

Of the four of us, three went with apple, and the fourth went with the raspberry pear.

Apple pie slices were inconsistent.  I needed more apples in my pie too.

Good cup of coffee.
author: Shirley N.

description: Was looking for a savory breakfast pastry and found just what I was looking for at Mission Pie. The spinach, bacon & cheddar quiche was just perfect. Smooth and creamy, excellent balance of ingredients, and not heated in microwave!  They have many more choices in sweet and savory pies, tarts, turnovers, etc. I will definitely be back and plan on being more adventurous next time. Coffee is good, too, and staff genuinely friendly and cheerful.
author: Barbara B.

description: Hipster pie place. Slice of strawberry/rhubarb pie is &4.50 (whole pie is $27). Slice is way too small. Only thing saving this review is that great crust! I also got the banana cream slice - it was alright. Get a mini pie - way better value, too. It was $7 and I got the strawberry! Super good and a great crumb topping. Do not get a slice - you will feel so cheated! Eat a whole pie!
author: Tinnetta T.

description: Meh. Not the place I would choose to indulge for a decadent treat. Definitely cute space, but nothing to write home about.
author: Mj B.

description: Fave fave secret food spot in the mission (beyond their pies). I have a few bang-for-your-buck spots to get food and their yummy stews are on the list. Like pure fuel for your soul.
author: Kay S.

description:
Had the herbed peas and ricotta quiche slice and a slice of peanut butter and jelly pie. I am once again thoroughly disappointed in the mediocre quality of the baked goods. The crust was thick and both flavors leave much to be desired. 

I really abhor when the pies and quiche are barely heated up. Why do I want to eat a very cold quiche or savory pie? The peas quiche tasted bland and there was no ricotta flavor. 

I tried the pbj pie on a whim to see how they could surprise me. The pie was just a slab of peanut butter and little smear of jelly on top. How unoriginal. I was hoping they would make a light peanut butter filling and incorporate a fresh and un-sugary jam.
I could have smeared peanut butter and jelly on my bread at home. 

I spent $9 on such poorly made food. The service was decent. If someone were to buy me a different flavored pie, I may try it.  I will not be coming back here again.
author: Uma A.

description: I ordered chicken pot pie and chicken&mushroom serve with brown rice and veggie that was so great. I would come back again soon :)
author: Pinarat S.

description: Banana cream pie will forever hold a special place in my heart. The quality is superb, so fresh and light and delicious. People are super friendly. Great vibe.
author: Christina C.

description:
I just can't get enough of pie. My motto is: the more pie the merrier. I came here on a Friday night and the restaurant was bustling with activity. I ordered a slice of apple pie ($4.50) and a slice of banana cream pie ($4.50) for the BF to enjoy in the restaurant. 

The apple pie had a crunchy top layer and huge apple slices. I'm used to a softer and more doughy crust so this pie definitely took me by surprise. The spices are not overwhelming. I can only describe the pie as being mellow in taste.

I have previously ordered the pumpkin pie slice and that is tasty. I definitely recommend the seasonal pumpkin pie and not so much the apple pie.
author: Katie C.

description:
We passed by Mission Pie on the way to El Faralito and were intrigued so we came back to try a slice afterwards. 

None of the popular flavors were available today (banana cream, strawberry rhubarb) so we ordered a slice of the peach berry pie. It was $4.50, which is a fair price for any pie shop. I was very disappointed with the pie. It wasn't very pleasing to the eye - the berry colored the peach a sort of lavender gray color and the oatmeal crumble topping was sparse. I appreciated that the pie wasn't overly sweet, but it just didn't taste very good. I am 99% certain that the peaches were canned, which was very disappointing because peaches are in season and I'd expect any gourmet pie shop to use fresh ingredients!

I probably won't be back but if I do, I'd stick to the popular flavors.
author: Anna H.

description: I had the peach and blackberry pie with their homemade whipped cream. I really liked that it wasn't too sweet and the crumble on top was pretty good. However, it didn't really wow me as it goes for pies.
author: Vy T.

description:
BANANA CREAM PIE! That's all you need to know :)

My company ordered pies from here a couple of times and from the ones that I've had, I have to say the banana cream pie is the best. Now, I'm not a big fan of bananas, no pun intended, but this banana cream pie is delicioussssss. It's not very sweet and it's real bananas, not mashed but sliced. Cream on top is light and fluffy, very complementary. The crust was also really good. It's still crispy and not mush from all the filling, amazing!

I also got to try the pumpkin pie and pear-raspberry. Pear-Raspberry was really sour, no likey. Pumpkin pie was... interesting. It's mashed but there's still pumpkin strands, ya know what I mean?! It could be a little sweeter too. It's just kind of bland.
author: Benita M.

description:
I loved the ambiance, but found that the pies actually fell pretty short of my expectations. 

This is certainly a great place to meet a friend for coffee or get some work done. The savory food looked pretty delicious, too, but the peach pies and the strawberry cheesecake pies that we came for were both pretty underwhelming.
author: Laura P.

description:
Mission Pie offers sweet and savory pies in all shapes and forms and has become a pretty landmark location due to its central location in the Mission and its retro feel.  The ingredients are sourced locally and the menu rotates depending on seasonal ingredients.  The menu is beyond simple with something for everyone.  The pies themselves are delicious, with a perfectly cooked crust and excellent seasoning for the stuffings.  I was lucky to get a seasonal pumpkin, which was delicious.  

PROTIP:  There is also the option to add a dollop of house-made cream if you so please.
author: David C.

description:
I live in The Mission, and I admit (a little shamefully) that I go to Mission Pie at least once every 2 weeks for a slice with my partner. This review is on my last experience, and not my overall experience, but it frustrated me enough that I felt it justified an overall review of 2 stars. To be fair, the pie is always pretty good and probably 4/5 stars. 

The reason for my 2 stars: 

I was completely lied to by the guy who handed me my 2 slices of pie, simply because it was busy and he wanted to move on. 

We ordered 2 slices of pie and a side of whipped-cream. The slices always come in very small cardboard to-go boxes, and the two boxes are always stacked on-top of each other and tied together with a string. The whipped cream always comes in a small 8 oz paper coffee cup with a coffee cup lid. 

When I was handed my 2 slices, I asked for my whipped cream. He told me it was in the box. I said I wanted it on the side. He then told me it was in a cup inside the box. Since the box looked too small to fit the cup and the whipped cream, I checked and saw that it was dolloped on the pie. I explained to him that we weren't going to eat the pie for a few hours and originally asked for it on the side. He stood there for a few seconds before asking (in a a non-inviting way) to redo them. I said, no worries and left. 

After walking out the door, it occurred to me that he flat out lied to me. There was no way that one of those 8 oz cups would even fit in the box on it's own, but if it did fit, there's NO way it would fit in there without completely crushing the slice of pie. He didn't think I would be able to peek into the pie box the way they were tied together, so he just told me what he thought would get me out the door. 

The mistake, I cared a little about but I know they were busy so I could get over it and understand completely. The lie.... well that was just so frustrating as a loyal customer.
author: Kristen M.

description:
I did not visit the store but was lucky enough to have these pies delivered to our office for coworker's birthday. I have to admit I was impressed! I believe a good pie has a few criteria. First of all, the pie crust should be crusty and buttery and they delivered on that. Secondly, a high quality pie should have fresh ingredients and in their case, the pumpkin and apple taste fresh. Last but not the least, the pie should not be overly sugary; the main ingredient already has natural sugar and added sugar just enhances the flavor. 

They definitely deliver on all 3 points. I was in love and I want more..
author: Athena C.

description: If I can only say one word I'll say yummy! I had the chicken pot pie a couple weeks ago and I've been dying to go back! The crust was delectably flaky and soft, and the inside of the pie was mouth-watering. The only thing I had a problem with was the inside of the pie wasn't hot enough originally..but not a problem! She put it back in the oven for five more minutes and voila!
author: Evin S.

description:
I have a couple dozen pie places I like to frequent, globally (when I am in town, that is). Mission Pie encapsulates what makes a bakery & pie stop: warm pies & friendly service, and the availability to make any pie a la mode. They also have various artisan jams for sale, which make for excellent decoration. 

I found the art on the walls to be a little provocative, but hey - what pie place isnt?

The hipsters here mostly keep to themselves, but be warned they can linger here long after their pie has cooled & been consumed. 

This place is also dog, children & old people friendly.  I would have to 10/10 recommend bringing your grandma here.
author: Mike M.

description:
Mission Pie is a nice dessert location. I came here on a weekday evening and while I was able to find a table, it got a bit loud once people started filling in. It was hard to have a conversation and hear everything my friend was saying with others around.

The atmosphere is very simple and much life a coffee shop.  As for the pie, they were pretty decent. I personally like the Raspberry Pear. Definitely get your pies with ice cream.
author: Nick A.

description: Stopped in for a classic apple pie and coffee. It's reasonably priced for SF at $5/slice but wasn't mind blowing. The bottom crust was rather soggy but the apples themselves had good flavor and right amount of sweetness. Coffee was very good, super hot and smooth.
author: Emily H.

description: I had the Chicken Pot Pie and a slice of the Berry Pie, which was strawberry and blueberry.  The Chicken Pot Pie was really lacking in flavor, would not order it again.  Ironically, I just saw the same comment in another recent review.  The Berry Pie, however, was out of this world! DELICIOUS!   The flavors of the strawberries and blueberries were not a combination I would have put together but it was truly one of the best slices of sweet pie I have ever had!  Net net - skip the pot pies or at least the Chicken Pot Pie and order a slice of the Berry Pie.  I am betting that the other sweet pies are just as wonderful!
author: M A.

description: Came here and got a Pear blueberry pie which was the bomb!  It was too good and not too sweet with the right amount of crumble and crunchy crust.  They have a kiddie corner where adults can enjoy and paper wrapped flowers.  There was a line to purchase and the pie was about $27 for a whole (I thought whoa!!) which is kind of pricey for a pie but once in a while is a treat.  They have a variety of pies, such as, vegan pies, chicken pot pie, and fruit pies.  I would highly recommend them.
author: FG L.

description:
- Fresh pies
- $4.50/slice or $27 for a whole pie
- pot pies are $8 each
- nice crust (stayed crunchy)
- we had a slice of banana cream and regular apple
- Apple was more cinnamon flavored (I like Ikeda's pie the most, then Petaluma Pie company is a good second place pie winner)
- Banana cream was smooth
- would go here again I was in the city
author: Mary H.

description: How delicious! These pies are amazing. It was amazingly good. Decent. Really. You can order by the slices are or get the whole pie.
author: Alejandra G.

description: Love love love this place! My boyfriend and I always come here for some nice comfort food. Typically get the chicken pot pie. Their dessert pies are great too!
author: Annie T.

description: Recently lactose intolerant and this place hits the pie spot. Fantastic vegan pies! Slices are a little on the small side.
author: Carla M.

description:
Hands down. Banana cream pie is A+++. Everything is fresh, timely, friendly service. Only wish the place was bigger because they're always BUSY! came in at 830pm craving a piece of pie... they never disappoint. Try their food too, it's DELISH. Had their quiche, omg, so light it's. .. 
::nodds head:: Solid.
author: Janie K.

description:
Chill place to talk and hang out :)

Pies are decent. I had banana cream pie. They could have better crust.
author: J J.

description: Well, I guess you just have to get the Banana Cream Pie because 15% of people who wrote reviews say so. And in all honesty, the Banana Cream Pie is so delicious so you should get it! I've played around the Mission District so much but didn't realize that this place existed until recently. I like the setup of this place but the tables can fill up quick with lots of pie-eaters. I like how this place serves alcohol too. If you're in the Mission around 25th St., you have to check out this place for a piece of goodness.
author: Marlon T.

description:
I went here with my friend & we split a slice of vegan apple rhubarb pie. 
It had great presentation & was excellent! 

Having pie on occasion is a very American patriotic thing to do so. 
Jack Kerouac ate a lot of apple pie during his travels around America.

I have seen Isa Chandra Moskowitz's book "Vegan Pie in the Sky" that looks interesting yet coming here for the vegan pie is the next best thing than baking your own. 

They also have vegan pot pie on hand so if you are vegan come here & you'll be pleased!
author: Shane S.

description: Delicious bacon, cheese and spinach quiche of which we had 2 slices each followed by a chocolate brownie which was a great balance between nutty and smoothly chocolatey. Only reason 1 star is taken is because the cashier serving us very clearly judged us for our order of more food than she is clearly used to.
author: Josh J.

description:
$4 for a slice of DELICIOUS piece of pie? Sign me up, buttercup! 

You'd think that $4 for a slice is overindulgence, but it's not! How much do you pay for a Sprinkles cupcake...or a bakery brownie?! I stopped by on a Friday afternoon after some alleyway mural exploring in Mission. Their pie selection looks heavenly! I really wanted to try the rhubarb pies (if it's in season, why not?!), but my friend wasn't too down with trying it so we had strawberry apple. Totally scarfed that in four bites. Not joking. 

This place is perfect for an afternoon snack or even a post-dinner stroll when you're craving pie. They also serve tea/coffee/drinks in cafe fashion, but the PIE is what they're known for. I'm glad they only serve pies because if they start introducing cakes and pastries, it would take away from their signature dish! Having a nut allergy, I looked at all of the pie crusts with wariness...especially because I'm pretty allergic. The cashier confidently told me that all of the pies were nut-free except the one with walnuts...so I was VERY ECSTATIC to learn that the strawberry apple one was safe.

The ambiance is very open-space, loft-ish, and clean/bakery-organic style. All of the workers have that sound-of-music/apron-wearing/flour-on-face vibe that makes you feel like the pies here are baked with love and warmth. They have a restroom in the back, past the front cashier stand area. They also have self-serve water with utensils and napkins, along with an environmentally-friendly sign asking you to help save the water! That's what I'm talking about!! 

Service, food tastes/portions, and pricing is all pretty great considering it's SF and in the Mission district. I would totally come to this cafe-esque joint for a date spot, meeting close friends, or bringing my parents! It's very all-encompassing for whatever situation you're in, but I wouldn't come here with groups larger than 6.
author: Jodi H.

description:
The banana cream pie is SO. DELICIOUS. I love the thick, crispy crust and the fluffy cream that basically makes up the entire filling of the pie. There's some bananas as well. This pie is served cold but it is still so good! It's refreshing and not too sweet. I feel like I could eat a couple of slices of pie here if I hadn't eaten a meal previously.

If you want to sit down to eat your pie here, you really have to be aggressive in taking open tables. This place is really popular so there's a long line (at least when I went on the weekend) and not that many tables...My friends and I actually were about to claim a table when another customer said 'OH SORRY. We were waiting for this table! We've been here for a while...' so we had to give up the table. Also experienced walking towards empty tables when another customer speedwalks/runs past you to sit at that table. So, you have to be aggressive!
author: Theresa L.

description: I love everything about this place. Try their $8 stew dinner or the pot pie. So delicious. Lovely people and great cafe like dining room.
author: Natalie T.

description: Except the fact that it does not provide wifi connection, this is a cool place offering healthy food. Also they have good vegan food selection.
author: Melody O.

description:
I'm a banana cream pie & coconut cream pie kinda girl.

On the fruit side, then it's cherry or strawberry or peach.

Hearing the banana cream pie here is a force to be reckoned with, I eagerly ordered what I thought was the last slice.  But, apparently there was more in the back.

It's probably not fair that I just recently had Pig & Pie's pie, or that I still have a blazing hot memory of how fantastic the banana cream pie @ Nation's was...

This was a clean & delicious banana cream pie.  No doubt.  But honestly it fell short of what I was expecting; which was a stellar pie.

The strawberry rhubarb was better.  Just a bit tart, light, & a crust that was not heavy.

The space is 5 stars.  Beautiful fresh flowers, spic & span clean, nostalgic. Very nice.

There are several savory options as well.  Chicken pot pie, soup, etc.  Need a jar of fresh jam?  They got you covered.

Good.  Solid.

3 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: One of the best walnut tartlets I've ever had! It had the perfect amount of sweetness and was super gooey from the inside. Good size to share with your partner with some latte. Reminded me of my Eurotrip on a Sunday night. Potato gratin with creamed corn was delicious as well. I'm not a tea or coffee person, but thier chai with vanilla milk was something I could come for. Overall, a great place to chill.
author: Haya M.

description:
When I say I don't drink, I get the same old cliched, eye roll worthy reactions and interrogations that makes me want to get into a plank position. We need more people who actually value others' company without the need to intoxicate themselves and everyone around them. God forbid, in the modern age, someone goes against the herd mentality, thinks for themselves, and makes their own life choices! The more you try to force a self respecting person to drink, the more they will rebel against you and lose respect for your zombie ass. So stop with the douchy behavior and mind your goddamn business. 

Ok now that I have that out of the way, let's talk about the wonderful chess pie at Mission Pie. I'm used to that good old classic Graeters chess pie from Ohio- for Californians, Ohio is a state/black hole in the mid-western U.S. So I didn't initially trust any other pie with the same name. This pie had a few cranberries in it- not too much to ruin the flavor but overall this was quite a sexy pie. I dig it.
author: Bhavi A.

description:
Now, I don't consider myself a pie afficiando by any means, but I do eat them enough to be able to distinguish between the great, good and the bad. And the pie at mission pie, undoubtedly is great. Maybe even the best you're likely to find in SF -- I certainly haven't found better.

I've gone multiple times with friends and got a slice or two to share. There's ample seating so it's usually a good spot to catch up with them at too. The warm pies served with ice cream (if you like) are delicious and perfect for those rainy sf days (or dry sf days too). 

Another thing Mission pie is great for is potlucks. I'm not much of a cook, so will often take a pie from here to such occassions. And trust me, everyone loves them!
author: Tanay J.

description:
This place came highly recommended to us by a friend, so on a weekday morning, what did two tourists decide to eat for breakfast? Pie, of course! I was sad to find out that they didn't have blueberry pie (my absolute favorite type of pie), so I settled for a slice of the banana cream. My boyfriend ordered a slice of walnut pie with fresh whipped cream on top. 

My pie was good, but not great. I appreciated that the banana pudding appeared homemade with specks of vanilla bean inside and was perfectly balanced in sweetness, but the texture was a little too gelatinous for my taste and not as soft and custardy as I expected. My boyfriend and I both enjoyed his pie more, which tasted like a nice twist on a pecan pie without being cloyingly sweet. My biggest complaint with both pies was the crust. I've had some amazing pie crusts, so this one just didn't cut it. Instead of being light and flaky, the crust on both pies was tough, nutty, and very hard. It almost seemed overbaked, but I couldn't figure out if it was on purpose or not. I reluctantly ate the crust because I was hungry, but wish I could have just left it there.

The place itself is bright, airy, and hipster. You order at the front, get a little placard for your table, and they bring you your order once you're seated. Prices were fair (~$4 for a slice of pie), and there were no real complaints with service besides the cashier failing to tell my boyfriend that the whipped cream that she asked if he wanted would be extra. We didn't find out until we checked the bill. Oops. Besides pies, they also do scones, muffins, and coffee cake, among others. I tried a sample of the coffee cake at the front and it was really good. I loved how they added a layer of raspberry jam to cut through some of the richness. Overall, a solid place that I would return to if they changed their pie crust.
author: Katie H.

description:
My observations:
- If you search pie on Yelp SF, Mission Pie is the first thing that comes up. 
- I'm sure SF has a large population of pie die-hards who insist on getting pie on Pi Day and documenting the experience appropriately via Instagram.
- Tourists tend to be die-hard for any relatively well-known SF attractions.
- The Mission can be touristy on weekends.
Therefore, I was prepared to brace myself when I decided to come pick up pie here on 3/14/15, i.e. ultimate historic Pi Day which fell on a Saturday...... and it turned out well! The pie itself exceeded my expectations, while the wait time and associated hassles were not that bad. 

[THE PIE]

Darn SF... my whole life I have been completely satisfied with Costco pies, but after Mission Pie I'm sure I can't go back :X

(+) Shaker lemon: Think the lemonade stand days of your childhood formulated into a marmalade and packaged into fresh homemade crust. It has the perfect balance of sweet and tart, and for anyone who knows what I'm talking about, the bits of lemon peel and overall citrusy sweetness reminds me of Korean yuzu tea.

(+) Pear blueberry: I've had this before at Peasant Pies, but I like Mission Pie's version--they have tasty chunky wedges of pear, and the granola topping is surprisingly delicious.

At $4 a slice, it does seem a bit pricey if you compare to something like Safeway, but Safeway bakery is extremely meh. I think Mission Pies has an appropriate market equilibrium price, considering the portion size is decent, the quality is good, and this is in SF where a tart from Tartine's is $7 and a single scoop of ice cream from Humphry Slocombe is $4. 

[THE HASSLES]

I admire how well they managed Pi Day craziness--in that hot and crowded and salivation-inducing-bakery-smell room, I don't know how all the staff maintained calm smiles, friendly service, and an efficient workflow. Despite all my risk factors for a disastrous outcome, I was in and out in half an hour with two delicious slices of pie. 

[AFTERTHOUGHTS]

Yes, I took an Instagram, and yes, it got a lot of likes :P
author: Edna C.

description:
Ok, I'm sold. Each time I come here seems to be better than the last. This time, we got an apple huckleberry mini pie to take home. After getting back and toasting it up a bit, it paired perfectly with some toasted almond ice cream which we ate while watching some Netflix.

These aren't the greatest pies ever but I'm coming to the reality that this may be the best store to buy whole pies at in the whole city. (I'm not including Sunset/Richmond or farmer's markets because, lets' face it, neither is a reliable source unless you plan unreasonably far ahead.) "I'm a fan."
author: Mark O.

description: So yum!! I love that they have vegan options as well as the 'normal' options. I got the peach and blackberry pie a la mode and it was so delicious. I was debating getting another slice! The atmosphere inside was really cheery and there was a good mix of families and friends hanging out. My friend and I spent about 2 hours there and we didn't feel rushed to leave, which was great. Staff was awesome - especially because there wasn't any seating available right when we came in so we ordered and then asked to be served when a table opened up. They were super accommodating! Definitely would return!
author: Priya B.

description:
After a tasty and filling meal at San Tung, I was having cravings for sugar.  Lots of sugar.  

Then I found this place.  Quaint and quiet, late at night, I found myself with the perennial dilemma: one slice, or two slices.

Then I consulted the wise words of Young the Giant:
"My body tells me no, but I can't quit, cuz I want more"

They were so right.  A slick of berry pie and a slice of walnut pie the spot, or many spots.  The ecstasy came from my taste buds up to my brain, and helped me ignore the fact my belly was hanging out.  

Love this place.  I would love it if the pies were a bit more moist.  And if they could adopt Dangerous Delicious pie's Baltimore Bomb pie, the people of the west coast will feel so special.
author: Neal V.

description: Nothing special about this place. I have certainly had much better pies almost anywhere else. Also, they don't seem to take pride or care in their pies. I would think that if your name is Mission Pie you would put some effort into your pies. Second time there, second time underwhelmed. One of my few culinary disappointments in SF. The pie slice sizes are very inconsistent--the people next to us had slices almost twice the size of ours.
author: J A.

description:
It'd be great pie if I actually got what I ordered!

This has happened twice now--my bf and I went in and ordered two banana cream pie slices to-go, got home to discover they gave us two chocolate cream pie slices instead. On a separate occasion, my friend ordered two banana cream pies and got home to discover they gave her an apple and pumpkin pie instead. What's up Mission Pie, why're you giving us the runaround??
author: Jenn C.

description:
A small place with a small selection, but totally worth the stop. 
I had the walnut tartlet. My fella had the apple  blackberry slice. 
Walnut was soooo good. Would have loved a little sprinkle of salt on top to round everything out.
I am now a convert. Walnut pie totally beats pecan pie.
My fella loved his slice. 
Worth a stop for some homemade goodies if you are in the neighborhood!
author: Kat R.

description: Ordered a pear/raspberry pie to share with friends on Thanksgiving. One key ingredient was missing: raspberries. As a result, the pie was quite bland and a hefty disappointment to those expecting berries in their berry pie.
author: Duane V.

description:
Dear Banana Cream Pie, words cannot describe the magical sensation you gave me today. 

The sweet creamy texture, the chill within each bite. It was almost like a soft served ice cream in you, but then it's not. I can feel the real banana chunks in every single bite and this tell me how down to earth you are. 

This feeling... How can I describe this, it's like when I first started dating someone. The honeymoon phase, the butterfly at our first date, yes. That's how you made me feel. I tried my best to resist another slice of you today as I want to assure you that the next time we meet, it will be another wonderful journey.  

Love,
author: Pinhsi L.

description:
Friend brought the mixed berry pie to the Fourth of July BBQ. I'm not big on sweets so I was like meh, I'll just have a bite. It was a big fricken bite. Had to fight my boyfriend off because he was trying to steal my pie. I was so sad when I served everyone and realised there would only be enough for one slice per person. Okay now I'm thinking about pie again. Dammit. 

Mixed berry pie everyone! Mixed berry pie!
author: Eunah T.

description: Absolutely, the best place I have eaten at in a while. The chicken pot pie is to die for. The mimosas are out of this world. I always order two. And their pear raspberry crumb pie with whip cream is the best. I love the atmosphere of this place, hipster chic. If you find yourself near the 24th St. BART Station, head for Mission Pie.
author: Terri J.

description: Just finished up a couple of delicious tacos at La Taqueria and was looking for a great dessert to top it off. I found it here. They have a large variety of freshly made pies, and a pretty hip cafe style atmosphere. I got the chocolate creme pie and my goodness, it was perfect! The service wasn't anything worth too much notoriety, but was good all the same. Keep doing your thing guys! I'll be back.
author: Sami M.

description:
My boyfriend and I stopped by here just to sit down and relax from walking around looking at all the murals.

The cashier definitely looked like he wanted to go home. No smile on his face, he actually looked like he was going to fall asleep! My boyfriend tried telling a joke to wake him up and all he did was stare back and say, "I'm sorry...whaa?" Hahaha funniest thing ever! 

At least he got our order correctly. My boyfriend ordered an iced mocha and I ordered a delicious chai. We also tried their apple pie. It was pretty tasty, just wished it was warm and it looked like the time we came there weren't many pies left.
author: Jaclyn M.

description:
Pi day got me thinking about this place.

It's easy to find because it's conveniently located on the corner of 25th & Mission.  It's a hop, skip, and a jump away from the 24th and Mission Bart station or right off the 14 line.

Plenty of seats inside.  I particularly enjoyed sitting by the window.  Great place to people watch.

I expected only sweet pies but they have a nice selection of savory ones as well.  I tried a savory galette.  I'll have to come back and try a slice from one of their sweet pies.
author: Janice C.

description: Fast and friendly service!  Pie slices were $5.85 each.  You're probably going to need to order 2 slices in order to satisfy your sweet tooth, because these slices were a bit too small and pricey.  Banana cream pie was delicious, double crusted apple was meh.  Trust me when I say Costco apple pie is way better, so maybe order something else.  I like how they open till 10pm!  Good for a first time but not worth coming back.
author: Sabrina T.

description: Good pies, not great.  It could be the pies we chose on our particular visit - Banana Creme and Pear Blackberry.  The Banana Creme was very creamy - not quite enough cream on top.  The Pear Blackberry didn't have much filling.  It was a lot of crust.  Tasted good just needed more.
author: Diana T.

description:
I've been eyeing Mission Pie for some time...so I was finally excited to have the chance to visit post brunch.

I really didn't have the room to eat then and there so I opted for a slice to go and I have to say...even after several hours, this pie still tasted AMAZING. The peach berry was definitely unique in several aspects. The sweet peach balanced the tart berries nicely, but my absolutely favorite part was the crust. Adding some oatmeal definitely boosted its texture and gave it a nutty flavor. I scraped up every last bit in my box.

I can't wait to come back and try other varieties!

Pie and coffee for breakfast sounds like a great idea always.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
This is probably my favorite dessert place in the city at the moment. To be fair, pie is my favorite dessert, so I'm somewhat biased... In any case, the location is convenient, the pie is amazing, and the atmosphere is laid-back and great for casual hanging out!

A few pies that I've tried and highly recommend:
- Banana Cream: I think everyone recommends this, and it's no surprise. The banana cream is just the right amount of creamy and delicious. It's not overwhelmingly sweet or fatty (at least, it seems that way...no guarantees on actually nutritional value).
- Pear Raspberry: This is a winning combination of fruit tastes: sweet, mild pear and tart-y raspberry go together really well. It's not overbearingly sweet or artificially fruity.

The crust is always perfectly baked and crispy, not soggy or hard, which is the case with more inferior pies. It's pretty impressive that the pie is (usually) served cold but still so delicious. It's also really impressive that they charge $4 a slice (about 1/6 of a pie) and I'm still giving them 5 stars.

If you love pie, you need to stop by. If you don't, maybe this place will change your mind!
author: Brittany C.

description: Adorable pie shop in the mission that pops out from the landscape of Mexican and el salvadorian restaurants. Love the decor. Came in for a bit of dessert and a happy hour beer. Great variety of desserts and would come back.
author: Linda L.

description: I was a little disappointed my favorite pie is strawberry rhubarb so I thought this was the place to go, but it was a little too watery. However the crust was great I would go back but I would try something else
author: Reema I.

description:
Mission Pie is one of those places that happens to be a bit over-hyped. I came here with high expectations of the chicken pot pie, but was disappointed. I felt it was too watery in the inside and not too hearty. The crust was delicious, but the filling was not up to par. What was the redeeming quality of this place, however, is the banana cream pie, filled with generous slices of real banana and light whip cream. 

If I were to return here, it would strictly be for the dessert pies, namely the banana cream pie, which earned the 4/5 rating from me.
author: Sheena T.

description:
Mission Pie is a typical San Francisco cafe with a cool, hip, young, hippy vibe and real tasty food and imbibe. They sometimes offer real funky pies like the satsuma custard pie (with whole orange peel inside, whoa) or pies that are bitter as eff like the ever popular lemon pie with whole, braised (or something) slices of lemon including the pith. I'm someone who will try all those funky pies, but in the end I'm someone who wants the comforting, familiar pie. 

That pie is the banana cream pie. It is soooo yummy! They use real, good, organic ingredients (I'm sure), and chock it full of banana flavor. Banana cream pies are normally stacked as follows:

Whipped cream on top
Vanilla custard
Slices of banana
Crisp crust

And Mission Pie's d-d-d-dominates! It's so crispy, not at all soggy, and I particularly like the strong vanilla essence. Most other places skimp on this, but not Mission Pie.

Their hours and location are great as they're right next to the 24th mission bart station. I often take out-of-town guests here for a nice SF treat. Usually seats are full, but chill for 10 minutes and you'll find a spot, so be patient.
author: Sarah W.

description:
There were plenty of dessert pies in this place and there were even some meat pies. I'm sure they would have been great so I decided to try something outside of my comfort zone: "Asian Eggplant with Bok Choy" Pie.

I was prepared to not like it. But it turned out great! The crust was flaky and buttery and the vegetable filling complemented. Seriously, I was afraid it was going to be vile. It wasn't I promise.

But for those who seek out pies for comfort, this might not be the thing to order.

There are several tables available for dining in. There is even a "children's section in the corner with a small table, short chairs, and some toys.

Don't even ask about the parking: We're in SF. We walked here dude. Much easier.

They have this incredible pie box to keep your pie intact if you're planning on buying a pie to go. Great as hostess gifts.
author: Kislev A.

description:
So nice I tried it twice. 
Translation = I've come to here two times. 

Satsuma Chess Pie!!! 
Translation = Get this pie. It is so bomb.

Good amount of tables for small groups. Sweet and savory pies. Delicious flavors. Other breakfast & lunch food too. Homey environment. The best seat is the window bench seat / table nook. Very family friendly. 
Translation = None needed. That was plain English there.
author: Joanna L.

description:
Chicken pot pie was good, but not the best I've ever had. The crust was very delicate and perfectly baked and the veggies were delicious but the chicken tasted a bit off to me. 

The banana cream pie was amazing!!! I've had this at Tartine and the one here blows Tartine's out of the water. Normally I'm not a fan of these types of pies but this one was not too sweet at all and tasted extremely fresh and fluffy. Will definitely come back to try other pies here. 

Cute place to have a quick but sit down lunch. Lots of open seating available that started to fill up around 12:30 pm. Great service. They even kept our pie cold and brought it out after we had finished lunch.
author: Yin H.

description:
Whoaaaaaa!

Mission pie, you got me good! Your peach, pear, raspberry pie is the best fruit pie I've ever had! TRULY!

"You da best I ever had
Best I ever had
Best I ever had
Best I ever had"

From the juicy fruit, crispy oat topping and jam-like outer crust - your pie is effortlessly extraordinary!
author: Rosalyn W.

description:
Love the service, food, and variety here!! Each visit here has been consistent, regardless of day of week or time of day.

My favorite is getting a slice of different pies and they are kind to put all the slices in 1 tin to make a "whole" pie. My friends and family love trying all the different flavors - sweet or savory - and especially the seasonal fruit ones.

My recommendations/ go-to's are:
- Dutch Apple
- Pear 
- Banana Cream

A word of advice: the shaker lemon pie should only be consumed if you really really like all parts of the lemon. There is a lot of the peel in the filling which is not enjoyed by all (me).
author: Anna M.

description:
The best pie place in the city. Bar none.

Alright friends, let me introduce you to Mission Pie. We have to start with the pies themselves. They do it all, sweet pie, savory pie, whatever you want, they'll do it well. I love the chess pie, vegan rhubarb pie (this pie literally made my mom go from "What the heck is rhubarb" to "OMG GIMME MORE RHUBARB PIE NOW", I kid you not), and of course the crème de la crème: the dutch apple pie. Now that is a pie, ladies and gentlemen. I dare you to eat a slice and not instantly want another one. In fact, just get a whole pie and pig out. It is so good.

In addition to serving a delicious pie, Mission Pie is just a really chill place to hang out. They have nice pastries, wine, and an awesome hot chocolate covered in their homemade whipped cream. And location, location, location! There's always a lot happening around 25th and Mission, yet Mission Pie always packs itself full of people. Kudos to you, five stars.
author: Nikhil S.

description:
Let me start by saying that I do not love pie. It's not that I hate it, I would just rather eat cookies. Or ice cream. Or brownies... Therefore I did not expect to like Mission Pie.

However, Mission Pie blew my mind!!! I split a slice of pear raspberry pie ($4.50) with my boyfriend on a Friday night. We ordered and paid at the counter, and then sat down at a table with our number.

I took my first bite and the first thing I noticed was the crust! It was buttery and flakey deliciousness... The second thing that hit my tongue was the solid combination of pear and raspberry. Neither was overpowering the other, and the sweet and tart flavors were completely balanced! The fruit texture was perfect. Another great part of the pie was the granola crumble topping!

They have a very large selection here! They also serve other baked goods like quiches, galettes, salads, and pot pies that looked extra intriguing. I hope to be back soon! :)
author: Tara A.

description: Let's stop thinking about creampie for a second and talk about the peach pie. Oozing sweet peaches enveloped by a light flakey crust and splooged with whipped cream - be forewarned that moans may discharge with each mouthful.
author: Suany W.

description: This is one of those hidden gems in the city. The pies are excellent and perfect with hot chocolate one a cold day. I bring my son here not only for the pies and hot chocolate but they also have a little kiddie table with books for the kids.
author: Steve K.

description:
I come here every week to get a slice of pie and a cup of coffee! I've been coming here since high school! They used to have unlimited refills for their coffee but I think they changed that a few years ago :( but I guess everybody stayed the whole day and that probably slowed their business down (me). So I guess it's understandable. 

  But back to the pies! --The pies here are so goood! I always get their cream pies! At one time they had coconut cream pie, it was my absolute favorite! But when they don't have that, I usually get the banana cream! Their cream is homemade, and it's not too sweet like I how like! Also it's fluffy and just sooo delicious! But all their pies in general are pretty good! 

  Not only their pies but I think their salads and breads are also pretty bomb! Just try everything if you come here!
author: Janet K.

description:
I'm not too big of a fan of the typical, commercially-baked pies that you buy at any grocery store, that also happen to be brought to EVERY SINGLE holiday party/potluck. They tend to be overly sweet with a slightly soggy crust, and it makes me think for a moment that I dislike pie. But Mission Pie is a blessing that reminds me of how pie SHOULD be.

Tried a slice of apple blackberry and a slice of walnut. Both were the perfect level of sweetness, with a buttery, flaky crust and that lovely home-baked taste. I also loved how the apple blackberry had a good balance of sweet and tart, with the sliced apples being soft while still having a bite (again, unlike commercially-baked pies, which would have soggy apples)

Looking forward to coming back and trying their savory pies, as well as more sweet ones!
author: Sara L.

description: Went with my best friend. I got the choco cream she got banana cream. Eat both at the same time. It was great. Crust is thin but surprisingly crunchy, the filling is a bit liquidy but its nothing to complain about.
author: Angie W.

description: This place was wonderful! When I heard that they had vegan pie, I was sold. I called and they said they had one slice of vegan pie left (it was late at night) and I told them I'd be there soon and they held it for me! The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, and the pie was amazing! I loved everything about my experience and will definitely be back next time I'm in San Fran!
author: Lindsay M.

description: The pies with the crumble toppings are the best! Especially with whipped cream and/or ice cream. Cause you need to be real here, you're not here for your health, so put some damn whipped cream or ice cream on the sweet pies. Also, the only way I'm sharing my dessert is if you get one flavor and I get another, then we half.
author: Theresa D.

description: My friend and I visited Mission pies last night and ordered our pie to go. I had a slice of strawberry apple. When I arrived home and opened the container, the portion was tiny. A few bites and I was done! Presently I reside in the East Bay and hope that my craving for your delicious pie is satisfied upon my next visit.
author: Paula G.

description:
I would definitely say mission pie has one of the best pie spots in San Francisco. I highly recommend the banana cream pie it has pieces of banana but what makes it so delicious is the vanilla bean custard thick body. We can't forget the tasty crust that makes this pie just that more delicious. The crust is thick and flaky in the other edge. 

The peach pie was good but it tasted way to sour for my taste and wished it was more sweet. I prefer to order the elderberry pie because it's both tart and sweet. Therefore making it a better choice.
author: Brenda M.

description:
Delicious and creamy. One of the best banana cream pies in SF!

November 2013
*Banana cream pie http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mission-pie-san-francisco#YeaUXdfeRlJwTw6tWOKXwQ

Damn, now I want a slice!
author: Elena N.

description: This place is a great find. I came across it during a search for a vegan pie for a birthday celebration. We picked the peach raspberry pie as per the store's recommendation and it was delicious! It was perfectly done with good quality luscious peaches and nicely topped off with crumble. A hit with the whole group, and in hindsight a certainly better decision than a vegan cake! Also pretty affordable : $27 only for 8 slices of pie!
author: Madhuja S.

description: Great pie but very disappointed they charged for a refill on plain ice tea. I don't think I've ever paid for a refill anywhere. Had to wait in line 10 mins to pay for the refill.
author: Rich S.

description: Excellent lunch place. We had a rice based salad which was good, a good omelette -- and excellent pies: apple, walnut, apple blackberry. The lemon curd pie was slightly bitter.
author: Charles L.

description: Great little corner of San Francisco, a soothing cup of coffee, delectable mini pie of raspberries and white nectarines and view to people watch the afternoon away. Love, love this city and the smorgasbord of treats it offers. Mission Pie you are scrumptious!!!
author: elizabeth c.

description:
Food and decor here is awesome.

They are recycle conscious. 

Food is excellent. Got the pear and raspberry pie with whipped cream, it was excellent. Pear was sweet, raspberry was sourish so flavor wise it was a great choice. 

A friend got the broccoli and cheese quiche and said flavor was excellent as well! Would certainly come back.
author: Chhaya N.

description: I hadn't been here for years! The last time was on a Mission tasting tour - gosh, I can't remember how many years ago that was. I was in the area one night and was starved! I love comforting food like chicken pot pie, so I couldn't resist. There's a little bit of a wait for it, but it is worth it as the pie was crispy and flaky and the flavors of the chicken filling inside was just perfect, so comforting and just right for a chilly, San Francisco evening. I promise not to let so many years fly by again! I'll be back!
author: Maile N.

description: The pies are small in portion, but definitely good. Pricey for what it is. Great iced coffee!
author: Riley C.

description: Simple corner coffee shop with delicious pies. And if there is an Arnold Palmer contest they win.
author: Cecilia C.

description:
First date idea: 
Go to la taqueria 
Go to mission pie 
Sleep for 10 hours 
Get married 

You're welcome 
10/10 would pie again
author: Will L.

description:
I don't know why I have been having so many subpar experiences at the places that I have been going to lately... The last three or four reviews I have given have all been three stars. Then again, they were all on my bookmark list, meaning I had heard great things so maybe I had high expectations for these places...

Anyway, likewise with this place, I had heard great things about Mission Pie so I was excited to try it out... I got the chicken pot pie, the potato/leek/fennel tart special, and the mixed berry pie. Now I will say that these pies all beat Marie Calendars any day... But... Sadly that's where it stops... The chicken pot pie was very soupy instead of thick and the berry pie was pretty average... Tbh, I've had better at whole foods and trader joe's respectively. The potato tart was decent but it truthfully did not taste like it was freshly made.

However, what really makes me feel like this place is overrated overall is their crust. That part is sometimes the favorite part of a pie for me and while Mission Pie's was good, it was still pretty standard and nothing beyond your usual pie crust. I honestly expected much better especially considering they use fresh and local ingredients and instead felt pretty disappointed.

Overall, not a terrible place, but as a pie lover, I had a pretty anticlimactic experience...
author: Kunal N.

description:
Why did it take me so many years to finally try Mission Pie!?

After the Yelp event in SF last night, the boy-o and I ended up in the Mission for tacos, and I was very happy to spot Mission Pie right next to our favorite spot - naturally, we went in. The place has the feel of a comfortable, relaxed coffee shop, but with the delicious aroma of freshly baked pie coming at you at all times (aka heaven).

We ended up ordering 4 slices (some for home, some to drop off with family), but the very nice pie man ended up giving us 5 slices instead (score!). On top of their INCREDIBLE hot chocolate, we ended up getting (and loving) the:

+Mixed Berry
+Peach Blackberry
++Banana Cream
+Plum Frangipane Tart

I will most definitely be back when I want some of the best pie in the Bay Area!
author: Claire S.

description:
Quaint pie place close to Cesar Chavez

The inside is decorated like a fancy retro pie shop, with menus that look like they are from the "Back to the Future" era, locally sourced veggies for sale, and hipster-ish-looking waitstaff. There's also free wifi, and the cash register is actually a Square device.

Of course, they also have a large selection of fancy pies! The turkey pot pie was superb--warm inside, with a fluffy crust in the center, and a hardened crunchy crust on the outer perimeter.

Retro, vintage, hipster, techy, and geeky. With pies. Can't get much more SanFrancisco than that y'all.

mmmmmmm piiiiiiie
author: Henry L.

description: Great Pie shop. I am always happy to see places like this. If you are in the mood for pie this place does not disappoint! Great pies both Savory and Sweet. I like to stop in here once in awhile and have a slice of pie and a cup of coffee. I usually have to try a hand pie while I am there too.
author: Nick L.

description: chicken pot pie was very bland with dry pieces of chicken in a thin sauce.  crust could have been more flaky. kinda expensive ($10) for what you get.
author: H S.

description:
I'm shocked that I never wrote a review of this place. I've been coming here on and off for years and the food is almost always 5-star. The pies, the stews. I'm not quite as fond of the pot pies, but even those are usually at least 4-star. The mixed berry pie today was no different. Right amount of sweetness, crisp but not burnt crest, tasty fruit. So why the 3-star review?

Disrespect for the customer.

I understand that costs are going up. I see restaurants all around adding surcharges, raising prices, etc.

Higher prices I can take.
Passive-aggressive SF employer mandates surcharge I will put up with.
Extra charge for this or that, understood.

*Provided* you make it clear to me in advance of my purchase what the price is going to be so I can make an informed decision.

Surprises on the check are not okay.

So when you start charging for whipped cream on the pie you need to put it on your menu right near the price of the pie. Tonight, I didn't see a Whipped cream +.25 anywhere.

Had you told me ahead of time, I likely would have happily paid it. Instead, you've lost me as a customer.

The sad part is I know what I'm missing. Instead of win-win, it's lose-lose.

So, 5 stars for the food minus 2 stars for the dis equals 3 stars for the review.

Bye, Mission Pie.
author: Charles B.

description:
A must try here is the BANANA CREAM PIE! A smooth, sweet cream on a good, decent-sized crust. UMM! Did I mention it has a good banana flavor too.

I also tried the peach blackberry pie. It was good but not as good as the banana cream. It was more tart. Good for those who enjoy that over sweeter items. 

The best part is you can buy them by the slices and share with friends! Because sharing is caring.
author: Christine N.

description:
Wow... how have I never heard of this place? I've been back to San Francisco more times than I can count, and now I'm just discovering this little gem. Mission Pie is THE TRUTH.

I wanted to take back something sweet that my wife could snack on, so based off a suggestion from my friend, he suggested that we visited Mission and get a pie. When I think pies, I think to myself... if I take an entire pie back, it's just not going to hold up well on the plane ride. Well, when I heard they have the option to sell by the slice and how tightly they packaged it, I was sold.

Their menu is fairly simple, consisting of ten different pie flavors: apple, vegan raspberry, pear raspberry, walnut, sweet potato, cranberry chess, apple blackberry, banana cream, shaker lemon, and pear blueberry. They might be subject to change up their flavors, but the last two times I've visited, it's remained fairly consistent. 

If you go by the slice, it costs $4.00, with complementary Straus Family Creamery organic whipped cream. For an additional $1.50, you can add a scoop of organic Vanilla Bean ice cream. Totally worth it if you plan to eat in!
author: Steve N.

description:
Food 5  Every pie I tried was so tasty! but Pear pie is the best! 
Ambience 5 homy, warm, and welcoming
Service 4
Price 5  good price, big portion!
author: Tory T.

description: Wow, this place blew me away. I ordered a pie by phone and got it delivered to a hotel.  The hotel proceeded to lose it.  Karen, over at Mission Pie, proceeded to be so determined for my friend to get her pie to her that she PERSONALLY delivered it!  She also texted me once it was received and made sure the hotel called me, as well.  On top of that, my friend loved the flavor of the pie and was blown away.  As. was. I.  @Karen -- you've convinced a New Yorker to be a loyal patron. Thank you again for going above and beyond!!
author: Jennie A.

description: Buttery and fresh pastries and pies. I had the coffee cake and slice of apple pie. Yummy I can't wait to go back and try some more items on the menu.
author: Infodiva B.

description:
