I never really crave pie but boy did that change quickly!!! I got a slice of pecan and my friend got mixed berry. Each slice was $4 topped with a dollop of organic homemade whipped cream (it tasted like milk and it wasn't that sweet which I liked because I was afraid I was going to get a sugar attack coming here). I shared a scoop of organic vanilla bean ice cream for $1.50 - I don't know what kind of vanilla ice cream I was eating before because this was SO damn good. It was partially melted when we got it though - not sure if that was done on purpose but I felt like that made it taste better. When my friend wasn't looking, I dived in with a big scoop :P 

The pecan pie had the perfect amount of pecans and dough. Perfect combination of sweet, soft and chewy. The crust was a little flakey and crumbly. I had a bit of the mixed berry and it tasted like a type of berry granola cereal. It was a little too sweet for me, but it was still delicious.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
I was leaning more towards four stars, but decided on three. We stopped in a few weeks ago, on a lovely evening, and shared a small salad and two slices of pie. The peach raspberry pie was by far the winner. The freshness of the fruit stood out, and everything melded together well. The frangipane tart, which I believe had nectarines at the time, didn't taste like much. The frangipane flavor was pretty weak. The slaw we got was similarly underflavored/underseasoned. Could have used a little more punch.

I know people love this place and I'm happy to give it another shot and see. There was a walnut chess pie, I believe, that was calling my name!
author: David B.

description:
I'm going to pull the "I used to work as a pie baker" card here and say that Mission Pie is wonderful. Fresh, seasonal fruit pies in a very quaint and a little kitch atmosphere. 

I've always had lovely service here. Last night I ordered two slices of Apple,  a decaf Americano and coffee cake to go. They threw in a broken piece of Apple on top of what ordered, which was generous. I think the prices are very fair, especially for SF. 

I will say that I've gotten a few bits of pretty dry crust, but the long flake makes up for it. I appreciate the lack of sweetness since the fruit tends to be pretty sweet already. 

For those who complain about the fruit being in its mostly unchanged form, why would you want good market-fresh fruit to be cooked with a shit load of sugar? I would rather experience high quality fruit that needs minimal prep. I love that the whipped cream on my pie was unsweetened, or maybe barely sweet. It paired with the apple pie nicely. 
Coffee is always great too.

Mission pie does a great job or attracting a diverse crowd and they have a diverse staff which is really lovely to see.
author: Natalie J.

description: Pies are okay, nothing spectacular. Great place to study or chat with friends and wonderful service.
author: S W.

description: If the reviews are true and this is indeed the best pie shop in SF, then I'm one very sad yelper. I've only had the classic apple pie here (my baseline for assessing all pie shops). It was a-ok - but underwhelming after reading all the hype. The crust was neither golden nor buttery. Big disappointment. But the apples were decently fresh (as expected during apple season) and I appreciated the variety of the menu and the openness of the space (i.e. availability of seats).
author: Jen H.

description: Had an apple blackberry pie delivered through post mates. The pie had a thin crust that is medium flaky and a Dutch crust on top that is buttery and crunchy. I prefer more of a thick flaky crust, but I enjoyed this pie. The fruit filling was well cooked - still slightly firm and not at all runny.
author: Christina G.

description:
One of the best pies in the Bay Area. Trust me, I know my pies. I've been eating pie since the womb. My family always keeps the pie next to the rice cooker. Apple, peach, banana cream, mud, pot, 3.14, etc. I've had plenty of them all! Pie is the appetizer before the meal where I was raised so I could make a great argument for why Mission Pie is one of the best.

Crust: Light, not too thick and not too buttery. Cooked to perfection and really balances out the fillings. I do, however,think the crust could use a tad more butter.. But then again, I think everything can use more butter.

Filling: So far, I've had the Banana Cream, Apple Rhubarb, Mixed Berry and Strawberry Rhubarb. The filling really makes these pies go from good to great! Not too sugary and plenty flavorful. Also, their filling to crust ratio is on point.

Service: I usually call in my orders if I need full pies and the workers are very nice. I suggest calling ahead and asking what time your pies will be made. Sometimes they don't finish baking until 10:00-11:00am. They get me in and out quick, love it!

Mission Pie is always a solid choice. I HIGHLY recommend the Banana Cream since it's one of the best I've had. The only Bay Area pie place I like better is Peter's Bakery in San Jose.
author: Chris W.

description:
Cool place, plenty of pie options, good pies, mostly fruit styles (no chocolate),  awards on the walls, and local kids work there making the pies and taking orders. They take credit cards and have a public restroom.

Decent amount of seating, not to loud and you clean up after yourself.

I tried slices of apple, and a mini pie with huckleberry, not bad but kind of pricy for 2 slices of pie and 1 mini pie, around $20.
author: Keith A.

description:
I love pie, and I definitely enjoyed Mission Pie. I tried the Peach pie with vanilla ice-cream (a must add on!!) and it was delicious. The peaches were very sweet and fresh, and the pie crust was divine. The only reason I didn't give it 5 star was that although it tasted great, it wasn't the most amazing pie I've ever had in terms of the perfect pie crust to fruit ratio.

However, if you're looking to satisfy your sweet tooth after dinner or just feel like have good ol' pie, I would highly suggest this place!
author: Claudia C.

description:
Their banana cream pie is to diiiiiie! 

My best friend swore that Mission Pie's had the best pies... and she ain't nevaaaa lied! The banana cream pie had the perfect mixture of bananas, whipped cream, and custard. My mouth is watering as I type this.

Go here! You won't be disappointed.
author: Steffi G.

description:
The banana cream pie had a jello texture; it was gross. The crust was so thin it practically didn't exist. Scrap your crust recipe and start over. I don't know why this place gets such good reviews, it isn't good. 

Note to manager, make people who have been sitting at a table drinking coffee for hour leave so people don't have to stand while eating the food they just purchased.
author: John S.

description: These pies are so delicious!!! I have tried the Banana Cream, Vegan Pear Rasberry and Blackberry Apple. I will eventually try them all, but the Chess Pie is next. The pies are sooooo fresh, I don't feel guilty eating them!!! I love them all so far...keep 'em coming!!!
author: A D.

description:
This place is terrible! Please stay away! don't get any of the pie here because its just the worse pie in the history of pie. I can't even stress how much I want you to not go here, like don't even walk past it. And if you see someone inside stuffing their face with all of the pies, soup and savory items, it's NOT ME!!! That is this guy I've seen before who really looks like me and says crazy things like "THIS IT'S THE BEST PIE I'VE EVER PUT IN MY FACE!!" or "I CAN'T STOP EATING IT, I NEED ALL THE PIE THEY HAVE!!"
He's an idiot who has no idea what he's saying. But YOU, you should definitely stay away. And don't get their chicken pot pie with their dumb flakey crust, and stupid creamy, hearty filling, I swear you'll regret it till the day you die.
Their staff are just unbearable with their table service and smiling at you and treating you like a friend, you don't know me!
I'm giving them five suck stars cause they suck so bad.
And my stars are red which everyone knows stands for danger. So ha! Take that, Mission Pie!!!
And just a reminder that that guy inside, it's not me!!! Its my twin brother or something...
author: Daniel J.

description: We all know how good this place is for pies but their savory items and lunch menu is exceptional. It keeps rotating but I have yet to have a bad lunch here. As the weather gets colder and wetter, these pot pies are only going to get better.
author: Mike V.

description:
Hang on a second. There's gotta be a glitch in the matrix here. Things aren't supposed to taste this good. Like, are you serious with this Mission Pie? You can't be that tasty. That's just not fair man.

Their banana cream pie is ridiculous. It should be illegal. It's more addicting than certain drugs that I've never tried myself. Like, there's an actual layer of bananas in their banana cream pie. It's just so silky smooth. Their crust really is the best part though. I'm one of those guys that hates crust. It's such an ugly word. I don't even eat pizza crust and I only tolerate bread crust. The crust here is wonderfully flaky and sweet. Like, if the pie itself was just crust, I would have gotten seconds.

I'm kind of happy this place is so far away from home for me. Those random cravings can stay cravings instead of me just getting huge from being a regular here. But, if I'm ever in the area, I'll leap at the chance to drop by here.
author: Sean H.

description:
Banana Creme Pie

I've been going through a banana cream pie craze. Yelped for a place and Mission Pie came up. Their version of banana cream pie is really good. Pricey, but the quality speaks for itself. Their BCP is really dense and custard like, rather than creamy and fluffy (which I like). The crust has a bite to it and did not flake off. Overall, though this isn't my favorite kind of BCP, i'd still come back and try other things because they sure do make some good pies!
author: Lena T.

description: I've lived in San Francisco for 4 years and never had a chance to try their pies. My friend took me to this place and I instantly fell in love with their pies. Their pies are so good I had to bring a couple of half pies for my friends back in Sacramento, and they just loved them.
author: Geetha M.

description: Banana cream pie! My favorite kind of dessert. It's not too sweet, the filling has plenty of bananas, fresh whipped cream, and creamy pudding. They also have a ton of other pie flavors but I only have eyes for the banana cream pie.  I'm not that big of a fan of the crust, but it's not bad. It's a little too dry and not flaky enough for me, but it'll do.
author: Linda H.

description:
Savory quiche: 5 Stars!

The filling reminded me of Bouchon's quiche. The filling is very light,  soft,  and tender Not mushy at all for it can stand on its own. Very well done!   It is hard to find quiche in the area which has this type of filling. The crust was very flaky. 

Staff were very informative on which items were vegetarian as well and they offered to heat my quiche as well. 

Centrally located in the Mission area. Close to Bart Stop.
author: Kitty D.

description:
Stopped by here on my way to the 24th and Mission BART station today. Great little gem in the Mission. True to the name, most things on the menu are pie-related, but there are also other brunch items on the menu as well. While I was there, I tried out the popular chicken pot pie. 

I have to say, their chicken pot pie is probably the best pot pie I've ever had. I thought the portion was kind of small for the price, but everything else about the pie was done right (crust, filling, etc.). I will probably go back to try some of their sweet pies in the near future since I saw a lot of people coming in to pick up sweet pies for takeout.

It should be noted that this spot is also a great place to sit down, have your morning coffee, and do a little bit of reading. Lots of light and a great almost home-like atmosphere. Will be stopping by again soon.
author: Derek L.

description: Had some time to kill in between appointments so I stopped in for a sweet pick me up. I decided on the strawberry apple pie. Apple is my all time favorite pie and if you add strawberry, one of my favorite fruits, it only makes it better. I would say this was a good slice of pie but not the best. There was not enough fruit inside for me. Also they rely on the natural sweetness of the fruit. There is not a lot of added sugar or even very much of the gooey apple sauce in between the slices of fruit. This is a personal preference because you might like it to be a little dryer and less sweet. The crust was great and there was a bit of a crumble on top. Also since I was going to see a friend the next day, I picked up a mini pie for them. They only offered one that day and it happened to be the strawberry apple pie. A slice is almost five bucks and then the mini pie is about $8. Not bad. They take credit cards. And I wasn't asked if I wanted it to go or to enjoy there. But they must've assumed I was taking it to go because of all the pie I bought. Haha. But after they delivered it to me, I settled into one of the few tables/chairs and ate my slice there. Not a lot of table so I shared with a few people. It was fine. Huge windows brought in bright light so it was perfect for enjoying the afternoon and people watching. Haha. I will be back to try their different types of pie.
author: Alison W.

description:
Came here late at night because I was craving pecan pie all day.
Got a slice of walnut pie which was close enough to pecan.

I'm not sure if it's because it was almost closing time but I felt like the pie really wasn't that great.
The crust wasn't flaky but more like dried up and held together by melted sugar.
Like I couldn't just cut through it with my fork; I had to work for my bite of pie.
Call me entitled, but I don't order a slice of pie at 9:45PM to struggle with it.

A friend got the apple pie which was also just alright.

BUT as they were closing up they offered us free leftover pastries as they were kicking us out.
I opted for a blueberry scone which I ate for breakfast the next morning.
But that was also just ok... haha

I would actually give this a 2.5 star but I bumped it up for the free pastry.
author: Samuel P.

description:
Fruit pies, cream pies, pot pies, seasonal pies, galettes, quiches...you name it, Mission Pie's got it!

Ordered a slice of Banana Cream Pie and Blackberry Peach Pie and dug in. Verdict? Good pie, but nothing special.  They taste fresh and they're made with locally sourced/organic ingredients when possible (which is a huge plus), but I didn't have that wow factor that I was looking for. If I were judging on taste alone, I think Nation's pies are just as good, if not better. 

The blackberry peach pie felt like it was lacking fruit and a lil bit of sugar. I think there were a total of 3 peach slivers and a few blackberries tossed in, with a sprinkling of crumb topping. I wanted more fruit! And more crumb topping! The homemade whipped cream didn't taste like there was any sugar added either, which means I got all the calories without the flavor! The Banana Cream Pie was the better of the two. The bananas were firm and fresh and not at all brown and mushy. The custard was light, creamy, sweetened perfectly, and topped with a satisfying layer of cream. I was hoping both of the crusts would be thicker and flakier, but they were thin and walking a fine line between a stale and flaky texture.

Whole pies are ~$22 and slices are $3.50-4.00. They also have a wide array of coffee drinks, along with tea and milk options on the menu. Cash only!

I still think Mission Pie is a great place to sit down with a friend and enjoy a slice of pie. The combination of the tall glass windows, the hardwood floors, the artwork on the walls, the chalkboard menus, and the beautifully displayed pies make for an inviting atmosphere that I will check out again in the near future!
author: Deanna Y.

description: First off, *super* friendly service. I know it's not required, but it's great to feel like everyone is just as excited as you are about pie! My bf and I purchased two slices of strawberry rhubarb to eat in the restaurant, along with one pecan and a curry to go. I don't absolutely love rhubarb pie but I found myself enjoying the one here. The pecan was perfectly delicious with a buttery crust and just-sweet-enough flavor. The curry one was a bit under-spiced for my taste. I also received incorrect reheating instructions for it, which likely didn't help. If I come again, it will be for the sweet pies.
author: Jessica R.

description:
Walking through mission, I actually just accidentally stumbled across this place and thought, why not. And I'm glad I did. It seemed like a nice little place, run by nice little people, serving pies, tarts, hot pockets, and the ilk.

I got the potato and leek tart, the chicken hot pot, and the banana and cream pie slice (yes, I'm a glutton), all to go. They packed it really well and the stuff remained intact till I got back home. 

The leek and potato tart was delish. Soft and the potatoes were cooked perfectly. The chicken pot pie, similarly, did not disappoint. It was nice and juicy on the inside and yet the crust outside was crunchy and not soggy at all.

When I finally took a bite of the banana and cream pie, I immediately regretted not bringing back the whole pie. It was divine. Soft and not too sweet. And the crust was nice and flaky, not doughy.

What a lovely meal. :-)
author: Avadhut P.

description:
Popped in with my gal for some dessert and it was amazing!  Busy well into the night it was still full when we were there at nearly 10pm.  My gal got the walnut tartlet and I got a slice of apple/blackberry.  Fresh flavors, great crust....We're hooked and will be back for sure!
Thanks Mission Pie Shop!
author: Jim P.

description:
I've been a fan of their pies for some time now. The banana cream (personal favorite) is consistently mouth-wateringly amazing, natural tasting and isn't overbearingly sweet. Crusts are buttery and flaky. I know there are other pies however each time I'm craving a slice, the banana cream is what I'm salivating for so I can't stay I've tried many of their flavors. 

I've read in other reviews complaining the taste of banana isn't as apparent as they'd hoped in the banana cream. I mean it's flavored with real bananas. Perhaps they are used to pies inundated with artificially flavoring? Just a thought. 

They also offer pot pies, galettes and quiches for those who prefer savory over sweet.

They've recently started taking plastics. Thumbs up! Way up!
author: Esther A.

description:
The pies are amazing! I found these guys on my search for banana cream. I'll normally order either the B cream or Chess pie. Both are really good.

It's however disappointing they charge a $2 fee to slice your pie for you.
author: Masa K.

description: Dinner in the Mission led to dessert in the Mission at Mission Pie! So excited that they've got their Mini Strawberry pie in right now. It's one of my faves and I couldn't wait to get over there to pick one or four up!
author: Dori D.

description:
These pies are really good. No question. The sweet pies are better than the pot pies though. Our chicken pot pie came out warm. Not hot. I personally lime my pot pies hot. We also had a curry stew which was pretty good. 

The highlight of the meal was dessert. We had a strawberry rhubarb pie and a banana cream pie. Both money!!!  Really good. 

Great little neighborhood spot for sure.
author: Steve J.

description:
Lets start with the GOOD GOOD!

!) Banana cream pie - crust was flaky crunchy and delicious.  Filling was not overwhelmingly sweet and had chunks of bananas.  
!) Berry pie - it was berry good with chewy granola goodness and buttery flaky crust.  Goes really well with yogurt the next day - seriously!!  Try this one with yogurt!!

NOW THE LONG DREADED STORY!

My co-worker and I trekked over here via BART from FiDi area to Mission area.  The moment you walk out of the BART station, you KNOW your no longer in FiDi district.  And because of the recent iPhone snatching that occurred in this area, I was on my guard as we walked down the street to this location.  It was my first time strolling the streets of Mission Street and my Spidey senses were kicked up into high gear!  So happy, it was only a big block away from BART.  That was really easy.

As you enter, you can't help but notice the patrons happily devouring slices of pie.  That is always a good sign.  In the pie window case, there were different types of pies that looks like grand-ma-ma baked them.  They are home style, freshly baked, and you instantly fantasize about taking each one home and smashing it against your face to get a good lick off the side of your mouth.  Ha!  

My co-worker ordered a couple pies to take back to the office for a farewell party.  She got in line as I lingered in the background contemplating buying a slice or half to bring home.  When I finally decided to buy a slice, I got in line with one other person ahead of me.  What I noticed is the cashier was ubber nice to that lady ahead of me.  But when my turn came up, the cashier turned her smile upside down and wasn't very courteous or friendly.  She took my order, my money and didn't bother to thank me, even though I thanked her.  When my pie came out in a box, she handed it to me with a frown and I tried to get her to smile or say something nice to me by offering my Thank You.  Nope...not a peep out of her.  Not cool. 1 point deducted due to bad customer service to me.  

I compared my notes with my co-worker.  She bought several whole pies and I thought maybe they were nicer to her.  But her reaction was that she acted weird towards her.  So, we both didn't have good service from the same cashier.  

Even with this sad service, the pies speak for themselves.  The pies are wickedly delicious and will make you wanna cry with glee!  I enjoyed it.  My co-worker enjoyed it.  And the farewell party goers enjoyed it.  Pies are good!  Service is not.
author: Jenny T.

description:
Danger! Danger! I just moved into an apartment two blocks away from Mission Pie! I'm not usually a pie person, but the banana cream pies here are irresistible! I think I'll be gaining the mission 15 pretty soon. Almost pudding-like in consistency with a thin crust and not overly sweet, it's the perfect summer dessert! If you're eating your slice on the spot, ask for a la mode. A scoop of vanilla ice cream makes it perfect. 

A whole pie will cost you $24 - a perfect addition to any BBQ, picnic, pot luck, or house warming party. Just don't forget to pack some utensils! We bought a pie with us to bring to Dolores Park and ended up having to eat it with a pair of chopsticks that my friend happened to have in her purse from some Chinese food she ordered last night among the 8 of us. Turned into the worst pie stabbing in history!

This joint also makes for a great casual date spot post-dinner if you want to do something other than grab a drink at a bar. You can also buy your date flowers for $12 here!
author: Catherine C.

description: Walnut pie and rhubarb chess - SO GOOD. Not too sweet. Also love their granola. And their savory menu is unique and enticing. I've come around to loving this place, not just really liking it.
author: Andrew K.

description:
One of my favorite spot in Mission, cheerful lovely food and space. I love to go Mission Pie morning for coffee and pastry, lunch, afternoon for pie, dinner for supper and for midnight pie!  
Not only pie is good, but also their supper helps me when I want to take a break for cooking, it's delicious and fresh, price is great too.  
Great place to chill and chat!
author: Misha O.

description: The banana cream pie here is by far the best banana cream pie I've ever tasted. So light and fluffy, and not too overwhelmingly sweet. Crust was perfect - just flaky enough, and added the perfect balance of contrasting texture to the cream. Banana flavored foods are so hard to get right, but Mission Pie succeeded 100%. Also, I love the Mission, so the location was prime. Interior is cozy and lovely. Definitely going to revisit this place.
author: Katherine Z.

description: The pies here are a little pricey but you get what you pay for. They're the best in the city. They have a good selection of ready-made pies to go if you're looking for a special dessert.
author: Sean C.

description:
I ate apple& cranberry pie! Really Yummy!!
Apple was alive in the pie, but I could find only one cranberry:p
author: Jini K.

description:
So yeah...I drove 50 minutes to get a banana cream pie and I would do it again any day of the week.  I actually got 2 pies, B-Cream and Key Lime (special that day) and they both were freaky awesome.  The filling on both the pies were delicious and the crust (my fav part) was made with love. 
Can't wait to go back.
author: Robbie Y.

description:
I must venture a guess that the people who love Mission Pie have simply never had good pie. 

Today I shared the mixed berry pie and banana cream pie with my daughter. I opted for whipped cream on the mixed berry, since my child tend to love whipped cream.

The mixed berry was ridiculous. No form at all, just a slopped mess on the plate. There were whole strawberries in it, making it more troublesome to eat than a slice of pie should be. It was incredibly mediocre; the flavors were not fresh. The pie was more or less bland until you got to the end crust which, with the berry liquid baked into it, tasted nice. The whipped cream was a MISTAKE. It had the most unpleasant noxious flavor and lacked sweetness almost entirely. 

This famous banana cream pie... I do not get it. I didn't come in with unreachably high expectations; I'm not the type to base my opinion on what I see on Yelp (my friend had suggested this place). It was, as I said before, incredibly mediocre. The filling lacked much flavor, the cream lacked sweetness, and the crust was brittle. 

Spending $9.28 on two slices of pie should've resulted in a much more pleasing experience, not one that left me feeling completely "meh".

Lastly, the decor is annoying. I rarely let a food place's decor affect my opinion too much as long as it isn't filthy, but Mission Pie clearly needs to get its life together. A lame painting of Paris Hilton? Really? Come on. It's giant right on the wall when you walk in. I cannot.

Sorry, I won't be back, Mission Pie.
author: Liz G.

description:
This was my first time at this how of the sweet & Savory house of Yummyliciousness.
I found the apple pie I had was simplistic yet very delicious.
The Customer service given by:Super Cool Sharon & Awesome Iris was Five Star Sweet and Savory as well.They never made myself and my friends feel rush,they had great smiles,and they that great of a job and the pie tasted soooo good we came back again the same day that  evening.Great pie,Great people,Great place.
author: Fred S.

description:
First time over at Mission Pies, and it seems like a nice place to grab dessert after enjoying some food in the Mission.

The restaurant is small, as to be expected of the area, but unlike other restaurants here it doesn't seem to be very crowded (at least when I came here on a Saturday night around 20:00).

I ordered a Blueberry Chess pie, which was balanced in flavor and served in a manageable slice. The pie was a little thick for my taste, however unlike a lot of the processed pies I am used to eating this one didn't make me feel overloaded with sugar afterwards.

A major plus for this place is that they have free self-serving water, and another benefit is their use of Square technology at the checkout counter, which I found to be convenient.

Would come here again if I'm in the mood for some dessert in the Mission area of San Francisco.
author: Alexander S.

description:
Thank you Mission Pie, for teaching me what a Shaker lemon pie is. I never knew, and it's improved my life significantly. Also a big fan of the seasonal fruit pies (especially the strawberry rhubarb pie I have at home waiting for me for dessert). 

Love the educational element of this place as well. And they sell beautiful cut flowers, which I found out recently when my boyfriend picked some up for me. All in all, a lovely place.
author: Tasha D.

description: Mission Pie, yum! We have been here twice now and love the friendly service and cozy seating.
author: Sabrina W.

description:
How to know IF he's a keeper:

1. He makes you smile.
2. He makes you giddy inside. 
3. He makes you "O".

I don't even like sweets much less pie (unless I'm PMSing). Bananas? Ehhh, other than for phallic visual purposes, I could care less. 

But one bite of Mission Pie's Banana Cream Pie was all it took me to make me CREEEEEAAAAAM all over myself. The crunchy buttery crust against the velvety smooth banana pudding topped with a fluffy, indulgent layer of cream alongside sinfully creamy Straus' vanilla ice cream was incredibly foodgasmic. Bite, after bite was like having a multiple "O". MmMmMmmMmm...

Mr. Banana Cream Pie, HE'S A KEEPER: http://bit.ly/VY0imm!

OTHER NOTES:
*Friendly service with a smile. Kudos to Mission Pie for collaborating with non-profits to hire interns on their staff.
*Locally sourced and farm direct ingredients used for all menu items.
*Seasonal Menu - Sweet Pies: $3.50/slice & $20/whole pie and Savory Quiches & Tarts: $4.50/slice & $26/whole. 
*Skip the lackluster Chicken Pot Pie ($7); center was tepid and filling was watery with very little chicken. 
*CASH ONLY
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Came here after dinner hoping to fill our crevice with dessert. We were excited based on the great reviews on yelp. We ordered a slice of apple pie ala mode to share. When our apple pie came, it was literally the shittiest piece of pie we've ever seen. I don't understand how they can serve this. It was so small and limp, there was literally no filling at all (not exaggerating) just crust covered by a scoop of ice cream. How can you charge $6.50 for this?? Wish I took a picture of how ridiculous it looked. We didn't bother complaining, just never going back.
author: Carmen G.

description: Their apple blueberry pie was outstanding. I wasn't as impressed with the beef paprikash supper whic was a bit bland for my taste. The atmospheric is great. It's nice to just hang out, and the staff is super nice.
author: Michael Y.

description:
My friend brought me to this small pie shop for some pie. We were going to order two different slices, but we decided to save some room for ice cream after! 

They have both savory and sweet pies. I love banana cream pie, but I let my friend choose and we ended up with sweet potato pie, which was pretty good. It had a good consistency - not too runny or mushy. It wasn't overly sweet either, and the whipped cream it came with it was very light and tasty.

Friendly workers and reasonable prices (~$3.50 for a slice of sweet pie)- much cheaper than some other pie places I've been to!
author: Catherine C.

description:
The pie ain't nothin' special.  Its like "would you like a bite of this pie" "uh, sure, fine, I guess" when it should be like wow. The best thing about the pie is that it tastes like its not that bad for you.  I had the blackberry peach.  The fruit inside was fine, but it hadn't been transformed in any way.  It was like heres some peaches and some blackberries.  The crust was not very good.  It was too crunchy in its dry places and too soggy in its wet places.  Altogether I think the word to describe the pie is kind of bland.  Its better than a 5 dollar supermarket pie.  But they charge 30.

The person at the counter gave me bad vibes.  There was a server moving through the room and I tried to ask her a question.  She didn't stop, she kept moving past me as she answered my question.  It wasn't nice.
author: michael m.

description: First time here and probably my last. The service was lacking as the staff didn't great me and the tables where unclean. The pies I ordered did arrive at my table quickly but ...they where lacking in flavor. I'm a native San Francisco resident and it's a little disheartening to know these new shops pop up left and right but aren't adding to the flavor of this beautiful ever changing city
author: Chris T.

description:
First time there. Very friendly staff and a nice place.

Ordered a whole banana cream pie (27 dollars).

I think the cream and custard part is very well made, but I was disappointed by the crust (which some would argue is what makes a pie special). For the price, I feel like it kind of failed me.
author: Danielle A.

description:
Highlights
- I'm so glad I had a slice of their heavenly pies last Thanksgiving, because I could not stop thinking about it since and I made it my mission to swing by this year to grab a few pies to share this pie goodness with others for Thanksgiving. 
- Procrastinating at it's finest, I waited until the day before Thanksgiving to swing by and looked online to get an idea of offerings for the day and since I missed the cut-off to order ahead a few days prior for pick-up in store, they offered a first come, first serve, walk-in option beginning at 12:00 pm. 
- Line was out of the door and wrapped around the store, but it moved quickly (was in and out probably about 30-40 mins), a nice employee came out to let us know we were okay and looped us in on offerings for the day. They offered a coffee station complete with sugar/milk for patrons in line and they came around with a bowl of fresh mini mandarins, while I waited in line in the store. What a sweet gesture and greatly appreciated! 
- There was a local vendor setup in the store promoting and selling cute totes for picnics and groceries, nice that they support local businesses. 
- Pear and raspberry pie: must try! scrumptious large pieces of pear with raspberry and topped with a crumble top. It's the perfect amount of tart and sweet and absolutely delicious with a side of ice cream to pair with it. Guaranteed a hit dessert for any gathering! 

Improvements
- Showed up about 20 mins after they started serving the first come, first serve walk-ins and they were already out of both pumpkin and walnut pies by the time I got to the register. No biggie, since I got to get 3 pies including a few of my favorite pear and raspberry but bummed I wasn't able to try these classics that others have raved about. 

Tips
- Parking is hard to find in this neighborhood, street and metered parking only. 
- They also serve savory mini pies, which I definitely need to try: chicken pot pie (sold out for the day when I arrived in store), Italian wedding, and minestrone. Yum!
author: Tracy T.

description:
Best mixed berry pie ever!! We got a slice to go and I literally licked the box. I make a mean peach and blueberry pie and apple pie, but I admit this pie is better... Much better. Also, it helps that strawberries are on season. Plan on going back this weekend to buy a whole pie!

The banana cream pie was also good. It was super light and had more of a custard texture!

Yum yum yum!
author: Christina C.

description:
Best turkey pot pie anywhere. So homemade. Best crust. 

Shaker Lemon. Never a lemon pie like it. 
Serious shit here. 

Another reason to move to Mission.
author: A. J.

description: Three trips to this jewel in The Mission...super good! I've had the chicken pot pie twice. Just as good as it can be...the crust was perfect, flakey, just a tiny bit too done on the edges-love it! Hot big chunks of chicken and every vegetable in the garden, excellent. I had ice tea, they have a couple different kinds of ice tea, lot's of choices for beverages. Pie...good grief...if I lived any closer, I'd be as big as a barn. Super good "non-dessert" pies...and the dessert pies, forgetaboutit...I had apple a la mode, then a slice of strawberry...like I said, it's a good thing I live a ways away. Just AWSOME, clean everywhere, sunny with big windows, very friendly people working there...it's always had a busy floor going but it's kept bussed...really a good place to relax with a nice warm lunch, read the paper...there is an area for little kids. I would enjoy bring out of town guests here to show off this part of our wonderful city.
author: Rodney M.

description:
This pie will make you very happy you found it 
May feel like reuniting with a lost lover...oh my goodness Banana cream smacks own goodness that will make your day
author: Mike N.

description:
I don't really get the banana cream pie hype here at Mission Pie - the filling was a little to gelatinous for me (had a jelloy consistency) and I was looking for something more creamy and rich. The crust was too hard and not buttery enough, kind of like a grocery store crust. I preferred the berry pie over banana, but enjoyed the cream.

Favorite Pie In Order:
1) Tartine: OK, it's not really a pie, but the banana cream tart is close enough and it will change your life. 
1) TIE FOR FIRST: Palo Alto Creamery - ZOMG, amazing banana cream pie, AMAAAzing crust.
2) Mission Pie
3) Chile Pie's
author: Jess C.

description: Chicken Pot Pie. Those three little words mean so much to me. This place rocks!! They have pies galore sweet and savory. But I'm always a sucker for the good ole chicken pot pie. They even have farmers market fresh flowers and a little mini fruit display for purchase near the register. I had a meringue for dessert. Almost as delicious as my main course. But my heart remains loyal to the CPP! I'll be back folks.
author: Tallestbird R.

description: The pies tasted great but I found a long black hair in my chicken galette. Really wedged in deep in the crust. Please you guys wear hair nets.
author: Emanne B.

description: Crowded on a Friday night around 9:30pm, but it makes sense as dessert post-dinner. I ordered the apple pie ($4.50) with a scoop of ice cream ($1.50). For the price, I wish the slice was a big bigger, and the presentation could've looked nicer. The pie came with half melted small scoop of ice cream and half the pie was broken off. There were big chunks of apples but the pie crust itself was a bit too burnt for me.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I am not sure why people rave about this place.  It was such a small piece for $5.  And there was hardly any filling in the pie! I got the strawberry rhurb pie which is one of my favorite and boy was it disappointing when they served it to me.  It was so flat and I was not even sure there was fruit inside.  The crust is nothing special either and I definitely would take a safeway peach pie over it (for you guys who have not tried this peach pie, don't hate until you have tried it and made it ala mode!).  

Though maybe I picked the wrong pie.  I did want to try the lemon one but it was out and there are rave reviews about that one and the banana cream pie.
author: Lauren S.

description:
BANANA. CREAM. PIE.

large space; cute decor and friendly service. They'll let you hang out for a bit but it gets pretty busy. we were there at a friday night and opted for dessert instead of the bars nearby. Strawberry Rhubarb pie is awesome as well. Sweet and tart with a yummy crust. I wish their slices were bigger! :D
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Mission Pie is easily one of my top 5 favorite places in San Francisco.

The mixed berry pie served warm with ice cream on top is literally TO DIE FOR. The last time I came, they only had one slice of mixed berry pie left, so my friend and I split that and a mini apple pie -- the mini apple pie, while good, just did not hold a candle to the mixed berry. The tanginess and crumble on the mixed berry pie are truly outstanding. I've also tried their famous banana cream pie, which I think is good as well but still nothing compared to the mixed berry.

Long story short -- come to Mission Pie if you have any appreciation whatsoever for sweets, but if you try to take the last slice of mixed berry pie, I'll fight you for it.
author: Kelly R.

description:
3 words: banana cream pie. 

The only place I know in this city that sells sweet, delicious pies, but it's also the place that makes them best! The crusts are flaky and the fillings are sweet, but not overly packed with sugar like those store-bought ones! They also have some savory options, but I only really come for the sweet pies. They also have seasonal pies, so if any of them sound appealing to you (which most do) you should be sure to try them! 

Knocking off a star because for a slice of pie, it's a bit pricey, and it's a bit out of the way (But maybe that's a good thing because if there was a closer location, I would probably have gained 100 pounds and been broke since all I would eat is their pie)
author: Judy B.

description:
Came here for a late dessert on a Friday night. Was pretty crowded, but I guess that was expected for the weekend. Got the banana cream pie which was $4.50 (kinda pricey? I have nothing to compare it to). It was pretty good, not too sweet but can still satisfy my dessert cravings. The crust was super crunchy though, and breaking off a piece sometimes made it go flying. But other than that, what's not to like about bananas and cream? 

It's a small place but with lots of chairs. They also have quiches and some savory options. Maybe I'll try that next time.
author: Justina L.

description:
I'm more of a fan based on their very community-minded goals. The food itself is probably a 3 for me. *sigh.

Lemon Pie - kind of good, but they didn't do a good enough job of seeping the bitterness out of the pith of the lemon. It was pretty clear they used Meyer lemons, which I love. Sweet with a touch of the sour. But because they didn't prep the lemons well enough, it was very bitter. Bitter and sweet. Bittersweet (get it?)

I was also intrigued at the strawberry rhubarb pie, and had a slice of that as well. Don't call me a pig, I shared so I only had a bit of both. This one was slightly better, but a little too sweet for me. 

What makes me like this place for more than the pies is that it actually invests back into the community. They donate gift cards and other items to local non-profits for fundraising efforts. I also read that they do a type of work-learning program for youth to get more involved and learn about the pie-making business. I like. I like a lot.
author: Lily W.

description:
I tried the place out because of the good yelp reviews. This is a cute little place but the pie and the service left more to be desire. We ordered chicken pot pie and another sweet pie. The chicken pot pie is freshly baked and served hot. It's nice to have it on a cold day. But the chicken cubes in there are extremely dry. Not sure if they have an off day or their pie is always like this. As for the sweet pie (pear something?), it was too sweet to my taste and lack layers of flavor.

Now, onto the service. Most servers there are friendly but one. This is our first time to the restaurant so we don't know the serving style. We went up to one lady and ask if we can have some water. The lady responded with an one word answer "NO!". I have to ask again on how to get water, then the lady pointed at the self service counter with nose up attitude. This two line conversation really ruined my mood. This is by no mean how you should treat your customer. She could have just told me everything is self serve and I can understand and enjoy my pie happily. If the food were god sent and the waitress were not there, I would go visit this place again. Unfortunately, this is not the case and I won't be back.
author: Sharon C.

description:
Been on a pie kick lately so while i was in SF, I found mission pies. It seems like they sell more 'traditional' pies.  (Mind you, I'm used to going to the 'Pie Hole' in LA) I got 2 whole pies (banana cream & apple/rapsberry) and they were $27 each. Both were really good! Banana cream pie wasn't too sweet which I appreciate. The crust on the apple/raspberry was a bit sweet but I'm guessing they're trying to offset the tartness from the fruits but  still delicious. Honestly, I can't tell you which is better because they're both amazing. It's really what you're in the mood for.

YUMMM....I'm a fan! Definitely will be coming back to try their other pies. Damn, I should learn how to bake some pies.....
author: michelle k.

description:
There's something really homey and comforting about pies and Mission Pies embodies that very feeling. Adorable shop located on the street corner with a nice big sign. The interior is very homey with it's wooden floors and tables. You order at the counter located in the back of the store after you're down gawking at their pies.

Hard to say what's really the best, because their pies are all around delicious. I do love their Banana Creme Pie. The crust is flaky, buttery, and rich. The banana creme is light, airy, sweet, and full of banana flavor. I also got to try their cranberry chess pie and that was soooo good. I probably wouldn't have gotten that pie but it was a recommendation from one the workers there, Sergio. He was right, the pie is awesome. The pie is sweet, dense, rich, and buttery topped with sweet/tart cranberries. The two flavors work so well together. But really, I think any pie from them will be a hit. 

I have yet to try their savory pies but those look really good. If you're a fan of pot pies, I have a feeling this place will do it justice. Great for dessert or a meal :) Parking could be difficult since it's the Mission but its only a few blocks from bart!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
This place is very cute. I'm more of a savory person, so I ordered the beef pot pie ($7) and a slice of quiche ($4). Both were very good, and the crusts were fantastic. I want to try everything on their menu!

This is less of a sit-down restaurant, and more of a quick-stop cafe where you get your own water and utensils.
author: Cynthia W.

description:
Anyone who love a splendidly warm pie with a perfect scoop of ice cream HAS to visit Mission Pie. 

The concept of Mission Pie is a cafe, where people can hang out and work. However, what it has over most cafe's is that it offers the perfect dessert that goes along with the mood. Pies work well because they can be enjoyed slowly, pair well with coffee and have the perfect amount of sugar to fuel your spirit. I love stopping by for a quick bite after a meal, meeting up with friends or getting some work done. They have ample seating and a wide selection of pies throughout the day: warmed or room temperature, savory vs. sweet, fruit vs. nut. I have tried almost all of their pies and none of them have disappointed. Their crust have the perfect crispness on the edges and moistness in the inside. I also appreciate that their pies are not muddled by sugar. Just enough sugar to bring out the natural flavors of fruit. 

Overall, a must in SF! My recommendations are the peach and berry pie, mixed berry and apricot frangipane
author: Jenny Z.

description:
I'm not sure if it's because of the holiday and mass quantities had to be made, but both the pies that we bought lacked in taste, texture, crust wasn't flakey, flavorless and just meh. I honestly can care less if they are organic but both of the pies straight sucked.
If you want my real opinion 27$ per pie is a rip off compared to Costco who sells a pie which is 10 inches round for 11$. I understand these peeps that want organic... But seriously my whole family shunned both pies and were pretty big dessert fanatics. 
Next time you want to order here....PASS.
author: Kehaulani K.

description:
4 out of 5 stars??? Seriously? Were you people PAID to write positive comments. 

Horrible pie. Had the pumpkin and apple tonight for Thanksgiving. Our dinner was amazing but unfortunately we bought dessert from mission pie after reading a rave review in Travel and Leisure. The writers must have been crazy...or starving. Lol!
author: Brooke K.

description:
I have been craving a good slice of pie since the husband and I came home from our honeymoon (seriously almost a year ago? Shit) during which we accidentally discovered Pie Bar while in Seattle and I've been looking for local equivalents ever since. 

A bar this place certainly is not, but they make some delicious pies (including a pot pie filled with BOLOGNESE RAGU! Whaaaaaat?!) and I need to come back to try all of the things. 

We shared a slice of banana cream pie, which doesn't look like much on the plate but it was so delicious, creamy, buttery and fresh. Also, they HOOK YOU UP with iced coffee - it is not free but for 2 bucks you get a giant ass glass (the equivalent of a Starbucks venti, practically) in which the ice cubes are ALSO made from coffee so as not to get watery. 

So glad we found this place. I love pie! And I will be back.
author: Aivy C.

description:
Much to my surprise, Mission Pie to me was underwhelming. For some time, I've been meaning to try their pies and finally went in last night for dessert. Perhaps my sojourns in the Midwest have spoiled me, but I still think San Francisco needs a pie shop with more oomph. We all know San Francisco takes its coffee seriously and we know we're "no joke" about local and farm-to-table cuisine, but down-to-earth hearty American staples like an all-around-exclusively-sells-pie pie shop?... I'm still in the search for one.

My boyfriend and I ordered a slice of the banana cream pie and apple pie. Because they are classics, I like to measure a pie shop on the classics and then get into the "creative"/"nouveau cuisine" stuff later. Well, unfortunately, I thought both were (in the words of the 2-star Yelp barometer) "meh." 

The banana cream pie, at its most basic, was just too custardy for my liking. I was hoping for an airer filling with large chunks of fresh banana and dollops of whipped cream. I was expecting the words "refreshing!" to jump out of my mouth with verve. This felt and tasted more like banana-flavored vanilla jello. Moreover, there were only a few slices of banana which - to me - is the central component of a classic banana cream pie. For the apple pie, I ordered it with whipped cream (which is complimentary). Since they posted a big sign that says, "it's apple pie season," I was more than compelled to taste it. And again, much to my surprise, I was slightly disappointed. The apple pie filling needed more spices and the apples themselves seemed a bit over-baked. It wasn't that hearty, warm, gives-you-all-the-feels apple pie you expect. It wasn't homey and on the other extreme, it wasn't luxurious either. Sadly, the apple pie was quite generic and almost like an apple pie you'd get from Marie Callender's (which actually might've been slightly tastier based on this pie experience). Lastly, the crust on both pies was also un-memorable. It wasn't golden or rich (and frankly, buttery) enough. When you bite into a slice of pie, you need to get a little bit of filling, topping, and crust... and the boring crust almost marred the other flavors because it was so bland. 

The pie shop itself is quaint. The wooden tables and chairs, accoutrement, and "country" feel attempt to evoke true-blue Americana in the middle of a cosmopolitan metropolis like San Francisco. It's a good place to meet a friend, go on a date, or take family to when they're in town.

Trust me. I don't like writing less than glowing reviews for a place --- especially a pie shop! But there are definitely better pies elsewhere. In the case of San Francisco, I hope another pie aficionado out there decides to enter the "pie market." There are some vendors in the city who bake delicious pies, but don't have a store. We need more Hoosier Mama (Chicago), Bang Bang (Chicago), Pie Hole (LA) and 4 & 20 Blackbirds (NYC) pie shop types out here! Sigh. Sadly, Mission Pies wasn't doing it for me. And like always, I will give this place another try down the road, but for now, I think I'll make my own pies at home.
author: James Z.

description:
Bruh. This place is hipster^2.

Had the quiche. Good and flavorful. Got two, ate one.

Unlike starbucks where people bring their computers to use, bruh this place is the place where people bring their typewriters.

Will come back, but only if I was with a group and the group wanted to go.
author: Jeff H.

description:
I'm not even a fan of banana cream pie, but this slice changed my mind - it was UNREAL. Tasted like a mixture of custard, whipped cream and bananas - mmmm can't wait to go back! 

Other notable mentions: 
+Pumpkin pie - get it a la mode if you're dining in. The vanilla ice cream is so smooth and perfect with the pie warmed up. 
+Crumble on the pear raspberry pie - delicious and sweet granola filled crumble

Notes/Tips:
+$28/pie, $4.50/slice
+Get a bunch of different slices because they have so many amazing flavors
+Good seating inside to enjoy your pie  

Definitely worth a visit!
author: Anu P.

description:
This place is really cute.

I'd read about it and after a dentist appt (uhhh ironic perhaps?) and before dinner, I somehow found myself here... ordering some pie... even though I had a dinner reservation in an hour. BUT I WAS HUNGRY and Mission Pie beckoned.

Or rather the peach blackberry pie did. But I saved it for the date because I'm already being a B by eating right before dinner.. and got the apricot frangipane tart. Preferred the peach blackberry pie -- the tart was too sweet for my taste. Next time, banana cream pie!
author: Vivian H.

description: A friend & I are regulars here. The service is consistently solid, but let's get to the good part- I haven't explored their menu much, but what I like is a slice of quiche & an iced coffee with coffee ice cubes... The coffee is smooth, never bitter, always full of flavor & that quiche- a rich egg cloud that melts in your mouth.
author: Jeff G.

description: Ironically, the best tasting item here were the fresh-off-the-vine delicious blackberries that they sell by the pint, at a good price. The banana cream pie, though a bit runny in texture, was fantastic tasting. Berry and apple pies also great. The chicken pot pie though needed double the filling (and was very watery/runny and very bland -- not nearly as good as Bi-rite or Whole Foods ck pot pie. Also there's always some kind of admin/logistics snafus when we stop by for take-out -- 4/4 of the last times we've been -- either the person packaging up our order gets 1-2 of the items wrong -- like subbing a piece of peach pie for the requested apple -- or in the last case, not tying the strings around the boxes correctly and thus resulting in the string coming loose and our boxes of pie falling onto the not very clean Mission sidewalk after we'd walked two blocks away... Recommend their using an electronic order system that projects items order on an ipad screen overhead, and just saving time and twine by using paper recyclable bags instead of string around boxes. Though I'm guessing most peeps coming here just get a slice or two to eat there, vs. trying to bring home pie for the entire family...
author: Kate A.

description:
I could cry tears of happiness when I think about Mission Pie.

It was a cold and chilly Friday afternoon and since Mission Pie was conveniently located next to where we ate dinner, I straight up told my boyfriend that if we didn't have dessert at Mission Pie, I would forever be mad at him! After scarfing down my burrito, I power walked to Mission Pie, walked straight to the counter without hesitation, browsed the menu and delicious pies in the display case, and ordered a slice of banana creme pie with vanilla ice cream while my boyfriend ordered a blueberry pear pie with vanilla ice cream. Since the place was extremely crowded, the friendly employee told us that she would put our pies in takeout containers in case we weren't able to get a a seat. Fortunately, some seats were free and we were able to enjoy our pies! 

The banana creme and blueberry pear pies were so delicious they had my eyes rolling in all different angles! Not only were the ingredients fresh and delicious, but they perfectly complemented the crispy and flaky crust. I think my boyfriend was ready to surrender his pie after I sneakily ate more than half of his and hovering over mine so he wouldn't be able to sneak a bite! Everything about Mission Pie impressed me; from the decor (they have flowers for sale, how cute!), to the service, to the cleanliness of the establishment, to the products.. I loved every single thing about Mission Pie and I will definitely be back!
author: Joyce E.

description: I was itchin for a piece of pie and heard this place is good. Upon walking in I immediately loved the vibe of the shop. I decided to get the Lemon Shaker, my friend got the apple pear, and another friend got the chocolate cream. I'll start with the crust, it was phenomenal. Just the right amount of flakiness and sweetness. My friends loved their fruit slices, but I can't say I was the biggest fan of the Lemon. Maybe it's just me but I wasn't keen on the amount of zest that was in the Lemon Shaker Pie, it made it very bitter. But maybe that's just the way Lemon Shaker Pie is supposed to be and it's just not my cup of tea. When they offer you the homemade whipped cream make sure to get it, it's super tasty and fresh. The only suggestion I have for them is to warm up their slices of pie (such as the Apple) that would innately taste better warm. I'll be returning to try another flavor here, or perhaps even go for some of their savory items that looked delicious!
author: Carly H.

description:
I used to love this place. I live five minutes away, and would come here often. I love the idea of supporting local businesses, and I appreciate their business model. I know that like many businesses in the area that have tried to stay afloat in this era of gentrification in the Mission, they had to raise their prices. However, my friends and I were shocked that pies that once sold for $22 are now $27. The woman who works there said it was due to a raise in rent. I'm not surprised, but I was surprised with the automatic tipping screen that popped up on the tablet when I paid. In total, the pie was about $31. 

For those of you who have just moved into the neighborhood in the last 2 years, you may not think that $5-6 is a big deal, but that's because you just moved into the neighborhood, and you have no idea what it used to be like. This increase in price is indicative of a larger movement toward catering to a population of rich, privileged people who think that this neighborhood came into existence when they moved here. Anyway, I don't think I'll be buying from here anymore, especially because the place has lost its flavor and grassroots feel (i.e. you walk in and all you see are the same homogeneous group of techies now).
author: Lisa P.

description: Love the warm cozy vibe here. I try to go to lunch here when I visit the Mission. They usually have a couple of hot stews with or without meat. Without meat is always tasty and they serve it with a green and brown rice. Healthy, not salty and very filling. Their deserts are pretty good too. You taste the fruit in the dessert without getting hit over the head with a 2lb bag of sugar. Staff is friendly and welcoming.
author: Liz J.

description:
Never met a mission pie I didn't like. One of my favorite places in the City. Love the savory (pot pies) and sweet (berry pies with ice cream). Nice airy space that's been recently renovated. Straus ice cream for a la mode pies. 

Classic place. Must go (I always stop by when in this part of the Mission).
author: Semuteh F.

description:
Would not go there again because of the poor pies and even worse hospitality. I lived a few blocks away and went here only to try it out a few times. My grandma was a prolific pie maker and none of their pies stood up to the expectations I had. 

I went back a little while ago with my boyfriend and, after asking if we could also eat the food we had gotten to-go elsewhere. The cashier was more than happy to let us have it there as well as a couple of slices, but then she asked where it was from. When she heard it was BBQ from Oakland, she turned up her nose, basically, and said that we should be careful there, Oakland's not a good city. 

The mission used to be cultural and diverse but is now full of people like this cashier that use the pretense of fear to mask their blatant racism. Maybe I'm reaching, but when we went there I definitely felt like I should be careful there, lest they think poorly of me for frequenting other, less white, establishments.
author: Alexzandra E.

description: I had a piece of the Walnut Pie.  Darling shop.  But my small slice of pie was just so-so & did not taste like it was freshly baked, a bit stale.  Will definitely give it another try.
author: Chris H.

description:
I like the stew option, I'm gluten free and what they offer is usually yummy.
Only 3 stars though because the few times I've gone, I got hungry pretty soon after.
In my opinion the portion is too small.
Nearly $10, for a little bowl, no thanks.
author: M A.

description:
Sometimes I crave Cherry Pie and a hot cup of coffee. I usually settle for Strawberry-Rhubarb. Though it's different, it still offers the tart to sweet ratio I'm looking for. Either way, Mission Pie satisfies.

One morning, my daddio dropped by my house before work to take me to Bart and took me to Mission Pie for some coffee and a pastry. 

Commence waiting 10 minutes for an Americano. If you've ever worked in a coffee house / restaurant of any kind, you know it doesn't take that long to pull a long shot and add water. 45 seconds? 1 minute tops? The espresso machine is in plain sight, so I saw that the barista was filling cups and wiping down the counter. Maybe she forgot, but it was kind of silly how long we waited. 

Not a huge deterrent from returning for me though, as it's convenient and, cravings strike often.
author: Crystal C.

description:
I. Love. Pie.
These folks make some damn tasty pie.
Service with a big fat smile.
Seating is a little wonky, but after that first forkfull of goodness, who cares.
I always leave happy and satisfied.
Last visit Raspberry Chess and Banananananana Cream were delicious.
Go get you some.
author: Socket W.

description: I love this place. Always enjoy the amazing, fresh food and great customer service. My only complaint is that I have been given the wrong order now for the 5th time in a row. I probably come here at least once a month and have been coming for over two years. I still enjoy this place, but am frustrated enough by receiving the wrong items repeatedly to leave this review. Every time I order food to go, at least one of my items is incorrect. It's usually the same person putting together the food orders but not really sure how this happens so frequently. Just make sure to check your to go orders before driving home! Sucks to get home and be excited for something you paid for and then not have it. But still worth a try!
author: Amelia S.

description:
So glad I accidentally stumbled upon this place. We went to the Mission for some bomb burritos and walking towards the taqueria passed by Mission Pie. I looked in and instantly fell in love. 

This place is just too, too cute. Staff, VERY friendly, fresh flowers all around, cool vibe with the best slice of walnut pie and cup of almond milk latte. I wish I had more time cause I could have stayed there for hours!! Def coming back!!
author: R P.

description: Pie isn't usually my choice dessert but the banana cream pie here is on point. I think it's the crust I loved so much! I gave 4 stars because the location is 100% sketchy ...so don't go alone..and maybe don't go at night
author: Janell S.

description:
It's pie, and pie is always delicious.  It's also San Francisco, so inevitably food will be on the pricier side - a slice of pie is least $4.  I thought the pie was decent, but not worth the price. 

Tip #1: The sweet pies use a savory crust (it tastes like something you would find on a chicken pot pie, not a banana cream pie), which I wasn't a fan of. 

Tip #2: Sometimes they have an open mike night, which is fantastic!  Just be aware that seating will be limited on event days. 

Overall: The pie wasn't enough to balance out my wallet.
author: Sarah W.

description: We ordered Mission Pies for our wedding and it was a delicious hit! Thank you for providing the tasting to us and for being so easy to work with.
author: Linda O.

description:
Chicken Pot Pie had a delicious flavor but it wasn't very stuffed with actual chicken and more so large chucks of vegetables. There was actually hot air space between the crust and the filling. It was very liquidy at the bottom.  I finished the whole thing but was a little underwhelmed for $9
I will go back and update my review for I have hopes for this place.
Cute atmosphere and very friendly, efficient staff.
author: John W.

description:
Mission Pie is a friendly, neighborhood, green-certified pie shop.  The kind of shop you might only find in The Mission.  It is always crowded with folks eager to enjoy the baked goods, pie and coffee.  Sometimes, I take my company's bus service to The Mission for a weeknight business dinner and the stop is only a block over from Mission Pie; I always stop here for a bit of caffeine before heading to dinner.

My wife and son love Mission Pie for the pies.  They often vote to skip dessert so that we can stop at Mission Pie on the drive home.  My wife is a huge fan of the vegan pies and my 12 yr old son loves the banana cream.

The place is kind of small and seating can be a challenge but if you are in the mood for pie, definitely give this place a shot.
author: Lance W.

description:
AMAZING chicken pot pie. Seriously, this is the best chicken pot pie I have ever eaten. The only thing that would make it better is if the crust were not just on top, but also along the edges of the pie tin too. The filling is chock full of quality ingredients, with carrots, celery, large chunks of potato and chicken, and just enough creamy filling to be satisfying. I like the fact that nothing is too salty either. My sister and I split the pot pie as an early dinner, and it was filling enough for the two of us. I will definitely be back for more chicken pot pie. I also think it's better to eat in than take it home to heat up, but that's an option too. 

I also had the pleasure of trying the apple blueberry pie, which was amazing! And I took a slice of banana cream pie home and was not disappointed, even after it sat in my fridge for a few days. Light, airy, and not too sweet, with chunks of banana, this was a star.

Yum, Mission Pie, I will be dreaming about you until I return again!
author: Leslie H.

description: This is my favorite restaurant in the Mission.  I feel a little lame going into a pie restaurant and ordering salad but the salads here are amazing and they change all the time. The soups and stews are also healthy and delicious.
author: Lukas B.

description:
Banana cream pie = me closing my eyes and savoring every bit because this.is.so.good.

Cute cafe/pie shop on the corner - indoor seating fills up fast but they have a neat communal table that usually has a spot or two available. This place isn't ideal for a large group catch up - but perfect for that 1-1 catch up or just a solo date with yourself!

Coffee is self serve and pretty good - but I honestly come here for that slice of banana cream pie. Lo mejor!
author: Carina M.

description:
It's a wonderful day for pie! *CUE TO THAT DISNEY RENDITION OF THAT ONE FAMILY GUY EPISODE* 

It's unfortunate, but it's true. For whatever reason, hipsters make the best baked goods around. Throw some of that hipster sorcery into a pie and you've got pure, unadulterated MAGIC. 

The second I saw that ornate emblematic pattern on the wall, I knew that I had strolled into a place that seemingly did not fit in with the rest of the mission. Whatever the case, I had a hankering sweet tooth that would not just let me be, and I just had to indulge in a slice of pie or two. Their selection of pies made me want to cry out tears of sugary goodness; from blackberry to apricot, from banana cream to peach, my body wasn't ready. I ended up ordering a blackberry chess pie and a blackberry peach pie. 

The blackberry chess pie was a delicious combination of tart blackberries and a custard, buttermilk pie. One of the few pies I wouldn't recommend with ice cream, due to the already perfect balance of the fruit and the custard. 

The blackberry peach pie on the other hand, be sure to order that with their organic vanilla bean ice cream. The peach slices were oh so gooey and sweet, which was perfectly complimented by the refreshing black berries.

Both crusts were on point and superb. 

I really wished I lived closer by.

So then I wouldn't have to cry. 

...sigh.
author: Kero D.

description:
What a cute place bursting with charming personality -- from the fact that they specialize in one thing, Pie! to the cute little flowers, fresh fruit for sale on the side.  

We got banana cream, peach and blackberry and walnut tarts.  All delicious.  

Wish we had more places like this spread around the city.
author: Candice B.

description:
Miss Bad Idea Bear says I hate this place, and though hate is a strong word, I dislike their pies all the same.

We've tried their apple pie, which to me tastes like it's from Smart and Final or Lucky's or some other cheap bakery. 

There's nothing editing about their crust, in fact I found the crust to be hard and the apples needed more cooking time, because they tasted rather raw to me.

And don't get me started on their banana cream pie. It tastes like a cheap version of banana jello in a pie crust.

Want to try a really good banana cream pie? Then go to Heidi's Pies in San Mateo, try that banana cream pie and tell me if Mission Pie is better.

I'm giving this place 3 stars because they have okay coffee and because I really want to support local businesses.

I just won't support their pies.
author: Jack R.

description:
I just ate an entire bowl of spicy pork and tofu stew with grains and veggies. Then I chowed down on a slice of pear raspberry pie, occasionally interrupting the experience with my super awkward posing for Instagram shots. Now behold, what's in front of me: A second slice of pie, this time apple and DECEIVINGLY in a to-go box because slap me if I don't eat this right now, 20 minutes before the restaurant closes, all evidence of my dinner and first pie slice smack dab in front of me.

I believe the saying goes... IDGAF. This sh*t rocks my world because Mission Pie's pies makes me feel like a queen. I was literally drooling onto the counter as I was ordering; I was that hungry and that excited. The pie is enough to make me pray for extra weight gain because it's that daaaaamn good. The pear raspberry pie made me go, "Ohhhh," aloud to no one other than my chubby, happy, hungry self. Eat it. This apple is gonna go the same way, devoured without mercy. I'm digging in right now. RIGHT THIS SECOND.
author: Eunice C.

description:
1, 2, 3... it's easy as P-I-E.

Oh boy! I've been missing out on some delicious pie. The menu is short and sweet yet I still had a hard time deciding on a slice of pie I wanted to munch on. There were the standards: apple, pumpkin, and banana cream pie but I'm such a "let's try something new/different!" snob.

Soooo I settled for a slice of pear raspberry pie ($4) with a scoop of Strauss Family vanilla bean ice cream (+1.50). Okay... I don't know about you but the pie crust was some of the best I've ever had. The pears were soft and definitely not something out of a can. And oh man, the vanilla bean ice cream was soooo creamy! Definitely amped up the whole pie-eating experience for me.

The coffee was good, too. My friend told me that the refills used to be free but in recent months, Mission Pie started charging $1.50 per refill :(
author: Annie S.

description:
Pie!  So many pies:  I can't make my mind which one I should buy . . . Doh!

You want free coffee?  Go wash dishes, then you can have a free cup of coffee!  Lol!
author: Shirley M. J.

description:
Mission Pie! Since my friends and I were having dinner at a Japanese restaurant a couple of blocks away and we weren't seated until 9PM, we were concerned that we wouldn't make it to Mission Pie before its 10PM closing time. Thus, I was sent on a pie mission to Mission Pie! ;D (I went to buy some pie to-go to bring back to the restaurant after we ordered dinner and were waiting for our food.)

Mission Pie seemed like a super cozy place with a great, relaxing atmosphere. Plus, the fresh baked goods smell the minute you walk through the door is incredibly welcoming. I would have liked to try some of their savory pies as well, but this time, it was just dessert. I got a slice of walnut pie and the mini strawberry pie for myself.

The walnut pie was delicious (similar to pecan pie, but with walnuts), and I especially liked the flaky crust. The strawberry pie was phenomenal as well, and was bigger than I was expecting for a mini pie. 

I hope I get a chance to try more pies when I'm back in SF! After all, it's right by the BART station! =)
author: Jeff Y.

description:
I've got the best pumpkin pie ever. It was so tasty and real pumpkin taste, not so sweet and it was just right amount of everything.
I like the store as well, next time I'll try a cup of coffee and eat there.
I tried a slice d of Shaker Lemon too (if i remembered the name correctly), it was a bit bitter because of the peal, but it was tasty as well.
author: Phuong P.

description: Sweet or savory, I asked myself...ordered the potato tart, which was like a scalloped-potato pie...layer upon layer of thin-sliced potatoes creamily ensconced in pie format.  Did I talk with my mouth full?  Yes.  My companion had the strawberry rhubarb pie, photo attached.  No complaints from her side of the table.  Next I checked, that slice was gone.  Neither of us offered the other a bite.
author: Lydia B.

description: Great selection of delicious pies made with noticeable honest ingredients. A little bit expensive for just pies, but they also have decent light healthy lunch options that justify a full lunchtime option. Have tried 5-7 different pies so far, and not one bad pie yet. Crust is a strength, not an after thought like many other pie places.
author: Mikey L.

description:
Can I say I have a pie addiction? More specific a apple pie?

If your ever in the mission, even if your not, must make it part of your bucket list to try their apple pie, I promise it won't disappoint.

Thin with a slight touch of softness and a hint of sugar sprinkles is how I can describe the crust. Just amazing! And the apple filings is nice and tart
author: cristina s.

description:
This is a solid place: good, quality food, respect for the ingredients and the customers, low-key atmosphere, and something for everyone - meat eaters, vegetarians, and even gluten-free eaters can all find something here.

I'm more of a SAVORY guy, so I came here in search of egg-y items for breakfast, and was not disappointed.  I had a nice slice of quiche (very fluffy) and two "breakfast pockets" (essentially an empanada made with their flaky pie crust as opposed to a more traditional dough) with bacon, egg, and cheese.  Everything was good, although I kind of wish the slice of quiche was a little bigger, and the breakfast pockets were dominated by the flaky crust; I could've used more filling.  Still, everything tasted very good and you could tell that they were using quality ingredients.

THE BIG SURPRISE came in the form of the side dish I ordered.  I did not expect a cold brown rice salad to be the hit of the meal, but it was!  Brown rice, mixed in a dressing with golden beets, walnuts, broccoli, "pinquito" beans (I guess mini pinto beans) and a little bit of mushroom.  Somehow all these ingredients came together in a wonderful, healthy, vegan protein that really hit the spot.  $5 for a whole bowl, $2.50 for a half bowl / side order.  TOTALLY worth it.  

I definitely want to come back and try their $8.50 dinner deal:  Stew with a side of grains (rice, quinoa, etc.) and veggies.  I haven't tried it yet, but based on what I tasted today, I suspect it's going to be a hit.
author: FoodDudeS F.

description: What a gem to find a dedicated Pie restaurant! It's a bit on the smaller size and would consider this more of a cafe to eat pies and hang out. Limited table and chairs and it gets packed with a line almost out the door. The one thing I have to say is that they got their pie crusts down to a science. Golden, flaky, almost too good to be true. I opted for the apple pie slice, the apple turnover, and the mini chicken pot pie. All of them were excellent. I actually prefer the apple turnover over the apple pie slice because the filling was much tastier (imho). I dinged them one star not because of their pies, but because it gets so busy there's not enough seating to enjoy your pie purchases! Why make a pie when you can just drive down to Mission pies to satiate your pie cravings!
author: Ny H.

description:
Oh Mission Pie. Since I've been working near the Mission there's soooo many places to try. Got to try Mission Pie! The 2 times I've been there, once around 4:30pm then another time 1:30pm both times were busy and loud. 

Good selection of pies n stuff.  Almost $5 for a slice of pie .  It may be a lot of hype, but got to try it at least once. I'll probably be back to try the other flavors.
author: Chris P.

description:
I'll admit: I'm not a big fan of pie. 
I'll also admit: I might be back for the banana cream pie

It was sweet but perfectly balanced. Definitely well done.
author: Jane N.

description:
Came here for book club and it was lovely! It's a small spot and I was able to find parking right away. I was actually quite surprised at the latter part...I may have just been lucky that day.

Finding seating can be difficult as it's a small place. Note that this is cash only!

Now let's get this straight: I hate bananas. No...it's more like I'm phobic of bananas. However, my coworker, who also hates bananas, swears by this banana cream pie. I was like, "Wut? Dude, I thought we HATED BANANAS TOGETHER," and he was like, "I know, I know, but trust me...and here. Here is a whole dollar toward getting a slice of banana cream pie for the table."

He gives me a dollar. Dammit, I will not let my pride and fear of bananas get in the way of my enjoyment of life. So at first I order a savory quiche because I realize I hadn't had dinner yet and book club was happening SO SOON, and I also ordered tea. I was pleasantly surprised at their tea selection. When a place thinks tea is important enough to carry not just a single brand of loose leaf tea, I trust them. +10 points to Gryffin -- Mission Pie!

The quiche was pretty amazing. I'm no quiche expert, but I have an allergy to eggs that are not all the way cooked. These are cooked perfectly. Not dry, not rubbery...it's as if the egg was on the cusp of being too cooked. Wow. Such quiche.

Also, the walnut pie was amazing. That's the one I got for myself.

And the thrilling conclusion to the banana cream pie? I bought one and took it home for the boyfriend, who enjoys banana cream pie. He said it was quite good (though his father makes a better one) and so I tried it.

It was delicious.

I may no longer be *that* phobic of bananas anymore if they can taste that delicious. So thank you, Mission Pie, for allowing me to enjoy a food I've been avoiding my whole life.

Things to do next: Pi^2, or, Pi and Mission Pie.
author: Robbin A.

description:
