it's impossible to walk buy without going in. We enjoyed a slice of Dutch apple pie, perfectly textured with a slightly burnt crust and crumble streusel topping. Also bought a coconut macaroon for $1; chewy, slight mini chocolate chips. What a delight.

It's very cool that this place also has vegan offerings including pre made dough to take home, vegan Shepherd's pie, a pear raspberry pie, and blueberry or carrot muffins ($2). I would have preferred a less homey ambience because all the kids running around made it really hard for me to talk to my husband, much less view the counter without tripping over a very adorable child!
author: Debora L.

description:
Delicious pie !! I got banana cream pie and raspberry pie for a party and they loved it ! Definitely recommend.

I came here for pie since my boyfriend loves the banana cream pie that his mother makes so rather than employing his mother to make his birthday pie, I decided to order from here. I ordered 2 pies for $22 each, which may seem a little steep but the pies were actually quite large. The party that I tried to feed were all hungry tennis players, so I really needed to get more than an average amount of food. I took the Bart here on 24th and walked a block. I served the pie as dessert for dinner and they all loved it, including my boyfriend. Although, it's only second to his mothers, this says a lot. I will definitely return.
author: Lyra C.

description:
Like Chicken Little, I started freaking out when something hit me out of nowhere, or in this case, Mission Pie fell onto my radar when a friend posted an Instagram picture boldly saying she found Banana Cream Pie that's better than Nation's. 

And you know what the real weird part is, I DON'T EVEN LIKE BANANA CREAM PIE. Alright let's take a step back, I tried this kind of pie for the first time a week before I began this pie craving habit, and had a bite of banana cream pie from my bf. We bought it at Nation's, I tried a bite and though, hmm not bad (and this is coming from someone who irks at the thought of whipped cream). I visit Mission Pie's page and instantly craved their pies, more specifically their fruit pies, pot pies, everything but cream pies! 

I finally convinced my bf to come here with me on Labor Day as part of our Mondate. I bought a slice of raspberry peach pie and he got banana cream pie. Each was roughly $4 and slightly smaller than Nation's, in case you were wondering. However, when it comes down to taste, hands down Mission Pie gets it. The crust was buttery and crispy and well balanced by the tartness of the fruits. His banana cream pie was also delicious!
author: Connie C.

description: Im sad it took me so long to discover MP's products. I was at a place that happened to serve their banana cream pie. Nice flaky crust, tons of banana and fresh whip cream. Not too sweet, well balanced. I could probably eat a half of one in a sitting. Now that I know they exist Im going to have to hit them up for a few varieties.
author: Kim N.

description: Visited with a friend and it was definitely worth it. Friend had ordered the apple pie (warmed up) with vanilla ice cream, I chose the banana cream pie and we shared the ricotta asparagus quiche. I definitely have to say that the banana cream pie was my favorite. The banana custard and the cream just melt in your mouth and it's a heavenly delight! Would definitely make the trek to the mission again if I'm in the mood for pie.
author: Nadine C.

description: This place is really good.  I tried their vegan pie and it was delicious.  Coffee is great too.  I hope the next time I'm in the area I'll try one of their savory dishes, since they all looked good.
author: a f.

description:
You know you have a quality friend when they want to grab a drink with you in the Mission the one night they're in town, you suggest several great bars and throw Mission Pie in the mix just for kicks, and they choose Mission Pie b/c it's "clearly the right pick". =)

At $3.50 a slice, it's a great deal.. come with a group so you can pig out like we did and try a variety:

* Pear Frangipane - 3.5 stars
photo: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mission-pie-san-francisco?select=Jz7jgSaw6sDIRqFncvqkRg#Jz7jgSaw6sDIRqFncvqkRg
Not as exotic or pear-y as I'd hoped, but still a good tart! I tend to like my fruit pies/tarts more overcooked, where you can barely detect where one slice ends and the next one starts. This one wasn't quite there with the fruit still holding a little bit of crunch, but that's just personal preference. I also found it was a bit too sweet/syrup-y, a little overglazed on top as well.

* Pumpkin Pie - 4 stars
photo: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mission-pie-san-francisco?select=Jz7jgSaw6sDIRqFncvqkRg#NuPt-syJwxvGKDcILgS3bw
NICE. Nice, nice nice. Really natural flavors - we even detected Chai, or something close to it! My only small complaint was the crust was a little hard.

* Banana Cream - 4 stars
Nice as always - love the fresh slices of banana, and their cream is fantastic (I always ask for it on the side with all slices of sweet pie we get - it has this fluffy yet creamy/dense consistency, and is't overly sweet).

* Split Pea Quiche w/ Goat Cheese - 4.5 stars
photo: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mission-pie-san-francisco?select=Jz7jgSaw6sDIRqFncvqkRg#n6z2dWYXrpNmNxzOl3cqmQ
Now this was the big surprise of the night! Being as I have a major sweet tooth, I never even considered getting a savory pie here (considering it a "waste" of my stomach space), but my friend opted for this and I REALLY liked it! The consistency was incredibly smooth and soft and it had a fantastic subtle savory flavor. Plus, the crust on this one was more flaky and buttery (especially compared to the pumpkin pie). I'll definitely get another savory pie next time I'm here.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
I was expecting something super delicious but when I bit into my banana cream pie, it fell short of my expectations. 

The banana cream pie was just Ok. It reminded me of something from Marie Callendar's but healthier-tasting. The crust wasn't flakey but it was hard, crunchy and tasted flavorless.
The raspberry pear pie was a mini pie with giant slices of pear in them.  I didn't think it was anything special. I didn't like the crust too much on this one either.

I guess I'm not really a fan of these healthier fresher versions of yummy pies.
author: Heejin L.

description:
Can this place be any better?

They sell the most delicious pies in SF. They have actual food (daily menu) that is healthy and affordable. They have cheap good coffee. They have a great location. The staff is friendly.

And yesterday I just discovered they are kid friendly too. OMG. They have a kids table with toys. High chair. Changing table! 

I have been here so many times but never truly appreciated it until now how good they are and hence this review. 

First about the pie --- my favorite flavors are banana cream and mixed berry. The only one flavor I never liked is Meyer lemons because I thought they would be tart but they are not.

Then yesterday I went in for lunch. The staff was uber patient as he let me sample both stews and picked the sausage beans. It came in a bowl with delicious brown rice and kale. My kid and I devoured it along with a broccoli cheese quiche. 

The ambience is just right. People who go there sometimes just pick up a pie and leave. Some stay and chat. There's no real pressure to leave as soon as you are done unless there are people waiting for empty seating (which only happens in evening). Rarely is there a line and even so it moves fast. 

I'm so happy this place is close to me. It is on Valencia in the mission but towards the end of it so parking is actually possible if you are brave enough to drive there even on weekends.
author: Elizabeth T.

description: So delicious. Had the classic chicken pot pie & the Dal supper. Wanna come back for more!
author: Bruce L.

description: Mission Pie makes the best banana cream pie!  It's a great place to hang out and grab a bite.  Whether you want breakfast (e,g,m cereal, muffins, scones, pastries), lunch (e.g., pot pies, quiches), or dessert (e.g., fruit pies), this is the place to go when you're in the hood.  Feel free to order anything to go!
author: Jenny L.

description: I got a peach blackberry pie and it was delicious! the pie wasn't too sweet, but still tasty. The crumble on top kind of reminded me like how an oatmeal raisin cookie would taste on top of a pie. The whip cream we got on the side was good and not too sweet as well. overall the pie was light and very satisfying.
author: Amanda B.

description:
This place was good, but not out-of-this-world amazing.

My fiancé and I shared a chicken pot pie, followed by a slice of apple pie.  We liked the fact the pot pie wasn't too creamy, and the apple pie's flaky crust was tasty.  The drip coffee was so-so.

The service was friendly.

No wow factor - but a solid spot, for sure.
author: Barnali D.

description: The banana cream really does justice to its name! The perfect balance of banana and cream placed with the right proportion plus the exact light sweetness that it needs to bring everything together! Love it! And will definitely come back for mooooore!
author: Yany W.

description: Pretty good pie. I like their banana cream the best.
author: Kelly D.

description:
Mission Pie sells salads,  pies, sweet &  savory,  pot pies, and other baked goods. kind of pricey and skeptical so went for an unorthodox choice.

eats: quiche (mushroom), slice (4)
-so good, mushroom tasted sweet
-lots of eggs mixed with other stuff
-everything tasted fresh.
-crust homemade
-pie warmed up too...fab service.

-crumbs:
definitely a place for dessert
coffee: taylor maid farms-fab stuff
-maybe the fruit pies not so great....
author: Victor G.

description: Scrumptious, finger licking deliciousness pie. From chicken pot pie to the banana cream to the raspberry pear never disappoints. My pic and I love coming here late night and grabbing a slice and people watching. Defiantly my favorite pie in the city!!!
author: Amber S.

description: Took a carryout after dinner along with a small coffee.  Place was busy at 9pm with about 6 different variety of pie.  Walnut similar to pecan back in Texas.  Had the banana cream.  The wife had the Raspberry Chess.  Not the quality of House of Pies in Houston but made the acceptable grade.
author: Robert B.

description:
Such a great business! They're a great addition to the Mission district without too much negative gentrification - what do I mean by this? I mean you have new-wave Mission hipsters, techies, and REAL locals and their families coming in for pie.

Pie unites everyone.

I'm totally serious.

That banana cream pie is to die for, and the last few bites consist of me licking my plate. The pear and blueberry pie is pretty awesome too - always a great crust on every pie! Decent portions, excellent complimentary whipped cream on top if you'd like, and friendly, approachable service at the counter.

Refillable coffee, and a discount if you bring in your own mug. Great vibes from this place!
author: Colleen M.

description:
I'm craving for something sweet when I was walking in mission district, found this place and it is good, though the pie size is small (for my likeness) lol. But, I like the atmosphere and everyone seems so friendly. 
I try Dutch Apple pie, It's just okay, definetely come back to try other pies.
author: Gabriella S.

description: Avoid the yellow curry and chicken stew. Tasted and looked like they were made in Britain during WW2 (I'm British and studied history so I'm actually serious). Delicious lemonade though!
author: Rodrigo D.

description: Got their banana cream and pumpkin pie. Both were just okay so they were nothing special.  Banana cream pie was sloppy and it didn't hold its shape.  Pumpkin pie had black beads of spices in it; not sure what they were.
author: Samantha C.

description:
This place...is amazing!  From savory pot pies and quiches, to dessert pies, you literally can't go wrong with anything you choose. 

The chicken pot pie is classic at its best. Flaky, slightly sweet crust. Generous amount of chicken and veggies for the filling. It's filled to the hilt so don't expect a really wet/saucy interior when you break through the crust. 

The walnut tartlet was the perfect size and had the right amount of nuttiness for an afternoon snack. I look forward to trying the Shaker Lemon pie this evening. 

This is a "must" for locals and tourists alike!
author: Gene D.

description: This place blew my expectations away. I've been to pie shops before, and they're all kinda the same. But the atmosphere of San Francisco on a sunny January day with the smell of pies just made it that much better. I started out with a slice of the pear raspberry pie, which had a nice granola crumble topping. The flavor combination was interesting, and definitely not something I would have though of, but it work really well. To follow up, I had a piece of the Lemon pie, which was a perfect compliment of crust and filling. Highly recommend this shop, and it's so easy to get to from the nearby BART station for anyone traveling to get there.
author: Craig H.

description:
Pies!!!

Good and flavorful!!  In and out.  Don't a relaxing stay a hang out ambiance but good for a quick bite (dessert).

Apricot pie : my very first.  Flaky buttery crust tart with tart apricot and sliced almonds.

Strawberry rhubarb was a bit runny but tasty none the less.  Chunks of strawberries and rhubarb.  Flaky crust.

Good pie spot, worth a try.
author: Crystal M.

description:
I went for the apple pie again. I'm an apple pie expert. The apple pie here is excellent. Seriously...this apple pie was better than the last time I tried it. The apple pie crust was outstanding as well - flaky and flavorful.

nom nom nom...apple pie :-)
author: J T.

description: Mission Pie does one thing, and does it great. I sampled a bunch of different pies during Smule Thanksgiving celebrations. Everything I tried was amazing, but I was very fond of the Pumpkin and Banana Cream Pies; I had way too many "one-last-bites" of each pie... AND REGRET NOTHING!
author: Mark C.

description:
Ok, super cute in there!! I'm not a pie person, but I do love cream pies! I was pretty bummed that by 8:30pm (closing at 10) there was no cream pie of any sort left. Didn't bum me out enough to give less than five stars. The coffee was delicious, the environment was delicious, and the staff was equally delicious! 

I had coffee while my counterparts thoroughly enjoyed their pie and ice cream. Next time I'm in town I'll try getting there earlier to try this apparent acclaimed banana cream pie.
author: Jordan B.

description:
i love you mission pie ！
-6 stars for being vegan friendly

they have a variety of pies and pastries to choose from. savory and sweet.
author: Maggie M.

description: I stopped by Mission Pie while I was exploring the Mission this morning. I had two of their pockets and they were both pretty yummy. The pies and other sweet treats looked amazing but I decided to stay away from those for the sake of my waistline. The crust on the pocket was perfect and the whole place has that delicious bakery smell. The two pockets cost me $6.50 ish.
author: Samantha W.

description:
4.5

Mission pie is awesome. They have a great selection of sweet pies as well as savory pies, and are now serving soup from 11 AM - 8 PM. 

Thoughts on Mission Pie:

Food- It's a strange thing to say, but Mission Pie gets better as you eat it. The first time I had it, I thought it was just alright. The more I eat it, the more I crave it- and Mission will continually surprise you. Stop in often because there are seasonal pies that you'll miss if you don't go for a while. Currently, my favorites are the pear raspberry pie (the crumble on top is the best thing ever) and pumpkin pie (reach chunks of sweet pumpkin). The savory pies were just okay. I've heard their coffee is also quite good.

General ambiance- Great place for a catch up or a post-date dessert. Outside seating for those rare sunny SF days.

Service- People are really nice here when it's not busy.

Tips - Get the whipped cream! They make it onsite with organic Strauss milk, it comes complimentary with every pie and is just a tad sweet, so goes well with those tart pies. Once you order the whipped cream, it's important that you check that the whip cream is there if you're taking it togo- they forget to do this a lot.
author: Margaret T.

description: So yummy, I've been wanting to be back since I left! The pies are good, and I don't even like pie, lol. Or maybe it was good because I added ice cream to it...hmm. Either way, I want to come back! I've tried a couple of things here and haven't been disappointed yet! Customer service was good as well, however felt a bit rushed my first time here when it was on the busier side.
author: Rebecca J.

description:
Such a cute pie spot in the heart of the Mission.

My mom and I came here on a sunny Sunday afternoon post-brunch at Universal Cafe (yes, we are fatties like that). I ordered the banana cream pie and my mom ordered the strawberry rhubarb pie. 

The banana cream pie was heavenly - it was creamy with perfectly flaky crust and wasn't overpoweringly banana-ridden. I personally was not a huge fan of the strawberry rhubarb though - a bit too sour for my liking. However, my mom loved it! So if you're not into overly tart-y and sour things, you probably should order another pie. 

We also ordered lattes and loved them. Very well crafted. 

All in all, if you're ever craving some pie, don't hesitate to check out Mission Pie and order the banana cream pie!

Happy Eating, Yelpers!
author: Priya S.

description: Had the wild berry with ice-cream! Wow!!! Absolutely one of my favorite pies I've ever tasted. Everything else looked good, cant wait to return and try a new pie. Highly recommend!
author: Noor S.

description:
Thus far, The BEST Banana Cream Pie I've ever had in The SF Bay Area. Only comes second to my all-time favorite, NYC's The Momofuku Milk Bar Crack Pie. 

So Yummy! You've gotta go and try it! 
Forks up!
author: John M.

description: All around possibly the worst piece of pie I've ever had. From appearance to taste to price, nothing about this dessert was appetizing. Perhaps it was because I came 30 minutes before close, but that shouldn't give reason to a pie looking like vomit (see picture). I got the vegan strawberry rhubarb pie (vegan - first mistake right there, but they had very few options left) and our table unanimously agreed that it resembled the taste of a fruit rollup. While that might bring back some childhood memories and sound appetizing, do not be fooled. The pie was tart, the crust tasted like wet dough, and the side of whip cream might as well have been soup. Should've just spent the $4 on 2 boxes of real fruit rollups.
author: Betty W.

description: ... best Banana Cream pie I've had. Cute shop, happy staff, delicious pie with a thin flaky crust... yum.
author: Josh C.

description:
Banana cream pie with vanilla ice cream - yummy, i couldn't tell what was ice cream, banana, whipped cream, or custard because they all looked sort of the same

Chicken pot pie - okay, i wish the consistency was a bit thicker

Not as great as all the hype I heard. I would probably come back if I was in the area, but not a place I would crave and need to go back to
author: Trang B.

description:
After dinner, my friend and I wanted to grab dessert on the go so we walked over to Mission Pie!

We had pie slices in mind: banana cream! My friend insisted it was the best and I had been curious about it for a long time. We got to the place thirty minutes before closing and was able to order our slices in time.$3.50 each! 

They also had a box of muffins out on the counter and announced that they were free. FREE MUFFINS, WOO! I grabbed one and waited for everyone to get muffins too before grabbing a second one. 

Both muffins were yummy. One was raisin and the other was chocolate chip.

Delicious. I will be back.
author: Sofia R.

description:
Oh my, that walnut pie though! I had the walnut pie (heated up) with a scoop of vanilla ice cream--it was wonderful! It was loaded with walnuts and had great texture and flavor. I also tried their banana cream, which was equally great. It was a banana cream based pie with yummy slices of banana. They have a variety of berry pies and a couple of savory pies as well--I'll have to give those a try next time.

Order your pie, take a seat, and they'll bring your order to you. It's a cute little earthy and rustic bakery with wooden tables and chairs. The staff is friendly and welcoming. I recommend!
author: Lien T.

description: Have stopped by on a few occasions now and had both sweet and savory pies. I have enjoyed a slice at their location and taken my orders to go. I have been happy on each visit and encourage others to give them a try. If you are looking for something special, it is worth the trip.
author: Frank G.

description:
Overrated.

Gave it a try on the recommendation of some friends, its in a great location right by 24th St on Mission. Nations easily beats this place, both on quantity, quality and value.  We got there close-ish to closing time, so I expect the pies weren't fresh and had been sitting out for a little while. 

I went for the banana cream and my friend went for cherry. Mine was pretty unexciting. My friend described his cherry pie as "toothpaste". Not really what you should be for in anything that isn't...toothpaste. 

Slices are of average size, consistency and flavor are generally bland. And this was after I had had a few...which usually lowers my bar for being impressed with food. Yelpers generally seem to like this spot, so maybe my experience was out of the ordinary and I should give it another shot when I'm in the area and in need of dessert. But I won't be going out of my way to return anytime soon.
author: Bud P.

description: Was wondering how could a place survive just by selling pies.  Well this place is a blast.  The crusts were outstanding.  The quiche was particularly good.  The proportion of the egg-water mixture was ounce-perfect.  Sweet pies were not alike those pastries having sugar as the first ingredient found elsewhere.  Decent latte too.  The famous chicken pot pie was out around 3 pm on the day I visited.
author: Hector L.

description:
The scenery is very warm, love the vibes here. Staff members are very friendly! I ordered coconut cream pie and it was amazing, I heard about it but I have never actually tried it. My girlfriend ordered pear raspberry pie and it was good. 
Overall I like this restaurant and will come back again for sure!!
author: Tan D.

description:
T'was a-ok. It didn't blow me away but I did like what I tried. I ordered a slice of the shaker lemon pie which, if you've never had it, is basically lemon peel pie. So it's very tart, and very bitter, but also a little sweet and overall a taste explosion in your mouth. Overall I found the pie to be good but not great. Maybe a little too bitter for my taste. Almost as if there was too much pith in the lemon peel (the white part of the peel that isn't very palatable). The crust didn't really blow me away either but in all honest I rarely go nuts for a pie crust. It's the filling that I'm after. 

I've heard great things about a few of the other slices so I'd definitely go back and give another a try. I went on a Saturday night and it wasn't very crowded but there also wasn't much to choose from. They'd had a busy day, I guess! Hope the next time I come in I catch them with more stock. The banana cream in particular has got my name alllll over it.
author: Annette J.

description:
People rave about Nation's pie.  Yea those are good, but if you want good quality pie, you come here.  Since they make pies according to what's available in the season, you get the best quality of fruits and veggies.  But you can also be limited because if you want peach pie in the winter, sorry buddy.  

This is a clean place and you can hang out and eat your pie.  Tried lots of pies here.
mixed berry pie was yummmy
banana cream pie was delish, wayyy better than Nation's
all their pies are good during summer when I went was good.
Went back in December and while I don't remember what I ate, it was still good!  Make sure you add that whipped cream!  Make sure you have coffee or something to drink with your pie.  Make sure you come here!
author: Claire J.

description:
The unique sign distracted me from my original goal of going to the donut place around the corner. I knew then It was fate that lead me here.

I immediately noticed the array of pies and various other savory treats.

I ordered the apple pie and a cheese/broccoli quiche. Soooo good! I went with the classic Apple, because messing up a classic Apple pie, would be a travesty, therefore deeming this place unworthy of your palette. But good thing this was not the case.

My friend ordered the pear raspberry- a little adventurous for my taste. She assured me it made  her feel like she was dancing on cloud. It quickly melts in your mouth!

The quaint ambiance and 80s music will quickly remind you that you are an adult, and you should go more often to classy places like this.

In conclusion, do something better for yourself and come to this place. :)
author: Blaine J.

description:
I heard much about this place so I thought I'd give it a shot. I tried their mushroom barley soup. It was good in texture but lacked flavor. 

I also had their sheppard's pie, which was the only vegetarian (vegan) pot pie option available. I wish they would have had an actual vegetarian pot pie that used heavy cream in the base of the pot pie filling. It was good, but nothing I'd go crazy over. 

Overall, I give it three stars because it's also expensive for the portion size! The pot pie was $8.50. The soup was small and included a piece of bread for $6.00.
author: Raakin H.

description:
Pie is the best thing in the world. It's like you're tricking your conscience in thinking that you're having healthy fruit for dessert. Let's be real though, pie  is probably bad for you... but it FEELS SO GOOD. I had the pear raspberry pie and the concoction makes me want to move upstairs above the pie shop. I would DEFINITELY be a morning person if I lived near this pie shop!

I've havd a fair amount of pie in my day and I think this pie is pretty awesome! I love the crumble top on pies and it had a very good ratio of crust to filling. I had a slice so I can't apply this piece of information to the personal pies. 

While I was there with my fellow pie-afficinado, a the coffee waitress handed us a cookie on a plate. Before she can finish her offer to give us the cookie, I unpausingly said YES and had a REALLY GOOD raisin cookie. I think they were giving them out  because they were a bit overbaked, but I like crunch cookies! I hope to try more pies in the future!
author: Anh T.

description:
NOTE: This review is solely for the banana cream pie.

I'm not an expert on pies, nor food in general. The most important thing to me is very simple. How does it make me feel after taking the first bite?

My first bite of the banana creme pie was very good, but it wasn't nearly as mind boggling as my first bite of Nation's. The main difference lies in the crust and whipped cream.

Mission's crust was very thin and got completely lost in combination with the banana custard and whipped cream. It didn't taste very buttery and as a result, didn't add much to the pie at all. Nation's crust is buttery and flaky, and was substantial enough to hold its own among everything else.

While I could tell that Mission's whipped cream was freshly whipped, it didn't have the fluffy texture of Nation's, which I feel works better on a banana creme pie. However, this is just me nitpicking. Both whipped creams were exceptional.

As for the banana custard itself, Mission's had a stronger banana taste and less custard-y consistency than Nation's. It was good, I just wish it had more bananas to give a little more bite.

I hope to come back and try some of their other pies, especially the savory pot pies. From the looks of everything else I anticipate giving Mission Pie a higher rating for my second review. The downside is that everything here is expensive ($4 per slice of pie, $24 for most whole pies). But that is expected of any artisan shop, especially in San Francisco.

TLDR -- Banana cream pie was good, but Nation's version is better in my honest opinion.
author: Vincent C.

description: Been here a few times but the pie is just not out of this world. Went for the peach pie on the most recent occasion and the peaches weren't sweet and the crust was not buttery. Too soft. I also ordered my slice a la mode and it took 10 mins to prepare. It was not even lukewarm when it was ready. Very underwhelmed by this place.
author: Jackie T.

description: Excellent fruit pies!  Loved the soft flaky crust and devoured the strawberry rhubarb pie topped with vanilla ice cream.
author: Sharmeela S.

description: Fresh, homemade pie.  What's not to like?  Maybe the prices, but if I don't have to do the work I'll gladly pay someone else to make me dessert!  The pear blueberry was refreshing and delicious.  I just wish they heated up the pie for you!
author: Jennifer M.

description: This place was a lot of fun. Stopped here after our trip in San Fran, but before we went to the airport. Parking was tough, but glad we committed. We had sweet and savory dishes, both very good. The signage and process of ordering was not that intuitive, but they finally called on us (standing looking helpless), and we ordered. Food was great.
author: Corrigan G.

description: The place has the best banana cream pie ever! Just the right amount of creaminess, soft delicious texture and not too sweet, absolutely delicious. I look forward to going again and trying everything else!
author: Ingrid C.

description: Good pies and great place to catch up with friends, family, or acquaintances. Since it's located next to La Taqueria, I would make my way here for dessert.. Honestly everything I've tried was tasty but what pops out the most was the banana cream pie.
author: Neil I.

description: Darling place. Friendly staff. Chicken pot pie was sooo good and the banana cream pie is the best I've ever had. I definitely plan to return here!
author: Sharon I.

description:
There's something really homey and comforting about pies and Mission Pies embodies that very feeling. Adorable shop located on the street corner with a nice big sign. The interior is very homey with it's wooden floors and tables. 

Hard to say what's really the best, because their pies are all around delicious. I do love their Banana Creme Pie. The crust is flaky, buttery, and rich. The banana creme is light, airy, sweet, and full of banana flavor. That's the only pie I remember since I was a little wasted, but really, I think any pie from them will be a hit.
author: Davinci L.

description:
Oh dear lord, the pumpkin pie is so tender, it melts in your mouth. It contains freshly roasted squash and is nothing like the Safeway or Costco pumpkin pies. I might prefer a tangy creme fraiche topping to cut the squash taste instead of the unsweetened whipped cream they offer.

I saw some questionable reviews where people said the pie here wasn't tasty. People may have different tastes, but as a pie aficionado I find that hard to believe. Way better than 3 Babes IMHO (blech, too much granulated sugar).
author: Dennis W.

description:
Stopped by here with my foodie in crime partner as we ate our way through the Mission! 

The star - Banana cream pie! Perfectly flaky, light & crisp pastry filled with perfectly ripened bananas & lovely thick comforting creamy golden filling topped with freshly whipped cream. Can see why they are famous for their Banana Cream pie. It perfected. I never have to eat another one now that I have found the best. 

Also the quiche was suburb! 

4.5 stars. Love to try the fruit pies next.
author: Jessabelle R.

description: Bananas are a sub par fruit. Whipped cream is most of the time unnecessary fluff, but put these two together at Mission Pie and you have unparalleled perfection! The bananas are fresh, the cream isn't some "from the can" cream, it's whipped home made cream that ties the whole pie together. I can't wait for the next pot luck invite!
author: Nathaniel C.

description: Unreal! I love this place! Apple pie with vanilla ice cream? Yes please! I've never had a pie here that disappointed!
author: rosanna b.

description:
Not much of a yelper but these people went out of there way so i can too.
Chicken pot pie was great! Good taste.
But what sets them off is the warmth of the people, this isnt your corporate ran business. 

Lovely people here. Ill come back :)
Thanks for the free apple pie
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Mission Pie is excellent, just excellent. Adorable space with lots of nice touches ("Eat More Pie" travel mugs, anyone? Granola? Pie dough to go?) plus delicious pie. Pie is so simple, so when you get a super complex tasting but totally pleasing piece, it's pretty amazing. 

I've only tried the mixed berry - imagine the perfect mix of berries (do I detect some rhubarb, too?) with tiny bits of caramelized sugar popping in your mouth and a just-right soft but firm crust to support it all. Yeah. Can't wait to try more, I heard the banana cream pie owns the web domain www.bomb.com.
author: Elena K.

description:
If any of you have been to Maui, they have this great pie shop off the highway called Leoda's. Kind of random from the Mission district in SF, but when I got back from my vacation I realized I've never been to a specialty pie shop in the bay. And so began the search for some good Bay Area pie.

When searching on yelp, there were numerous pie shops in SF with great reviews. Lots to choose from but decided to go with this one: Mission Pie. No regrets! Sometimes good yelp reviews and actual experiences don't match up... But that isn't the case here. Here's what we tried

Banana Cream 
Mixed Berry *
Vegan Peach
Lentil and Cauliflower 
Chicken Pot Pie

- My favorite would have to be the mixed berry. If you're looking for a sweet pie, go with this one! The cream that comes on the side really adds to the flavor, texture, and pie experience. I'd get this again and again.

- The banana cream had a great fresh and real banana taste. Not the overly-sweet artificial kind. 

- The peach pie had great texture. I'm no expert, but the crumble-like thing on top was delicious. The crust had a unique taste to it too; almost whole-wheat like. The pie had a good balance of sweet and not too sweet. The sugary crumble on top was the main source of sweetness for the rest of the mellow pie. It was a good pie but not really my type. 

- Lentil and cauliflower was really flavorful! Surprisingly really good and delicious. I'd definitely recommend this to any of my vegetarian friends or even just lentil loving friends! 

- Chicken pot pie is a classic. Can't really go wrong. Love the crust and the ingredients they chose. Mmmm I'd go for this one again too. 

So reason why we got to try so many pies was because we ordered Beef and Cabbage but they accidentally put in the wrong pie. Soo they gave us two extra slices or any other pie, on them! I love it. I was in pie heaven! 

Great customer service + cute/clean space + delicious and tasty pies = without a doubt 5 star rating. Definitely a successful pie hunt.
author: Lisa N.

description:
What's not to like about this cute little pie place? We stopped here for breakfast one morning and I enjoyed its hipster vibe, Etsy-rustic decor, and tasty pies.

The space is fairly large, but there aren't a ton of tables inside, so you might want to have someone grab a table while someone else in your group goes up to order at the counter. They offer sweet and savory pies, quiches, muffins and scones, and tarts, as well as a little gift-shop area with things like Cuppow lids, local honey, and fresh-cut flowers.

Prices seemed reasonable - most things were under $5 (pot pies are $7) and you could easily grab a couple of items and a coffee for around $10. The steak pie was a hearty portion for one, with lots of flaky crust and maybe just a bit too much juice inside. 

The cash-only part is kind of inconvenient, but as long as you're aware of it, you can plan to have cash on hand. I would have been happy to come back here every morning of our trip and eat my way through the menu!
author: Stephanie P.

description: The pies used lots of fresh fruit, but it was a bit dry and  I wished they came out warm.  We ordered the mixed berry pie and the plum frangipane to share.  I would come back to try the other pies, but think these pies that we tried were just okay.  Perhaps getting them a la mode would have helped?
author: Helen T.

description: $4 per slice.  The banana creme was pretty good.  The crust was good.  The rhubarb chess was recommended but it was not good.
author: Chris L.

description: I have tried their elderberry chess, apricot frangipane and the banana cream pie. They are all good but the banana cream pie is always my go-to!
author: Kelvin Y.

description:
Loved this place!  I came here with my Birthday Gals, Club (it was a non-Birthday 
month).  We went to the Jewish Contemporary Museum earlier in the day.

We arrived after 2pm and didn't have to battle lunch crowds.

You order at the counter after choosing your selections from the vertical chalk board or by getting mesmerized by the delectable selections in the case.  My first thought was, "Ohhhhhhhh I want one of each!"  My inner Rinky, the sensible part that is buried way way way deep inside of me whispered, "No way, don't be a pig." IR prevailed.

They have both sweet and savory pies (with vegan choices) as well as quiches, tarts, gallettes, salads and a variety of teas and coffee.  

Each of us ordered the chicken pie---it was good but the sauce  seemed a little bland and lacked a little "oomph"  I loved the buttery crust and the vegetable (carrots, celery, onions) were soft and tasty (not hard and uncooked as most other pot pies I've had elsewhere).

We also tried the cabbage slaw which I also loved-yummy--made with finely chopped cabbage, raisins, with a light lemony dressing.  Two of the Birthday Gals Clubbers had a rice salad which was divine.

For dessert we shared slices of Lemon Shaker Pie (divinely tart) and luscious
Banana Cream Pie. Yum!

The ambiance was quite comfy during this non-busy time. We sat at the community table----a sturdy,solid wooden table (I love this kind of table).  Nearby there were books, sketchbooks and crayons & pencils. 

There seemed to be many regulars--MP is definitely a  neighborhood hangout.
We saw one group of 5-6 people working on a drawing project.

Just noticed a  couple of my Yelp buds,  Hilda Z,  and Adrienne G, were not very impressed with MP.  Dear Hilda I plead guilty for taking a little time to decide what I wanted (forgive this Newbie).

There used to be a place called "Noble Pies" (from Australia) that had the BEST BEST pies I've ever had.  I'll have to try MP again and select other items.
author: Rinky N.

description:
Skip lunch. Eat Mission Pie instead.

That's what I did, I and I have absolutely NO regrets! I was planning on grabbing a treat at Mission Pie one day anyway, but when I stopped at Precita Eyes Mural Arts Center (check them out, too!) and one of the women that works there told me about the pie shop's business model and mission, I had to go. 

I got a slice of Pear Raspberry perfection and washed it down with a coffee from the self-serve bar.

Who needs cake (or any other food, for that matter), when you can have pie instead?
author: Nina B.

description:
This is more of a 3.5 review. I feel this is also a little biased since I only tried two things.

I ordered an empanada and a slice of chili apple pie. The empanada was a little too hot around the edges, but was pretty good. The size wasn't that big for paying almost four dollars. The pie was tasty, and the chilies gave it a meaty, savory flavor along with the sweet apples. The crust really stood out too. But the slice was a little small for 5.50.

Overall, its worth checking out if its not out of your way and you don't mind the prices.
author: Gill S.

description:
Mission Pies has decent pies, but I think I have had better.  I like pies with very flaky crusts with very airy whipped cream.  The pies at here have bland crusts (1 star off) and the whipped cream falls flat (1 star off).  The fillings, while delicious, are a little too dense for my taste.  This is still a decent place for after-dinner dessert and coffee, so I would recommend checking it out if you are in the neighborhood.

Just don't watch American Pie right before you come.
author: Ally W.

description:
Darling establishment and a wonderful concept. 

I had the apple and huckleberry pie a la mode, and a decaffeinated coffee. Although the flavor of the pie was very tasty, I subtracted one star because I would have liked the pie served hot rather than luke warm. The coffee (you serve yourself from the three coffee canisters provided), was also just slightly above room temperature.
author: Alexandra F.

description: Stop the madness, don't bake again, go to #MissionPie! Alright, bakers should bake but, check out this establishment. Your taste buds will thank you. Mixed Berry Pie is my absolute favorite, Yummy! It's obvious that the food here is made from a true passion :)
author: Regina D.

description: We had the pear raspberry pie for $4.50. The pie slice was smaller than expected for the price. There were large pieces of pear and maybe one tiny piece of raspberry. The pie fell part and the crust was thin and sparse. It just wasn't that good compared to what we expected from all the Yelp reviews. The cashier was nice.
author: S C.

description: really disappointed their chicken pot pie had no bottom crust or side crust. It was basically a tinfoil bowl of chicken soup with a crust hat. Boo!
author: Patrick H.

description: My first time having Mission Pies was at a friend's wedding, and I couldn't shut up about the freaking pies. Can we stop for a minute and appreciate that pie restaurants exist? And being open until 10pm doesn't hurt.
author: natalie a.

description: Still the best pie shop I've ever encountered. Just stopped by for a slice of their amazing banana cream pie but seriously debated getting two slices. Thank you for existing, and a huge hug to all of their employees, they are so rad.
author: Cindy G.

description: $27 for a pie, $4.50 for a slice. Nice location close to BART.  Relaxed yet welcoming atmosphere.
author: Price L.

description:
Missions pie is the best pie shop in San Francisco. 

In the summer, nothing surpasses the Peach & Raspberry pie. A dangerous fruit combination that I will devour in a single sitting. Not just a slice, but an entire pie. Thankfully for my waistline, peaches aren't in season year round. 

In the colder months, Mission Pie's second best choice is their Banana Cream. Light, fruity, and delicious. I usually supplement that with a slice of dutch apple heated up with ice cream. 

The Pear & Raspberry pie doesn't compare to the summer peach version, but is a decent stand-in when you need a pie fix and the Banana Cream is sold out.

On the savory side, the salads and stews are a healthy, filling side for when you feel guilty about eating nothing but pie for lunch. The protein fix from the Lentil and Kale stew is a great thing to eat so you don't feel quite as bad about stuffing your face with slice after slice of delicious fruit pie.
author: Justin H.

description: Yummy pie and tasty salad. Also a nice place to hang out on an otherwise kinda grubby street.
author: Anne R.

description:
Its hard to pin down exactly what i love most about mission pie.

its probably the pies.

Though it could be the whole artisanal/traditional/local foodie vibe. Or it could be that they've taken a simple food mostly associated with dessert to the next level.

The selection of tea is solid too.
author: Oleg H.

description: Tastes like my grandmother's baking in the Midwest. It is a flakey crust...I want to say Crisco like....this is a positive. Plus they put coffee ice cubes in the ice coffee. Wish everyone did this for ice coffee. Only negative is that this would be a great place to meet for get togethers or work meetings with the long tables but no Wi-Fi.
author: A J.

description:
I'm not really a pie person, but even I go nuts for this place. The pie was fantastic, and so was the smiling, dark haired, light eyed man behind the counter. 

The banana creme pie was incredible and I will certainly be coming back for more. I've heard the mixed berry pie is the best.

See you soon, Mission Pie!
author: Brooke E.

description: Stopped here for dessert on our last night in the city. I'm not usually much of a sweets eater, but the pies came highly recommended so we felt that we had to check it out. So glad we did! We had the walnut pie and the pear blueberry pie. Both were amazing!
author: Suzanne P.

description: So I didn't get the text that went out to all hipsters living in The Mission, but for us common folk...  if your restaurant is a Pop Up one night and not a Pie Shop can you post it on the front door or on the pie menu hanging above the counter? Seems like common sense to me so someone (me) doesn't wait in a long ass line just to hear you are not selling pie that night. Especially annoying when there is a rack of pies right behind the counter person just waiting to be eaten. Lame.
author: Susan S.

description:
Bottom line at the top: overrated!! All the pies kinda taste the same (way too much crust that tastes super bready and not enough filling). The staff was also rude and snipey (visited at night). 
--
Came by with some friends and had apple pie, mixed berry pie, two types of scones and a blueberry muffin. Everything was really average and basically tasted like baked goods from the supermarket- meh. 

Rude service is never a good thing and especially annoying at a dessert/bakery. Skip!!
author: Dahlia S.

description:
Not that I've had too many pies in my life, but I know a good one when I get one.  The Banana Cream Pie here is really good.   Creamy and sweet and full of banana flavor!  Probably could have eaten two slices.  I am a bit bias because I really do like banana's, so maybe this one is better than average.

However, the Dutch Apply Small Pie we got just didn't do it for me.  First when we got it served there, it was cold.  Apple pie should be warm, surprisingly they didn't offer us this option.  After we took a couple of bites, we asked them to warm it up, it was better, but still not the best pie.

The waitress who brought us the pies was really nice.  She forgot to put the whip cream on the side and brought us a new pie.  Mistakes happen and how they are received are dependent on how they are remedied, they get an A for this one (she recalled the error on her own as well).  On the other hand, the lady at the register seemed a bit out of it.  Half talking half mumbling.  Felt a disconnect.

From a previous experience, the savory pies are really good.
author: Veasna H.

description: Love the Walnut Tartlet--it's just the right size & is very caramely and buttery.  Aside from their  awesome selection of pies/tarts/scones, they also do hearty soups as well. Their ingredients are locally sourced so everything tastes super fresh & homemade.  It's one of my favorite dessert stops in The Mish.
author: steve c.

description: Had dessert here last night. The pie was fresh and delish. Coffee was fresh. Nice crowd of young folks. Recommend the pies and coffees.
author: Mike H.

description:
It kind of kills me to rate any bakery average or lowly, because I love dessert so much. But I'm not even sure I had dessert here. We got the blueberry pear crumble pie, with whipped cream on top, and I couldn't taste anything. The whipped cream wasn't sweet, the blueberries barely came out, and the crust wasn't buttery. It was strange! It was so promising when we walked in - I immediately said, "it smells like quiche!" and lo and behold, racks on racks on racks of pies, savory and otherwise.

It wasn't terribly expensive; four of us split a mini-pie for $7.50 and were all satisfied with our portions. Also, the staff is super friendly, and there is a nice wheel they spin for free coffee if you fall under a certain category e.g. you work in a warehouse.
author: Cat N.

description:
Beer And Pie. Beer and Pie. Beer and Pie. That's what I chant as I walk to Mission Pie. 
For real.

The place has over 1,000 good reviews because the pie is pretty great and the atmosphere is probably charming and cool to most of those reviewers.

For me, it's all about the beer and the pie, and not so much the students camping out doing homework and playing video games on their cell phones. I'm like, damn, it's cool you can do both at the same time, but it totally sucks that I may have to stand up and eat my pie and drink my beer while you do it. You think that level is hard? Try standing up and drinking beer and eating pie at the same time. That's hard.

Beer And Pie. Beer And Pie.
author: Marcus C.

description: Horrible service!!! Typical San Francisco restaurant that has the rudest people working, disgusting customer service or lack there of, overpriced and overrated mediocre food and drinks and expecting a good tip in the end! Haha! Yea, right!!! I came here this morning with 7 friends and no one but one other patron was in the whole place and they managed to get all our orders wrong and made us wait another 25 minutes for one slice of apple pie to finally tell us that they had put it on someone else's ticket and they didn't even apologize for it or anything! I ordered the lentils with veggies and it was a joke!!! For $10, save yourself the 1/4 of a side dish that I got today! Not to mention there was no taste!!! Absolutely gross!!! This will be the last time I come to this stupid overrated and extremely over priced place!
author: Bridgette P.

description:
I love pie; I wanted to have wedding pie, before that dream was blown to bits when they told me I would never get enough pie for 400+ people.

Very cool place - I love the floors, the high ceilings, all the wood in the bakery. Very nice vibe, but not too off-puttingly hipster. We had just eaten at two different places for lunch, and I needed to have some dessert. 

I love the pie display, and the chalkboard listing out the flavors -- perfect for those of us who have to see all the flavors listed out in front of us to evaluate what we want to order but also see the visual displays of the pies and desserts. to help with the decision-making process. Complicated, I know -- I take pie-eating very seriously. 

The walnut pie looked really good, but it was a hot day, and I just wanted to eat some banana cream pie. We ordered it, paid for it, and waited for a lovely hipster lady to bring us our slice of pie. When she did, it was so worth the couple minutes' wait! The crust was crisp and delicious, the banana cream was not too sweet, and the whipped cream was fresh and full of flavor without being way too sweet. Even my husband loved the pie, and he usually doesn't like a ton of sweets! 

Will definitely be back as soon as possible. I love banana cream pie, and the walnut pie is so intriguing. It looked like pecan pie but without the crazy pecan paste-like stuff midway in the pie. Just all crust and walnuts! Yum!
author: Anh D.

description: I only had a slice of their vegan pie.  It wasn't that good.  I'm sure their other pies are much better.  They should find a better vegan pie recipe.  I've had much better before.
author: Jane L.

description:
I saw the four stars and was really excited to try some delicious pie for dessert! However, my dreams were dashed during this entire experience.
For starters, the blonde person (not sure if male or female) working the cash register was high as a kite and I could not understand ANYTHING coming out of that person's mouth. I asked several times if he/she could repeat what they said and let's just say it was inaudible. 
Second, there were plenty of people working but they were not bussing the tables and after we ended up sitting at a table with people's leftover food and dirty napkins, the girl freaking put my dessert on the table next to it! I asked her to please remove the remnants from the previous customers and she made a face as if I told her to eat it. How are you in customer service?! Oh and when I tried the pie? It was banana- not the blueberry pear that I had ordered. 
So then I had to flag down the waitress (again!) and let her know that I was given the wrong order. When she finally gave me the correct order, the pie wasn't even warm. It was cold and she gave me the tiniest piece ever. 
All in all, I will not be returning and hope that a manager will change up personnel.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: If I could eat breakfast, lunch, dinner and dessert at Mission Pie, I absolutely would. This place is amazing - I've literally never left here feeling anything less than transcendent. Not only are their sweet slices heavenly, but their savory pies are delicious as well. On top of the food, i love the environment... the workers are always super friendly and helpful, and they're supporters of local artists and florists, with cool art on the walls and fresh bouquets for sale. Definitely one of my favorite spots in the city - worth the price!
author: Molly G.

description: The staff is lovely and the pie is to die for. The chess is superb & they have vegan options. Fresh, delicious whip cream that is light and not too sweet.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
damn. Hipsters make the best pies. 

Homemade crusts... awesome pies. 

So far, i've had...
the banana pie- refreshing yet decadent. 
Pumpkin Pie- so good. 
Pear Rasberry- My favorite of all the pies I've tried. It's definitely not a traditional filling, but feels like it should be. And it's freaking good. Sweet pears with tart rasberry...aaaah!

To top it off, if you eat a slice there, they will put a dollop of fresh whipped cream on top of your slice! Who needs ice cream with your pie when you have fresh whipped cream!

overall... love this place. Worth a bart ride into the city just for this :)
author: Daniel L.

description: I swear I'm here every week or so. :) (and I never regret a visit). Today we tried the chicken pot pie and the salad with cabbage! Big portion for a half salad especially if you get full pretty easily like myself. I liked the pot pie but I guess I'm not a huge fan of the creamy sort-of consistency. (I've never really tried pot pies so not sure if this is how it's suppose to be). Besides that, it tasted yummy. I really can't wait to try the lentil & tofu pot pie!!! Pretty awesome they have that.
author: Mischelle D.

description:
Mission Pie is a new favorite in the City. Locally sourced, cozy place to hang out, and amazing pie- how can you improve on that?

We loved everything we got for lunch, including pesto pasta salad, chicken pot pie, pear raspberry pie, and our favorite- walnut pie. Flaky crust. Just fantastic. I'd kill for the recipe.
author: Stacy G.

description:
SF ppl love their pie at any time of the day 
Always packed this place
Had the vegan pie it was good but not wow blown away factor
author: Maya J.

description: The walnut pie, is the bomb. I haven't tried any of their other food items but the pie definitely lived up to the hype.
author: Stephanie D.

description: Their dessert pies are consistently great but the pot pie that I had was pretty horrible. I learned and I've probably been back another 30 times since.
author: Justin W.

description:
I love banana pie!! It isn't too sweet as American pie.
Stuff is friendly and nice atmosphere.
author: Itsumi K.

description:
There aren't too many places that have perfected the art of pie making, but Mission Pie certainly is one. I crave Mission Pie! One bite and you're hooked.

The atmosphere is relaxed. It feels like you are eating pie made in your home kitchen.
author: Nathan E.

description:
I love Mission Pie (and not just for the pie)! Their stews are hearty and flavorful, and come with brown rice and cooked veggies, making for a delicious, filling, and nutritious meal. I've had at least 4 different stews of the day, and they were all fantastic. I love that they use fresh, seasonal ingredients.

The pies are phenomenal- large pieces of yummy fruit and perfect crusts. I particularly recommend getting a scoop of vanilla ice cream with them.
author: R T.

description: Love this place. Always go there if we are in the Mission.  Lemon Shaker Pie is the bomb.
author: Joyce C.

description:
I've had a craving for pie that has lasted way too long, so I made a quick detour to Mission Pie. They have a diverse selection of pie, from their regulars to their seasonal specials. I went with a slice of the banana cream pie that seems to be a specialty, as well as a peach blackberry slice that is a summer special.

The banana cream was smooth and light, with slices of banana underneath the banana cream. The whipped cream on top was not at all overwhelming, and the actual banana cream was rich without being sticky sweet. The crust was light and flaky, which contrasted well with the creamy softness of the pie. 

The peach blackberry was my favorite because of the crumb topping on top! The pie was primarily pie with a few blackberries folded in, but the peaches were extremely juicy and soft. I liked the crust on this pie better because it had a touch more butter, giving it the gooier texture that I love. Once again, I appreciated how the pie wasn't overly sweet, allowing me to really enjoy the flavors of the fresh fruit.

I love pie and it can be so hard to find sometimes, so I'm so glad I ventured out to the Mission to get my pie fix!
author: Ashley T.

description:
Very impressed by this place. Came here on a whim after we found parking in the Mission to eat at La Taqueria. We walked by, and I was immediately enamored at the thought of pie. I hadn't heard of the place before, but it looked cute on the outside and inviting. Came back after having a late burrito lunch and a quick stop at a gallery nearby. There was a long line in front of us (a group of coworkers just came in for coffee) but it went by swiftly and gave my friend and I time to deliberate on our pie choices. They have a nice display case with all their offerings available neatly labeled from salads, pot pies, cookies, and of course, pie. The day we went they had a vegan apple strawberry, shaker lemon, walnut, apple strawberry, and strawberry rhubarb from what I remember. I went for the strawberry rhubarb, and my friend had the shaker lemon. We both added a scoop of organic vanilla ice cream for $1.50 to the pie slice which I think was $4.50. The strawberry rhubarb was very light, not too sweet, and the crust complimented it very well. The ice cream also reminded me a of a soy-based ice cream, that made this afternoon snack not too heavy. We also had a mocha and latte (single shots) and our total was just about $20.

There was plenty of seating with lots of windows (some open). They bring out your order to you, and they ask you to kindly to bus your own table with little reminder placards. Would come back if I was nearby!
author: Ravo Y.

description:
Enough with the cupcake shops. I'm tired of 'em. Who needs frosting? I want crust. With plenty of Crisco. I'm just not into pretty. Ever see "Waitress"? That's the kind of shop I want in my 'hood. Mission Pies serves a much-needed niche market, the gluttonous pie eater. Sure, they're big on sustainability and do a lot for youth advocacy (employing quite a few high school students at their source Pie Ranch). That's all very admirable, but how's the pie, you ask. 

It's good. At least the slice of Banana Cream Pie I had was good (see photo). Very creamy but not too sweet with a nice flaky crust. No swirls of Reddi-Wip on top, just good eatin'. The fruit pies look delish - the apple rhubarb was on display on the counter - and will be worth a repeat visit in itself. But they also make savory pies like quiches, galettes, and pot pies using the same principles of fresh, local ingredients. 

Lamb, chard, dandelion greens, Niman ham, potato gratin. All sorts of combinations that make me want to come back for dinner. I was surprised to find the place pretty spacious with a long handsome communal dining table and nice large windows to see the happenings on Mission and 25th. In fact, the corner location is ideal for BART travelers like myself since it's only a block away from the 24th Street station. That's good for me 'cause I never know when I need a pie fix. 

PIE - 4 stars...good pie, fresh and tasty...me want more...let them eat (cup)cake!
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...spacious and casual...windows make for good for people-watching 
SERVICE - 3 stars...they cut 'em up, no big whoop 
TOTAL - 4 stars...please, ma'am, can I have another slice?
author: Ed U.

description: Amazing! We had savory and sweet pies, and all were great. The crust is )in my opinion) the most important part of the pie, and Mission Pie knows how to do it right! Like that they also list out where all their ingredients come from, so you know exactly what you're getting. Tasty,tasty and worth the train ride from downtown.
author: Courtney B.

description:
Before Yelp, I use to be a frequent customer to Mission Pie. I love every single savory and sweet pies made fresh with local and organic ingredients from the kitchen in the back. 

One of my family's favorites was (and still is) the Banana Cream Pie.  When my wife was pregnant, I would buy the popular pie, which was $15.00 for the whole thing (now $20.00), and feed her during her pregnancy. Occasionally, she would foolishly splash the whole pie in my face as well. 

Sorry, no photos of the cream pie in my face. 

"Though I would use the organic whipped cream topping for shaving...j/k!"

Since the changing of my work-schedule, I haven't been here in many years. And I finally came back here on my break for a quick snack in the later afternoon. I had a slice of the Plum Fragipane Tart. The $3.50 slice had a mixture of sliced plums and apricot preserve in a crunchy and sweet crust. Looking at my picture of my slice may not be a big slice, but "big" on taste. I also enjoy my treat with cup of Joe, from the Taylor Maid Organic Coffee Company in Sonoma, CA.

Credit cards are accepted here, including my snack.

Add this place as one of my 24th Street's favorites. 

Err...25th Street...close enough!
author: Matt G.

description:
Oh Mission Pie. I've heard some amazing things about you, but the time I got there, there wasn't too many options. I went with 3 other friends and we ended up getting 4 difference pies: 

-Banana Cream Pie
-Berry Pie
-Pecan Pie
-Peach Pie 

I think our favorite was the pecan pie, but I think that I enjoyed all of them. The banana cream pie was oh so sweet, but so good. I really enjoyed the homemade whipped cream that was made. 

Overall, it was delicious time, but I feel like I could make a better pie and that's never a great thing to think.
author: Nina Y.

description: Tried the banana cream and apple pies. Service was great and the cafe is cute. I would have loved to buy a pot of tea with my pies and relax but I had a plane to catch. I can't compare with any other pie shop in SF but the best pie shops in NYC definitely have them beat. The pie crust was flakey but too dense, almost like a cookie. The apple pie filling was good but the banana cream pie is overrated. I would definitely come back if I needed to kill time in Mission but it's definitely not worth going out of your way for.
author: Yukari L.

description:
Their sourdough bread is delicious. It has the perfect crust and stays moist.

I tried some of their pocket pies (can't recall the names of them, it was in French), and they were incredible. A little pricey, but I certainly couldn't have made them myself.

Need to try more pies, but I enjoyed the banana cream pie.
author: Ellie M.

description:
Mission possible: found a frontrunner for pie in SF.

This is easily one of the best Banana Creme Pies I've ever had. The pudding is so smooth and light and the whipped cream is airy and is the perfect layer on top of the nicely baked crust. 

The best part is the pie really holds up after a couple of days and the bananas don't make it a soggy mess. 

At $22 for a pie it is on the pricier side but you get your money's worth in flavor and craftsmanship. 

When we went, we also tried the Peach Tayberry Mini Pie ($7). While not as spectacular as the banana creme, this personal sized pie really shined with fresh fruit flavors. I thought it was a nice change of pace from the soft and airy banana creme because this Peach Tayberry was filled with substantial fruit.

To conclude, Mission Pies definitely has that artisan pie feel and taste. I am normally a wholesome country pie type of guy (the kind of pie you might find at Gizdich Ranch) but if I'm in the city and have a hankering for pie, Mission Pie is my go-to!
author: Matthew T.

description: Very nice and cozy place in Mission district. Fresh and warm pies, friendly service.
author: Vlada C.

description:
One word. Orgasmic.

The pie's here are so delicious and they are so fresh. I think I've found the holy grail of pies. I came here with some friends and I had both the pie and the quiche. I'm not sure why but I was def. feeling a little savory at the time. The quiche was okay. It wasn't the best thing that I've ever tasted, but the PIE!!!!! omg. So good.

Pro tip: Get the one with the ice cream. Why you ask? Once you taste it, life will hit you so hard that if it could talk to you it would say "YOU KNOW WHY!" And the truth is you'll know. So enjoy. Happy pie grubbin.
author: Nathan L.

description: Friendly and fast service. Line wasn't bad but it went quick. Stopped in for a snack- had to finally try their pie. Dutch Apple did not disappoint. I'm a sucker for crumb topping. So good! Make sure you ask for it warm and ala mode. Pie was perfect temp without the ice cream melting. Awesome!
author: Christine R.

description: Some of the best pies in SF I've ever tasted. Such rich and fresh quality. How i overlook this gem in SF for most of my life I don't understand. Will come back when I'm in the mission area again.
author: Jude N.

description: While the pies are good, I just wish there was a place to sit. I still don't really know whats in the chess pie, but it taste delicious.
author: Lawrence V.

description:
We headed to Mission Pie to celebrate Pi Day and to take advantage of the Pi Day special, $3.14 for a slice.  Unfortunately, others were thinking the same and by the time we ordered the banana cream had run out.  Keep in mind this was around 10am so I am assuming they did not adjust to meet the demand. 

We ended up getting a slice of lemon pie and the recommended kumquat chess pie.  The texture of the chess pie was nice, like a cheesecake, but the flavor was just way too citrus-y.  Had it been another fruit, we may have enjoyed it more.  We could not even finish the lemon pie.  I guess we were expecting something a bit more like lemon meringue, tart and sweet but what we got was pretty bitter with only a hint of sweetness (maybe).  The pie was literally made of lemons, rind included.  The crust was good, in terms of flakiness and thickness.

It is a nice shop in the Mission area.  Plenty of seating and open space if you wanted to sit and enjoy your slice of pie.  Parking consists of street parking but it is not in the more popular areas so it wasn't too bad.  You can't miss the joint as they have signage in front of a pie and pitchforks.

I am not sure if I would head back to Mission Pie.  It was ok - good quality and decent price but some of the combinations just didn't work for me.
author: Roy L.

description:
Bye bye diet! Heeeeeello pie!

Thanks to my friend, I discovered this amazing pie shop in the Mission.
Even though we were all so full from lunch, the pies looked so delicious we just couldn't help trying a piece each.
We got the walnut pie, peach frangipane and some other berry pastry (I forget).
The perfect mate for walnut pie was vanilla ice cream and some coffee.

I threw my diet restrictions out the window just for a piece of this heavenly pie.
author: Kinjal S.

description: Just ate the two worst pies I have ever tasted. We were at a dinner party last night and we had two pies from this place. One was a chocolate pie and one was a meyer lemon pie. The chocolate pie would have been better if they used Jell-O chocolate pie filling. This filling was watering and just oozed out the sides and the meringue (if that was what it was) had no flavor. Now that meyer lemon pie was just totally disgusting. The crust was ok. The filling had the lemon uncooked peel still on the lemon. Unfortunately the custard was totally curdled and grainy. Everyone that tasted it spit it out. These pies cost $27.00!! Highway robbery. DON'T SHOP HERE.
author: Sam L.

description:
Full disclosure:  I'm more of a cake person.  Still, the pies here are solid.  Pricey, but good.  The environment is clean-but-loud, environment is uber-hipster, and it's hard to know in advance what pies they might be selling on any given day.

This is not a great place to go if you're in a wheelchair.  While technically the front door is accessible, the tables are really jumbled and close together, making it really difficult to navigate.  The people who go here don't seem interested in being helpful/getting out of your way, and the people who work here pay no attention to the fact that you're trying to get a piece of pie, but can't because people won't get out of your way.   They don't HAVE to be helpful, but I tend to return more readily to businesses where the employees are more helpful in this regard.

I went here the other night and there was a band setting up to perform.  At 6:15 pm.  Yup, just when people are getting off of work and might want to meet a friend/lover for a piece of pie and conversation.  This just doesn't seem like a great arrangement.  Loud music in a club or bar, sure...but in a bakery?  No, not really.  Just not working for me.  

I'm sure I'll dash in here from time to time looking to purchase a pie to go, but I won't be staying here to eat any of it.  It just doesn't feel like a great place for that to me, especially if I don't know in advance if there's going to be loud live music.  That would ruin my pie enjoyment.
author: Amy L.

description:
Note to self

You have been here.
You liked the banana cream pie. 

but you want to try the apple pie next time.
author: Henry C.

description: This review is only for their lemon pie. Inedible -- way too bitter.
author: R S.

description:
I'm not that big on pies but I do like them occasionally. I'm the chocolate lover so I was a little bum that the didn't have chocolate creme pie. My friend told me to try the apply pie. I got the apple pie with whip cream and ice cream(of course I had to get it a la mode). Also I ordered a cappuccino which was strong but really good. The apple pie was the BEST apple pie I ever had. The whip cream wasn't too sweet and went well with the tart apples. I don't want to eat apple pie from anywhere else. 

This place got pretty crowded and it was really cute! I would like to just hang out here.
author: Ann C.

description: I was so happy when I stumbled upon Mission Pie. This place is so cute and definitely a great place for the Mission community! First off, Mission Pie is all about supporting local produce and products! They have a list of all the ingredients they use and where they come from, which I found to be amazing! They have sweet and savory pies which make it a great place for all the likes of people with different taste buds!
author: Chelsea S.

description:
I finally got to try this place. The pies are delicious, seasonal and delicious! I got the peach and raspberry pie. They even warm it up if you ask nicely. 

Since we came toward the end of the night they were giving away items from the day that hadn't sold. I went and got a couple of pastries to bring to the hospital I work at the next day and they went back and got two more mini pies for me to bring in. HOW NICE!! The residents  here were super happy the next morning!
author: Komal B.

description: Love love love this place~ very healthy, organic, and natural ingredients, which subsequently make you feel good about your food choice! Their Peach Blackberry pie is by far the best thing on their dessert menu, but the Banana Creme pie is a close second! Their warm beverages are very good ~ especially the hot chocolate! My only complaint is the serving size of pie to price ratio was a little off: $4.50 for a smallish slice! However, if you are nearby the Mission District I DEFINITELY recommend this quaint and quirky little pie shop!!:)
author: Samantha M.

description: Went in on a busier Tuesday evening. Stood in line  for quite sometime and asked the man with a small blonde ponytail for help. He was extremely rude and refused to help. Never going back
author: Ryan A.

description:
Just alright with the banana cream pie.. why does the crust crack and fly away off the table when I use the fork and try to break into it? why is the cream pie so flat and deflated?

The apricot raspberry pie is also just alright. I'm not sure what is all the hype about? freshly made, in house... yes... but the pies, I am not seeing it....that purported magic. I'm sorry!

Why $3.50/slice for mediocrity?
author: Jana C.

description: First timer. I ordered the banana cream, strawberry walnut with a side of ice cream. Delicious! Even a table play area for children. Love it!
author: Diana T.

description:
I have a strong philosophical objection to Mission Pie. Like, not only did I not enjoy eating at Mission Pie, but it actually PERSONALLY OFFENDED me. We got a slice of banana cream and pumpkin pie, for reference. Maybe all the positive reviews are from people who are looking for something different in their pies than i am (mainly, plants and grains masquerading as delicious pie)? If i wanted to be healthy, I would just eat a pumpkin, or some bananas, no need to make those things pie-shaped. I am not convinced they used sugar in any of it?  

Basically, if you are vegan or like things that taste like they are vegan, even if they are not, i'd recommend this place. Otherwise, strangers of the internet, trust me on this one. I am just trying to keep you from breaking your heart (or a tooth) over this.
author: Maria G.

description: Wow, the banana cream pie here is to die for. It's not too sweet and just the right amount of crust, cream, bananas and custard. My favorite place for banana cream pie use to be Heidi's Pies in San Mateo but this beats it. We also had the pear pie but it wasn't as good. I like how they have almond milk which I had steamed for my latte but I wish they had vanilla syrup as I love vanilla latte. I will try the chicken pot pie next time along with the pear and raspberry pie.
author: Chi N.

description:
So I have been wanting to try a pie from here for a while and thought I'd try one of their most popular pies, the banana cream. I called to reserve a pie and pickup was relatively easy. I dropped in on a busy Saturday afternoon, forked over my $22 and I was on my way. I was pretty excited to go home and slice into this pie that I had heard so many good things about! So that's exactly what I did...

The Filling: Good banana and vanilla flavor with a decent amount of bananas layered over under a nice fluffy top of whipped cream. The cream's consistency was a little more gelatinous and less cream than I had expected. Not a bad thing, just a different consistency than I had expected. Filing: 4 stars. 

The Crust: Definitely not what I would have expected for a "luxury" pie ($22). The crust was hard, almost a burnt flavor. There was very little layering and it was quite hard to cut into. For what's claimed as a butter crust, it definitely didn't feel as rich or flaky as I had hoped. Maybe it works out better on the savory pies or the others that aren't refrigerated. Here however, it just didn't work for me. Crust: 2 stars.

I really really wanted to like this pie and this place, but for me, a good crust is a necessary component to a good pie. Unfortunately this wasn't it and I'll have to search elsewhere to satisfy my banana cream pie cravings.
author: Justin S.

description:
I am so ready to revisit Mission Pie to devour all of their scrumptious sweet and savory pies. Sadly, I had eaten lunch right before heading out to Mission Pie so my eyes were bigger than my stomach. After much debating, I decided on just a slice of quiche for $3.50. 

Absolutely delicious quiche with three distinct memorable parts. The pie crust was amazing-- light and flaky, not bland and soggy. The top layer of cheese added a nice crunch to the heart and center of the quiche. Such a soft yet flavorful mixture of eggs, cream, mushroom, and red bell peppers. 

What I recommend: 

1. quiche
2. come with an empty stomach
author: Andrew W.

description:
Umm...delish!! And what a better way to have celebrated our wedding than with pie--Mission Pie! In lieu of a wedding cake, we decided to order apple and pear/raspberry pies for our big day and they were a hit with our guests! 

We worked with Sharon to place our order and loved meeting with her. Prior to our big day, she invited us to come into Mission Pie for a complimentary "pie tasting" and made us feel right at home. And on our big day, she and her team sent a fun goodie bag along with our pies wishing us all the best! So sweet!!

We know where we'll be going for our next slice of goodness! ;)
author: Hannah R.

description:
Very nice, very clean, and comfortable quaint spot. Service is great.Experienced the pockets which had the clean homemade flavor, flaky crust just as I like it. Next visit will be the chicken pot pie.

A nice surprise. Will be back sooner than later.
author: Ron P.

description:
One of my favorite places to bring people from out of town, first dates, informational interviews, anything (it's better than a coffeeshop for any of those!).  

Their prices are reasonable, both for single slices and full pies, and the service is always great.  Choices are seasonal, but they always have a Walnut Pie (like Pecan, but Walnuts are local) and a Shaker Lemon Pie (my personal favorite)

They have a lot of space to sit down; it's almost always possible to get a table or section of one.  

Other positives: They sell excellent tea and coffee; they source as much of their ingredients as possible locally and organically; they do job training for underprivileged youth; they give back to the community; homemade whipped cream; good savory options (quiche, pot pies) as well.

Cash only.
author: Zachary R.

description: Went in awhile back to for the first and last time to get a pastry.  The female at the counter begin having difficulty containing her distain and walks away.  Someone else show up with an apologetic look on their face.  I order something and left. Rude staff verging on racist.  I was raised to not say anything if I can't say something good.  I will never go back and I think that is a good thing.
author: Fareed A.

description: The best thin crust pie ever! Next time, I will sure try the savory ones.
author: Anna Y.
