description: A Mission staple. The Apple+Berry pie is insanely good and the pot pies make a great lunch/dinner.
author: Irina P.

description: Called to place a large order for breakfast for a work gathering of 12 people and the girl was very short & rude on the phone. I asked about sides of fruit to go with their quiche and she said we don't do that. Ok fine, but I'm thinking about placing a $200+ order here and she's being rude. So I told her I'd work with another company. Btw, she was the manager. Ouch!
author: Sean C.

description: We ordered a couple coffee's, quiches, and pies.  Perfect snack spot to warm you up after a long walk.
author: Christopher N.

description:
I love coming here for the banana creme and the atmosphere.
I'll usually stop by here if I want to be outside of home or have some small reading to do. I feel like they get a lot of foot traffic in so I'd hate to stay long and study when someone else can have a seat.
So this is actually the first place I ever had pie!
I tried the pumpkin one and apple but they just aren't tastes I like so my friend ate them happily for me and loved them. I think when it comes to pie I'm just about the banana creme, so that along side their scoop of organic ice cream.... Oh man. Sooo good.
I've ordered whole pies for thanksgiving from here and my family loved them!
So if there's ever that craving for pie, you'll find me sitting here enjoying every bite.
author: Eff B.

description:
I think every city needs more establishments with a noteworthy cause. Here at Mission pie, local high school students get to explore baking and learning about a business. They can even go to Pie Ranch and learn about sustainable agriculture.

The pies are very good and the ambiance is superb. Ample seating to sit and work on a project, share a table with another gaggle of people, or just enjoy your coffee or tea. 

As in SF tradition, this place is all about recycling and offers discounts for mugs instead of to-go cups. I loved sitting here and catching up with my friend!
author: Ari A.

description:
The best pies in town.

Sometimes worth calling ahead to ask for their selection or to reserve a certain type of pie. We found 1 pie easily fed 7 people.
author: Harrison L.

description: You really can't go wrong with any pie at mission pie...they won't let you down. On this visit we had the key lime pie special & it had a crisp crusty pastry base (no sogginess here) &the key lime filling was like velvet melting away in your mouth! Exquisite!
author: Nicole E.

description: I tried the strawberry rhubarb pie and it was one of the best I've ever had.  My husband loved the shepard's pie too.  A nice beer selection was welcome for the savory pie.  Not only was the food great but the service was friendly too.  Our cashier was helpful with recommendations.  I only wish there were a few more larger tables.  A very minor complaint of a wonderful place; I wish I lived closer.
author: Becky N.

description:
Super yumsies!!!

The Banana Cream pie though? Foreal.  SO SO good.

I love the small town feel of this place, and the service is pretty great.  I don't even think there is supposed to be a waitress in this place, but someone came by and refilled our tea and coffee several times.

We stopped in after the Color Run for a post-marathon treat, and it was a perfect setting to just sit and relax.  It has a great community-esque feeling.

Plus, the floor to ceiling windows make for GREAT mission people watching. :)

Only CON?  Cash only.  Weak sauce.
author: Vince S.

description: Came through for a quick pie break and we shared the banana cream pie which was off the hook but the crust was nothing fancy and actually was quite dry.  The walnut pie was nice and tasty, quite similar to a pecan pie but definitely not as sweet. Seating is tight and can be quite noisy but their menu is extensive and makes you want to come back to try everything.  Bottom line, we left satispied. :)
author: T C.

description: This is a really cool place to come get some pie, coffee and chill out with a friend or on your own. I sometimes come in and get macaroons if I just want a little bit of sweet, the for the heavier days ago that there lemon pie it's pretty darn awesome. Good atmosphere and a good place to just hang out with friends and have a little chat in the mission.
author: Esther F.

description:
I was treating Mission Pie as if it was my neighborhood coffee shop.  This became problematic as I was consuming eight slices of pie a week and I finally had to limit myself to Mission Pie Mondays (pie breakfast every Monday).  However, this wasn't before I had sampled most items on the menu.

Highlights:  

-delightful pies made with local ingredients
-gorgeous granola and yogurt for a quick breakfast on the go
-pot pies are the perfect treat for the dinner-minded
-the quiche may as well have been made in a farmhouse kitchen (in the best possible way)
-always say yes to the whip cream
-a pot of tea is ideal for two, difficult for one
-the children's table in the window is probably the best seat in the house
-friendly staff that pretends they haven't seen me one million times
-babes with beards
-easily accommodates all sized groups, ages and appetites  

That's all.  Mission Pie, you're just so easy to get along with.  Will you marry me?
author: Allyson D.

description:
Dear Mission Pie,

I appreciate your commitment to letting the ingredients speak for themselves, but when the Meyer lemon pie is so sour that it is inedible, I have to start questioning your choices. 

Things I liked:
How there were many people of many ages just chilling and eating pie.
Very rustic simple feel of the place where the baked goods were the star of the show.

Things I Did Not Like:
Smelly bathroom. Either get a fart fan installed (should be code) that is permanently on, put in air freshener or clean it more.
Meyer Lemon Pie.
author: Tara H.

description: I gave it a second change and I have to be honest that I am not impressed. The apple pie was ok, too sweet, the crust nothing special. My friend is a baker and her stuff   is incredible.
author: Magda G.

description: We tried the chicken pot pie and it was pretty good. Your standard pot pie like mom would make. The service was friendly even though it was busy and they hand deliver each pot pie to the table. I think what would make this place a 5 star rating would be to make the "pot pie experience" feel more like going home. Little things like greeting the customer warmly when they come in, asking if they'd like anything else, and chatting about their day would change the experience from a business transaction to the feeling of being in your own kitchen. Mission Pie has all the right ingredients to make it happen!
author: Lindsey G.

description:
I've been coming here for years and Mission Pie never disappoints! I love the variety. No matter if you are craving cream base, fruit, sweet or even savory they have a bit of everything here.... Only hard part is I want a slice of each. 
I love the fact that they base their selection on in seasons, local and organic produce so each bite is high quality bliss! 
Highly recommend!
author: Christina W.

description: Pie is my favorite dessert! I really wanted to like this place, but what we were served was some of the worst pie I have ever eaten. We tried the peach pie hoping for fresh peaches, and walnut pie. the crust was like soggy cardboard, and the fillings were bland, watery, and lifeless. What a disappointment!
author: Jen O.

description: The banana cream pie here is just a tad underwhelming. It's pretty hard to mess up banana pie so of course it was good but something was off. The consistency of the banana pudding was really thick. It was like flubber but it tasted decent enough. The crust was flaky but in a hard burnt (but not burnt) way. Overall, everything was okay. It was awesome that they got the right amount of sweetness so I would definitely come back to try other types of pie.
author: Irene C.

description: we came to mission pie after spending the afternoon at dickensfair, where the promise of pies was of course met with meat pasties and savory pies of the british variety.  didn't feel christmas-y to us so we ended our night at mission pie, where we treated ourselves to the apple blackberry pie which did not disappoint.  I just wish this place was open for longer.  Pie is a 24 hour comfort food, if you ask me!
author: Archana P.

description:
The only pie worth mentioning is their banana cream. Everything else falls short. And their crust, well....

If you're going to charge $22 for pie, fix that hardened, flavorless mulch you call "pie crust". I don't think Mister Ed would even risk chipping a tooth on your pie.

Go to King's Bakery across the street and get a whole pie for $9 and save on dental bills.

By the way, McDonalds probably brews a better cup of coffee, but you're better off staying at home with your french press.
author: Darth M.

description:
I have found my nirvana.

Mission Pie is everything that is right with small businesses in San Francisco. It is the perfect combination of home baking, friendly service and a beautiful corner store. They serve a fixed menu of pies every day, so make sure to checkout www.missionpie.com for the selections of that day.

I've tried four pies so far - Banana Cream, Shaker Lemon, Vegan Apple Blackberry and Pumpkin. The Banana Cream is deliciously fluffy and smooth, and holds together surprisingly well given the interior is just cream. The Shaker Lemon is very tarty and the Vegan Apple Blackberry is filled to the brim with fruit. My favorite by far is the Pumpkin Pie. The crust adds a delicious crunchiness to a smooth pumpkin flavor. And the spice! Oh the spice...it is good.

Pro-tip: Use Postmates! They are 50% right now, so you can get Mission Pie delivered to your door for just a ~$10 fee.
author: Dennis R.

description: Really good! Today I tried my first pie there: banana cream pie! Too good to be real! I'm not a big fan of banana pies but this was just a dream! Hot chocolate is very simple, nothing special, but not too sweet, perfect with the pie. Can't wait to come back and try more different flavors
author: Asiyat T.

description:
This shop, which charges too much to begin with for a small piece of pie ($4.00) or a whole one ($22.00), wanted to chare me $2.00 just to cut a piece out of a whole one for me to have there!  

Not everyone who lives in the Mission works for google. You have to cut a slice anyway!  I'll come back, and start bringing people there again, when you cut out the greed.
author: Ben R.

description:
Banana Cream .... Dang thats a good slice of pie.  

Good: lots of spaces with small rounds for 3-4 ppls and a large buffet table.  Pies and fresh and tasty.  Vegan for those people are available. Good staff and friendly and helpful.
Bad: closes early-ish, but then the area is on the south, south part of Mission.  Better to get home early.

What I Had: Banana Cream Pie, Coffee less than $5
author: PJ T.

description:
First off, the yelp information is wrong and they accept cc. Always good to know! 

There's a lot more than pie here, although the pie is great. I decided to play lazy Sunday and have quiche even though it was well past noon. It was definitely more custard than veggies, but I've never had such a delicate texture. Simply amazing! 

There are a number of savory and food options. Salad, pot pie, stews. Way more than I was expecting! Also, although I had my coffee hot, I saw someone get iced and they definitely use coffee cubes instead of ice. 

I decided to have a slice of pie as well, and it was delicious.  I will be back!
author: Angel G.

description: The best pies I have ever had in my life. Their banana cream pie is outstanding. They also make nice gluten free macaroons that we've taken for some of our gluten free friends. Anytime I am back in the mission, will definitely hop into Mission Pie and grab my own plate of pie.
author: Varun V.

description:
Mission Pie feels like the quintessential San Franciscan cafe -- awesome mission statement plastered on the wall; local cookbooks along the side; even the colors scream local mom n' pop. I definitely love the look and I love their mission.

We got the Chicken Pot Pie and the Beef and Cabbage Pot Pie -- both were really good, but I can't say that they stood out all that much when compared to the frozen Marie Callendar ones in your grocer's freezer. Plus, when they were served, my pot pie had a lukewarm center, which made it kind of lackluster from the get-go. They graciously reheated it for me, but it was just kind of a downer upon first bite.

The Banana Creme Pie was delicious, though.
author: Roy C.

description: Pie to the dome!  Got an apple pie here and an extra inch on the waist, pies are good!!  After everyone said "small sliver please"...I ended up housing the rest of the pie.
author: christopher h.

description:
Want Pie? Come here for pie, it's all in the name. Considering the number of restaurants near Mission Pie, this is the place to go when you skip desert because you don't feel like dropping another $10-12 on a store bought chocolate mouse. Buy a slice of pie for $4, buy another one because you couldn't decide between Pear Raspberry and Pumpkin.

I plan on coming back for the savory pies, maybe when I'm a little bit less full from all other pies.
author: Jake B.

description:
They offer a nice assortment of pies - some traditional pies and some flavors I've never seen. 

I ordered the banana cream and it was pretty good - I'd try something else next time though. Still kind of regretting not getting the blueberry pear a la mode. 

I like the atmosphere here and I have no complaints about the service. I would come hang out with a slice of pie and cup of coffee the next time I'm in the mood for pie. 

It's a cool place and I appreciate its existence - anxious to come back soon!
author: Shane E.

description: Their vegan sweet pies are very good. Would recommend asking for them to be warmed. The vegan pot pie was also good, even as someone who isn't a fan of savory pies.
author: Josh B.

description: Cutest pie shop in one of my favorite neighborhoods. A slice of pie(or 2) with some coffee or tea would warm your soul anyway! They also have some savory options, also tasty.
author: Annie C.

description:
I'm a lookin and I'm a likin.  Well actually the bannana cream pie doesn't look so hot but it tastes delicious. Washed it down with a tall glass of cold milk and this man was quite happy!

I like lists what can I say? 

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. 

Here is a look at how I rank the SF Bakeries I've visited and I indicated what they're known for or a dish I recommend:

Rod's SF Bakery rankings (and what they're known for or what I like). ?) Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places. 
1 Neighbor Bakehouse=cinammon almond bostock
2 B Patisserie=Choco Bannana croissant
3 Zanze's Cheesecake=Regular cheesecake
4 Ariscault =Croissant
5 Yasukochis=Coffee Crunch Cake
6 Chili Pies Baking Co=Pies
7 Dynamo Donuts=donuts
8 Golden Gate Bakery=Egg tart
9 Mr Holmes Bakehouse=Green tea croissant ,Cruffin, 
10 La Luna Cupcakes=cupcakes
11 Three Babes Bakeshop=pies
12 Anthony's Cookies=Cookies
13 New Hollywood Bakery=Egg tart
14 Dianda's Italian American Pastry=Napoleon , Cannoli
15 Mission Pies=Banana Cream Pie
16 Schubert=Swedish Princess cake
17 Yummy Bakery=egg tarts
18 Stella Pastry & Café=Cannoli , Tiramisu
19 Craftsman & Wolves=Rebel within
20 Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop=any donut 
21 Noe Valley Bakery=dipped cupcake
22 Café Greco=Cannoli 
23 Kings Bakery=Tres leches cake
24 Benkyodo Co=mochi
25 Cupcake cove=cupcakes
26 Cups and Cakes Bakery=cupcakes
27 Good Mong Kok Bakery=dim sum
28 Karas cupcake=cupcakes
29 Mission Minis=cupcakes
30 Sift Dessert=cupcakes
31 Tartine Bakery=lemon tart
32 Jane The Bakery=matcha twist , cardamom Lattice Bun
33 Café Madeline=various goods
34 Panaderia La Mexicana=mexican sweet bread
35 Hot cookie=Cookies
36 Les Gourmands Bakery=Croissant
37 Mee Mee Bakery=Cow ears
author: Rod M.

description:
What they lack in effervescent service, they make up for in killer pies.  

We had to forego the righteous-looking savoury pies as we'd already eaten dinner and went straight for dessert.  My friend and I split a slice of 'Shaker' lemon pie the tip missing.  I guess it was a Shaker recipe?  Pacifist Pie Makers!  Woot!  Anyway, the pie contained slivers of what tasted like Meyer lemons and it was oh-so-tart-yet-sweet & good!  The espresso drinks were nothing to write home about, however.  

The joint was jumping on a rainy and cold Tuesday night.  Every pie lover in town was there.  I even saw the employer of my first 'responsible adult' job having pie and a chat with his wife!  

Oh, and they strive for locally-sourced (read: CA-wide) ingredients.  Good on them!
author: Bea B.

description:
Don't come here on pi day if you want pie!

I must have been crazy to think that a place that sells pie and promotes they're having a special on their slices of pies on pi day I would get pie. And I dint but not the kind I wanted and not the price I wanted to pay. I felt hella silly to stand in line expecting to get any pie I want at the special pi day price and then not get anything. I guess you had to get here at 7am to get pie but damn who wants pie that early. 

My brother and I came here at noon and they only have one slice left when we got to the front of the line. Like damn they didn't even have the courtesy to maybe put a sign up stating they don't have anymore slices of pie left. Damn then you were kinda forced to buy whatever is there and its not that great and triple the price you were wanting to pay for pie. Damn and we didn't get any forks to eat our pie either, wtf?! By the way they had hella pies on the racks. Given I don't know if they were saving them for customer orders but shit be prepared for the customers coming throughout the day! 

I will not be coming back!!
author: Denice D.

description:
Staff needs to ditch the attitude. 

I know they hate making pies, or it appears that the workers who I have encountered there do, but why must they insist on belittling customers who ask for a humble piece of pot pie?

I get treated more kindly, and more humanly, at a truck stop.
author: L. J.

description:
My boyfriend brought me here for the first time for my banana cream pie fix on my birthday a couple years ago.  I've been hooked since then! They have some standards (like the banana cream!) that they carry all year and exceptionally delicious seasonal favorites.  The frangipane is my favorite with the perfect almost paste texture and it's not too sweet.  

My favorite thing about this café is that they offer savory pot pies, gallettes, stews, and salads.  Everything I've had here is fantastic and I often have pie for dinner and dessert.  Talk about indulgent! The ingredients are very high quality and everything is delicious.
author: Jessica L.

description:
We celebrated President's Day with pie (a Walnut Tartlet, actually). Love this place. We'll be back for the savory pies. :)

Prompt service. Smiley employees. Lots of light. Eco-conscious script (the writings on the walls). Delightful all the way around. :D
author: Judith E.

description:
My new favorite place. They aren't pretentious, which is so gaddamned refreshing when it comes to people doing good things. 

Mission Pie is invested in using local ingredients, working with youngsters to help them build a career & being ecologically sane. And they make really good pies! 

It smells so so so good in here. There is plenty of space, and a relaxed, friendly and content vibe.
author: Em L.

description: Great place to go if you want mediocre overpriced pie and vagrants cutting in line with full support of the inept staff. Better to try tartine, dandelion or Dynamo donuts if you want sweets nearby.
author: Shaban S.

description:
I've never been super into pies until I met Mission Pie! We love their mixed berries pie. Anything with berries in our pies have been delicious. The pies are made to perfection. If I wasn't a pie person before, I am now!

I have a huge sweet tooth and was surprised when the pie wasn't overwhelmingly sweet. It had a subtle sweetness to it and it worked so well! It was light and tasted so fresh. The crust is to die for and the pie is topped with a delicious crumb topping. I could eat the crumb topping alone and be happy.  

Our all time favorite pie is the Mixed Berries, which is only in season during the summer. We also like the apple huckleberry pie. Honestly, we have tried a couple of pie slices that we weren't a huge fan of but the ones that we really love are definitely worth the 5 star review. We tried the Pear Frangipane which was not our favorite. The pear flavor was too light and it didn't quite hit the spot. 

Anytime we come to the city, we bring back a pie. $22 a pie is steep but for us, it's all worth it! Cash only!
author: Victoria N.

description: Good pie but super expensive. $27 for a banana cream pie is $10 too much in my opinion. It was as standard as you'd get at any pie shop and not worth the extra cost. Very tasty but too expensive.
author: Ron P.

description: I honestly have to say I have experienced better.....much, much better. Maybe it is my fault, going in I had huge expectations. The article I had read written on this place said Mission Pie was an absolute, do not miss, eat pie here before you die place. I cannot agree with that. The crust on the Pumpkin Pie was bland, the pie filling was flat and forgettable. I was so hoping the hype was going to carry over into the taste but for me it did not. Unfortunately, NOT yum.
author: M T.

description: I've just never had a bad experience here. The workers are always friendly and they have just the right thing when you're craving a late night mini pie and don't want the standard grocery store pie that was made days ago. My favorite has got to be the apple pie. Buy a mini and share with a friend!
author: Leina K.

description: Been wanting to try this place for the longest time. Can't wait. Didn't know it was sit in style but you can sit and dine in.  they also have tarts, some food pies like chicken pot pie, and of course every poe can come a la mode. Best pie I've had in a long time. I tried the pear raspberry, SO GOOD.
author: Dee C.

description:
Basically here's how my day went:

9 am: Oh man, I wish I could have some pie for breakfast.

1:30pm: Pie would sooo hit my sweet spot right now.

5pm: My o my, I want pie.

8pm: Can I have pie for dinner?

11pm: Pie o pie... dammmit, I really want some pie.

2am: Omg, you know what I'm really craving? BANANA....CREAM....PIE!!!!!!

MY MISSION (and new year's resolution) : EAT MORE PIE!!!!
author: Angela W.

description: Banana cream pie has consistently been OFF THE HOOK SLAP YOUR MAMA GOOD. Creamy, smooth, crust perfect on this one. Coffee strong but never bitter. Slightly pricey for mini pies, which was soggy in the middle and the crust wasn't as good as the banana cream.
author: Bianca U.

description:
Delicious food not just pies. First time to try pies here. Also had veggie pocket pie simply delicious especially since I like meat. 

It can be a little wait but worth it
author: remy m.

description:
Who doesn't love pie?

Seeing as their pumpkin pie was sold out that day, I got my favorite flavored pie: banana cream with an added scoop of Strauss Family vanilla bean ice cream. All the workers I interacted with were super friendly and welcoming. 

The pie itself was on the smaller side for what I paid ($4 for the pie + $1.50 for ice cream), but it hit the spot. The crust was flakey and buttery, and the ice cream really complemented the pie.
author: Mina K.

description: Coffee was not hot and $4.50 a slice for pie that's just "ok". $26 for a whole is ridiculous. Heidi's, Sharis, even Nations pies taste better and are less expensive. Tried it, won't be back. Mostly because the coffee was not hot and not a fan of the pie crust.
author: Lilian L.

description:
A Pie Shop that offers various flavors of pie= 5 stars

Everything was very good, but not the best I've had. There's better banana cream pie at Tartine, better crust from 3 babes, but Mission Pie has pretty everything you want for your pie cravings.
author: Yuchi C.

description: I saw this place in an article about amazing pies in the U.S., so I had to try it. The banana cream pie was amazing! It was perfect and light enough that you want to go back for seconds!
author: Kinsey B.

description:
Sweet and savory pies are excellent. Great range from crunchy to soft, tart to sweet and a lot in between. I've had lemon, pumpkin, berry and savory, all excellent. Sweet pies come with fresh whipped cream, not the junk from a can so many places try to pass off as cream.

One drawback: seating is a bit limited.
author: Stiofan O.

description:
Very chill place with lots of people chit chatting over coffee and pie on a Sunday. 

They had savory and sweet pies, but I ended up getting slices of plum frangipane and peach raspberry pies to go.

I liked the crust and all. However, I am almost positive that they used canned peaches for their peach pies. Trust me, I've had my fair share of being a frugal college student for four years to know the difference.
author: Tina C.

description: I'm so stuffed right now because I just had two, yes two, slices of chess pie. And the slices are hearty. After a long hike on one of the hottest days in SF, I hit up Mission Pie because they are 100% reliable and that's what you need when your hunger and all the heat has turned you into a monster. The staff are knowledgable and PASSIONATE about quality ingredients and pie and service. This place is my haven. I can always trust that what I'm eating was carefully made up of consciously selected ingredients. So if you appreciate all those things too, you need to come here. Plenty of seats and windows.
author: John R.

description: Wow, wow, wow... This little place is amazing. We came here to pick up pies for our friends wedding and had breakfast there. My hubby had apple blackberry which was super yummy and tasted like something a grandma in an 1890s farm made. My daughter had the the pumpkin, silky smooth and spicy! I had the potato tart which was out of this world! Layers of mushrooms, cheese, onions, potato, and yams! Oh man I want more right now! The coffee was ok but the only sweetener seemed to be sugar and brown sugar. I do like a sugar alternative.
author: Brittany C.

description: This was a cute little stop on our Mission food crawl. We got two slices of pie to try amongst the 4 of us. We could have eaten so much more but like I said this was just one stop on our food crawl! We had the Early Apple and Peach pies. Both were superb and really cooked perfectly. We heated up the Apple and ate the Peach cold. It didnt matter temperature though they both were great! I would definitely go back and try their quiche and other snacks!
author: Vanessa M.

description: I've been a couple times in the past couple of years, and it is a great place for the Mission. I really enjoy pies and love their selection. My only complaint is the whip cream. Nonetheless, wonderful decor and I will be back.
author: Mike I.

description: Delicious and fresh ingredients.  I especially love the mixed berry and banana cream pie.
author: Marie V.

description: My sister and I come every Wednesday now!! I highly recommend the raspberry pear pie and the lemon pie. You have to really love lemons for the lemon pie! Served with strauss ice cream, which happens to be my favorite. Clean, nice urban vibe.
author: Cheska P.

description: We ordered coffee and black berry apple pie.  However, we only found a single blackberry in the slice.  I'm not sure if that's how the pie was made but they provided another slice.  The second slice was the same. I guess I expected more blackberries, at least more than one, in a pie that is labeled Apple black berry.  I have been here before and I probably will make it my last. There are so many other places to get a good pie/dessert.
author: Frank A.

description:
A small super friendly organic locally sourced, vegan friendly pie joint.  Amazing vegan pot pies, vegan dessert pies, etc.

It's got a very local coffee shop type feel with all distressed wooden tables, chair, and flooring.

I love it.
author: Matt T.

description:
Damn good pie! Not great pie, but good pie! Great place to curl up in a sunny window like a cat, with a slice of banana cream. 

They also do a promotion where thy give you a whole pie if you buy books! It's a great way to get pie with your culinary knowledge!
author: Raven P.

description:
I honestly haven't eaten very much pie, so it's difficult for me to compare Mission Pie against anything. However, after venturing in here one evening after dinner, we decided to give one of the seasonal fruit pies a whirl -- nectarine blueberry!

$7.00 for a "mini pie" seemed pricey, but it ended up being pretty darn large (and we saved half of it), so it didn't feel as bad spending the loot (standard pie slices were $3.50/each). 

The pie had a flaky crust and incredibly fresh fruit. It didn't have much added sweetness, which was nice, because you really got to enjoy the fruit in its natural form. We got a dollop of whipped cream on top, as well. I thought would add more to the pie, but it sort of lacked flavor and didn't do much for me. The plain pie was just as good without cream, so save yourself the cals.
author: Mansi A.

description:
My life is better because of Mission Pie. So tasty, so healthy, with truly lovely souls making it the lovely restaurant that it is. 

If you are looking for a hearty meal, try granola with yogurt and one of their suppers. If you are thinking that this may not be the most harmonious flavor combo, just know that all who have tried it are hooked!

Hope to see you there sometime.
author: Matt W.

description: Saw the reviews came here and was disappointed AVOID the pumpkin pie and the banana cream just so so. The best pumpkin pie is in half moon bay at HMB bakery
author: Ray Y.

description: Had two slices of pie to go. I think apple and cranberry and pear and raspberry. Delicious combo, pies were too sweet for me but not overly sweet. A bo
author: Zainab J.

description: Savory food & dessert pies in the same spot. Cool environment complete w/ a kids table. Berry chess pie w/ whipped cream was yum. Wish it had more crust though. Open till 10. Reasonable prices. Will come back!
author: Chayla G.

description: UH-Mazing pies. Like, forreal. Tried the banana creme and the mixed berry. Wasn't expecting much out of the mixed berry but wow, both were incredible. I sometimes think about having Postmates deliver some to me but then I think about their delivery charge and I change my mind.
author: Zara H.

description:
Would have given 5 stars but I don't know what's wrong w the waitress/bus boy. She dropped dirty plates in the bin really loud like having passive aggressive attitude toward her job. 

Pie and quiche are excellent.
author: Bh Y.

description: banana cream pies!!!! i'm not a big fan of bananas but damn, the banana cream pies here are my jam!
author: Helen P.

description: A wonderful place eat and just be. Pie sure, but I really like their savory, healthy meals as well. Not only is the food exceptional, but their inclusive, neighborhood-friendly business model is good for the Mission.
author: J J.

description:
The pie offerings here are a bit hit or miss. Wandering around Mission yet again, my friends and I find ourselves craving some pie, so we drop by Mission Pie, crossing off yet another item on my ever-growing checklist of food (well, mostly bakeries and dessert), and order a slice each of banana cream and peach blackberry at $3.85 per, and a mini pot pie, which we are told requires 15 minutes to bring out.

No problem we say, as we have our other two slices to momentarily keep the three of us occupied. The banana cream pie, like others have stated, is delicious - light, not overly sweet, with an excellent custard filling and tasty crust. The peach blackberry, albeit still tasty, was far less stellar. The pot pie, when it finally came out, was a disappointment - lukewarm and quite bland (and it takes a lot for me to consider something bland), I'm glad I'm already full from the much tastier banana cream pie by this point.

So while I'm sure I'll be back, I may just stick to their sweet pies in the future (a shame, considering their savory pies and quiches SOUND delicious). Also, bear in mind that they're cash-only, so plan accordingly.
author: Johnny W.

description:
Mission Pie will make men LOVE you.

Seriously! 

J and D mentioned that they wanted to try Mission Pie.  So being the food enabler that I am, the next time I saw them, I brought along my favorite Mission Pie:  Banana Cream.  The combo of pie crust, bananas, pudding, and whipped cream is IRRESISTIBLE.

And apparently, now so am I.  

Later that night, I got pie texted.  The messages said, "thanks for the pie.  We both LUV you" and "now both have a crush on you."

SWEET.

------------------

UPDATE 6/2011:  Got quiche?  Mission Pie does.  http://bit.ly/mxrMN5
author: Amy C.

description: If you have a specialty shop, you better be damn good at it. Like when you just focus on pies, your crust better be amazing and your fillings, too. Methinks not, Mission Pie. I had a pear wine-infused galette. The pie crust was so bland and boring. Then, I went back thinking that your quiche may be better. Nope. The brussel sprouts were overcooked and bland, the egg was like a non-sweet flan, and the cheese was non-existent. The crust was bland and hard. Seriously? So heartbreaking to see a pie shop with so much hype have nothing exciting to bring to the table (literally).
author: Michelle M.

description:
Pork pozole pot pie, chicken pot pie 
and banana cream pie-YUMMMM!!!!
author: Neni E.

description:
I don't know why but I can never catch a break on the flavors here! Maybe I need to come when they open so everything glorious sounding on their menu hasn't already been devoured. I'm always left with the shaker lemon, which I'm not a big fan of... 

The pies I do love, though, are the banana cream and apple. I could've sworn the banana cream used to have chocolate, but I guess no longer.
author: Trish A.

description:
I went here on 4th of July in search of yes, you guessed it, PIE!

I looked at fellow YELPERS Reviews in order to get an idea of what to expect and for suggestions of what to order. Thanks everyone!

What I've noticed about pie places is that it's a hit or miss in terms of what pie varieties are available for the season and the time of day. My friend and I went around 3pm, which is already almost closing time.

We got 2 pies: one for the shop and one for on the go.

The berry pie tasted like berries but the entire piece was missing something...SWEETNESS. We also got fresh whipped cream on it which was not very fluffy and going into a liquid state. Maybe the berries weren't very ripe for that batch. I'm not sure.

The seating area was cute. Customers were sitting happily and drinking water from glass jars (recycling, nice touch!). I really liked how you could see the Mission Pie folks constructing pie from the counter and around the side by the bathroom. The walls display all their awards from the past years which is great to see.

As I said, we got not 1, but TWO pies.
For later we had the peach pie. That one was delicious! It had the right amount of sweetness and the crust was amazing.

Thanks MIssion Pie for making my 4th of July extra special! Not to mention, the shop is located in the very fun and vibrant Mission District.

Until next time, happy eating!
author: Valerie A.

description: I've had the banana creme, walnut and the pear raspberry pies which were all incredibly delicious so, I decided to order an entire apple pie for a party. The apple pie looked delicious when I picked it up. A few hours after I picked up the pie, I reheated the pie because, I enjoy eating my pie warm. When I took the pie out of the oven there was an eggy smell to it, the moment I cut the pie open the syrup was watery, I bit into a couple of the apples and some were sour and not appetizing and others were too soft to enjoy. The pie was mostly air which was disappointing. I would have gone back to Mission Pie but, when I got home from picking my pie up the receipt wasn't with my order even though the cashier asked me for one and I had said yes to a receipt. Mission pie have some great pies but, the apple pie I ordered was not worth the $27.
author: Lilly M.

description: Customer service was meh - they messed up our order and the pie wasn't really that great. I wouldn't go back.
author: Em O.

description:
I loved the Banana Cream Pie. I never go out to a pie place just for a slice of pie, until now. It was very custardy & smooth. Although I'm a huge fan of graham cracker (a la Marie Callenders ) type of crusts. The crust was very crispy and flaky. A friend of mine ordered the pear/raspberry which was also very good. I would describe it as refreshing. Especially the pear. The raspberry was pretty tart, as expected. And as crumby as it was, it wasn't crummy at all! 

The place was cute and appropriate in size. Very comfy. They provide pie books, other books, and blank books to write or draw in. The stories you'll find are hilarious. I'll mosdef be coming back!
author: Krystal A.

description: Besides the fact there might be a out-side-street lady randomly (at small times) halting you.... THIS PLACE IS PIE! YOU, anyone, better shoot you bum here and love !
author: Michael A.

description: This is an adorable little country style spot right on Mission St. I stopped in for some pie after having a burrito for lunch at La Taqueria. I'm so glad that I did! They sell pies by the slice, mini pies, and whole pies. You can also get quiche, chicken pot pie, and ratatouille. I sampled the banana cream pie and it was delicious! I love the country decor including a little children's area and bar stools that are made of tractor seats. Glasses of wine or beer are for sale if you want to make a night of it. You can even buy baskets of fresh fruit and flowers.
author: Kari G.

description: When I first moved to san Francisco 6 years ago, I was still trying to get to know the city, and decided to walk around the mission and stumbled upon this gem of a place. they had less workers at the time and different décor, but their banana cream pie continues to be the best banana cream pie I have ever had!. I later introduced this place to other friends and family and they have all loved it! I recently went back after 2 years that I moved to the east bay and it amazing what they have done with the place. It looks great and everything is still soooooo delicious!
author: A M.

description:
Mission Pie is an awesome place! All the pies are pretty much reheated when you come.

== Food ==

I haven't had a bad pie here at all.

Banana cream pie is the best pie I had here. Good creaminess.

Walnut pie is really nutty great!

== Service ==

Quick in and out most of the time. Sometimes there's a line of 5 people who take a long time to decide or pay... but whatevers... pie awaits.

== Overall == 

Best place in town for pie!
author: Steven B.

description: The banana cream pie is really all that.  It's creamy and has the perfect amount of sweetness and banana-ness.  The mixed berry pie was also delicious and the whipped cream balanced the tartness well.  I'm a crust girl though, so I wish the crust was a little more dense, but I'd still go back for more.
author: Jina R.

description:
After a lovely afternoon doing some bargain hunting in the sunny mission I was due for some sustenance. I was feeling slightly down on myself after a Mexican woman told me they didn't make cowboy boots that would fit "my people."   She simply meant they didn't have a size 12 due to a lack of 6 foot Latino customers but I was still sad that I would have to survive another day without that gorgeous pair of Alligator skin shit kickers. 

So on to Mission pie to gorge myself.  I ordered a slice of their rhubarb strawberry with whipped cream and I was happily scarfing it down when in walked who I can only assume to the future dictator of America.  The young Chinese lad was all of two feet tall and 45 pounds but he moved with the presence of a true leader.  His stiff legged stomping mimicked the military march of a communist soldier as his parents trailed behind him.  When he arrived at the counter he gave one final stomp and then raising his hand in what appeared to be a "heil Hitler"  stated firmly "Give me Pie!!!"    He didn't even flinch when his mother told him to add a please to that.  

Now I don't know who this kid was or where he got his training, but one day when the economy collapses and pie is the sole form of nutrition in some post apocalyptic Pie Society  I am fairly certain that this kid is going to be our leader.  And I will be standing next to him.  I don't know what my job title will be, but I know that I don't want to be on his bad side.
author: Dru P.

description:
This is the ONLY place in SF that I've seen with such rave reviews that has completely fallen flat.

My wife and I went here with high expectations and really looking forward to finding a great pie place. Were we disappointed! We ordered the Asparagus Quiche, Banana Creame Pie and Lemon PIe. All of them fell flat. The quiche was nothing to write home about. For $4 each, I was expecting something a little filing or something really tasty. These pies were neither.

Its hard to mess up a Banana Cream pie, so the filling was all right, but the pie base was really just so-so. The lemon pie gave a bad after taste. Service was all right (+1 star for that), and reached a low point when the waitress nearly made the piece of pie fall over when she slammed it on our table.

Never again... SF has way too many other options for a nice treat that going back here again.
author: Anwar H.

description: Chicken pot pie and hip-hop on the speakers. This place has my heart with the best chicken pie I've ever had. Service is friendly and quick. Place is clean and convenient. We've gone twice this week.
author: Renee F.

description: I had their pie for the first time last night (mixed berry) and decided it was so good I would come back today! but this time I decided to try their pork verde stew and both are delicious! the pie wasn't too sweet and the crust was buttery and delicious. the stew tastes wonderfully homemade, id definitely recommend it! I'll be taking friends from out of town to this gem from now on :)
author: Alyssa L.

description:
Picked up the bolognese ragu savory pie for lunch today and was not mad about it. 

- No bottom crust of the pie, which I fully appreciate, more room for that filling & less carbs for me
- The crust that did exist was flaky, though still thick & buttery
- Filling was made with great ingredients & flavor,  and full of meat ;) 

one star gone as I was expecting a bit more of a sauce feel to it, though I feel in my reheating process I may have over cooked it. Will def be back for a second attempt & leave the preheating to the professionals.

++ Friendly & knowledgeable staff
author: J A.

description:
Mission Pie, how did I not know about you?? 
I love dessert. Enough Said.

I bought a Pear Raspberry pie for a dinner party last night. Ordered earlier in the day for pickup after work. Everything worked out smooth. I was in a rush, but they had my pie ready and I was in and out the door in less than 5 minutes.

The pie was delicious. Not too sweet and plenty of fruit. 
I can't wait to go back and try the other flavors esp the banana cream.
author: Cicely T.

description: I came here and ordered 3 different fruit pies. The chess pie filling was amazing.  The pies were served cold and the crust poorly made.
author: Rhea L.

description: We got 2 pies to go - banana cream and strawberry rhubarb a la mode.  I don't eat bananas so no comment on that one.  The strawberry one though was bomb dot com.  I don't even really like pies, but this, I would go back for!
author: Joyce C.

description:
I picked up a chicken pot pie for a quick and easy dinner, and big disappointment.  For me, a good chicken pot pie starts with a nice blend of chicken, veggies, maybe some potatoes in a rich and cream "gravy" or sauce.  This filling is completely encased with good, flaky pie crust -- bottom, sides and top.

The Mission Pie version was basically chicken soup in a foil bowl with a slab of crust on top.  The filling was nothing like the saucy version I expected; it was just "watery" chicken soup, no sign of any thickening agent at all. (not bad soup, although i did add some things to spice it up a bit...but still just a chicken and vegetable soup).  The crust on top was nice and crispy...but no crust on bottom or sides.

So, if you like a chicken pot pie that is basically a chicken soup with a piece of flaky pie crust, you'll like this.  If your vision of chicken pot pie is more in line with mine, though, i think you'll be disappointed.

I may be back to try the sweet pies, but I don't think the pot pies will be on the list.
author: John R.

description:
Date & Time:  Tuesday April 21, 2009 @ 8:30pm
Company:  Sara, Justin & Michael
Crowd:  Hipster Couples & Groups
Atmosphere:  Charming
Decor:  Cozy. Counter Filled w/ Pies.  Wooden Counter-Seating, Tables for Deux & Communal Table w/ Bench Seating
Service:  Nice & Efficient
Imbibe:  Organic Taylor Maid Farms Coffee
Devour:  Walnut, Pear-Ginger, Banana & Sweet Potato Pies.  $3.50 Per Slice & $18 For Whole- Mini & Itty-Bitty Sizes too.  Savory Pies Also Available
Note:  Make Sure to Get a Pie Tomorrow for Earth Day- All Proceeds Go to The Grow a Farmer Campaign
author: Genevieve Y.

description: 80% of the reason I'm moving to San Francisco is because I miss Mission Pie too much. The place is really cute and the service is great. Mixed berry pie = LIFE. I bought a whole one once. Just for me and my boyfriend to split...yep. The first time we came here was for dinner and honestly, I didn't thought I would like it too much. I'm vegetarian and when I think savory dinner pie I think chicken pot pie. NOPE. The vegan eggplant bok choy pie they had when I was there was AMAZING. I can't wait for that seasonal pie to come back :) And their little seasonal rice salad with the tomatoes and zucchini...ugh I'm making myself so hungry. Mission Pie, I will be back so so soon.
author: Kirstie B.

description:
Eh, eh. I think I like the concept better than the execution. Now don't get me wrong, I love pie. I mean, I LOVE pie. a) who doesn't love pie, b) I'm from the Midwest (ever listen to Garrison Keillor talk about tales from Lake Wobegon? yeah, it's like that).

But this pie falls a little short. Sure the banana custard filling is tasty, and there isn't too much whipped cream on top making it overly sweet, but the crust just doesn't jive. It was like a savory tough puff pastry. A traditional graham cracker would have been soooooo much better. My buddy's fruit pie was super fruity, and again, not too sweet, so I have to give props for that (it's why this review has three stars instead of two), but there was way too much acid, and it was hard to finish. Just became overpowering after a while.

Now this makes me want to open up my own pie shop to show how it should be done.  Plus, they're cash only. Sure, I can rationalize cash-only for places with small orders, but if someone orders multiple pies, who's gonna have that much cash on them? Get with the program people.
author: Amanda S.

description:
A beautiful sunny and hot (and rare) Spring day in San Francisco made me crave refreshing Spring inspired lunch.

Mission Pie is THE PIE DESTINATION in the Mission.  Easy enough to remember. However, Mission Pie's awesomeness is not just limited to their artisinal pies. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YV9PYdUD0O4sLDz1DUk0Gw?select=hvR1syU2SQqevPt_KmN0kQ

Today, I treated myself to a sumptous and tasty lunch of
a.  PASTA WITH ARUGULA PESTO
 b. STRAWBERRY GALLETTE
 c. ICED TEA

This trio of savory and sweet, hot and cold food delivered a simple yet one of the deliciously satisfying lunches I have had in a while.

PASTA W/ ARUGULA PESTO: One bite of this cold salad woke up my palate. The simple combination of arugula, garlic , pamersan cheese and white beans produced  very refreshing and bold flavors. I  enjoyed and finished the whole bowl. $5  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YV9PYdUD0O4sLDz1DUk0Gw?select=slET-hAceGiFaBxiUoZwVw

STRAWBERRY GALLETTE: This hot round pie was oozing with the flavors of strawberries. The crust was flakey and contrasted nicely the gooey berries. So simple but so good! http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YV9PYdUD0O4sLDz1DUk0Gw?select=Cz7h4utoi3jAWemjss5UGw

ICED TEA: I considered this nice fruity drink in an ice-cold sweaty glass  on a hot Spring like today where I walked probably 10 blocks one of  life's simple pleasures! http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YV9PYdUD0O4sLDz1DUk0Gw?select=rWbEyE_kIYjTkOYKe38cSg

During my previous visits, I also had : 

PERSIMMON GALLETTE WITH BLUE CHEESE AND WALNUT:. The sweetness of the persimmon satisfied my sweet tooth and the blue cheese was its perfect creamy-savory accompaniment.  The filling was very tasty but the crust was overly crispy because the server left my pie too long in the oven when he reheated it.  ($5.50)

COFFEE: I paired it up with one of their coffees from Latin America. What a lovely meal!

DECOR:
Pies are made in the open kitchen and baked in big industrial oven that is  visible in the dining room. The pie flavors are handwritten on the chalkboard wall. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YV9PYdUD0O4sLDz1DUk0Gw?select=f1PwJZRASODkqnBYTOqh5w

Mission Pie is spacious, rustic and charming. The  almost floor to ceiling wraparound windows make the place bright. You will get a nice view of the bustling Mission Street. A long communal table is also available but plenty of tables for solo or group.

AMBIANCE: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YV9PYdUD0O4sLDz1DUk0Gw?select=mvRVzi8AJBQQMl12IzB4SQ
Aside from the irritating group who was having their staff meeting at Mission Pie (I do not need to hear how you are trying to get your Federal funding! I am running away from work myself!), the place provides a nice reprieve from the 9-5 over a cup of coffee and delicious pie.
 
PRICE: 
Sweet pies are pricey at $20 or more and savory pies are $26. Slices are more affordable at $5.50 http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YV9PYdUD0O4sLDz1DUk0Gw?select=XL8fcbDPSvDW-bcnd80mBg

FLAVORS:
They change weekly. Check their website for the pies available as well as community work they do such as Youth Advocacy.
 
Some of their savory pies are:
 *Persian galette 
*Corned beef and cabbage galette 
*Cauliflower and olive quiche 
* Potato gratin tart with braised fennel 
* Beef chili tamale pie 
* Chicken pot pie 
* West African Peanut Stew pot pie Vegan 

A sign at the restaurant says: "Mission Pie is a corner café, bakery, and neighborhood gathering place."

For me, Mission Pie is  my "Pie in the Sky" in the Mission. 

TAB: Iced Tea, Pesto Bowl and Gallette $14
 
CASH ONLY.
author: Leah E.

description: So amazing! Apple pie a la mode is the way to go! Can't wait to try rhubarb next time
author: Joy Z.

description:
They have a great, welcoming space here. High ceilings, floor to ceiling windows, and a nice breeze. Who can say no?

I came here years ago and wasn't too impressed. Never wrote a review. 

I'm finally back and the verdict is about the same. Craved butter and dough today; came to Mission Pie (MP) for a chicken pot pie ($7).  I prefer the Grove's chicken pot pie for the flavor. I like the pie crust and chicken chunks of MP, but it's not salty enough. 

Got a mini strawberry pie ($7) to go... And it was pretty tasty. Also, none of that rhubarb business that I hate. Strawberry all the way!
author: Erika C.

description: The only negative thing about this place is the weight you'll gain because you cannot resist the temptation of going back again..and again..and again !
author: Sudeep S.

description: I love the pies here! They have seasonal pies which can be extremely yummy and fresh. Simple and tasty
author: Priyanka P.

description:
God, these people do pie right. I've never been disappointed with any sweet pie I've tried. Sure, $22 for a pie can seem a little steep... but (1) this is San Francisco, and (2) pie is happiness. 

Pear raspberry is out of this world.  Friends rave about the pumpkin and banana creme. 

Only real tip? Buy some vanilla ice cream. Scoop it on top of your take-home pie. Wallah!
author: Tiffany K.

description:
One of my favorite spots in the entire city!
Mission Pie has such integrity and an extremely warm welcoming atmosphere.
There pie is out of this world to top it all off.
Plus, they now have $10 CA grown flower bundles!? Can this place get any better. SO UNIQUELY AWESOME.
author: Diane V.

description:
I had been craving pie so I was oh so happy when a friend suggested we get dessert here. I had a slice of the banana cream pie and my friend had the berry pie. The pie was pretty good. It was a little too heavy on the cream but a basic banana cream pie. The ambience of the cafe was very relaxing and nice and everyone who worked here was friendly. 

The best part was we got there at the end of the night so they put out a plate of muffins and scones for us to take home for FREE! YAY for free breakfast! :)
author: Grace C.

description:
One of my favorite places, I love the potato tart! I am a sucker for desserts so I will always spring for that too and they are tasty. The crust is delicious and I pay particular attention to pie crusts as it is my favorite part.

They offer their pie crust dough for sale, and I've purchased it before when being lazy..
author: Ayo R.

description:
I feel this place deserves 3 1/2 stars, but since that isn't an option let's go with 4 stars.  It feels like more of a conveyer belt type of place, than a sit down and relax type place.  We had a piece of walnut pie heated with ice cream and a piece of banana cream pie.  The walnut pie was great...not overly sweet....the ice cream was very tasty as well.  The banana cream pie was yummy and tasted very fresh.  We definitely enjoyed our pie, but it did seem a tad pricey for the size of the slice.  

The service was good...no complaints.

It's also located super close to Bart which makes it a convenient location.
author: Susan L.

description:
We stopped here for dessert one evening after having dinner nearby.
We were able to get a spot directly in front of the door. It was pouring out, and we thought this was a good sign.

Wow, we were WRONG!

We decided to try two pieces of pie.
My husband got the banana cream, and I got the lemon, The description of the lemon sounded so interesting, my husband (who's not normally a  fan of lemon desserts) even wanted to try it.

Ew, ew, ew.....The  pie has actual slices of lemon in it that are candied overnight....Well, overnight isn't enough. There's a reason why most recipes only call for a zest of lemon rind and not the whole thing. 
The taste was beyond bitter, and the pieces were way too hard and chewy. 
The pie was literally inedible. I nibbled at  the crust and the tiny bit of curdlike substance within it, and was totally disappointed.

My husband's banana cream pie was a big loser too. It was totally bland.

I love what this shop is doing for the community, but the pie was just plain awful.
author: Amanda G.

description:
Items selected:

Walnut
Plum Frangipane

Opening later than I'd guessed - 9am on Sunday - thus letting me explore the Mission a bit further while I waited for the Closed sign to flip to Open, Mission Pie was one of those places I'd always been meaning to visit but never made the time for; thankfully it was worth the wait.  A rustic spot with rustic food including a few scones and muffins it should go without saying that although I'm sure those items were good the real reason to visit is the pie and with over a dozen options on the shelf that day I chose one slice for myself and deferred to the cute young lady behind the counter for the other, a slice of Plum Frangipane and Walnut, respectively.  Topping both off with house made whipped cream the early morning scene was hipster-free and much like everything else in the area the quality of the locally sourced items truly shined in both desserts - magnificent plums with a tinge of almond overlying butter, flaky crust in one hand and caramelized walnuts, toasty and slightly bitter in the other - it was only the fact that I had more dining plans shortly thereafter that prevented me trying the apple or peach.
author: Michael U.

description:
They were out of most of their pies around 8pm on a Tues. Had shaker lemon pie and it was bad. Imagine unpeeled, thin sliced lemons cooked in a pie crust. Bad. But! The cashier who recommended the lemon pie was awesome and let me switch to a mixed berry slice, which was delicious. 

Also, they mixed up our tea order and we ended up with oregano tea. Do not order oregano tea.

I like their mission, and the staff is so friendly, but I don't see myself craving a piece of pie from here anytime soon.
author: Nike A.

description: Banana cream pie was perfect sweetness.  I've tried many kinds before.
author: Thomas C.

description:
This place is amazing!

First of all: It's on the corner so don't walk past it. They have the cutest sign out front with a Pie Tin, look for that.
Inside is woody and rustic. There's a bookshelf full of cooking books, long tall wooden tables and benches, a coffee bar.. and then finally, THE PIE!!
It all always looks soo delicious. The mixed Berry is by far my favorite but I haven't tried all of them yet. 
They tie the pies to-go with a twine string that you can carry. VERY CUTE !! I LOVE IT!!
I got a small cappuccino to-go and the cup they gave me was not only COMPOSTABLE, THE LID WAS THE POTATO PLASTIC! It made my heart melt and my eyebrows straighten with love...
Thanks Mission Pie! I've only to-go'd but I will definitely come in one day on a lunch date to sit and eat pie and talk over good coffee and sweets.
author: Elizabeth M.

description: My absolute favorite pie! Also great soup and cute mason jars to buy
author: Catalina B.

description:
My wife and I came in today with our 4 year old daughter.  We've been wanting to go for a while so we may have built this place up in our heads.

It did not disappoint.  We had the blueberry pie al a mode.  It was so good that we ordered some quiche and pot pies to go for dinner.  

Another nice thing was the staff was very friendly and polite.  The other patrons were too.  We sat at a large round table with a couple of other guys and they had a very friendly conversation with my daughter.  Then my daughter had to use the restroom and a group of four women let her cut in .

The pie was 5 stars and so were the pot pie and quiche later for dinner.
author: Michael L.

description: Not a life changing experience but decent pie.
author: Michael K.

description:
Denied by mission pie.

7 friends on a pie crawl and had the amazing idea to order a full banana cream pie and share.  All we needed was one pie and 7 spoons.  

but noooooooo  they don't let people order full pies and eat them there.  you have to go out side in the cold if you want to eat a full pie.

their excuses reasons for not letting us buy a full pie and eat it there included:
1.  it's too messy (uh.. we are just eating pie.. how is it messy)
2.  it is too hard to cut a pie into 7 pieces. (but we didn't want it cut)

lame.
Lame
lame.

we consoled ourselves by sharing two slices of banana cream pie and one of pear raspberry.

they were tasty but the fun factor was lost.

mission pie i dub you an enemy of fun!
author: Meredith K.

description: The people here are really nice and the overall atmosphere is really chill and great! I personally love the banana cream pie because of the pudding-like texture, but then, I haven't tried any other flavor yet, so who knows? Maybe there's a better flavor? But to each their own ^_^
author: Jessamine L.

description: Ordered pear/apple and pumpkin pies for Thanksgiving Dinner. Pies where delicious and the whole experience was Great!
author: John C.

description:
Saturday, 9:00PM.

Crazy for pie! Yup, that's us!

Quickie:
+++Transparency: source of ingredients listed on column
+Clean 
* More beverage selection, por favor!

Final call:
Will try the savory pies some day. In the meantime, keep lining up the sweet ones.

**********
Stuffed my face in:

1. Banana cream
     +Light, fresh taste
2. Mixed berry
     +Tart-to-sweet-to-tart-to-sweet, yum!
author: Chuck N.

description:
I have grown up in the city and still have the image of the mission as a place you don't go to after dark.  Being a huge pumpkin pie fan, and having a foodie girlfriend, I was pulled down to Mission Pie.

From the second I walked through the door I knew I was going to like the place.  It has a mix of being a local coffee shop with every kind of pie you can imagine.  

I have a bit of a sweet tooth and when told the pumpkin pie was, "More savory and had a touch of squash mixed in with it."  I was worried the food would not deliver.

All my worries were crushed and the pie was GREAT.  The experience was amazing and tea and pie cost only around $7.  Will be taking many friends to this and excited to go back.
author: Richie G.

description:
Review is for a berry/strawberry mini pie.

To. Die. For.  

My mouth was so happy.

Loved the homey atmosphere and "grandma's kitchen" vibe.
author: Alex N.

description: What a wonderful place this is! I feel like I'm back at my grandmother's kitchen...so warm and heartfelt. I love everything about this place
author: Patricia H.

description:
Disappointed they didn't have my absolute favorite apple pie when I came - but I guess sometimes the world doesn't revolve me. 

Regardless, it was still in my favor because it prompted me to try their peach/blackberry pie. My friend also got the banana cream pie + vanilla ice cream, which I got to taste a sample of. 
When our pies came out, I was a little sad because the slice was pretty small... I LOVE PIE so maybe next time I'll get a whole pie to myself, hahah. 

Their ice cream was definitely of an interesting texture.. appeared almost matte in appearance... if that made any sense. 
Their crust was yummy. 
Both pies were delicious. Like seriously. I don't even like bananas that much and I enjoyed the banana cream pie.

Maybe a little pricey? Still a good treat every once in a while.
Potentially will become a habit once I can afford to make it a habit (financially, and healthwise, haha)
author: Ashley N.

description:
We sure seem to be a society who likes our pie & I'm not gonna to tell you any different: 

American Pie - Don Mclean 
Apple Pie A La Mode - Destiny's Child 
Cherry Pie - Sade 
Chicken Pot Pie - Weird Al Yankovic 
Sweet Potato Pie - James Taylor 
Sweet Thistle Pie - Cracker 

The list goes on...... 

Heck - there's even a whole band called Humble Pie 

Well, fortune finally smiled upon us & Sis & I were able to give Mission Pie a try..... maybe expectations were too high b/c we didn't think it lived up to the hype..... AT ALL 

Banana Cream Pie - tasted more whipped cream than banana flavor. We were looking for something more pungent. Also didn't notice too many naners distributed throughout - more like thin slices here & there. Didn't hate it but didn't love it 

Potato Gratin Tart - thick layer of radicchio triggered my slime factor so only Sis had this - she said it was tasty & she'd get again but she wouldn't go out of her way to go get it 

Vegan Shepherd's Pie was described as having a base of Root Vegetables.....we saw carrots, lentils & some abundance of leafy green. Since when did lentils & leafy greens fall under the category root veggies? 

The taste was off as well - not sure what spices they used but there was just something "off" about it 

We'd be willing to give this place another try & after reading so many outstanding reviews of the place, maybe we just got a bad night but as of this review, definitely have to say "we've experienced better"
author: Adrienne G.

description:
Best banana cream pie I've ever had. The other pies are OKAY. 

Sucks they charge cash and check only for fairly expensive pies
author: Winny F.

description:
Food is good quality.

Pear rasberry pie - very very tasty...good texture and nice crust...also pears are great in pies and i was very pleasantly surprised by this discovery...just never occurred to me to have pear pie but hell yeah it's in my life now!

turkey pot pie - i was a little dissappointed on this one...it was a bit dry...had great flavors but the crust was just slightly on the burnt side and the filling was dried out

beef stew with greens and some sort of grain - DELICIOUS!!!  it's a small portion for $9 but the flavor is there and it all was cooked wonderfully.

Bowl salad with quinoa, greens, beans, almonds - best item i ate there...dressing was light, the nuts gave a great texture...beautiful and tasty salad...i would most definitely order this again if i was at this place
author: Jocelyn W.

description:
It smells amazing inside here. The smell from the baked pies and their coffee mixes together into this fantastic aroma of sweet pure awesomeness. We got the mixed berry pie. The pie was good, but a bit pricey for my tastes. The berries were nice and fresh and had a lovely tartness to it that complimented the sweet streusel and crust very well!

4/5 I want to come back and try their other pies for sure!
author: Ernest C.

description: Place is simply excellent! Happy hour from 3-7 during the week and terrific food. Chicken pie, a half salad and a beer brought me to where I needed to go. The only thing more outstanding than the food was the service. Friendly staff and the women who corrected chix pie exemplifies great customer service.
author: Alex C.

description:
This rating is based on their service and not so much for the food. I'm not a big fan of pies so I'm not sure if it is consider top notch or not.

I came here to meet with a friend for a coffee. My friend was about a hour late and I sat there waiting for a long time. About 30 minutes in my wait, I felt bad for just using their space so I ordered a coffee and a pie. The lady over the counter insisted that I didnt need to order anything while I wait. She was extremely nice and helpful.

I'm not sure whether or not refills are free, but the lady offered refill while I wait for my friend. Excellent service.

The pie tasted awesome as well. I wish they had splenda to go with the coffee though, but they did have soy milk!!
author: Wilson P.

description:
Just walking around San Fran with a friend, we suddenly saw this place, and well, who can say no to pies?
We got in and overwhelmed by the amazing smell of pie baking and friendly casual vibe.
They have a great variety, but in the end we got the a slice of banana cream pie and of apple pie - I recommend both of them!
The banana cream pie has the excellent combination of fresh banana cream and sweet and buttery crust.
The apple pie reminded me Berlin..
Worth a visit :)
author: Baryo B.

description:
What I ate: Chicken pot pie (to go), Soy chai
Visit date: December 22, 2011
First time? Indeed.

I've been eyeing this pie place for a while now. There are lots of pie choices -- savory and sweet. I decided to go for the chicken pot pie because I've heard good things. It should be noted that I'm not a chicken pot pie fan --the concept just doesn't sit well with me. I was hoping Mission Pie would change my mind, but, sadly, they did not. The crust had a weird dry/chewy texture, the chicken filling was just ok. Nothing too memorable. I found myself eating the filling only because I needed some calories, not because I was enjoying it. The chai was 'milked' down. It wasn't horrible tasting, but it was like I was drinking warm milk flavored with some spices instead of a tea with spices and milk. The warmth was nice though. 

I would give them another chance, but would definitely stay away from pot pies and chais.
author: Erin G.

description:
This is the best vegetable pot pie I have ever had in my entire life.

Note: that I didn't eat it there, I took it home and baked it for 30 minutes on 375.
author: Jason S.

description:
Walnut pie!  It's like pecan pie, but better.

The best walnut/pecan pies ever.

Near the SF symphony there is a small restaurant The Grove, which my wife and I went to before going to the symphony, we ordered pecan pie a'la mode.

It was incredible.  We found out that the pie was made here.  Absolutely, great bakery.
author: Drew P.

description: LOVE THIS PLACE! Here has the banana pie that you are never disappointed.
author: Minmindy W.

description: We had the Apple, Dutch Apple, and Banana Cream pies. Dutch Apple was probably my favorite. Banana Cream needed some more bananas. All were good but not exceptional. If you're in the area and hungry for pie you could do worse but I wouldn't make this your destination pie spot.
author: Roger H.

description: Best oatmeal raisin cookies EVER!! And the sweet pies are just as good. Im not a big fan of sweets but their pies are light and has a perfect amount of sweetness/tartness!
author: Yan H.

description:
I was glad they sold pie by-the-slice ($3.50) because I wasn't ready to commit to a $20 pie. Mostly because I don't have enough self restraint to trust myself with an entire pie.

My hubby and I had two slices with a cappuccino:
- Banana cream: MY goodness. The crust was soft, buttery and flaky. The pie was ultra creamy and had chunks of real banana. I had to restrain myself from inhaling it while I waited for my double cappuccino. 
- Cherry custard: interesting flavor but the pie itself was a bit dry. I'd opt for a different flavor next time. Maybe the walnut - that looked yummy.

I also had my eye on their rack of fruit preserves and jams - butter lemon, apricot raspberry...I meant to ask, but I'm guessing they make these in-house. I also love their eco-friendly approach - silverware rather than disposable spoon and forks, natural rather than processed sugar, and little signs reminding you to save a tree by taking only as many napkins as you need.

As I sat in Mission Pie and watched customers flow in and out, I realized just how much the area has changed over the years. When I was growing up, 25th & Mission was not a place you'd want to find yourself in at night. But now there were young couples and groups of friends, all bundled up in their hats and scarves, sitting at a corner table reading a book or on their laptops. It has changed indeed.
author: Mariela D.

description:
This is what you bring to the party.

Offer to bring dessert. And when you walk in with a pie or three from Mission Pie- -- it doesn't matter if you late. Or hog all the champagne. Just bring the pie.

It makes a statement--bringing Mission Pie. It screams that you know what is good and you are willing to find a parking space in the Mission even on a Saturday to share it.

Who would have considered a Carrot Muffin pie. If you want to go traditional-- get Apple.

And get a chicken pot pie for lunch the next day. Because pie makes all things right.
author: Dani K.

description:
Swung by here after dinner in the area.  It's pretty easy to find, but there isn't a whole lot of seating available.  I saw a bunch of people come in and order their pies to go.

They have a good variety of savory and sweet pies.  We tried the Mixed Berry Mini Pie, Walnut Pie, and the Pear Frangipane.

Long story short, they were all quite good.  I'm not a big guy on sweets, but these pies seemed to hit the nice balance of sweet without drowning out the fruit flavors.  The crusts on all of them were nice and flaky as well.

Another cool note is that they get all their ingredients locally.  They have a nifty map up on the wall showing where in CA they get all the different components for their pies.

Pie Descriptions:
The mini pie consisted of apple, blueberry, and something else reddish.  It's costs more than a slice, but it's a mini pie!  You can have a whole pie without the guilt of...well eating a whole pie.

Walnut pie was like a pecan pie, just with walnuts!  It's a sweeter flavor pie than I'd normally go for, but my buddy seemed to enjoy it plenty.

The pear frangipane wasn't actually a pie.  It was more like a fruit tart, but again like all the other pies was well balanced and the fruit came through.

The only thing that could have made the pies better is if they came heated up.  Maybe that's why everyone was taking their slices to go!  Definitely try it out, or better yet, take it home and heat it up for noms.
author: David K.

description:
It was bad enough that their price jumped up from $19 to $22 for a pie but now I think they're 
charging $27! Outrageous!
And I found a hair in the last one I bought!
Just go to Destination Bakery on Chenery.
author: Aki T.

description:
Oh YUM YUM!!!! Mission Pie edges out (ever so slightly) Peasant Pie and that's pretty impressive! I met my friends up in the Mission today and we were going to do the standard burrito and then one of my friends suggested this place. The store is a couple of blocks south of the 24th street BART station (which makes it very convenient for me!) in a little bit of a sketchy area that's gradually getting hipster-ized with various restaurants and bars. That being said, there's still a real rogues' gallery of neer-do-wells and rapscallions loitering out in the streets.

Mission Pie has an old skool feel to it with a nice big airy space, plenty of tables to sit at and a large counter that looks back into the kitchen. I say old skool because it has that classic San Francisco architecture look with the old wooden floors and big windows to watch the world go by. It is VERY clean and tidy though!

I ordered a meat pot pie for my meal and then  noticed what looked like pecan pies on a rack behind her. The nice cash register girl informed me that they were actually walnut pies, so I got a slice of one of those too. My pot pie was put in the oven for about 10 minutes and then brought out to the table piping hot with a crispy, flaky crust. The crust was delicious with a nice mellow flavor that complimented the savory meat, veggies, and fresh herbs inside. It's a singles serving pie which is somewhere in size between a Peasant Pie and a Marie Calendar pie. I didn't feel overstuffed by the time I was done eating it which was great since I still had the walnut pie to go. The walnut pie was a lot like pecan pie with the sweet filling being offset by the crunch and slight bitterness of the walnuts. It was easily as good as any pecan pie I've had!

I totally love this place and I'll be coming back again soon!
author: Jason W.

description: Love their pies! They are a bit pricey but delicious! Make sure you warm up a slice and ask for a scoop of ice cream on top! You can taste the freshness of the fruits and the ingredients they use. The strawberry/peach rhubarb is yummy and so is there walnut/pecan. YUMMMM!
author: A J.

description:
We had the pear fragipan and apple pie. Both were just ok. Crust was ok. Apples were ok. The pie slices themselves did not have generous filling for the $4 a slice price. 

The location is primo, and has great seating.
author: Nathaniel G.

description:
i finally got to try out mission pie! it has always been on my "places to eat" bucket list. (i always jot where to eat on my iphone's notes.)

i got a mini strawberry rhubarb pie with whipped cream. 

the girl at the register asked if i wanted my pie warm, i decided not to have it warm because i like majority of my pies room temp. (don't know why...) i am sure it would have tasted just as good warm. 

you would think a "mini pie" wouldn't fill you up by its name...but it sure did.

don't underestimate the power of a mini pie!!
author: Donald G.

description:
Fantastic vegan apple rhubarb 

We stuck around for a bit on a date. Like 30 minutes later they gave us each a free slice of lemon shaker
author: Alyssa S.

description: I have loved Mission Pie since my first month of moving to the Bay Area and because my fiancé and I love pie so much, we were sure that we wanted pie at our wedding instead of cake, but (as many betrothed folks do) we went on several tastings before selecting Mission Pie. And because of this, we can say that Mission Pie is FAR AND AWAY the best pie place in the Bay Area. Of course their ingredients are locally sourced and seasonally focused and of course the product is delicious (some of the best I've ever had ever) but I have to say that the most refreshing part of Mission Pie is that in spite of being an institution, they are incredibly gracious, generous and community-minded. We felt that they were a part of our wedding and genuinely cared about making our experience special. And they did. Everyone devoured our pies at the event and we enjoyed the leftovers the next day. I'm glad to say that they've got some lifelong dedicated customers here. I can't recommend them enough.
author: Jessica D.

description:
On a slow sunday morning I went to Mission Pie for a quiet brunch... It was a fantastic pie experience!

I had the steak & Guinness pie and it didn't disappoint! the crust was perfectly flakey, the filling was full of flavorful chunks of tender meat in a thick rich sauce!
author: Gordon O.

description:
Mission Pie is a cute little pie shop that makes me wish I lived in SF so I could spend a couple of hours here with a book, coffee and a slice of pie. Seems like other people have the same idea because all the seats were full! 

I ordered 1 slice of banana creme pie to test the waters. Now I don't like banana anything (except banana runts & laffy taffy) but my friends INSISTED that I try it because it was amazing. 

First bite andddd I thought it was OK. Which is pretty impressive since I hate bananas! Maybe it was my slice that day, but I liked it because it wasn't super  banana-ey and to me it had more of a custard taste to it. My other friends tried it as well and they wished it was more flavorful and tasted more like bananas. I agreed that it kinda tastes like diet banana pie. This could be great option for someone who likes pies but doesn't want to get a cavity from eating it. The crust was delicious though! I might have to buy some of the dough from there next time, they sell it refrigerated and all ready to go! 

Although I wasn't blown away by the banana creme pie (my friends led me wrong!), I will be back to try a few more of their pies and hopefully come back with a better rating cos they all look amazing!
author: Teresa N.

description: Have you ever tried the Banana Cream Pie at Mission Pie? Omg it's a must! No joke! It's so good fresh cream yummy custard and banana perfect crust and no too sweet just right!
author: Rita A.

description: First, you should know that I love pie. It's my "desert island" dessert, no question. Today's seasonal peach blackberry may be the best pie I've ever eaten. It's so good I'm violating my own rule: most places, I believe we all should share, or at least taste a bit of everyone else's selection. At Mission Pie, you'd better keep your fork where I can see it.
author: Be F.

description:
