Yum yum yum... I'm definitely not vegan but have fallen in love with their vegan pie selection, each time I've gotten it.  It's a lil pricey at $20 a pie but totally worth it because one of my friends is lactose-intolerant and often feels left out of dessert time.  You would never, never know it's vegan.  

I always just get the whole pie, to-go.  One day though, I'm going to take a group of friends and have everyone order something different, just so we can try a buncha stuff at once. hehe

Mission Pie is worth the drive, waiting and price.

See ya there!
author: Susan D.

description: Tried the banana creme pie this time and it didn't disappoint! The bomb!!! This place always delivers!
author: Maria K.

description:
You know the scene in Ratatouille when Remy sees sparkly things whenever he eats something awesome? I actually seriously experienced it when I took my first bite of pie from Mission Pie. No joke. I mean, yeah, it's pie. But when it's made so good, it really is an out of this world experience.

Aside from the awesome pies, the cute little place has a cozy ambiance with cute little things for decor. 

Their seasonal pies were good, their apple pie is awesome and banana cream pie... the best.
author: Jee S.

description: My friend had a bite of my banana cream pie and purchased a whole one to bring home immediately :)
author: Amy Y.

description:
Summary: tasty good-quality pies unmarred by the excess sugar pitfall plaguing most supermarket pies; Berkeley-esque (but cleaner) unpretentious cafe ambiance for a meaningful chat or some productive people-watching, studying or reading time. BRING CASH!

It's been on my to-eat list for a while, because I like (not-too-sweet) pie and I like finding places that are BARTable that provide the potential for a cheap but relaxed date or study/reading chill time. Perfectly matched that criteria with good pie and good space. 

After weeks of eating in and saving the monies, husband and I splurged with a whole slice of pie each! A seasonal peach-blackberry for me, and banana cream for him. The peach-blackberry definitely highlighted the natural ripeness of each fruit and I so enjoyed the crumble and (not-soggy) crust, that I ended up picking out the fruit and crumble and crust when I got too full to eat it in normal bites like a normal human being. The cream on our slice of banana cream was light and fluffy without overwhelming the banana. Husband declared it a true representation of classic banana cream pie (his other fave BCP is Wexler's Bourbon BCP with salted caramel). 

We had to run across the street to get cash from the Chase ATMs, which was a bit of a bummer, but we enjoyed our pie and decaf coffee. It ain't cheap, but it ain't Nation's in ambiance, right? I could see myself back here with a good book and another slice of pie and coffee (I also want to try their savory pies!) if I'm looking for somewhere to kill time or even just sneak in some me time. :)
author: Hannah C.

description: Bought  two pies yesterday- Dutch Apple and lemon- for a family dinner.  We devoured the pies. My favorite was the Dutch Apple. Tasty, not too sweet, and great crust. Also, the service was friendly and helpful which is a rarity these days!
author: Lynn T.

description: Though I'm not much of a pie person, the banana cream pie here totally delivered!  Freshly made and not overly sweet with a very well made crust.  Win.
author: Eric F.

description: The BEST banana cream pie! This place is always my go-to when I crave. Their apricot bar and vegan mixed berry pie are really bomb too! It's quite expensive for a slice ($4) but it's so worth it.
author: Yvonne N.

description:
I'm pretty annoyed. $20 for a pie? Fine but be amazing. (They don't take card either so bring lots of cash with you if you go here). I'm going to preface this by saying I didn't even eat any of the stuff I bought here. I just bought it to bring over to my friend.

First of all, the guy "helping" me at the counter was totally insolent. He was so slow and whatevs. I ordered some macaroons and a few slices of pie. After waiting forever to the guy to make sweet love to the pies or cut them or whatever he was doing, I open my box and find mangled looking slices. So I had to bring over dessert to my friends that looked like it had been ravaged by dogs. My friends thought the dessert was good but I was pretty disgruntled about the whole thing. Invest in some better customer service, homeskillets.
author: Hanan H.

description:
There's nothing that gets my goat like a place that's cash or check only. I never have cash and inevitably end up pulling out my checkbook like an animal hoarder buying 5 bags of cat litter at Safeway. Get square or something! This is 2013!

And yet, the buttery, sumptuous crust of the dutch apple pie and their mini apple huckleberry pie, with their chunks of juicy apple against flaky pastry, keeps me crawling back. And there's usually no line. The pie is best when warmed up and was sadly served unheated the 2nd time I went. But no matter, I took that mini pie home, popped it in the toaster oven on 350 for a few minutes, and served it up with some vanilla ice cream, then devoured it with a vengeance.

Best insulin spike of my week.
author: Selina K.

description:
My pick for best pie shop in SF. Everything from traditional pumpkin, apple, and berry pies to tarts, quishes (spelling??), chicken pot pie. Big pies, little pies, slice of pie. Ala mode. With whip. Heated or chilled. However you love your favorite pie, this is the place to be.

I was feeling a little down after work tonight and had time to kill before my BF met me to head home- or out and about. I also wanted to write my 100th review (today's my 66th as a Yelper :-). What better place to make me smile than Mission Pie? And one also deserving of the 100 review milestone.

Tonight I had the pumpkin pie with whip since it is now pumpkin season.. I wanted sweet potato pie but I was completely satisfied after taking my first bite. Other Mission pie favorites are bannan, coconut, and chocolate cream pies. Delish..

Oh and the whip cream itself deserves mentioning. Obviously homemade. Absolutely perfect.

Now 1,000,000 calories later.. lol.. I'm smiling again.

Thanks for the great pie. Thanks for the perfect and friendly service (every time). And Congrats to the newly engaged neighborhood regulars celebrating their news tonight with the staff at Misson Pie!
author: Lisa H.

description: So, our group of six pie-tasters concurred that the banana cream pie was amazing!  Also, we enjoyed the Shaker Lemon pie more than we expected to.  Lots of pie selection AND quiche and salad options as well.  Delicious!
author: Carolyn S.

description:
Best pies ever!!!

Peach Blackberry - soooooooooo good
Mixed Berry - good, but on the tart side

The savory pies were good too, but not as mind-blowing. We had the pork pappardelle pot pie (it was interesting to have noodles inside of a pot pie) and the chicken pot pie. Both had a lot of broth inside, it was almost like eating soup, it wasn't as thick as I would've expected. The crust on both the sweet & savory pies was delicious - crisp, flakey and buttery!

Plenty of seating and lots of window light.
author: Kim D.

description: Worth a visit, but not everything there is a winner.  I've had fruit pies there which were quite delicious.  However, I recently had a slice of chess pie, and it wasn't terrific.  The texture was off.  I can't put my finger on it.  Maybe it was dry, or maybe it was too solid.  The crust was unimpressive too.  Maybe it was made that day, but it didn't taste very fresh.  Best to skip it and stick with a fruit pie.
author: Lucullus L.

description:
We ( 2 adults, 2 boys) came here for lunch on a bright, sunny Saturday.  All of us opted for the staff pick: beef and cheddar pot pie.  Drinks were hot chocolates (kid-approved), apple juice and tea.  All the ingredients were sourced from California farms, including the honey and flowers decorating the tables.  While we waited for our pot pies, the literature provided enlightened us about the wasteful habits of American food consumption.  We waste 40% of the food we produce.  Luckily, that was not the case today. We gobbled up our pot pies with glee.  The beef was wholesome, as well as the chard and carrots it came with.  It's been a long time since I've enjoyed a pot pie that satisfies.  Banana cream pie was chunky, toothy, and not too sweet.  Real cream, yum.  Only caution is: the wait for the piping hot pie was 14 minutes.  Order something sweet (and instant) while you wait!
Fun tidbit: Mission Pie Ranch, 1/2 hour south of Half Moon Bay is worth a visit. The pies are doubly good after a hike along the coast!
author: Emma R.

description:
Pear raspberry = Mmm.
Pumpkin = I didn't like as much - tad too mushy/sweet.
author: An Y.

description:
I approached this place, affirmed that my Yelp ratings will not play favorites to a social cause, prepared to provide an unbiased review of the actual taste and service.  Yes, I was once a teenager, but as a big fan of sweets, I was apprehensive about the qualities of the pies created with involvement of teenagers.  After all, I couldn't tell a good pie from bad when I was a youth.  I was pleasantly surprised by what I found.

Although their address is 2901 Mission Street, entrance is located on 25th Street.  The place is small, but it has a really warm-classy feel with comfortable seating area to enjoy your time.

The teenager who took my order recommended banana cream pie ($3.50), so I got that with a large cup of coffee ($1.75).  On hindsight, I should have done 'coffee for here' ($1.50), which is one free refill.  The service was fine with no issues.

Banana Cream Pie:  Very good!  They toned down on the sweetness, so you could actually taste the fresh ingredients.  When you look closely at the cream, you can see the black vanilla dots.  

Pear Rasberry Pie:  Very good!  Nice crunchy crust with fresh pears.  Again, not too sweet.

Apple Pie:  Although I am not a huge Apple pie fan, it was very nice.  Apples were not over cooked, so texture and tartness remained.

If you are a fan of sweet pies, you need to try this place.  I think I've just found the 'Pie in the Sky' in the Mission.  With their delicious pies, they don't need to sell me on 'organic, community, health, environment, etc.' and I'll return.  With that said, I do really like Pie Ranch's idea of helping an urban school source local produce for their cafeteria.
author: トモ T.

description: Banana Cream Pie! So noms.
author: Christine C.

description:
I'd dine more often at places in the Mission street area, if it weren't such a mine field for the olfactory senses. I'm referring to the few homeless and drug addicts that wander around who think of Mission street as their personal toilet.

Have you ever played that old computer game "Minesweeper" (http://www.gameswizard.com/j_jvmine.html) in which you really never win? Well, walking on Mission street during the evening (or any other time also) is kind of like that. Odoriferous bombs await you.

If u can get pass that invisible obstacle course to reach the corner of 25th street & Mission, u will be rewarded with some nice homemade-style flaky crust pie. The store sign is on the 25th street side, but the entrance was moved to the Mission side after they remodeled.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YV9PYdUD0O4sLDz1DUk0Gw?select=EEEOmQHxHEi5rj9UmiDohA

Apparently some pies are created with ingredients grown at Pie Ranch (http://www.pieranch.org/), a bay area non-profit farm dedicated to teaching urban youth (most from Mission High School) about the natural food cycle. And some of those youths are also employed at the cafe counter, but I have never seen them. So I cannot attest to the accuracy of those statements.

This place opened in January 2007, and was remodeled/ expanded late this year. The old colorful board menu, rustic seating, eclectic decor, and various coffees and teas are gone. Replaced by an old-fashioned style wallpaper and decor, more spacious seating with small tables, big windows facing Mission street, and a self-service standard coffee carafe. I think that the new space is more relaxing. Some nights have scheduled live music.

Walnut pie w/optional whipped cream:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YV9PYdUD0O4sLDz1DUk0Gw?select=NkYD6g2k5mCg8SZPiQK0tQ

Pear ginger pie w/optional whipped cream:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YV9PYdUD0O4sLDz1DUk0Gw?select=-QIzD_s-qp6t2XcugKhs3g

Bottle of pear juice:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YV9PYdUD0O4sLDz1DUk0Gw?select=Pnazl1khP__Y35oNQcy_eQ

Window sign with store hours:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YV9PYdUD0O4sLDz1DUk0Gw?select=KQgap8iiiZ8M1EuWTxgc3w

Parking is often difficult, but easy walk from the 24th & Mission BART station.

CASH only.
author: Luis C.

description:
The banana cream pie was pretty delicious. It was sweet, but not overly sweet and it had sliced bananas in the filling. The crust was thick, but not that flaky. 
I enjoyed it, but it didnt put me in a food coma or anything
author: Connie M.

description:
Love comming here for breakfast every morning.
The goat house coffee is soo good and mixed berry pie scrumptious. 

A definate must
author: dimitri c.

description:
Strawberry rhubarb pie!! Yummy!
All of their pastries are delicious.. Very informal coffee house atmosphere.
author: M F.

description:
Places like these make San Franciso the second greatest city (after NYC) ofcourse.

This place sells really good pies. We went late evening before my flight to DC. She had a vegan pie and I had a pear raspberry pie which was mind blowing. 

We had dinner already so i could not sample the savory pies and the Banana cream pie.

This place reminds me  so much of williamsburg, brooklyn and the east village and the staff and customers are chilled out.

If any girl is not in love with me as soon as i say Hello, she will be as soon as i bring her to mission pie and  she eats a slice of pie heaven.  

well.. i wish... let me get back to you on that one, but the pie is still excellent and I am convinced the way to a woman's heart is by getting her some mission pie.

I will definitely be back here whenever i come back to San Francisco.
author: Oculus C.

description:
I used to work across the street from here and went in often in the morning for a cup of coffee. They often switch their roasts so it was great trying their different flavors. 

My favorite pie that they serve is the Banana Cream Pie. The filling is creamy with lots of natural banana flavor in it with a flaky buttery crust.

Sometimes I would order a slice of quiche for lunch as well as they're pretty filling. Their pot pies sell out quickly and are quite delicious.

Love how they try to use as many local ingredients as possible. Super friendly people as well.
author: Kitty K.

description:
Dined here for the first time and I was quite excited to try a savoury pie since it's been a while since I've had one. We ordered the Moroccan and chicken pie, and both arrived on our table nice and hot. Overall the pies were ok, but I wouldn't consider it t be great. I felt like it was a little bland, and lacked some spices to liven it up a bit. We were really stuffed after that we weren't able to try a sweet pie. Perhaps on our next visit, we can try some.

With regards to service, they were great and very friendly.
author: Camille A.

description: Yes, the pie is tantalizing and worth a visit if you're in the neighborhood. Living up to its name, Mission Pie does indeed serve pie. Living up to San Francisco hipster hype, it only serves pie. If you don't like pie, you're out of luck. Once again, they serve pie.
author: Alex C.

description:
Decent Pie + Charming Environment + Progressive Food = Wonderful. 

This place, to me, embodies all the things that a good business should be.  You can read up on their mission and values on their website; I won't go into too much detail here.  

I think this place deserves several stars just for the social justice aspect and for being a model for other for-profits looking to do the same.  I've been having more conversations with friends lately about how to think and talk about food in a more meaningful and productive way instead of just OMG FOOD IS GOOD YUM YUM YUM EAT!  And I think Mission Pie helps us do just that, demonstrating all the ways in which food can be a force for good - in building community, in empowering youth, in supporting a healthy Earth. 

That's where the first two stars come from.  

The next star is for the aesthetics of the place.  I've only been here in the evenings, when the place is softly lit, with cozy furniture and a nice homey charm.  It's just really simple and nice.  

And then I'll give one more star for the pies themselves, which are good, but didn't blow me away.  I've tried several varieties, and was happy with the fresh eats, but to be honest, the pies aren't the main draw for me.  (That's why I'm leaning towards 4 stars instead of 5.)

However, I still really like this place.  Some of my favorite kinds of adventures are the quiet, creative ones you go on with your friends, when you're just sitting together, eating food in a comfortable place like Mission Pie.  The place just feels comfy, the staff is really nice and friendly, and I can't quite explain why it feels so good, but it just does.  

Thanks, Mission Pie.
author: Vivian C.

description: One of my favorite places to eat pie. The Mission streets around it are nasty, but once inside you are treated to unicorn pies (sustainable, sourced, free range, etc, etc.) I get the quiche and a slice of pie-so I restrain from going very often if possible. But the whip cream is divine, and the fruit pies make your soul glisten with glee.
author: papa s.

description:
Tartine makes a bomb @$$ Banana Cream Tart. Mission Pie makes a bomb @$$ pie! What's the difference? Other than the obvious, one is a tart - a  more firm and crumbly crust. Mission Pie's crust is a more crispy and flaky crust. 

To keep Tartine's crust from getting soggy, the crust is coated with dark chocolate and caramel before the creamy pastry filling and sliced bananas are placed. Mission Pie's a fresh, crisp crust, a lightly sweetened cream and sliced bananas. Nothing mushy, nothing soggy - it's freshly baked on site. You can feel, taste and sense the freshness of it in every bite! No banana pudding and no banana artificial flavoring here...

I've been on a hunt for some good Banana Cream Pie. Mission Pie = MISSION ACCOMPLISHED!
author: S Y.

description:
I was very disappointed by both portion size and quality of what was served.  A place with pie in its very name must have prefect pies and this was far from it. 

The apple pie had so few apples in it, I am unsure it qualified as an apple pie.  More applicable name would be pie crust with a hint of apple flavoring.

The raved banana pie had fallen and spread all over the plate.  It was reminiscent of banana pudding with cool whip on top, not good at all.  I left about half the pie on the plate.

 Better pies are easily sourced at any road side diner found all over the South.  

If you are in the mission during the day, just go to Dianda's Italian bakery and get some amazing desserts. Just say no to Mission Pie.
author: Dan P.

description: I am so Open to the experience of a pie shop, but I was take back by the price per slice which I found to be steep.  I thought that hopefully flavor would make up for the price discrepancy.  Unfortunately, I was underwhelmed.  The sweet potato pie I had tasted of lemon.  Really?!  Yes it really did!  Ultimately, the pie was bland and not memorable.  Being from the South, maybe I have high expectations for my pies, but at 4 bucks a pop I think I should be blown away.
author: travis c.

description: Unimpressed.  If you are all about pie, you should do it really well.  Here, the pie definitely wasn't bad, but it certainly wasn't special.  We ordered a slice of apple and a slice of banana cream.  The apple pie was served cold with nothing on the side.  Why not offer to heat it up or make it a la mode?  The banana cream was simply lacking.  Nothing to write home about.  I think this place has potential, but for now, I wouldn't go back.  It feels like no one has really had to try because it is in a great location with cute signage.
author: Sherry J.

description: This place is the bomb! And really a bargain for SF. I tried the walnut pie. It was full of perfectly roasted fresh walnuts and I loved that the sweetness in the filling was a little restrained. Can't wait to go back to try some more of the menu. It all looks great.
author: Christopher W.

description: What is there not to like about a place that is all about pie.  I got the walnut pie, which tasted similar to a pecan pie.  Can't wait to go back and try more flavors.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
The first time I ever saw Mission Pie, I stood on the street begging like a sad puppy for my friends to let me get pie. They said no. 

3 months later, same said friends declared it pie night and I GOT PIE. 

Mixed berry pie with whipped cream. Heaven. Slightly too sweet in the last couple bites but I am such a hypocrite because I cleaned the plate with my fork. And by fork, I mean fork. Keep your mind out of the gutter, I am a lady!
author: Emily D.

description: Been wanting to try for a long time, and finally made it. Had a sweet pie with coffee. The pie was not overly sweet and was delicious. The service was wonderful. One can definitely feel the care they have for each customer, which is very special. Would recommend pie lovers to give it a try!
author: J Y.

description: My friend brought over their Strawberry Rhubarb pie for my birthday and it was delicious.  I'm not a huge fan of warm pie so room temperature is fine by me.  Not sweet at all and I loved both the filling and the crust.  Generous portion of filling.  This is definitely a gourmet pie!
author: Erica S.

description:
I don't really understand all the inflated reviews about this place.

The pies are kind of bland and the crust is bland as well,  

I got the apple pie which was meh...  it was kind of watered down and not very sweet.

The pear,cranberry pie was not very sweet either and a bit grainy.

Will not be back.

Go to baker's square!
author: Em F.

description: Was enjoying their pie so much till I saw a hair. Politely turned it back to the cashier who smiled and told me "oh that must be *name's" and gave me a new slice while cutting out the same size I ate from the old slice. Did not even apologized. I asked for money back was cordially fulfilled. Great pies but hygiene is so so.
author: Sami B.

description:
Honestly, I think my blackberry nectarine pie is a lot better than what I had a Mission Pie. 

Cash/check only.
author: Lee H.

description:
The pies here are pretty tasty, reasonably priced ($20) and the hours are good.  I only come here to pick up pies for dinner parties, pot lucks etc. It serves the job well. The banana cream pie and most of the fruit pies are guaranteed crowd pleasers, although they can sometimes verge on overly sweet. The pumpkin pie is a bit disappointing; it's lacking some flavor and spice.  

The one really frustrating thing about getting pies here is that the line for pickup can be s-l-o-w. It's not so much the number of customers, but more the speed at which orders are processed. They need to get a second line or cash register for to-go orders... especially with no parking ever available nearby it's a bit risky to double park outside when you can be stuck waiting for 10 minutes to make your order.
author: David C.

description: Sadly disappointed. I'm a huge banana cream pie lover and let me just say, the crust to this was disappointing. I like the cream to the pie but I didn't like that there weren't any chunks of bananas in the pie. It's ok in my book but I don't think I'd go back.
author: Marlene T.

description: Meh, I've had much better chicken pies at places that don't specialize. Try The Napper Tandy's just a block away. Much better.
author: Sean C.

description:
The first time I visited here,  I had the banana cream pie.  The crust is good and has the texture and taste of puff pastry, something you'd find in a Napoleon.  The banana filling is nicely sweet, tastes banana-e, and slightly runny which works with this pie.  The texture goes nicely with the soft whipping cream top.  Tastes like your favorite aunt made it.

Everything here is good.  So just decide what you want from the variety here and enjoy.

The plum frangipane is my favorite.  It is unexpectedly delicious.  Very delicious. I highly recommend it.

The walnut pie has a very roasty flavor to the walnuts.  This pie is similar to a pecan pie but with walnuts.

The Shaker lemon pie takes some getting use to when you may be expecting something similar to a lemon meringue pie.  The only thing in common it has with lemon meringue pie is lemons.  It is a pie of another mother.  

The Shaker lemon pie is filled with slices of lemon, rind and all.  

If you like pie, or you just want to sit and have a little bite to eat in the Mission, you should get to know Mission Pie.
author: Rebecca B.

description:
Went there again today, apple pie is still amazing. I wish they gave me more whipped cream though!

Although they only take cash, the good thing is Chase bank is across the street so if you have Chase then hooray! ATM = cash = mission pie.
author: Cassy H.

description:
Vegan savory pie?  Oh my.
Ahhh, yet another gem in the Mish that I didn't want to Yelp.  But after 462 reviews, oh hell, I think the secret is out ;)

I could easily add this place to my Mission rotation.  Both sweet and savory yummy pies.  Add a cup of loose leaf white tea, and game over.  Color me happy.  (Samovar who?)  

My only question...do they have wi fi?  I don't know.  If they do, I'm hooked.
author: Angella S.

description:
I like the idea of this place, but the pies just aren't excellent here.

The crust isn't flaky or buttery, but hard and bland. I had the banana cream pie everyone raved about and the filling had a jello quality to it. Maybe it's just the stabilizer added. The apple pie was mostly crust and not much filling.
author: John H.

description:
I was out in the Mission after my dr's appt at St Lukes and decided to Yelp desserts.  A few blocks away was Mission Pie.
I'm not a big pie fan myself but have made so many pies for other people so I was willing to try something new.
The place was pretty huge and cozy.
No one is in line so I took the time to check out what they got.  You can tell the pies were hand-made and very rustic.  Not like the ones you see in regular bakeries.  Meaning, they actually use butter, sugar and nothing fancy.
I eventually tried their mini peach/blueberry pie.
Took it home to my hubby to criticize.  We're both not a big fan of fruit pies but this pie was a hit!  It was not too sweet, the peaches still have the tartness in it, the crust is butter and flaky and golden brown.
I would have had more but I'm on a low carb diet.. darn!
would love to come back!
author: Learnee L.

description: Pie pie (said in Southpark Cartman voice). How I love sweet delic pie. I'm so over the cupcake phenomenon, its all about pie from here on out. The pie offerings in SF do not disappoint and I would place Mission Pie towards the top of that list. Apple with blackberry, banana cream, quiche- I love them all. I do wish there was a bit more variety offered at Mission Pie, and the bottom crust is a bit on the thin soggy side for my taste, but other than that I'm in love.
author: Ritu K.

description:
Been here once, but I don't remember if I got anything so I had to come back to this place to try their pies. It's great that this place is opened until 10pm. Made it here 15 minutes before closing and copped myself a Banana Cream Pie. The portion was small but I guess you shouldn't indulge as much on something like dessert. It was great in taste so I guess the portion was enough.

The place is on the corner of the block so it's easy to spot and inside has such a chill atmosphere. This would be one of my "go to grab a pie and sit and chill" spot if it wasn't far away from my house. The people that worked there were very friendly too!

I want to try all of their pies so I would definitely come back here.
author: Richard C.

description: I was disappointed in the pies here. I thought that since pies are their specialty they would be really tasty, but I've had much better. Even the pies I've baked myself are better, and I am a slightly above average baker at best. I will keep searching for a good pie place in SF.
author: Carmen T.

description:
Whenever I'm in The Mission, I absolutely have to go to Mission Pie. Mixed berry, banana cream, peach, pumpkin, raspberry pear... they are ALL amazing. Even the savory pies are wonderful. I love the chicken pot pies!

This is a great place to meet up with friends for coffee and dessert. The pie is always fresh, and the staff is very friendly!
author: Danielle D.

description:
I came here for pie in honor of Pi Day today and I can confirm that their BANANA CREAM PIE IS GLORIOUS. So creamy, but not too sweet. 

The apple pie was just ok. The chicken pot pie was.. ehhh.. The best part about it was the crust. The filling wasn't creamy and chunky as I was expecting, but that's not that big of a deal. However, it wasn't seasoned well and the chicken was pretty dry. 

Will come back for banana cream pie. Dat crust. Dat cream. Dem banaynays.
author: C. Z.

description: I ordered the hot chocolate, but it was not so great. Warm milk, not hot, with chocolate flavor.
author: Ted Z.

description: There is nothing better than Mission Pie except maybe the PIE Lady!
author: Amber D.

description: Went here for lunch ordered chicken pot pie. Waited well over 20 minutes for pot pie to arrive.  When it did arrive the pot pie looked good.  Upon breaking open top crust of pie found it to contain very little chicken.  Vast majority carrots and some potatoes.  Overall flavor was disappointing.  Save your money and go to another chicken pie shop
author: Don L.

description: I rarely make it past 24th Street when I'm tooling around the Mission. That's kind of sad when you consider that means my visits to Mission Pie are few and far between. The crust is amazing, light and flaky with terrific flavor. And, it's never soggy. The banana cream filling is pretty delicious, too. I always wish they had more than one bathroom, but that's really my only complaint. The space is clean and cheerful and the service is friendly. They're a green business, too. What more could you ask for?
author: Nicole M.

description: This place is delicious and fantastic! Well worth going out of your way for a visit- their savory tarts are life alteringly good and I think their salads balance out the decadents of their sweet pies!
author: Kyra T.

description:
If this business has one flaw - and I mean only one - it's the fact that they're cash-only. Should you have a jonesin' for organic pastry and have nothing to exchange but a debit card and a smile, you shall sadly be left wanting. Feel free to fall to your knees outside the door, wailing "Why?!!!" to the heavens in futility.

Yes, it's that good. Whether you're there to kill time, picking up a quick to-go treat, or taking a date there to discuss the movie you just saw, Mission Pie is the one part of the night you're guaranteed to enjoy. It's mellow coffee-house vibe and friendly staff make it worth returning to over and over again.

So hit up the ATM and step inside. Whether or not you succumb to the temptation of buying their for-sale condiments is up to you.
author: Charles L.

description: Man am I a sucker for pie. This place will not disappoint. Wanna come back and try out their pot pies.
author: Eric C.

description: Pies are good, but it's really expensive for the amount you're served. Banana cream pie is my favorite.
author: Drew M.

description:
Never been into pies really however I stopped by this place to check it out. 

I got a slice of the banana creme pie with a cup of milk. From someone that doesn't really doesn't like the consistency of bananas, I totally loved this pie! Not super sweet, bananas weren't mushy gross--just right. 

If you like pies, come here. It's worth a visit!
author: Cindy B.

description: The pie is to die for. The crusts here are super flaky, which I love. I would go back here for the banana cream pie. I've always heard it was good, but they're always out when I get there. I need to go back there again.
author: John W.

description:
Ugh. I had such high hopes for this place. We came specifically for the pot pies. I ordered a chicken pot pie and a sausage / red bean pot pie.

I ordered the chicken pot pie. It was horrible. All the pot pies were premade so imagine my surprise when it took 45 minutes for it to be brought to us. Anyway, the chicken pot pie tasted like an old microwave dinner. It had an odd taste to it and was not creamy enough. 

The sausage and red bean pot pie was significantly better than the chicken pit pie, surprisingly. I think because the sausage had a stronger taste and the stuffing was thick. The crust was alright.

I also got to try the potato gratin, which had a cardboard taste to it.

The only redeeming dish this place was the banana cream pie. It was very light and flavorful. However, I wish that there was more bananas in the banana cream pie. Also, -1 star for charging $2 for eating the pie at the restaurant. 

Cash only.
author: Margaret R.

description:
Nation's who?!

Got a slice of quiche and a slice of banana cream pie. Quiche wasn't warmed up all the way.. It was aiiight, actually. But the banana cream pie! My first thought was, "Is this what real banana cream pie is supposed to taste like??" So fresh tasting and the crust was really good too! The place itself had a home-y vibe to it. Had a long wooden table, and art hanging on the walls.. I wanna come back to try other pies.
author: Michelle C.

description: The best pie place in San Francisco. We come here regularly. They have different types all the time. The staff is great and friendly.
author: Jürgen H.

description:
Walnut pie is good, not too sweet with lots of walnut as i like it. The crust however could be a bit more flaky. A small issue i have is that the base was soggy yet the dense walnut makes up for it.
Ordered to go this time, however the decor and setting of this quaint friendly little place will require a eat in to enjoy a fresh slice of banana cream pie on the next visit.
I see its cash only, there is a small notice by the counter that said credit card acceptance by sept 11, i think, so its great news
So looking forward to eat in and credit card acceptance will be nice.
author: Nelle L.

description:
I checked this place out with a bunch of my friends who are on a "Pot Pie Quest" to find the best chicken pot pie in the Bay Area.  Mission Pie was one of our stops, as it had decent reviews and... chicken pot pie.  The ambiance is coffeehouse-ish, and not quite overrun by hipsters yet, though, it will be soon.  

Being mostly vegetarian, I opted for their vegan pot pie, which had rice, beans, and some sort of greens (chard or kale?), while the rest of my friends got the chicken pot pie.  My pie was pretty decent.  I dug the flavors, though I had to add salt.  I almost never salt my food.  My friends all seemed to have similar criticisms - their pies lacked flavor and were runny.  Coffee was good; if you get your coffee in a mug, you have free refills.  I had to knock off a star because they ran out of hot sauce, bummer.  I would go back to Mission Pie for the mellow vibe and I would love to try some of their sweet pies.
author: Laura C.

description: Good pie, but expensive pie. It's nice to stop in for an after dinner snack, or just a snack. They need more food options. It seems very limited.
author: David H.

description:
SO glad I didn't go overboard and buy the banana cream before even trying it. 

Actually really sad I didn't enjoy either of the pies I tried.  The place is a cute little spot on the corner of 25th and mission - probably a great place to get a cuppa coffee and enjoy a slice of pie with a friend (low key).

Onto the pie..

Not really a fan of the crust AT ALL.  It's on the brink of being rock hard and tastes burnt.  I'm a huge crust fan -- its the last bite of deliciousness, but not with these pies..which sort of ruin it all.

pumpkin - both the boy and i thought it was 'too pumkiny' - what that means? just tasted almost as if you were eating raw pumpkin- i think we prefer a thicker more solidified chunk of pumpkin.  A little too mushy for us.

banana cream -- the custard is TOO thick/solidified.  -- can you update with the texture from the pumpkin? let's swamp 'em!  Same issue with the crust and just not very impressive at all. 

Much rather walk down the street, pay a few more dollars and get something from Tartine.
author: Melody T.

description: Pies, pies, and more pies! It's actually a really cute bakery/cafe. I like the kids table by the window. There are a variety of magazines and books for you to leaf through while enjoying their sweets and beverages. The pies are all really delicious, my personal favorite is pear.
author: Sherry L.

description: Strong sense of sustainability here! I can taste it in the pie. The crust isn't bland like most, as they use whole wheat flour in it. The fruit is from the farmers market & is all organic. Thankful for this incredible pie shop so close to my house!
author: Nicole W.

description:
This is a review by a vegetarian

Very good but not super-fantastic life-changing pie. One of the problems with local, in-season yada yada yada places is that if it isn't in season then things are a little subpar.
Mission Pie has Lemon Shaker, walnut, and Banana cream pies on the menu at almost all times because they are not seasonal. Ditto why some form of apple pie is almost always in the case.
So if you're there in the depths of winter and they have something with a berry in it, don't expect it to be eye popping delicious. But the crusts are real, slices are not watery nor sickly sweet, and it's a place to go for dessert that is actually open late enough to hit after dinner (a genre I wish would proliferate for those dates that you don't want to end but don't want to relocate to a deafening club or a pressured apartment)
author: Bob R.

description: First pie shop that didn't give me a tummy ache or waxy feel on the roof of my mouth --shows the superior ingredients used. If you get the walnut pie, make sure it's a la mode! Banana cream pie was super smooth and chicken pot pie was a winner!
author: Sabi M.

description: For a long time, I drove by Mission Pie and thought it was a junky pie shop, so I never went in. I try to eat organic and not eat a lot of dessert. I could not have been more wrong. It's organic, even a bit vegan! Yes, they do have gorgeous pies, but also great meals and drinks. I'm having the chicken pot pie today and it's fabulous. This is my third time here, and they've never disappointed me. Thanks Mission Pie!
author: Rachel L.

description: The cream pie is very rich! I'm in love with the mission Pie
author: Terry L.

description:
Perhaps I came here under the false pretense that a taste of their banana cream pie would suffice my cravings and put all of the other pies I've every tasted to shame,

But that was a silly expectation, even after hearing about all the hype about this place.. The sliver of pie I had was sub-par, a bit dry, and probably would've saved myself the trouble if I had just went to Tartine.
author: Ty T.

description:
Vegan tamale pot pie was perfectly flavorful!

I would meet with a professor here for monthly meetings. I would usually end the meeting with a banana creme pie. When I brought back home a slice of the banana creme, my girlfriend was very pleased.
author: Axel F.

description: My godfather and I split slices of banana cream pie and shaker lemon pie. Both were superb! Flaky crusts and fillings that were just sweet enough. We'd never had a shaker lemon pie before and were surprised by its heartiness, textured filling (the peel is inside!) and tastefully tart profile. We'll definitely be back for more!
author: Ashley C.

description:
5 stars: 
walnut pie
walnut scone

4 stars:
Chicken supper 

3 stars:
Savory veggie galette

7 stars: the green & social mission of the company
author: George K.

description:
This was the first stop in our quest to taste the best SF has to offer. We got here at 11am after not willing to wait in +50 people line at Tartine. 

I ended up with the banana cream pie. It had fresh bananas but the cream and the rest of the filling was alright. Still doesn't match liberty cafe's banana cream pie.

My friend had the rasberry-pear pie. It was mostly pear. I wish it had more of a rasberry filling.

Beware: Cash only.
author: Kien M.

description:
My favorite place for a cup of tea in the city! No wifi can be such a refresher and really makes for a nice environment.  
The vegan pies are delicious, and you can get a whole pot of tea (plenty for 2-3 people) for only $2.50.
author: Hannah M.

description:
Although I am not a big fan of pie, I still really like this place. 

Went there around 8:30pm on a Friday's night. The place was packed and there was a line. It took us 15 minutes in order to place an order. But it was OK because I could take my time to decide what I want since all the pies looked pretty good. 

I ordered: 

Berry Pie - It was so good. very fresh ingredients. The pie had a lot of fruit and seasoning but it was not overly sweet at all. Perfect crunchy crust. YUMMY! 

Apricot Pie - It was very good too. The crust was a little bit hard but it was still delicious. 

The pie was $3.50 for a slice. A very good place for dessert. 

BTW, they also have savory pies!!!!
author: Liza T.

description:
You know it has to be good if the locals are there. Came through on a Saturday night looking and feeling like a super tourist as we stood in line debating on what to order for a good 5 minutes or so.

Banana Cream Pie:  Not to sweet but had that home made flavor. You can tell their whip cream is home made and the crust was buttery and flaky without being overly rich. It could have used more banana flavor; either from the fruit itself or the filling but it was still a decent piece of pie.

Strawberry Rhubarb: It was everything it should be-sweet, sour, and appetizing. Though it wasn't the most presentable pie as it came to us in an exploded state, it sure was enjoyable. The sweet cream balanced the sour fruit medley and the crust added the necessary touch to create perfect balance.
author: Allison M.

description:
UGH, why must you be at such a bad location?!
Because Mission is such a busy street, it's super hard to find parking around to actually stop and check out the pies, so if you guys are driving, GOOD LUCK!
I went in there hoping to see a HUGE banana cream pie, but I thought it was small... and it was $20 for the whole thing, WHAT?!
but it was super yummyy! The crust was so moist, and the cream.. omg.. I felt myself melting after the first bite. Seriously!
author: Linda K.

description:
Had dinner with the fam-bam while out on vacation in The Bay last week, and my nephew and I decided to swing by Mission Pie for dessert after dropping off my parents at SFO. I've had my share of pies in my lifetime, and I'm not too discriminatory when it comes to them at all. Honestly, I will enjoy everything from home made pies to the cheap $1.99-Hostess apple pies you find near the check-out line of your local grocery store. 

I'm def not a pie snob.

But as my nephew and I were told (and we had also read online), Mission Pie's banana cream pie was (is) one of the most amazing ever. I must say, though, that after giving it a try for myself, I was totally left just "whelmed." I wasn't as over-whelmed as most, but definitely wasn't under-whelmed at all. I was merely "whelmed."

What I did enjoy about MP's BCP: the flaky crust. Unlike other pies that have either a "too thick" or "too dry" crust, MP's crust was a perfect concoction of flaky & moist. I also loved the fact that the banana cream wasn't overly sweet at all. The freshness of the bananas added that extra push I needed to appreciate its overall goodness. 

Thing is, I wasn't exactly moved to tears by it, nor did it blow my mind. But to MP's credit, I think it's because I had set my expectations too high... Sort of similar to how 90% of people tend to judge a cupcakery by it's "red velvet." But why? Of all the cupcake flavors, red velvet is as varied as they come. You can't judge a cupcakery by its red velvet; you're better off judging it by something more conventional like a vanilla or chocolate cupcake, or a black & white. As simple as that sounds, its the basic cupcake that a cupcakery should be able to do best. Perhaps in the pie world, the BCP could be that conventional pie for which a pie place should be judged. But to me, I think the BCP is also somewhat tricky in the same way that the red velvet cupcake can be. What I need to try the next time I'm in The Bay, and visiting MP, is a traditional apple or cherry pie.

Despite this analysis, Mission Pie is loveable in many ways. I love the neighborhood feel of the place, and the coffee it serves adds a nice touch. I also appreciate the menu's diversity: sweet and savory options for all palates. 

If you happen to be in the Mission area, you definitely should give this place a try. Hopefully, unlike me, you won't happen to notice a woman with uber hairy legs enjoying herself some Mission Pie during your visit. While I'm glad she was enjoying it as much as everyone else, it took everything I had within me not to go out and buy the poor girl a razor! (EEK!)
author: Wendel L.

description: Mission Pie offers a good variety of pies to choose from--both savory and sweet, a fair selection of coffee and other drinks. The only problem I have with this place is their limited seating. It's like a musical chair game here. You would have spotted a few spots to sit down when you enter but once you have finished ordering, those spots would be gone.
author: Joelle K.

description:
I love this place! 

My first experience was someone giving me a pecan pie tartlette! Mmmmmm!!! That caught my attention and I had to go here!

I went this past mother's day and picked up treats for my mom and gramma :) 

They had many different selections of pies and pastries that were def made with love! ;) 

I got a strawberry rubarb tart and pecan pie tart and then they also had savory items as well, which pleasently surprised me...

VEGAN pot pies?!? OMG! I heart this place just because of that! 
And all the people working there have so much positivity and are so awesome and helpful and I just LOVE the hippie, down to earth vibe here :) one guy there told me I had great energy and my smile lit up the room :) so sweet...!

I would eat here daily if I had the mulah! ;)  

My family loved the desserts and everyone was happy :))
author: Lauren S.

description: Tried again, this time an apricot & berry pie (strussel topping) and a peach & apricot pie. still not working for us. unfortunately, we have to move on.
author: Abigail W.

description:
What a lovely place.

Banana Cream pie was delicious and the crust was the best ever. How do they do that?
author: Pat P.

description:
I wouldn't recommend this place unless you're a vegan or are into healthy desserts, it was simply TERRIBLE! I mean if you're gonna eat pie you better do it right and go for the whole schbang..c'mon ppl!!

We stumbled into this place because Pie Friday wasn't open till 5 on a Sat and we couldn't locate Bike Basket Pies. We had the apple rhubarb pie with whipped cream. The pie crust was like card board, the filling was just not impressive and to make matter worst, the dreadful whipped cream had no sugar in it whatsoever.

Alrite, I get it, this ain't your normal pie shop, but seriously. If I"m going to waste any calories on pie, I wanna do it right. This place just didn't do the trick and left us disappointed. We wanted real pie, not faux pie!

The biggest irony of this spot is that they had a TV display about how they went all solar panel last year to emphasize how they're saving energy by going solar...seriously?!?! Print it out!! That's all, no, thank you, never again...
author: Margie S.

description:
Craving pie? In the Mission District? Or don't mind making the trip down to the Mission? You can't go wrong with checking out Mission Pie.

Organic, fair trade, all those feel-good things that make the Mission and SF special, Mission Pie has delectable sweet and savoury treats to get you by, as well as coffee, tea and beverages. There's also random other things you can buy such as fruit preserves, mugs, books, and general kitsch. 

Overall, not a bad place to stop if you're in the area or looking for a pie fix. We weren't overly impressed with the lack of variety in sweet pies though, so -1 star for that.
author: Cassandra J.

description: I have been brought here with friends because it was supposed to be great. We ordered a pie and after 30 min we were still waiting for it. We finally found out that we had to pay extra to get it sliced. We paid for it and still had to go twice at the counter to get our pie. I dont understand this.
author: Franck M.

description: Hey this was a great place and fun environment.
author: Shawn B.

description: I'm a regular here. Wonderful pies, local ingredients and lovely, friendly happy people work here. It's a bit noisy even on a week day but they deserve the business and I'm happy for them. The best of the best in my humble opinion: walnut pie, banana cream and pear-blueberry. All are perfection.
author: Bryan H.

description:
Good pie and plenty of seats. They also have a variety of vegan pies. I had the ginger pear vegan pie and it was REALLY good. I also had the regular pumpkin pie. It was delicious, I think there are bits of chestnuts in there which made it even better. The pie crust on the pumpkin pie was just right.
Overall a good spot to have a slice of pie, some coffee, read a book or chat away with friends.
author: Noir L.

description: Service is great but pies are underwhelming. Not enough Apple in the Dutch Apple pie and shaker lemon pie had far too much rind, which had a strong bitter taste that intensified with each bite. Not worth the detour.
author: Kat A.

description: I don't understand the hype of this place, other than that it's open later than other bakeries in the area. However, the Cranberry Chess Pie deserves an outstanding mention for being such satisfying and filling drunk food when you've had too much wine at dinner. So good I decided to buy a whole pie to take it home. The next morning when I sobered up, I realized it was just a ton of butter, milk and sugar. Still good, but so much better when you're inebriated.
author: Kathy Y.

description: I have nothing but a rave review about Mission Pie!! Decided the morning of my daughter's birthday to find something special to have delivered to her office by AT&T Park. I called Karen - owner of Mission Pie, and asked if she could have a pie delivered. She was charming and went above and beyond to meet my request. They had yet to try a delivering program  but was willing to try it so my desires could be met. Sure enough - a beautiful tarte was delivered to my daughter within 90 minutes of my call. Not only did I receive wonderful service and gracious hospitality, my daughter reported that the tarte was incredible!!! Thank you so much Karen and Mission Pie. We will definitely be using you again...as will my daughter's office!
author: Madison B.

description: Pies look amazing. Everything you could ever want in a pie shop. Coffee tasted amazing. Dining room is a little warm for my liking, so I had my coffee to go. Service was fantastic.
author: scott h.

description:
LOVE this little gem. Servers are always courteous and generous. Huge fan of the banana cream pie: light, fresh, just the perfect amount of sweetest when you want to wind down your day :) 

Also try their savory pies, takes a little longer to prepare, but it's worth it. Very fresh ingredients, home made and prepped. Gotta love it.
author: Sophie L.

description:
When people think of desserts in the Mission they think ice-cream; Humphrey Slocombe and Bi-Rite. When I think of dessert in the Mission, I think Mission Pie! True to their name, Mission Pie serves American classics as well as creative originals with ingredients sourced  from throughout California (they have a map marked with where each ingredient is from if you're into that sort of thing). It's a homely space, with various sized tables to fit different parties. Service is good and it's conveniently located near the 24th/Mission Bart Station.

 Of the 3 pies I have tried, Peach Berry is my favorite. The tartness of the berries plays well with the sweet peaches and the hearty crust. I love the texture that the crust has with the oats or whatever grain they use adding a nice crunch. I always have them add a dollop of their house whipping cream! Not too far behind is their Banana Cream and Plum Frangipane. The Banana cream is not as sweet as some other versions, but is more refreshing and natural. I have no idea what Frangipane is, and I still don't, but the plum frangipane is also a solid choice. 

Mission Pie has a thorough menu with sweet and savory pies, quiches, and other baked goods. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place, so skip the ice-cream and get some PIE!
author: Josh Y.

description: Lovely little neighborhood spot for a slice, pot pie, fresh baked quiche and or cup of coffee. Just sitting in this place will put a smile on your face as it smells amazing. All the staff are super friendly as well.
author: Justin Y.

description:
Their Banana Cream Pie is the best pie ever..... with mixed berry as runner-up! My husband and I have always enjoyed getting these pies to share with family and friends. Mission Pie uses quality ingredients. The bananas cream pie never disappoints, as the banana is always fresh and the crust is full of buttery goodness. You can totally see the specks and taste the vanilla bean in the cream.

For our wedding, instead of having a traditional cake, we had to have MISSION PIE! All our guests raved about the dessert- we got banana cream and mixed berry. Totally unexpected, but at the end of the evening, my mom handed us a bag, stocked up full of goodies, telling us that we got a gift from Mission Pie- wishing us luck on our marriage! They are so thoughtful and generous. Thank you Mission Pie!!!!
author: Frankie R.

description:
If I wasn't on a baking kick lately, I would probably think their pies were more special. Unfortunately, no such luck. I'll give them credit for their buttery, flaky crusts and their hearty chicken pot pie, but the banana cream pie was a disappointment. Better pies and pastry creams have been gracing my kitchen lately.

Three glorious stars for shutting people's pie holes and (last but certainly not least) for not being a phucking cupcakery.
author: Anastasia B.

description: Savory or sweet, Mission Pie will satisfy all your pie needs.  I like to think that I'm a pie enthusiast (lol) and this place is my fave. You can't go wrong with the banana cream pie or the strawberry rhubarb.  The fruit pies are even better with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.  They also have a nice selection of fancy teas and coffee. I need to go next time to try their lunch! I love pie... And I love this place.
author: Candace C.

description:
Sooooooooo....my entire week has been centered around going to Anthony's Cookies. I made a special trip out there and everything, just to find out its under construction. WHAT. THE. FUCK. 

Unsure what my next step in life would be, my loverman and I walked back and forth in shock. "Look up desserts pweez," I said and up came Mission Pie. 

I've been wanting to go for years but I always forgot about it once I was in the Mission. We walked over and tried to find the place. Sign fail. The sign is located on the side of the place and the sign above the door had nothing written on it. 

I really liked that it was all cafe style with a bunch of wooden tables for you to sit down at. I told him to order the Shaker Lemon Pie and the Spinach & Mushroom Quiche while I saved us a table. 

The staff all looked like they were moving in slow motion. All dead and zombie like. The Shaker Lemon Pie was weird and I wouldn't order it again. The quiche was very tasty though. We had to eat the lemon one first because they took forever heating the quiche up. 

$10 for two tiny slices of pie is far too much. Now $10 for a dozen of Anthony's Cookies? Yes, please. 

LOOK WHAT YOU MADE US GO THROUGH ANTHONY!
author: Tiffany V.

description: They have the best fruit pies hands down! Also, their daily vegan pie is delicious! It's a little pricey for a pie, but totally worth every bite. They always use fruits that are in season, the menu changes daily. I have had their vegan spiced apple, mixed berry, banana cream, pear, and peach. All have a taste of heaven in it. The crust is always cooked to perfection with a slight crunch. The fruit just has the right amount of sweetness and you get them in chunks!
author: Aiza B.

description:
wait what??? i haven't reviewed this place yet?  their banana cream pie is amazing!  i wouldn't normally choose bananas in my pie, nor cream but the combination they create here is absolutely refreshing and mind-blowing.  hmmm maybe not mind-blowing but definitely awesome.  the crust somehow doesn't get soggy under the refreshing custard, fresh bananas nor fluffy cream.

we've tried their chicken pot pie.  also very good and fresh.  crust is solid.  their salads were also delicious!  we had a slaw that was fresh

we also ordered 5 pies for our wedding and they were gone in no time.  

if you love pie, don't miss this place
author: claudia y.

description:
Savory, Sweet, any way you slice it, this place is great!
The use of local produce and other products is a plus in my book for sure.
Not too hipster (yet) since it is deeper in the Mission (thank God).

Savory Galettes are divine.
Chicken Pot Pie just like Grandma used to make.
Banana Cream Pie...like heaven.
Blue Bottle Coffee and great iced tea.

Stop in for a slice and get some to go!

Cash and Check only!
author: Katie S.

description:
I judge pie by the crust, and this is definitely the best I can remember having. 
The pear raspberry pie is perfect. It's not too sweet, and the crust is buttery, flaky and delicious. 
I can't wait to go back and try some of their other flavors!
author: Cami J.

description: I can do two reviews for a single day! First, I picked up a peach pie for a co-workers birthday. Big hit. However, that banana cream in the case looked delicious but I was afraid it was to warm to travel to the office. When a friend called and wanted to grab a bite, I suggested Mission Pie. I love the vibe--almost like a 60s commune. Everybody feels comfortable, everybody is equal. Mismatched tables, interesting people, super-delicious food that is lovingly prepared. Then I read about the work on the back-end, the work at Pie Ranch, and fell in love just a little bit more. Great, great spot I would highly recommend. Can't wait to go back for that chicken pot pie. Oh, and the prices are very reasonable.
author: Robert M.

description:
This place has a wonderful mission & creative approach to the business. I've heard they have a learning program for high school students, teaching them the processes from farm to plate. 

They use fresh ingredients from the farm, employ SF youth (great service by the way), have an awesome location & cosy cafe sitting area. 

So it's a shame that the food isn't fantastic. Every time I've ordered a pie, the crust has been dry & cardboard like & the fillings are ok. If they can't make good crust, it's not a good pie so be prepared to eat it humbly if you want to support this very nice establishment.
author: Becca S.

description:
Wow. Best Bakery I've seen in a while. I had the MOST AMAZING PEACH PIE. I've definitely been on a peach kick lately, but this exceeded any expectations that I might have placed with my biases. Also, most amazing kitchen I've ever seen. I went to the bathroom and lingered long time to oogle at the open bright huge kitchen. WOW. Alsoooo, best wall paper EVER.  

We were only in the SF area for one day, and I'm so glad we stumbled upon this gem.  The staff was supppeerrrr friendly.  Even when they caught me, jaw-dropped staring at the kitchen. They were lovely people who seemed really excited to be there and who seemed to love their job.  It looks like a great place to hang out and do homework, work or meet a friend.  Very inviting, great natural lighting, great location.  LOVED IT.  

As a soon-to-be bakery owner, I find myself to be VERY CRITICAL of other bakeries, just as far as understanding what I do and do not like.  This place matches 95% of what I would do in a bakery.  I am thoroughly impressed and inspired.  Thank you, Owners and Employees.  Well Done.
author: Sarah H.

description:
Ive had good experiences with a variety of pies from here. They are prepared nicely with good ingredients. Although i havent had a chance to try any of their savory pies since i usually come here after a stop at La Taqueria  across the way.

The pies are nice but not really memorable so im not super impressed but still satisfied.
author: Jennifer T.

description: One of my favorite eats in the world is pie. I loooooove pie everything, pot pies, fruit pies, galettes, tartins, anything with crust is my best friend. I like buttery, flaky crusts so when I walked into this place, I thought I died and went to heaven. This review is based on the 2 slices I bought; dutch apple and the lemon pie. The crust was sadly underwhelming, the bottom was too thin so it became too soggy, and the top looked great but also lacked the flakiness I was hoping for, and the lemon filling with the lemon peels was way too bitter, different but not to my liking. And my husband always gets the apple dutch anywhere he goes and the apples were just too soggy and overdone. I also got a cookie and i thought it was waaaayyyy too greasy, i know, i know its a cookie but i don't want feel like I'm literaly biting into a chunk of butter. Its all about balance. But maybe I'll come back for the chicken pot pie...
author: Ennie L.

description: Love love loveeeeee their banana cream pie! The filling is delicious and their crust is so flaky! The bananas are always sweet and the cream on top is divine! I love how they're open late as well. Definitely a place to try if you're a visitor and avid banana lover!
author: Heather R.

description: Pies are organic. Fresh.  Good but nothing special in my opinion.  I'm more of a sweet pie person so I may be bias. I had the pear raspberry pie.
author: Jasmine N.

description:
Okay, something clearly changed between the last time I was in and now. 

Baby was trapped in the deep Mission and didn't want Salvadorian food, and I saw the sign. It's like, 10:20 AM, I could stand for some pie, even if it isn't the best, right? 

Three (I know, what's wrong with me) slices of quiche later, I roll myself out of that building and towards home. Ugh...it was so good. I seriously regret not buying a whole one, and slowly digesting it while bingeing on Netflix in the dark, like a spider. Their quiche will inspire your inner fat kid to take every last ounce of your self-respect. :o)
author: Neko M.

description: Only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because of the service. The ambiance and the desserts are amazing
author: Suren M.

description: Seems like they always have one sweet vegan pie option!! I had a great vegan apple cranberry slice for $4.50. It wasn't too sweet, yay. I only wish it had a regular crust top instead of a crumble top. SO enjoyed his non-vegan pear raspberry slice. Will be back to try their vegan pot pies. We also split the India Pale Kolsch, from Pine Street Brewery. Nom.
author: Alexis B.

description:
Banana Cream Pie. Period.

It is not too sweet, the crust has just the right about of flakiness and thickness, and it has the perfect cream to banana cream ratio. Excellent, accompanied by a cup of hot latte. I do recommend getting the entire pie if you are taking it home though, as I have never been able to keep the slices for long due to my adorable friend aka "banana cream pie monster" who occasionally visits. =)

I also love the rustic tables that you can share with a few neighbors and talk about the banana cream pie, the weather, or even business (a-hem). =)  

If with pollen allergies, you can also pick up a wide selection of localized San Francisco honeys (ie: Tenderloin, Mission, etc.) to mix with hot water and lemon to help your body build resistance to the local flora.

I love this place. If I could have dessert and coffee with my neighbors every day like this, it would be heaven!

Tips: Cash only, bring your own mug for a coffee discount.
author: Grace G.

description: We really liked this place. My Love had the mixed berry pie and I had the walnut pie. Both were delicious. Don't forget the whip cream! We also had to ask for our pie to be warmed, as they serve it cold. Nice place to go grab a quick desert and coffee. The setting was spacious, but a bit loud. I would not recommend it for intimate conversation, but this is a nice venue for group discussions/gatherings.
author: Vernadette G.

description:
The crust is bland. 

Their walnut pie is adequate. It tastes like they use brown sugar instead of maple syrup or corn syrup, which gives it a too-sweet, not-quite-right consistency for my taste. 

The banana cream pie is just okay. It's hard to mess up banana cream pie. But again, we're talking about a communion wafer crust with whipped cream, and some banana filling. But the crust just keeps crashing the party. 

Their pot pies are a bland, soupy mess that leaves you hungry & craving real pot pie.
author: Larf P.

description:
So, you get like three stars just for selling pie, right?  

That's about it.  Nothing really special here.  The staff seems super nice, which always makes for a more enjoyable experience.  The food was decent.  I had one of their savory slices; it wasn't anything to write home about.  The slice was also a little pricey, but I guess that's what you have to expect in SF.  The iced chai was pretty mediocre (probably the blandest I've ever had anywhere).  

I will definitely be going back though, mostly to support their fairness over profit values, but I won't really be expecting anything out of this world.
author: CS W.

description:
MISSION PIE ROCKS!!!

Came here on a Saturday night with a friend and my mom. There were so many people there at 9pm, it was hoppin. We lucked out and found a nice table for the three of us right away. My friend got a mini blueberry pear pie and I got the pear frangipane. Both were DELISH. The pear frangipane was especially good since I love almond tasting things. We also ordered a Chai Latte that was seriously, very very tasty. Perfectly spiced and not too sweet. I've been here during the day as well, it's the perfect place to meet someone for coffee, or to chill out on your laptop, but the pies are what will continue to bring me in...

Only thing is they are cash or check only!!!! Always a pain, but still worth it!
author: Eliza F.

description:
Best. "LOCAL" local community spot. EVER.

All ingredients sourced from farms/producers in the Bay area.

Seasonal offerings for pie flavors keeps things interesting and the favorites keep things consistent.

Sweet, fruity pies or rich, nutty pies. 

Savory meat or vegan pot pies.

Other stuff that must be select because everything I like is.

Dana and everyone on staff are super nice, super cool and super authentic.

Separate tables, community table, kids play table and outdoor seating (when the neighbors aren't doing 4-story construction on the side of the building).


A few downsides (that can be forgiven b/c they are true to Mission Pie's identity):
- can't call in an order (sometimes I think it is lame & sometimes I'm glad I have to hang at the place b/c it is about creating community)
- cash only (bad b/c I never have cash; good b/c I never have cash so I don't order pie every day)
- apparently, a group can't come in and order a whole pie to be served warm (even if unsliced)...no idea how to justify that one...

Did I mention that they reduce their environmental footprint through solar power?

But whatever. Where are you from? Unless you say one of a handful of spots that might be as cool as San Francisco, then you don't have a spot as cool as this in your neighborhood. Maybe they do not have everything I want (who does?), but they definitely have more than I ever imagined possible in a local, affordable, neighborhood meeting place.

Do yourself a favor and don't miss out on kicking it here for awhile if you are in the lower Mission.
author: Benjamin W.

description:
If Jason Biggs had to use a Mission pie for arguably one of the most infamous scenes in late 90s film history, he might have refused, eaten the pie, quit on the spot and saved himself of a decade worth of torment.  Instead, the guy will be known in perpetuity as the "Pie Fucker."  Sometimes, it is best not to have a lasting contribution on society.  

How unlucky was Mr. Biggs?  Well, pretty much everyone on Yelp has already showered Mission Pie with laurel upon laurel for their sweet offerings.  I am here to say that the savory options hold up as well.  Eschewing Yelp reviews, my eyes sauntered over to the pork & olive savory pie.  You mean I get to combine tender chunks of delicious pork with the unique flavor of olive all within the context of a decadently heavy pot pie filling covered with a genuinely flaky crust?  Hell yes!  This pie was incredibly delicious.  The decidedly buttery crust meshed perfectly with moist pork, green olives, carrots, and potatoes.  There is no question in my mind that this is the proper update to your mom's chicken pot pie.  

If you somehow don't manage to finish your pie, don't be an asshole and engage in fornication with your leftovers.  Not only would you fail miserably given that the pie will have lost its warmth, but also you would be an incredible tool for attempting to do so given that leftover pie from Mission is actually quite tasty.  Indeed, two days later, I polished off the pork/olive pot pie and it was still marvelous.  

In any event, so long as you enjoy warm pie for the right reasons, you will probably enjoy this place.  It is definitely worth a visit if you happen to be in the Mission.
author: Yelper N.

description: Really, as good as gets. Local, seasonal ingredients, freshly baked pies and pastries. Everyone is so nice and helpful. Can't wait for their peach and raspberry pie to come back this summer. Banana pie will do until then. Actually, banana pie is amazing :)
author: Vegi T.

description:
Have been back w/ friends. They were suitably impressed and adoring.

Also of note: this particular restaurant is not guilty of charging us "Healthy SF" fees and keeping it for themselves: http://hedonia.seantimberlake.com/hedonia/2013/01/when-where-to-eat-and-where-not-to-eat-are-the-same-place.html
author: Amy T.

description:
This place opens at 7 a.m. Pie for breakfast? Absolutely. 

Three of us shared four slices... two apple, one pear raspberry, and one walnut tart slice. I could have gone for the banana cream as well, but apparently that's "not breakfast food". Just goes to show what my companions know about breakfast. Pah.

My personal favorite was probably the walnut, because it was one of Mission's more unique choices (and so much better than pecan). The nutty to sweet flavor ratio was spot on, and the crust was fantastic. Pear raspberry was also pleasantly awesome, considering I've never had a good pear tart or pie. The crumb topping makes this one, and there's a tangy, lemony flavor that really compliments the sweetness of the pear (which by the way, is not mushy at all. Bravo!). The apple was good... but it's not my grandma's, and I'm a little bit partial to homemade apple pie, even though this one left nothing to be desired.

On the the down side, the brewed coffee was too bitter for any of our tastes. I literally could not force myself to drink it, even though it's local and supposedly had notes of all kinds of tasty things in it (dark chocolate? fruit?). I recommend not ordering it and instead, having another slice of pie to compliment your first slice of pie. However, if you need a boost of caffeine, the almond milk latte complimented the walnut tart like PB compliments J. Perfection.
author: Rachel R.

description:
After a pretty intense Wednesday evening workout sesh, my manfriend suggested pie. And since I can never refuse pie (this might be why I go to the gym...) we headed to Mission Pie.

Pies are displayed in a case - but you can't see them very well. I wish they would use cake stands or something. I like to see what I'll be eating. 

Banana cream pie - fresh banana pudding with sliced bananas and a light whipped cream on top. I could eat a few slices of this....

Lemon - Manfriend chose this and I had a taste. It is VERY tart. The filling is not lemon curd. It's straight up candied lemons. There's no way I could eat a whole piece of this. 

The crusts on both were perfectly flaky.
author: Sara P.

description: I went twice to mission pie and this place is one of my go to place now to satisfy my sweet too craving after dinner. I tried the walnut pie, the banana cream pie and the raisin scone and all three were delicious. The food and service was excellent, you can't ask for more!
author: Marc-Andre L.

description: There was a pie theme Saturday.  Probably because it was so hard to find a parking space on Saturday night and I didn't want to move the darn car.  I always wanted to try this place. It was kind of cold outside and the warm smell of pies just brings you in and rest and admire all those pies.  The guy was wiping the glass case probably from the people getting too close and breathing and fogging up the glass.  So much scruptuous baked goods to try.  Minny minny mighty moe.  We shared the walnut pie.  Forget about the calories, I'm taking it with real whipped cream. The walnut was fresh and had so much crunch.  The water complimented it so well that my friend drank at least four glasses of water.  Got to go back to try their quiche.  The staff were super nice. Service with a smile.
author: Helen L.

description: This place knows how to make pies! Being from the south we tend to stick to what we know about cooking pies, and they are right on the money here! Not only is the food great, the service was fantastic as well. They welcomed us with a smile, and after hearing it was our first time there, they made sure we had an experience we wouldn't forget! I can't tell you how highly I recommend stopping into this business and having a great slice of pie! You will make some friends there as well, I know we did!
author: Hailie C.

description:
Dear Savory Pie-aholics Anonymous,

I managed to curb my addiction to chicken pot pies for many years while living in SF, but a year ago I moved within walking distance of Mission Pie, and will be the first to admit that I have a problem. My low point came when I ordered several of these flakey delights and didn't leave my apartment for days. I was just eating and cackling like an evil cartoon character. Later, my best friend came over and found me 20 pounds heavier and soaked in pie gravy. Not a pretty picture.

Since joining this group, however, I've managed to cut down my consumption to just "every once in a while." They're addicting little SOBs, those pies. And thanks to Mission Pie for taking me to the edge of the abyss and back again. 

Sincerely,
Crusty only half as often
author: Christina S.

description:
I want to like them, I want to love them! But I find myself only somewhat satisfied & not very eager to return. 

Recent tasting: pear & cranberry pie. Barely any cranberries in my piece but nice chunks of pear. The crust was pretty heavy, which is understandable since it has to hold up to baking pears, but it was really flavorless...that's what disappointed me. It seemed like some pears, pear puree (or gelatin?) & a few dashes of cranberries, no spice. 

Wonderful if you're a bland-foodist, but I'm not so I was sad. :(

If you go stick w/ what they do best - banana cream pie. I've never been a huge fan of this style of pie, but their's is pretty darn close to heavenly. 

And I like supporting the "support local, empower local" ideology I get when I purchase from here, guess that's why I keep going back.
author: Marissa H.

description:
This place is great, I have gone a few times for myself or to bring to a dinner.  I always get compliments when I bring their items as a dessert.  My favorite is any fruit with raspberries, they use real butter in the crust! (they have vegan options too)  I have tried their sweet and savory options all are really great with the exception of the shaker lemon pie.  I was thinking it was more lemon curd than a zesty rine of sweet and bitter.  It wasn't for me, but the staff was great and exchanged it for another pie.  I rave about this place to anyone that loves fresh baked goodness.

Cash only joint!!!
author: Loretta M.

description:
I have been a Mission Pie devotee since they were a small little place that you entered from 25th street.  

They've since grown into a larger operation that occupies the corner of the building.  The menu has also expanded quite a bit to include some stew pies and quiche selections.

The seating area has expanded to include some larger communal tables and window seating.  The new corner space also means tons of great natural light throughout the day.  It's a really pleasant little spot and their pie selection is consistently delicious.

I always worry when a place that starts as a great little spot suddenly becomes a large, popular spot that the quality of the food or the vibe of the venue will suffer.  I was happy to discover that neither was the case at the new Mission Pie.

If anything, it's better than before.

Luckily, my brother lives around the corner from them and I usually stop in at least once a day when I visit him.

Best pie in SF.
author: Thomas A.

description: Got two slices of banana cream pie.  Service was great and fast. The pie was light and had that banana pudding flavor to it, but was nice and cold. They said bus your own tables, but one of the staff did it for us. Would reccomend for a quick bite to eat dessert!
author: Kevin T.

description:
It sorta saddens me to give Mission Pie three stars, so let me explain.

I ordered walnut pie, and the filling was delicious. Not too sweet, plenty of nuts. But the crust was just not great. It tasted dried out and didn't have good flakiness. Maybe they need to add a Paula Deen dose of butter to change that.

Other than that, I love the interior. It's very cozy and I would chill or read a book here anyday. The large windows make for good people-watching in the Mission.
author: Josh O.

description: There was absolutely nothing special about this place. We got a slice of the strawberry rhubarb pie after a delicious brunch so we were psyched to try the pie. The selection was pretty limited...didn't even have cherry which is one of the most common pie flavors.
