But the worst offense of all was the fact that the pie was served cold...not hot or room temperature...just cold. It was one of the mostly unappetizing thing I've ever eaten. Not only was the traditional sweet/tart flavor lacking but it was also cold. I'm actually confused by all the reviews...sometimes yelp can be reliable and other times not.
author: Mai C.

description:
Banana cream pie - tasty though in a bit of a bland way. Really liked the mixed berry pie - tart with a yummy crumbly topping but minus one star for the long hair I found inside the pie. Ugh. So maybe 3 stars for the pie. 
The lower rating comes from the somewhat poor customer service and poor hygiene (one of the servers handling money also directly touching food).
author: Aisha C.

description: My son and I love Mission Pie. Their coffee and savory Galettes are my guilty pleasure while my son enjoys the kiddie table.
author: L P.

description: I came here in pursuit of pie and definitely found what I was looking for. We had the banana cream which was pretty solid. It wasn't really crave worthy. Cute little place though tucked into a part of the Mission with some good options. Worth a stop if you're in the area but I wouldn't seek this pie out like I do some other places.
author: Stephen S.

description: I had a peach blackberry and it was divine. My friend had their banana cream pie and she said it was to die for. Their prices are reasonable for pie slices, but not for the mini pies ($7), that I feel is a little steep, especially for something on Mission Street, then again I'm sure they're trying to make more money then to just pay rent. My crust was good on top, but a little mushy on the bottom, but other than that, it's worth the shot. Also, they don't take cards, so make sure you have cash on you!
author: Carolina S.

description:
Great pie, great coffee! Great great great! The kind of coffee shop you dream of, but never think you'll find.
Well it's here on Mission and 25th!
Do it!
author: Mr E.

description: Holy shit Banana Cream Pie. Cash only (about 3.50 a slice), you'll thank me later. I never thought pie was special until I had this place.
author: Mike P.

description: I enjoy eating pie crusts, but their bottom crust was really thin. It was a like a teaser for those pie eater's who really like the crust.  Banana cream pie was pretty damn good! The mixed berry pie was also great.  It had a nice balance of tartiness and yet wasn't too sweet. You can really taste the berries, but the banana cream pie...pretty damn good.
author: Kathy S.

description: The slice of pie was tiny and the scoop of ice cream could fit into a teaspoon. It was not worth the money. Do not get me wrong, it tasted good-but it simply was not enough for what I paid for it
author: alexandria s.

description: I came here for lunch and had a braised pork pot pie. The meat as well as the sauce inside were delicious, and the crust was perfect. The pie is a little small, but not too bad. My friend and I even got a free piece of strawberry rhubarb pie to share, because they had cut it too small. It was also delicious.
author: Ryan C.

description:
Ok, all the reviews about the banana cream pie are true...it is amazing.  I'm not a huge banana cream pie in general but this is awesome.  Inside the store is pretty quaint but you can see everyone working on the various food preparation and it's pretty cool.  Besides the banana cream pie we had the apricot tart and it was amazing as well.  The crust was so good.

Great small place with amazing pies you have to check it out!
author: Blake B.

description:
I hate to be mean....but the only saving grace is their coffee (drip that is). Pies are ok. I think the flavors are meh and kinda pricey. I've even tried the salads they sell, they're also--ok.

Service kills me sometimes, as I will have to wait foreva' for who ever is ordering to select what they want (I mean what were you doing all that time in line!?) or the person at the register is having a bad day. 

It's cash only...btw.
author: Hilda Z.

description:
SHOVE IT IN YOUR PIE-HOLE!
...and I mean that with love.

Ah, love.. that's all you get here- well, at least in the pies.  The service, actually, has only been GET-THE-JOB-DONE decent.  But, then again, it's a GET-MY-PIE-AND-LEAVE-ME-ALONE type of place.  There is ample seating, or at least enough room for most everyone to huddle with their company for chit-chat or study.  The bakery is also very hipster-y cute, with rustic furniture that still remains true to San Francisco's urban feel.

The Vegan Apple Cranberry and non-vegan Pear Raspberry have a perfectly sweetened crunch top.  They both are great for those that want a spoiled-brat breakfast without feeling like one, or those that want to spoil themselves with dessert without feeling guilty... and I say "feeling" because I don't know how much cushion they actually add to your trunk.  The Banana Cream pie is more like banana pudding pie; nevertheless, it's quite tasty.  They also give a hefty dollop of Organic Whipped Cream, which is also non-sweetened and perfectly balances out the flavors.  The latter is also free of charge- but I'm sure the $3.5 tag helps.
author: Diane N.

description:
There are some days where I just need a pie fixing. This place serves up some decent pie, but it didn't totally satisfy my pie-sweet tooth. We tried:

** Banana cream - Solid, but needs more banana flavor. I got more of a custard/pudding flavor from it, when what I really wanted was sweet, ripe, chunky banana. I make this at home from scratch, so I guess I'm picky, and I'll keep on searching for the HG of banana creams.

** Walnut - just ok, good texture (it's walnut), and sweet, but nothing extraordinary.

Also, I'm not too jazzed about the crust. Even though the website states the crust is "all-butter" and rolled by hand, am I crazy to say that it didn't scream "BUTTER" to me. It was also a bit soft, and needed more crispy, toasty flakiness. 

Interior was very welcoming, large, and a great place to lounge for a while. Cash only.
author: Michelle S.

description:
My wife told me about this place. I was surprised since this is one of those places that's hard to miss, and I would walk by it often. It's now a landmark of the mission for me. A place I takes guests too.

Banana Cream - It's always there, always dependable. It's my go to pie, the one that never does me wrong. That first slice changed my life. It was so creamy. The textures were overwhelming; the flaky crust, the smooth savory cream, and the mushy sweet bananas. Yes, my friends... that's love.

Shaker Lemon - I'm not a huge lemon pie person. This one rocked my world. I'm so used to those "pies" with lemon "flavoring" but this is not one of those pies. The thinly slices of lemon where insanely delicious. I had this one with a side of whip cream. The tarty flavors with the soft cream where a match made in heaven.

The place is clean and has a very inviting feeling. I've been there later in the night usually during the week so I haven't seen it super busy. I don't think it takes long to eat a slice I pie, but I guess if you're sitting there savoring every bite it could take a while.
author: Gilbert S.

description:
I really wanted to like this place. I LOVE pie. I'll take pie over cake any day. We visited this place at the behest of a list of the top ten dessert pies in SF (sfweekly blogs). I knew something was up when Chile Pies was nowhere to be found on the list though. If you have a hankering for some pie check them out.

We tried the banana cream pie and the pear raspberry pie, as we heard those and the lemon pie were the ones to try (they were out of the lemon). I was underwhelmed by my pie (pear raspberry), the pear was a bit bland and I kept thinking it would have been so much better with apple instead of pear. The crust was bland too. It was good but not AWESOME like the green chile apple pie at Chile Pies. My partner in pie had the banana cream which was good, but to be honest cream pies aren't what I think of when I hear the word pie. She said it was good because it tasted like the banana was fresh and she liked the cream. I had a taste and thought it was sweet but meh nothing to rave about. If I'm in the city and I want pie I'm still heading over to Chile Pies, no contest.
author: Jose U.

description:
DE-LIC-IOUS. I love this place. Everything thing I've tried here has left my tongue dancing: notably the strawberry rhubarb and the pear raspberry.  

From the aesthetics and atmosphere, to the friendly chatty staff, everything about this place is welcoming. It's one of my favorite spots in the city.
author: Kori M.

description:
BANANA CREAM PIE! 

Love yourself. Get some.

They make the best crust ever. Its flaky yet tender and oh so delicious. I can't talk about this pie anymore. I'm drooling.
author: Elissa P.

description: Review of the apple pie: Nothing to thicken or minimize the juice from the apples so both top and bottom crusts were soggy. In the cardboard to go container the juice just soaked into the cardboard.
author: Annie M.

description:
TWENTY FOUR DOLLARS, for a pie ?!?!  
They have really jacked up their prices, and they've lost a long time customer.
author: Eddie W.

description: After reading all the great reviews about this place, we were super excited to dig into some quality pie. The pie was good, but not amazing (tried a raspberry peach crumble of some sort). The bottom crust was pretty soggy, and the flavours were good but not great. Actually, the coffee was the highlight here... Nice place and vibe, though! I'd probably come back and try the famed banana cream pie next time.
author: Kiera S.

description: Great place to relax and enjoy a delicious pie!! We had the banana cream pie and limited time walnut pie!! They were both to die for!! The staff was very friendly and overall it has a very cozy feel to it. The hot chocolate was also very proper=)
author: Ilse A.

description:
So, I love pie. A lot. I consider myself a bit of a pie connoisseur - I eat pie wherever and whenever possible and it might be my favorite dessert of all time.

So, when I heard there was a place in the mission solely dedicated to pie, I had to go. 

First of all, the atmosphere is great - super cute place, mismatched tables and chairs, nice wall paper and great floor to ceiling windows (made people watching on Halloween weekend splendid). Second of all - THE BEST PIE I'VE EVER HAD OUTSIDE OF MY MOTHER'S KITCHEN!!!

Had the pumpkin pie and the mixed berry pie - whipped cream is a must because it's definitely homemade and definitely not too sweet. The pumpkin pie tasted like Thanksgiving came early and the crust was perfect - hint of cinnamon and and just sweet enough for the pumpkin. Oh god, so good. But the mixed berry pie... holy guacamole... the fruit is perfect, it was warm and the crumble crust was perfectly crumbly - surprising hint of oats in the crust and I might have died. 

Also, really great selection of teas, the quiches looked amazing and they have vegan options that looked like they'd rival the mixed berry pie.

So unbelievably highly recommended, and I loved the feel of the place - my sister and I ate the pie, drank our tea and just sat and talked for a couple hours - great spot. AMAZING PIE!
author: Aviya M.

description:
Not that they really need another amazing review
But what a pie the walnut is amazing and the Apple pie is
Let just say why bother to make one yourself
Just go to mission pie and get one
24.00 is actually pretty steep for a pie but it's super yummy
author: R K.

description: Good pies. I got a tofu pie that was kind of sweet for my tastes, but it was supposed to be BBQ so I get it. The dessert I got was all right, strawberry rhubarb. Not super memorable, but fine.
author: Xuan N.

description:
My pie high from the prior night's dinner at Cotogna was quickly fading; By Friday evening, the sugar & carbs had long left my system (oh, but how the pounds linger) & I needed pie again stat! I remembered the 25th & Mission eatery & invited my cousin out for a slice. 

The wall-to-wall windows & the gigantic pie tin above its signage gives Mission Pie a quirky & inviting look. MP is casual, like a coffeehouse. 

We shared: 
-- a slice of plum frangipane ,$4: super tart & had crumbly bits of almond paste. best thing we tried. 
-- ham & cheese quiche, $5: nice flavor, but the eggy, fluffy texture reminded me of why I don't (usually) eat quiche
-- chicken pot pie, $7: entire dish, including the crust, was not well seasoned. veggies were used sparingly & the chicken fat had not been cut off. needless to say, I do not recommend.
-- a slice of banana cream pie, $4: wish there were more banana slices, but overall, a decent sweet treat. 

Savory dishes aren't their strong suit, but their pie slices, although on the small side, are worth a second try (peach looked good & my mom liked the mixed berry slice I brought to her.) I had high hopes for their crust (considering they specialize in pie) but it was bland & not flakey. It'll be a while til I visit MP again as I only like pie once in a blue moon.
author: Fancypants X.

description: Today was a very disappointing lunch day I been driven past this place for a long time now so today I decided to stop but that was not a good idea lol the banana cream pie was bland and the classic chicken pot pie was far away from classic the whip cream they use is gross it's flavorless and leaves weird greasy feeling in your mouth the crust on the pot pie is more like a Filo dough and the filling deff needs lots of salt and pepper and more CLASSIC veggies
author: melisa r.

description:
There's sooooo many different assortments of pies here! Mission is seriously where the good food in SF is from. You just have to know where to go and what to order!!!

There are so many choices of sweet and savory pies such as banana cream, pecan, fruit, shepherd's chicken....

I ordered a banana creme pie and it was so good! The cream wasn't too creamy, and banana creme part wasn't too sweet. The crust could have been flakier though..but it's probably because the pie has been sitting in the store for a while. I can imagine when it's just hot from the oven though..flaky and hot and delicious! 

They also heat up your savory pie. :)
author: Jeanette S.

description:
Every time I come here, I am welcomed by the staff--overall the customer service is at a high standard--they are really attentive and helpful.
I don't really like the coffee, but the environs are cute and cozy. Pet friendly, as well.
author: N Y.

description:
When pumpkin season comes around...pumpkin pie of course.
buy it. try it. 

If you think you hate pumpkin pie, don't be so sure until you try theirs.
always, always ask for their homemade whip creme. 

the 5 starts is for their pumpkin pie only.
i don't really care for their other pies.

i appreciate sustainability and everything you value, but please make your pumpkin pie year round!
author: Nat Y.

description:
The banana cream pie is delightful! It has a delicate vanilla bean custard filling with slices of fresh banana inside along with a crisp, flaky crust. The homemade whipped topping was also great on top. I can't wait to come back and try more. I only wish there were more power outlets and free WiFi here for customers. 

Great little cafe for families with small children and for people to casually meet up!
author: Cheri D.

description:
All you need to know about this place: BANANA CREAM PIE. Mmmmmmm... sooooo good. Oh yeah, and cash only.

Although Mission Pie is located in a semi-shady area on Mission, the place is well worth the visit. THE BANANA CREAM PIE IS BOMB. 5 stars baby. Very creamy, lots of bananas, not overly sweet but sweet enough, yummy crust... this is the BEST BANANA CREAM PIE I have ever had. I believe it's $3.50/slice, and $20/pie.... great to bring to any occasion! 

All the other pies are also made of fruit but less decadent than the banana cream pie since they are traditional fruit pies (not cream). I tried a piece of the peach pie one time, but I wasn't a big fan since I usually don't like "baked fruit" pies (ex. like apple pies). But if you're a fan of these type of pies, I'm sure the variety at Mission Pies would be very tasty (there's usually like 4-6 diff pies)! I'm more of a fatty, Marie Callenders pie type of gal :) and this place definitely has a slightly more "healthy" choice of pies/desserts if you know what I mean.

I've come here a total of 4-5x, so I'm definitely a fan! Just don't come here if you're expecting to go to a super decadent pie shop since they only have simple fruit pies here and other savory items like quiches. There is also usually enough space to sit down and eat a slice; the vibe is very much like a coffee shop. Check it out!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I've been meaning to stop in here for quite some time now. 

Despite it being a pie place I tried their bacon quiche w radish greens. DAMN it was good. 

I can't wait to try one of the many pies they had available. The space was very well-lit with natural light and has about 10 tables and 1 large communal table. 

The staff also was very nice. Nice in that hippie/granola kind of way that reminds you that you're in SF...which is a great thing. 

I definitely recommend this place.
author: Carlos A.

description:
This is for the customer service. I don't need to sell how good the pies are because everyone else has. I'll just reiterate: they're bomb.

But today, we went in and ordered some banana cream pies. Ended up waiting for 10-15 min. due to our forgotten ticket but we were just enjoying the super rare nice day in SF so I was pretty relaxed about it. I politely reminded them about my order and soon after, one nice staff member came out with our pies, complimentary macaroons, $2 Mission Pie coins and the option to get fully reimbursed as an apology for the wait. I didn't need to be reimbursed but took the other offers and happily ate my pie. 

I really loved that so I will definitely be back lots more!!!

And for the record, they seem to generally produce pies in an efficient manner... our order just got lost somewhere I suppose.
author: Amanda V.

description:
I have gotten my family HOOKED on their Banana Cream Pie, that if I ever show up at a family gathering without one, you can hear a unanimous sigh of disappointment throughout the house.   The majority of my extended family lives in the South Bay, so I've become the official Mission Pie delivery person at our  potlucks.  (I usually don't like many banana-type desserts, but their pie is SO damn good!  It's become my favorite.)  

I was on a hunt for lemon pie, and was excited about their Lemon Shaker.  Not too many places offer a Lemon Shaker pie, and Mission Pie makes a delicious one!  You just have to have the palate for it because of it's bitter/sweetness.  I love that it contains whole lemon slices.  

I love this place and support their mission.  Customer service is fantastic!  It's refreshing to see happy people working in an environment they enjoy working at here in San Francisco.   I've lived in this city for over 15 years, and have to come support businesses where I see that the employees are happy and kind.
author: Thuy N.

description:
I LOVE LOVE LOVE Mission Pie, I'm not the biggest fan of pies, but I love Mission Pies.

The Good:
Awesome and Unique PIES PIES PIES
Quick & friendly service
Vegetarian Pot Pies
Vegan Pie Options
There's always something for everyone: fruit, nut, meat, or coffee

The Bad:
When they run out of Nectarine Pie  ;(
When there's no where to sit
author: Amy P.

description: I'm pretty stoked about the beer & pie I just enjoyed. Local craft beer, even. In fact,  the quality of the beer & the pie made the fact that the beer came in a can an endearing aspect,  rather than tacky. I got my pie to go,  but I totally devoured it. The milk stout paired way too well with the walnut pie to try to save it for later. In fact,  everything happening here combines well together,  and makes for a wholly pleasing experience.  The music isn't obtrusive,  the art on the walls isn't too uncomfortably hipster, and the servers are polite,  humble,  and calm.  The customers here are even more pleasant than at other cafes or dessert spots.
author: Lindesay G.

description: Pie heaven!  They have list of dessert pies that they make from scratch daily.  We had a banana cream pie and strawberry rhubarb with vanilla ice cream and it was excellent!
author: Kristina A.

description: I was tasked with dessert for an annual friendsgiving gathering.  I did not bake.  Instead, I swung by (and yes you can find parking and in this part of the mission) and picked up a banana cream pie and a pear almond tart.  And no one considered me that lame guest who brought store bought goods, rather I was the impressive fancy dessert bringer.. they were beautiful and delicious. Success =)
author: Ellie N.

description: I've never had a fresh pot pie before... only the frozen Marie Calender stuff. So, this was pretty good, no doubt.
author: Gerald C.

description:
I have never stepped food (Bwahaha, food on the brain, I meant fooT!!!) inside this place...but my friends have brought me numerous pies from this place.

So far, I've tried their apple, apple rhubarb and something else. My favorite is the apple rhubarb and they're organic, all-natural, etc... Fillin g = delightful, large pieces and obviously not out of a can.  Crust = buttery, flaky, but quality ingredients comes through.... OMG yum.  

You can't stop at one slice, and the pie is worth the $$ upwards of $20! :D (Granted, I have yet to buy one yet :P)

Go get some, yo!
author: Fannie S.

description: This was the first time here and was looking for a slice of great pie. I found it here at Mission pie all the pies were fresh and delicious. I ordered the chess cranberry pie it was sweet and tart and now one of my favorites. The pie had a perfect flaky crust and topped with  organic vanilla ice cream. We also had the lemon pie which also had the whole lemon inside baked into a sweet and slightly tart treat. The slices are a decent and the service was friendly and fast.
author: John F.

description: Have to give a perfect rating, simply for the pie crust alone. It is just the right texture and consistency. We ordered an equal share of sweet and savory offerings, and, while I'm not much of a sweet person, I went ga ga over their sweet pies.
author: Stu R.

description: 5 stars for the best banana cream pie of my life
author: Tina A.

description:
Came here since I was really craving a chicken pot pie and it's close by.

Ordered the chicken pot pie and I wasn't that impressed with it. It looked good when I saw it... but the flavor profile just isn't there. It's a little too bland for my taste. I don't know how to make chicken pot pie, so I'm not sure what's missing... salt? There was a lot of chicken in mine... but the chicken pieces were again bland and dry. All in all, I didn't enjoy my chicken pot pie.

I also got a slice of the banana cream pie. Now, it's nothing compared to Heidi's Pie (in San Mateo) or Nation's banana cream pie... but since its close by, it's good for its location. It's not bad, it's just not pie I would be bragging about with my friends. If I'm too lazy to drive to the other locations for my banana cream pie, I guess Mission Pie will do.

My experience was ok here... I may come back in the future to try the other pies they have.
author: Johnson S.

description:
"Any time is a good time for pie."

Yes, Bruce Willis' French girlfriend from Pulp Fiction, any time IS a good time for pie.  Especially breakfast.  On my way to work, groggy and possibly hungover, I see the sign for Mission Pie and think, yes, that's a great idea.

Their pies are always seasonal, so the menu rotates.  I recently ordered a blueberry/apricot pie for my department.  Yum (as others have so eloquently put it).  I love their out of control strong coffee, too; a small is enough to start your day off right.  Really, A+'s all around.
author: Chris C.

description:
About $3.80 for about 1/5 of a pie. 

The banana cream pie is delicious and isn't too heavy. It can get pretty crowded at night so sometimes you  have to wait around for a spot to sit at, but otherwise great place to relax for dessert & coffee.
author: Alice W.

description: The people here were really nice and awesome. The musical soundtrack was rocking and spot on. The pie, however, was decent. We got the peach elderberry pie and it was a little dry.
author: Isaac R.

description: Hmmmm Banana Cream Pie! I'm not even a pie person! Love it! Full of banana flavor, there are actual chunks of banana inside, and the crust is amazing. Flaky and wonderful. This place is amazing, and it's open until 10pm. Perfecto!
author: Vanessa K.

description:
I love pie. In order of preference: apple pie, cherry pie, blueberry pie. 

Today, I had apple pie and apple cranberry (vegan) pie. Both were good but I liked the apple cranberry a little more than the apple because it had a fancy crumble topping. The apple pie crust was a little crisp, but I liked the inside. 

There isn't a ton of seating, but if you're a duo there are lots of tables for you.
author: Dorothy B.

description:
My buddy showed up at my doorstep with two apple & huckleberry mini-pies from Mission Pie. He popped them into the oven while I whipped up tea & lattes. Silence ensued for the next 3 minutes as we devoured the pies (lick the plate clean devoured), followed by moaning & groaning about how amazing they were and how we need more. The next day the BF and I ventured across town and braved the hipster movement to get us sum-mo-pie. More moaning and groaning. Freaking awesome delicious pie! The whipped cream is an unnecessary -- trust me. 

I wish I could bequeath them an extra sixth star for the huge smile the cashier girl flashed me. Sweet & also sincere. 

I'll be back.
author: Laney L.

description: Amazing pie. Definitely recommend getting the ice cream along with it. Sometimes can be crowded. Go early they run out of flavors quickly.
author: Vanessa O.

description: Was bringing the bf's family a pie to bribe them into liking me so I had to be thorough and taste test as many pies as possible. Their fruit pies (aside from banana cream which was just okay) are sooo good, especially the pear blueberry (which is the one I ended up bringing). Their other pies are still good, but not as amazing as the fruit ones. Definitely get the seasonal fruit pies though!
author: Esther K.

description:
I want to go to there.

Banana cream -- I ate three slices in less than 12 hours.  Next time I'm just buying the whole pie.

I normally just tolerate pie crusts as a way to deliver pies to my mouth, but this pie crust itself is outstanding.

Just thinking about their pies makes me fat and happy.

Honestly, is there anything better than a store that specializes in pies?
author: David L.

description: So amazing! The lemon shaker pie is to die for, make sure to get it with whipped cream to cut the tartness. Cute little place, a block away from the 24th st Bart station, and good coffee. If I could change anything, it would be the addition of wifi.
author: Melissa C.

description: Not much there is to say about Mission Pie. They have a nice assortment of sweet and savory pies available.  I came in here with a small group and we ordered the banana cream and mixed berry pies. Both were tasty but I wish they had heaten up the berry pie instead of just taking it out of the fridge and placing it on a plate.  The place is quaint and does get randomly busy but if your ever in the area and our craving something sweet. I would say to give this place a try
author: Nava N.

description: Delicious pies made using local ingredients and lots of love.  Lovely interior setting and they even sell fresh flowers and jams!  If you are in the area and hankering for delicious, crusty, warm pie with fresh cream on top then go here!
author: Carmel U.

description: The walnut pie was delicious but the banana cream was disappointing. The shell wasn't that great and there was very little whip on the top layer. The set up in there is ok but I would grab and go. There are much better pie places around.
author: Vanessa H.

description: Delicious pie!  Loved the peach raspberry!  The plum frangipane was great too.  The chicken pot pie smelled tasty.  Go and indulge.
author: Carolyn K.

description: Had the banana cream pie & it was yummy.  I've been here several times and really enjoy it. The only thing I don't like is there is never any seating.
author: Carb Q.

description: Fresh custard quiches, savory warm pot pies, and delicious fruit pies. And a lot of organic, independent, and local sources!
author: Bunny C.

description:
I hate to give such a Mission institution only one star.  I give this rating for a number of reasons.  

a) my piece of walnut pie had a LONG HAIR baked into it.  it was threaded into the crust and ran through the filling as well.

b) neither the pie nor the coffee were as good as I could make at home.  I am referring to the pie I tasted before I saw the hair

c) crowded!  apparently hair pie is popular!  ;)
author: Margaret C.

description:
Okay, here's the deal. I used to really dislike this place...a lot. It had nothing to do with their products, it stemmed mostly from the sentiment that it was yet another example of the gentrification of the Mission. I grew up in the Mission and watched this place grow, too. Let me tell you, from first hand experience, in watching this place grow (and rooting for it's failure) that the people who run this place are no joke. They mean business. Not only are they serious about putting out the best products possible, but they actually care about investing in the neighborhood and providing a solid business model for philanthropic ventures. 

I also had a so-so experience with the pies, in the early days. I wanted to like them, but wasn't blown away. I tried one or two but wasn't impressed and didn't really give it a shot. Well, that's CHANGED! 

Just tonight, I had the Mixed Berry Mini Pie and holy blackberry's, Batman! It was probably one of the most delicious things I've ever put in my mouth, and let me tell you...I've had some pretty delicious things in this mouth. 

So, Mission Pie, please accept my most humblest apologies and my avid support of you and your business. You have made a fan out of me, and I was your biggest critic. I'm sure you know who I am so let's not make this any more awkward than it is. You'll be seeing me come in, more often, for my mixed berry pie fix. Damn you! Bless you! Thank you! 

Humbly yours, 
Your newest fan
author: Antonio G.

description: My coworker bought the team a banana cream pie. It was soooooooooooo goooood!!! I normally don't like cream pies but this was an exception! It was not overly sweet and the bananas tasted like how bananas are supposed to taste! Omg!! I want another slice right now!!! It was soooo good!!!!!
author: Alice X.

description: What happened to my neighborhood pie shop? I used to come here often; I'd grab a coffee and a slice of walnut pie, take a seat, and relax wifi-free for forty minutes. It was unique, pleasant, and comfortable. Today the pretension is so thick it's hard to wade through it. Despite the increase in pie price, I still had faith in my local pie shop. I walked in today with some beans that needed grinding - my coffee grinder broke yesterday - and was promptly told "we only grind 1type of bean here, sorry." After giving them my business for so long they left me hanging high and dry and coffee free. Just not very neighborly.
author: Julie P.

description: Amazingggg, the Banana Cream Pie was the best pie my wife and I have EVER tried, and we have tried many over the years.
author: Giancarlo P.

description:
I felt silly spending four dollars on a slice of pie. But then the counter man asked if I wanted any, "Whipped cream on top of that?" 

I would have paid four dollars for the whipped cream alone.  Which, kind of makes me feel silly.

But damn!

Light yet rich, full of moisture without sacrificing texture. 

The plum frangipane tart filling itself didn't cause any quakes in my tasters, but the crust killed. 

House was packed, and I wound up sitting at a tiny round top with a stranger. Which was actually nice, but only because I was in the mood. 

We chatted a second, focused on our computers for about an hour, then complimented each other for being très communal before parting ways.

The staff was helpful but didn't go out of their way to be friendly.
author: Sarah M.

description: Amazing pie! But I recommend going elsewhere for coffee. A shame because coffee and pie go so well together
author: Jamie L.

description:
Yeah, this place turned out to be just hype - quite disappointing...

We tried the chicken pot pie - which turned out to be rather watery / soupy on the inside (instead of substantial chicken and veggies), and the banana-cream pie - which turned out to be a small portion and tasted like nothing special (I thought you couldn't go wrong with banana-cream pie, but apparently you can). In both cases, I kept thinking that my office cafeteria pies beat these by far - that shouldn't be the case for a place that has "Pie" in the name now should it...?
author: Lucy V.

description: Omg walked in for a coffee and the place smells so good..it's so cute I can't wait to come back and eat something
author: Amber R.

description:
I used to like pie a lot.  Recently, I don't eat as much pie; I don't eat as much sweets in general, and pie doesn't often make the cut.  With that caveat, my review:

When I want pie, it's generally a fruit pie with a flakey, buttery crust that I'm craving.  It's good when the fruit tastes like fruit.  Sweet is fine, but don't overdue it. 

I visited twice over the past year or so and tried a slice of fruit pie each time.  Mission Pie came highly recommended, and I seemed like a specialty place.  

Initial impression is that everything looks amateur; the pies especially.  Many are lop sided and break apart when sliced.  But, after looking around, I get that sense of the entire environment.  

Taste of the pie was not especially good.  Maybe, mid-diner level.  Also tried the coffee (drip only).  Again, alright, but not very good.

On a third occasion, I visited with the idea of trying another slice.  But, after walking in and surveying the pies, I left without ordering.  Nothing looked good enough to warrant the calories.  

Perhaps I'm being a bit harsh for what the place is.  But, given the high ratings, my expectations were similar.

(Reading some of the other reviews, I note that Mission Pie seems to be associated with some social causes.  Their website states that they are a for-proffit business.  Anyway, perhaps they should be graded on a curve?)
author: Jice E.

description:
...its always been desserts first for me no matter what! The reason is simple: you dont have to worry about leaving room for the good stuff!  Which today the good stuff is PIE and more pie coz I ate a good share of compadres too. Pies are not to rich they are tasty and yummy and make a meal. At least they are for me.  

Some noisy snaps for the VERY BERRY pie! Im on a Pie kick now thanks to Mission Pie!! Im over donuts for a minute although I will never pass up chocolate cake...(Marie Antoinette and I have that in common).
author: Bryan G. W.

description: It was hard to believe that, at 9pm, the most bumpin' spot on the block was a pie joint. That was, of course, before I tried my pie. I went with the classic apple pie (it was in season!) and I wasn't disappoint. The pie itself was a little too tangy, but it was complimented by the homemade whipped cream, don't let the staff skimp on that stuff.
author: Jarvis J.

description: We came here after reading such great reviews, but were utterly disappointed. The Moroccan lamb pot pie, banana cream pie and apple pie were dry and unseasoned. They seem to use quality ingredients, and local source is to be commended, but the execution was very poor.
author: R C.

description:
CASH ONLY!  I went to Mission Pie to get some pie for home.  I got a slice of banana creme pie for $3.50 and a walnut tartlet for $3.

They don't have big bags so bring your own if you need it.  The walnut tartlet they put in a small brown bag and the banana creme pie they put in a recycled-type container - but by the time I got home all the creme got smooshed on one side.

CASH ONLY
Saw a sign for Restroom through the kitchen in the back - didn't use.
author: Ann L.

description:
I'm convinced the secret of their pies is the crust.  The ingredients are sweet and probably organic, but let's be real here, if we just wanted to eat fruit flavors we'd eat actual fruit.  Pie is all about the crust, and theirs is superbly flaky, which is properly characteristic for San Franciscans.

Service is kind of slow when it's busy (understandable), and they've forgotten my order entirely at least twice (and I am not exactly a regular here...), which is not as understandable, so points off for that.  Also, do not order the pot pie, it is quite possibly the most disappointing pot pie I have ever had.  Except the crust, which is delicious as usual.

Recommended:
Any pie with pears in it.  They have incredibly good pears.
author: Norman S.

description: The place is a bit small. But thats not a surprise since its in SF city. We got a banana cream pie and a mixed berry pie. I am not a big fan of pies but these pies made me like pies.
author: Osman S.

description: Perfect, inexpensive, little pie place.
author: Gad Z.

description:
Really like the pies here... fresh made, savory, but over priced but I guess this is the price for fresh grown fruit on a farm to use in these pies. 

Only negative is that ther eis no WIFI
author: Vanessa T.

description: I don't know what the fuss is about. Because of all the hype, you'd expecting to have some kind of out of body experience on first bite. It's just pie! The pear and blueberry pie was good but no better than any other pie I've had. My boyfriend said the banana cream made his top 5 worst list.
author: Jeanne C.

description: The walnut pie; great, and yes, I went through a faze but in general; completely overrated with fairly crap pastry.
author: Ali B.

description:
How is Mission Pie like In-n-Out burgers? They are two highly-rated, popular, beloved eateries with cult-like followings ... and I just don't get the hype of either.

My banana cream pie was very mediocre and I had to share a table with pseudo intellectuals discussing middle east politics while using the word "like" in every sentence.  I was, like, "can't I just eat this boring banana cream pie in peace?"  

So Bye Bye, Miss Mission Pie ...
author: Rosie M.

description: Tried slices of the berry pie and turtle pie. I'm a chocolate lover, but it was hard to decide which flavor I liked better! Good stuff! Right amount of flaky, perfectly baked crust. Will definitely come back to try the other fillings!
author: Riz W.

description:
LOVE my Mission Pie & Hot Cup of Tea!
Variety is Spice of Life & they've got it going on!
Great Atmosphere & it smells so GOOD! :)
author: Lady J.

description:
Peach-Rasberry pie was good but not phenomenal.  Especially for $3.50 a slice...
I'd come here again to try their other pies, but only if I'm in the area and craving something sweet.  Otherwise, I don't think it's worth going through the pain of trying to find parking.
author: S R.

description: And heat it. omg yum. vegan apple cranberry pie --- with crumb (which is my fav pie topping) I think I'm in love --- not to mention there was live music (first monday night) and savory tofu veggie bowls available. I'll be back to try the coffee roasted in Sebastopol, CA and more pie of course. Quaint atmosphere. lovely vibe.
author: Coco J.

description:
I have been here a few times and tried the following pies:

Banana Crean
Peach
Peach-Raspberry
Sweet Potato

I thought all of the pies I tried were delicious with amazing crusts. 

I wish the whipped cream had sugar in it. As far as it being Cool Whip - NOT SO. A previous reviewer complained that the whip was Cool Whip???? This was homemade whip - trust me, I am an avid from scratch baker so I know the difference between  Cool Whip and real whipped cream.

They don't accept cards (they take cash and check) which can be inconvenient if you want more than a slice.  

I walk all the way from the Lower Haight for this spot and a good thing I do to because I can polish off 2 slices in a snap!
author: Katherine B.

description:
This pie's so good it is a crime.

If Agent Dale Cooper came here he would DIE. The banana cream pie is some "damn fine pie".
author: Cyndi C.

description: Delicious, health food,  inexpensive,  totally amazing pies. We had a great rescue meal there today with tasty salads on the side.
author: John D.

description: They've got a cherry pie there that'll kill ya.
author: Dale C.

description:
I've passed this place a billion times finally decided to check it out.

Ehhhh.  It's "ok"
author: Anthony Xavier S.

description:
banana cream pie
you are my dream come true.
what would it mean
to spend my life with you?
author: T A.

description:
Never really tripped off this place(in the Mission I usually go for my people's food - pupusas and Mexican food), until I heard about a lemon pie...hmmm...I love love lemon desserts (like the lemon cupcake from CupKates) and homemade lemon anything. 

So, this is what we tried: 

Savory

1. Chicken Pot pie- Husband liked it, ate every bite of it. He said it was good, but didn't give a quick response about the goodness of it...so it was just ok. I had one bite of it and I think I like the KFC one more- yes I had one last week when I was sick! yum! 

2. Slice of Quiche of the day- I think it had Spinach and mushrooms This was so good! It was eggy and soft and souffle textured! superb! I wondered why it was so much better than other quiches and I think it is because they use way less cheese than other places so it makes light and airy...not heavy like many of my homemade quiches have turned out. 

3.  Wheat berry salad- superb! talk about cancer fighting salad! OMG, this is one to replicate- I am buying the ingredients tomorrow: wheat berries, radicchio, cauliflower, green onion, parsley, olive oil and probably salt, oh and I think i tasted lemon. That was incredible. Husband loved it too! 

Sweet
1. Apple cranberry pie (Vegan)- husband loved it. This was he was sure of! He said that he would order this again and it had a good balance of apples to cranberries. I tasted it and enjoyed it as well. 

2. Shaker lemon pie- Wow, this was quite interesting -was almost like a love-hate relationship for me. I didn't love it when I first tasted it, but the second bit was amazing. So, the peel makes me kind of hate it, but the lemon curd like filling makes me love it! It was like bitter/sweet/bitter/sweet/bitter/sweet...all gone! I am thinking that whipped cream might have created more of a balanced taste, but I didn't get it because we took it to go. Anyway, I think this is the most interesting pie I've ever had. I will try it again and again maybe...

All in all, solid place!
author: Yva D.

description: Nice place to have pie and coffee/tea. The raspberry pear pie was fresh and the fruit texture was perfect. Pie crust was good, but not very much above standard. Slightly too sweet, would have been nice with a few acidic notes from the raspberries left.
author: John S.

description: I went here yesterday for late afternoon pie and coffee. I have been meaning to try Mission Pie since moving to SF last year. I had the Dutch Apple and another fruit one. Everything was delicious! Also loved the vibe inside which had wild flowers for sale and on display and had a warm comfy vibe. Can't go wrong being indulgent here!
author: Itai B.

description: Anytime I'm in the area, I make a stop here. Everything I've had here is baked to perfection. The pie, scones, breakfast pastries, all delicious! Pie must be eaten with ice cream, because it is also awesome. Bring cash.
author: Helene E.

description:
Spacious pie shop with a great selection of sweet and savory pies.  We stopped by for dessert and ordered a slice of the chocolate cream (sunday special) and the strawberry-rhubarb with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.  

Grabbed a table and found a chess board nearby so started to play while we waited for the pies.  The strawberry-rhubarb was phenomenal, while the chocolate cream was good.  I think they've mastered the berry pie and I'll stick with that on my next visit!
author: Allison P.

description: A little pricey for pie but it is very good.  Everything is so natural and high quality. We went with walnut and strawberry rhubarb. Definitely worth an afternoon visit.
author: Bobby H.

description: Thanks Yelp for Mission Pie.  I needed pies for Thanksgiving and came to Mission Pie due to the reviews on Yelp.  Wow, this place is cute.  I love it.  The cafe is adorable.  The pies were wonderful.  I purchased the pumpkin (fresh pumpkin, no canned stuff), pear cranberry (wonderful, the cuts of the pear allows them to retain their shape and taste), the vegean apple and cranberry was also top-notched.  My husband and a piece of walnut pie while we waited for the other pies to get wrapped up, he loved it.  I'm sorry I could not taste due to nut allergies but it looked good.
author: t d.

description:
I am so sad to have to share my experience of Mission Pie.  But, it is really true.

I was super-excited to check out Mission Pie, because I heard that it was owned and operated by the same person who does Destination Baking in Glen Park, which I totally love.

So - I went to check out Mission Pie just days before Christmas of 2010.  I stood in line (which moved smoothly) - and eventually got up to the front and was greeted by the young lady behind the counter.

She seemed frazzled (which was not why I am giving Mission Pie ONE star for the rating) -- I would have been frazzled too - with that many customers just before Christmas.  

I was asking her about the pies I could purchase as whole pies to take home.  She really was not-so-helpful -- really not able to recommend one pie over another... not particularly enthusiastic about any pie, exactly.  

I chose the cranberry-apple pie and the sweet-potato pie.  

I also chose two chicken pot-pies to go.  I wanted to serve the pot pies for dinner, and serve the other pies for Christmas dinner and Christmas Eve.

I followed the instructions on the pot pies before serving.

Whoa.  

These have got to be the worst pot pies I have ever tasted.  My sweetie took the first bite, and pulled something out of his mouth -- which elicited a grimace.  

"what is this?"

some mystery chicken connective tissue?  cartilage?

not sure.  

not good.

I tasted mine - the chicken was tendon-y.  

After only one bite each, we tossed the pot-pies out into the compost.  I didn't even feel comfortable giving these pies to my kittens.

I felt horrible about throwing away the food -- something I NEVER do, because it is so wasteful.  

But these pies were really awful.

I was optimistic about the sweet potato pie, because it is my FAVORITE at Destination Baking Company.

wrong.

Just terrible.  

I did actually finish a small piece -- but then brought the pie to the hospital where I work - knowing that scavengers would take care of it.

They did.

The cranberry apple pie actually deserves at least a two-star rating.  It was not terrible.

not great.  But not terrible.

Two personal-size chicken pot pies, 1 sweet potato pie, and 1 cranberry apple pie = $52.00.  

They didn't take credit cards.  So, I paid by check.  

I won't be going back.

Anyone else know of a good bakery in the Mission?
author: Amy P.

description:
Absolutely delicious pies!!!
Apple, walnut and Banana Cream are superb.
author: Romeo And Lola K.

description:
Yum! 
Great tea's and Amazing Pie's!
author: Charliena B.

description:
My pie was cold.

I had pear combined with some berry pie. It had thick slices of firm, cold pear. That's not a good pie experience. I can't believe they don't warm up the pie before serving. 

The whipped cream was fresh and unsweetened-excellent.
The cappuccino was delicious and hot.
The counter-woman was friendly.
They have self-service water.
The place is warm and cozy.

My pie was cold.

(I had subtracted a star for cold pie, but I added one for great espresso drinks.  
It used to be the only place you could get a good cappuccino was at an Italian restaurant.
We're coming full circle as the groove-ster hive mind pretends briefly-roasted, green coffee beans make a delicious cup of acid, I mean, 'cappuccino'.
Real espresso is disappearing.  
We're back to Italian restaurants and Mission Pie, holding strong.)
author: Lame Lake Meese Z.

description: Cool trendy place in the Mission, something you wouldn't expect in the area. We tried the Pear and Blueberry Pie and also the Banana Cream. Sooo good! They have unique combinations and ingredients from sweet to savory so you just have to try them all. Only complaint was the portion, for $4 a slice I would like a bigger size.
author: T L.

description:
The banana cream pie that we got for takeout was really quite good.  The crust has a nice flaky texture but I especially liked the custard filling.  Light and not too sweet.  Also, just my preference but I liked that they didn't overstuff the pie with banana slices. 

Curious to try the other pies.  Whole pies are $20.  Cash only.
author: F. P.

description:
The pies here are amazing. We got there while they were about to close, but they let us eat in and let us stay while they were cleaning up. I got a pear and frangipan tart topped with whipped cream. The pie came warm, they reheated it and the whipped cream wasn't overly sweet, but perfectly balanced the pie's flavours. Buttery and flaky crust, crisp without being dried out. It would have been 5 stars but the coffee I got was lacking, what? I can't quite put my finger on it, not quite bold enough or not sweet enough, could have been the milk choice. Also I feel like there should be a larger pie selection. Don't get me wrong, there were at least 5 to choose from, but if your main focus is on pies, I would like more variety.
The place is really cute, looks like they used reclaimed wood in their construction and the chairs don't all match which makes the place have a fun charming feel.
author: Brian J.

description:
Note to self: Ask them to warm the pie (if they have an oven). Slow service. Need to be warmed.  $1.50 for a small scoop of Strauss vanilla ice cream. 

We had the Winter Apple and Walnut Pie. 


Cash only.
author: Jboogie L.

description:
Oh my Pie!

I was walking towards the shop and I swore to god I won't leave the place without trying most of their pies.

So we got a slice each of Pear Frangipane Tart, Quiche, Shaker Lemon, Walnut and Potato Tart.  

The ones that really stood out for me was the Shaker Lemon (oh my with the sweet tangy taste) and the Potato Tart (anything with bacon and mushroom is a winner, right? right!).  

Very nice cashier too.  I was talking to her about why it's "CASH ONLY".  Seriously, establishments should not be charged more for having the machine.  Because for people like me who seldom carry cash in our wallets, we have more buying power with our cards.

I'm not done with this place.  I will come back and eat more pie.
author: Pam S.

description: Galette was delicious!  The crust was amazing.  YUMMMM I'm a fan for sure
author: Gabriela H.

description: Can't say that I'm as enthused as everyone else.  The pie I tried (raspberry-pear, I think?) was overly sweet -- not just the filling, but the crumble on top.  The a la mode was a little skimpy, too.  Maybe I should have tried a different pie?
author: Laurence W.

description:
The aforementioned disgruntled employee problem has been solved. Kind, friendly and knowledgeable wait staff are plentiful and I may now say that this establishment deserves 5 stars. 
Once in the years that I've been eating pie here, I had a less than stellar piece of pie....once. It had just gone flat by the end of the day.
Great great great pie.
author: Melody M.

description: Great pies but you have to remember to tell them to heat yours up.  The strawberry rhubarb is really good but they only have it when it is in season.  Raspberry pear wasn't that good.
author: Sean L.

description: Been wanting to stop by here for quite some time. I was so excited to try a few pies. I ordered their apple huckleberry and banana cream...Both were good but in my opinion it wasn't great or memorable.  I thought it was just okay. I didn't like their pie crust cuz it was a bit dry n crusty. Im looking for that buttery sugary, flakey goodness!
author: Rosalynn D.

description: best Banana cream pie ever.  I was expecting something different, but damn, this pie was like fresh pudding with bananas.  It wasn't overpowering at all, I'm not a fan of banana cream pies either, I'm more of a fruit pie (apple, berries).  I've also tried their pumpkin pie which was excellent as well.  Not too sweet and filled with fresh pumpkin (there are pumpkin fibers in it).  I wish they had a strawberry rhubarb, that would be the best.
author: Kevin W.

description:
So my wife told me about this place and we decided to check it out.

Parking sucks, we had to park around the block. But its right on Mission.

Upon arriving, the place is decent in size. Wood floors and even a huge wood table. 
Slice of pie was about $3.50 and were about the right size.

The taste was great. Simply tasted better than any reheated pie. 
We had banana slice, Pear/rasberry slice, apple slice and a macaroon. 

What I like about this place is that it felt "local". There is a shelf that has local products you can buy. Honey, Jams, marmalades, even some small pottery/plates that were made for  mission pies. 

On all the walls are promotions about local, organic and how mission pies was about the local farmers and their products (map showing where they get what).

Great place and if you are in the area, I suggest stopping by and have a slice.
author: Roger A.

description:
I'm a big fan of Pie Ranch and all that they do (it's worth the trip if you enjoy farms and tree swings), so I've been looking forward to eating at Mission Pie for some time. 

It was solid. The pie crust was outta this world- so light. I'm a big chocolate fan and since they didn't have anything like a double chocolate cake, we had the mixed berry pie, peach blackberry and then the potato fennel tart. I really enjoyed them all!

And I will be back for more because this store makes the world a better place.
author: Marn E.

description: Great pie, but a little pricy. This has, however, not stopped me from eating many pieces of pie here. I still like their plain ol apple the best.
author: Michael S.

description:
Uh, no.

I was really excited to try Mission Pie and even more disappointed at how average it was. Tried the banana cream and walnut. Both were honestly just...bland. Sadly not much more to say based on how unimpressive it was. I just can't understand the love for this place.
author: Aubrey O.

description: I don't get it. OK, this place makes a bunch of different pies, and most of them are decent, but we've never had anything from here that's great or even out of the ordinary. Why so much buzz? Beats me ...
author: David K.

description:
Was somewhat disappointed with the pies here. I have been wanting to try the pies here for months, and finally picked up three whole pies (apple, lemon, banana cream) to bring to a bday party. 

The lemon pie was the worst. Extremely bitter from way too much zest and peel. The filling was just too gloppy. I expected the filling to be lemon meringue-y - light and tart. The apple pie was better, but a little sweet. The crust was nice on this one. The banana cream pie was probably the best - custardy and just the right amount of banana. The whipped cream was light and went nicely with the filling.

The pies were $20 each. Generally, I think a $9 pie from Whole Foods would be about the same. 

Cute little place to grab a slice, but other than that, I wouldn't go back to buy whole pies.

Cash only.
author: Cindy Y.

description:
I used to date a guy in London.

He said that he knew "I was the one" when I had finished off all of our appetizers, and a big plate of curry with no effort, in 7 minutes. 

The rest of my friends at the table had barely touched their beers. Let alone their food.

There was a look of wonder on everyone's faces.

As I pushed my empty plate away from myself.

So....

I can eat.

Like really eat.

My plate is empty before anyone else's.

And I'm always quick to refill it for seconds.

I'm not quite sure where I got this talent.

Could be a Welsh thing?

But I suspect that it's a family thing.

Back in the day.

In New Jersey.

Whenever we were treated with takeout. Chinese, Indian or Pizza.

We all dived in.

My two siblings and I, armed with huge appetities. 

If one of us didn't eat it, someone else would. Eyes bigger than our stomachs, Married with Children playing in the background, we'd heap on two and three slices of pizza at a time onto our grease stained plates. Making sure to taint the slices with our dirty playground fingers, so no one else could have them.

We were territorial and fierce when it came to food.

In five minutes - there was nothing but empty Chinese cartons and empty pizza boxes.

It was gruesome.

So...when a couple of days ago, we had a number of birthdays in the office, and a handful of Mission Pie's - my natural urge to devour came out in it full....uh....

"I'll just have a small peice...a little bigger....uhhhhhh....a little bigger. Here, why don't  I help myself?"

(plopping a gigantic serving of banana cream pie on my plate)


force.

We had three pies. A strawberry pie, an apple pie, and a banana cream pie. Each pie was unique, fresh, and dangerous. The crust of the apple and strawberry was light and buttery. It melted in the mouth, followed by a fruity burst of slightly tart strawberry or sweetened apple delight.

The banana cream pie was the real star. Stunning. Perfection.

Sweet banana sliver slices, surrounded my a mouth-watering mass of banana custard-like ambrosia, lightly topped with fresh cream.

I lingered in the kitchen, cutting of small slice, after small slice of that banana pie.  It was instinctual. 

Where there was once 3/4 of a pie, was quickly whittled down to a little less than 1/2 (and that's being generous).

I stared longingly at the pie. I could have easily finished it in two fork fulls. Those primitive New Jersey eating days egging me on.

But I resisted the power of the pie - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pie 

And instead - grabbed some carrots, and a water.

And sat down at my desk.

I could still hear the banana cream calling me.

But I put on my headphones, and chomped away on carrots.

Each carrot bite,

an attempt 

to forget about the magical lure that is Mission Pie.

.0000000000000000000000000000000000000001percent

more mysterious and alluring than

this

3.14159 26535 89793 23846 26433 83279 50288 41971 69399 37510

pi.
author: Jessica T.

description:
It was one of the most talked about pies ever. I'm referring to my West African Peanut Stew pot pie. Unassumingly brought it into a meeting at work, and it immediately prompted the following Q&A:

- "Where did you get that?" (Mission Pie)

- "Did you go all the way down their?" (No. Picked it up last night while also getting a slice of banana cream pie. Knew I wasn't going to be able to leave the office for lunch.) 

- "Are you really eating both?" (Yes. It's all part of an epic night with Paul Van Dyk. Need fuel. And four hours of dancing equals eating whatever I want, including pie.) 

For the record:

- West African Peanut Stew pot pie: Four stars. Potatoes, quinoa and veggies were excellent.

- Banana Cream pie: Strong three stars.

- Paul Van Dyk: Five enthusiastic, uplifting, life affirming stars.
author: Jason B.

description: Overrated. $3.50 for a tiny slice of pie? I guess it was worth a try... Many of my friends have been raving about this place, talking about how much they're craving Mission Pie at the moment so I gave it a try while I was in the neighborhood. I got the Mixed Berry Pie. It was tiny and it lacked crust. It just looked like a mush of liquefied berries on a plate. I didn't enjoy the amount of seeds from the berries as it masked any other texture. Probably won't be coming back here any time soon...
author: Kevin H.

description:
I finally tried this place our during lunch.  I ordered a chicken pot pie and a vegan pear cranberry pie.  They didn't have any pies with chocolate for my fiance so I ordered the banana cream pie to go for him.  Their coffee was really good and went well with the vegan pear cranberry pie.  It had a slight sweet and tart flavor and paired nicely with the fresh whipped cream.  The chicken pot pie was not that great.  I have had better chicken pot pie.  There was something about the flavor that did not taste right to me.  The banana cream pie was ok, not fabulous.  

I would come back to try other pies, like fruit pies with the fresh whipped cream as I enjoyed the pear cranberry pie, along with their coffee.
author: V B.

description:
How can you not like this place? I've now had a few different types of pies from here and they're all stellar. My two current favorites are the strawberry rhubarb and the banana cream. 

My buddy Kevin's only lament is that they don't have ice cream (Mitchell's if you're reading, please) to go on top, if you eat in, but with a "pie in the sky" good cause (http://www.pieranch.org/) like this, he and I both are willing to get over it. 

So you can eat inside - there are a few tables - but we saw some folks grabbing a slice and eating outside, or next to their cars. This last Saturday afternoon, a couple of friends and I ordered a whole pie and took it home, had it with champagne. Now's that deluxe!
author: Nish N.

description:
Scrumdiddlyumptious!

An independent, sustainable, and responsible businesses that favors locally grown, natural materials and ingredients--that's rare... and one that is THIS delicious? That's just plain 'ol AWESOME.

Like a swallow returning to Capistrano, every time I'm in the Mission I seem to find myself flapping my little wings here for a slice of seasonal pie and a cup of loose leaf tea.

And they have a clean bathroom. (C'mon, it's important!)

Bravo/a good folks at Mission Pie! Keep up the great work.
author: Russell H.

description:
Wait. Does such a place actually exist? Finally, I can give up Nations and get decent pie.

So I ventured here with friends the other day and was pretty impressed. The corner location was full of life, even at 8:30, and not to mention, the pie was pretty good. I got the Shaker Lemon, which I liked, except for the pieces of lemon peel in it, which made it a bit bitter. Was not expecting that at all. Banana creme was pretty good, no complaints there. The apple definitely took the cake (I mean, pie), it had pretty big chunks of apple pieces that made the entire thing super delicious.

I would say next time, I would try to be there a bit earlier. Pies run out, and if I had gotten my hands on the Pear one. 5 stars .. for sure.
author: Jessica H.

description:
I had heard about this place for hours in hushed whispers and distal reverence.  "Let's go get some pies.  I know a good spot..."  like even committing the name to words might disrupt the deliciousness of the pies that awaited us.  My mind dreamed up a veritable Willy Wonka's of pie shops.

:(  What happened, guys?  These pies are average at best.  Luckily I was with a large group and got to try many different pies, so the mediocrity wasn't just a single pie, but spread equally throughout.  I watched in confusion as most of my group devoured their pieces like it was Ambrosia, but I nibbled politely at mine, offering as many people as many bites as they wanted.  It just wasn't that good.

The apple pie was apple sauce in crust.

The pumpkin pie was bland and could use a few (hundred) shakes of cinnamon.

The walnut pie was my favorite, but still has nothing on a pecan pie that anyone could make themselves.  (Ask me for the world's easiest recipe!)

I would go back if someone invited me, but it would be for the company, not the pie.
author: Brett P.

description: Tried their banana cream pie and the peach one. Love the banana cream one a lot! Also, I like the vanilla ice cream there too! I will recommend this place!
author: Suki W.

description: Crammed with chicken and vegetables is what I experienced with Mission Pie's Chicken Pot Pie. Along with a thick & crusty crust, it was good enough for me to mutter:  Hmmm, that's good pie.
author: Derek N.

description:
I swore I already wrote a review for this place...hmm what happened to it?

Anyway, went here for the first time on Pi Day with my friend Michael who was in from out of town. I had banana cream and he had a pear tart or something super fancy looking. They both looked great, but my banana cream was more like instant banana pudding with thick, flavored gelly instead of bananas and cream.

I don't honestly know how my friend's was though he said it was good, but I heard so many great things about this place and was disappointed by the flavor and consistency in that pie filling. I've had way better. The crust was good, though and crusts are hard to get done right.

Also, their pie selection was minimal; banana cream, something with chocolate, or the pear tart was all they had. Maybe it was because it was Pi Day, but even then they should have been stocked up knowing it was coming. And their portions were small slices when I've had large big ol' slices of pie at places like Denny's that tasted better! And this is coming from someone who used to be a pastry chef and overnight baker...including of course many things, but of all things OF PIES. So I know a good pie when I taste one, and this was not it sadly.

Bottom line: $3.14 special on Pi Day was not worth it, so I can't image what the regular price is they charge. Hoping to go back and see if it's better the second time around with a different slice.
author: Xhris C.

description: best pie I've had in a long time. I love Marie Calendar's pies, but the banana cream pie here just taste fresher. Vegan and pear ginger hit the spot for me and I feel it's far better than the Pie Bar in Seattle. Sadly many restaurants in California are regardless. Good place to just relax or study.
author: Lily L.

description: Pie is so awesome and I love pie and I love to eat pie and spoon slices of pie on a plate and then eat them and sometimes warm them up but not usually and pie is so glorious and I want to eat them all. They have dinner too. Try the walnut pie.
author: Will D.

description:
Came in, had a slice of banana pie and left.

I'm not sure what the hype was about this banana cream pie. It was ok. The only great thing about this place is that it open late for us snackers!
author: Andy N.

description: When I'm eating, it's just me and my pie. I don't see anyone or anything else around me. Get in my way and I will shave the hair right off of you and slap your bald head.
author: Jen Y.

description:
Delicious apple pie! We stopped by after a dinner at Rosamunde to pick up some dessert, went with 2 slices of apple pie as we weren't ready for full-pie commitment (having never tried their pie before). Got home, whipped up some cream and some beer, and ate myself comatose. I especially like the soft, moist apples while the guy enjoyed the flaky crust. 

I'm ready for full-on pie now :)


(what do you guys drink with pie? it was a hard pairing)
author: Tatyana K.

description:
Huge fan!  I love that everything is very simple -- just pies and hot drinks!  Also amazingly delicious.  The crust was perfect, flaky and not wet.  

I can't wait to try one of their savory pies.
author: Cara M.

description:
"Sing a song of sixpence, a pocket full of rye,
Four and twenty blackbirds baked in a pie."

Used to be quite fascinated with this one line of prose for some bizarro reason...Guess it was highly entertaining to envision a whole flock of birds being stuffed into a tiny pie.

Or maybe it's just my own personal fascination with pie.
Mud Pie...Shepherd's Pie...Kahlua Pie...Boston Cream Pie...Sweet Potato Pie...Key Lime Pie...Pizza Pie...Pumpkin Pie...Apple Pie...Cherry Pie...Rhubarb Pie...The pies I have sought out & sampled over the years seems to go on & on.

Speaking of seeking out pie...One gem of a place for a good slice is Mission Pie. Sportin' some of my all-time faves like Banana Cream Pie...This place is a must try for all you pie lovers.

While they've got an arsenal of different pies...They don't have any blackbird pie (which actually is probably a good thing!)
author: Justin L.

description:
When you visit the bay area you MUST stop at Mission Pies. If you live there, support local business.   Try the apple or the cream pie...yum!!  

All the pies are made on site, and they use ingredients from local farms.  

Make sure to bring cash..they don't take credit cards.
author: Ryan E.

description:
Every time we have friends or family visit, we take them to Mission Pie. 

The pie is honestly the best pie I have ever eaten. The menu is always changing because the ingredients are local and sustainable. They even have vegan options (not that I am a vegan, I love my butter and cheese, but it's nice to know they cater to all) Actually, the vegan pie happens to be my favorite- the apple cranberry. They have a delicious baked walnut pie and different tarts as well.  All come with whipped cream (not from a can or bucket) or if you want to pay a $150 more, the vanilla bean ice cream is way worth it, especially with the classic warm apple pie. If you are not into the sweet stuff they also have quiches and savory pies, like pot pie.  They have great coffee and cappuccinos as well and offer almond and soy milk if you are lactose intolerant or just prefer non-dairy. 

The staff is always really nice. The atmosphere is casual, like any quaint cafe. People flock here to meet up with friends, to study, to read a book. The crowd is always mixed, because honestly, everyone loves pie. Support a local, humble business who has really perfected their craft and try a slice. The only thing you will regret is that your stomach doesn't have enough room for another.
author: Katie D.

description:
Shhhhhhh.

The resto was so full but it was so quiet. Like a library. 

Banana cream pie - delicious innards with a mealy, healthy-tasting crust. I prefer Tartine's banana cream tart with the flaky, buttery crust with a chocolate and caramel coat. 

Chicken pot pie - the individual serving is so cute! Manly chunks of chicken with a dill-heavy gravy. Can't remember the crust.
author: Jacquee P.

description: Alas, Mission Pie has not been able to achieve gluten free baking. I have asked to no avail. It would behoove them to figure it out since the neighborhood is full of places that have, including Arizmendi, Anthony's Cookies (and they are good) and even Big Mouth Burgers has gluten free buns. Perhaps Mission Pie can borrow some recipes.
author: Joan P.

description:
Only been here once, but their banana cream pie was the best I've ever had so far. Glad I found this place on yelp when I was in the neighborhood! One slice was $3.50 and kind of small, but the cream was nice and chilled- pie crust was surprisingly good too. I usually don't even like pies that much, but this was pretty good. Really nice place too! If I lived around this area, I'd come here often. 
PS. Cash only!
author: Wendy L.

description: Gave Mission Pie a try again. Ordered a slice of peach blackberry pie, and it was hot and delicious!
author: Tiffany W.

description:
Don't get me wrong. Mission Pie isn't bad! It just didn't live up to my expectations, which were pretty high after reading the Yelp reviews and another review on an online San Francisco magazine. The atmosphere of the shop and community partnerships are down-to-earth, positive, and family-friendly, and parking is so-so, but the pies themselves didn't live up to their hype. 

Sho and I ordered a Malaysian tofu curry pot pie, the organic chicken pot pie, the banana cream pie, and the apricot frangipane pie. The variety of ingredients in the savory pie was promising, but the savory sauce in both of the savory pot pies seemed to lack a spark. They seemed a bit bland-- perhaps because the pies were lukewarm and the crust really hard? We had our Malaysian tofu curry pot pie reheated in the oven, where it was forgotten and burnt, but the lady working at the counter apologized and gave us a salad in addition to a new Malaysian tofu curry pot pie. -- so, the service was friendly and fair.

The apricot frangipane was well-constructed, but the crust was really hard and I suppose apricot frangipane's strong tanginess isn't as much to my liking. The pie that probably saved Mission Pie for us was the banana cream pie, which was light yet satisfying. The crust was flaky and the "custardy" contents delicious. Banana flavor was very natural and lifted the pie's overall appeal. 

Mission Pie has a good story and promise. I look forward to seeing improvement!
author: Gigi L.

description: If I die, I want Mission Pie's Banana Cream Pie in my mouth as I go... hands down best BCP I've ever had
author: Gary T.

description:
I dont know why I tried to be different and get a savory pie when everyone here raves about the sweet pies, especially the banana cream pie. I ended up getting the Moroccan pot pie on this particular visit and I was not impressed at all. The pie itself (after having them heat it it) was still COLD, the crust was overdone, and the filling was lacking some kick.

until i listen to conventional wisdom and get a sweet pie, I cant upgrade this place past 2 stars.
author: James T.

description:
So many bakeries in the city, but so few pay more than lip service to pie. If you love pie, get yourself down to Mission Pie. They have a daily selection of both sweet and savory pies that will satisfy. 

I came here for someone's birthday. The place is charming. Lots of art on the walls, a nice long communal table on one side of the shop. Large windows to watch the traffic in the Mission roll by. Pretty friendly service. I learned that they have a mentoring/internship program for at-risk youth, so these kids have an opportunity to come in and learn the business and help out. That's pretty cool. 

So I didn't get to try the savory pies, but the chicken pot pie looked very good. Nice flaky crust covering a steamy, creamy stew of veggies and chicken. Not huge, but good for a meal. I tried the apple pie a la mode. It wasn't bad. The crust was good, but a little dry. I think it's sprinkled with cinnamon and sugar. The filling was juicy, but not runny, with decent flavor. I'm not the biggest proponent of apple pie, so for me it was pretty good. I ordered a slice of the banana cream pie to go. Now banana cream pie is where my heart lies. The version at Mission Pie was just ok. It only had a layer of bananas at the bottom, but I think banana cream pie should be stuffed to the brim with banana slices with the vanilla cream/pudding as a filler to keep structural integrity when the pie is sliced. The pudding itself in the banana cream pie had good vanilla bean flavoring, but the crust was a little too tough. Sadness. 

Nice place to get some pie. Maybe I'll try some of their other flavors another time.
author: Saunders C.

description:
When I was growing up, I swore to my mother that I would have a wedding pie instead of cake. Fast forward just a few years later and as yet no wedding...but I still do love me some pie. Apple, berry, custard...name the filling, I'm an equal opportunity pie lover. 

You can imagine then the excitement I felt upon learning of Mission Pie. A whole store just for pie? Genius! And socially responsible? And pretty inside? Crazy!

I just wish the pie had lived up to my heightened expectations. I had huckleberry-apple a la mode, milady had banana cream. She loved hers. I was underwhelmed. My slice was just too sweet; I expected a bit of tang from the huckleberries but it wasn't there. Nor was there much appreciable texture to the fruit; the only real texture in the whole thing was the crumb topping, which was tasty and crunchy, but just ladled sweetness on top of the overly sweet fruit. I had a taste of the banana cream, and the crust seemed a little bland. I'm a sucker for flaky, flavorful pie crusts, and these just didn't deliver. 

When it costs $10 for two small slices of pie, somehow I expect better. I understand that doing business in San Francisco costs money, and their commitment to locally sourced products is admirable. The store is clean, bright and pretty, and I enjoyed sitting there and observing the activity of San Francisco on a Saturday night. 

This is a business I want to like and support, so I'll give it another shot. Still, I don't think these are the folks who will bake my wedding pie. Still looking...
author: Leslie S.

description:
Mission Pie is one of my favorite places in SF - I'm not joking when I say that. There's way too much GREAT about this place to even write here in my review. Not only is EVERYTHING delicious but it's sustainable! My two favorites are the Chicken Pot Pie & then the walnut pie for dessert!

Love that they don't serve bottled water, Love that they train & mentor youth from Mission High, Love that they work with local artists and stay close to the community they are in (Mission), Love that everything is delicious and ALWAYS served with a smile. 

Great for eating in - or taking to go.
author: Teresa J.

description:
When you are on a mission to get pie the only choice is Mission Pie.

Who knew vegan pies could be so good.
Friendly staff.
Chill play to hang out.
No WiFi.  Deal.
author: Po L.

description: Fun community-felt cafe.  There's great pie and service to match.
author: C O.

description:
Get the shaker lemon pie if they have it - awesome. It's real lemon pie, rind, zest and fruit all in there. I had banana cream as well, good but not in the class as the shaker lemon.

They also sell Inna Jam products here, which I love.
author: Sam P.

description:
The Mission district is synonomous with the word Pie at the end...yes, it's that awesome. 

Recommendations:
- Banana Cream Pie, light cream filling w/ bananas, not too sweet perfect combination of creamy delight with flaky crust
- Mixed Berry Pie, amazing mix of tarteness of fruits and crust
- Peach Pie, simple and clean peach flavor with buttery sugar dusted crust

Service: Everyone is usually very nice

Overall:
It's always Mission Pie Time. Great for a anytime of day snack and bringing your friends for a get together.
author: Wendy L.

description:
I have no problem paying $3.50 for a slice of hand made, organic and tasty pie made with social consciousness in mind and benefit.  If the pie was crap that would be another story - but it's not!  I dunno about folks who gripe about the price - most restaurants charge at least $4.00 and some even $8.00 at the fancier places.  I suspect that if I gathered all the fresh organic ingredients to make one myself it would be pricey.  

Go Banana Cream!!
author: Julienne G.

description:
Pies:

Traditional double-crust APPLE; and
PUMPKIN, made from "sugar pie" and "winter luxury" pumpkins along with "red kuri" squash
