Ordered (by phone) and picked up for a Thanksgiving potluck.  The entire process was smooth and friendly.  Plus they used a square reader + ipad to take credit cards on that one day!  I think that helped the cash / check times.

Well, I didn't get to try the double-crusted apple pie, but it looked fantastic.  FANTASTIC, I say!  Unfortunately, my oven-warmed apple pie + ice cream was so popular that I didn't get a slice.  This despite my protestations of calling pie while I served them.  Boo.  I was told the apple pie was fantastic.  I'm sure it was (bitter bitter).  *sniff*

The pumpkin pie, which I did get a slice of, was delicious.  It wasn't too sweet, and I served it with whip.  I particularly liked the red kuri squash in it.  Gave it a slight twist on the traditional concoction.

In closing, MISSION PIE rocks!  In my mind, it's a riff on mission impossible.  And other food items flow naturally.  Mission Pancakes!  Mission Fried Chicken!  Mission Mission!  Oh dear...
author: Timothy Y.

description: Old school charm meets new school hip
author: Amy O.

description: Just returned here after my first visit 4 years ago.  Stopped in on my way to the airport.   Love the smell when you first walk in.  Had the potato quiche with bacon and gruyere.  The flavor was great, however both my friend's and mine were still cold in the middle despite being warmed in the oven.  Didn't stop me from scarfing it, a maple walnut scone and a delightfully foamy cappuccino down.  Wish I could have carried a pie or three on the plane with me...
author: Michelle P.

description: Bought a bananna cream pie for dessert for a family dinner get together. It was so.delicious, crust was flaky and custard filling was not overly sweet. One of the best pies I have ever eaten. Will definately be coming back here again. Go check them out, you won't know which one to pick
author: Ronette B.

description: Picked up a walnut pie for Christmas. Walnuts were perfectly toasted, and the filling was delicious. Crust, however, was dry and over-browned.
author: Sophia B.

description:
Sometimes a girl's just gotta have some pie!

I love mission pie! The banana cream makes me swoon and warms my heart. The staff is friendly and helpful. I've also had their carry out full pies at dinner parties. I have not yet had any of their savory pies but I plan to in the near future!

The have a "kids corner" in the front window, so its a coffee shop that is safe to take your hipster babies :) There are not many family-friendly coffee shops, especially in the mission. 

Do yourself a favor: If you're having a bad day, go get a piece of pie, enjoy it in the window seat, and you'll fell better before you walk out the door.
author: Halley B.

description:
LOVE Mission pie!

The pies are absolutely delicious, whether savory or sweet.  The pastries are definitely a turn on for their perfectly flakey deliciousness, and even the coffee is actually decent!

Also, for being on the south end of Mission and not on Valencia where everything is more Kisch-y and Hipster-y, it has a great ambiance.  You walk in, and it just projects the perfect cafe atmosphere at you.  There are people perched at their tables working on their laptops (probably designers), people studying, reading, kids in the play area not making a nuisance of themselves (I do love kids, but it's terrifying when they're running about underfoot, so kid-safe areas are definitely a bit of a god send).

And the pies. THE PIES.  The mixed berry, the raspberry-pear, and the apple are among my favorites, because I am definitely more of a fruit-pie person.  However the pot pies are the perfect savory comfort food  and definitely just leave you full and, well, happy!

Seriously, though, the only major con to this place is that they are most-assuredly cash-only. 

My mission at the moment? Go back for pumpkin!
author: Emilynne A.

description: Strictly for Banana Cream Pie & Service! I haven't had a chance to try any other pies, but I always get the Banana Cream pie to bring to someone's house and/or potlucks-always a hit!! They are even nice enough to hold 2 for me when I called to make sure they had some in stock today!!
author: Geraldine R.

description:
Before you spend your hard-earned money on a slice of mediocre banana cream pie, I have some simple advice -- don't.

You can find tastier pies at diners and grocery stores. If you want a banana flavored concoction that will truly make your taste buds tingle, head over to Tartine Bakery, wait in line, and get the banana cream tart.

Despite my disappointment in the pie, I really enjoyed the cafe atmosphere. It's a great place to take a date or to hang out with friends. If only the pie lived up to the hype, this place would be great. Is that too much to ask from a place with "Pie" in its name?
author: Donald F.

description:
Yay for Mission Pie!  Yummy food made from ingredients grown on a local farm and created in partnership with local schools.  Who could ask for more?   

Check out this article that appeared in the George Lucas Education Foundation magazine, Edutopia: http://www.edutopia.org/1816
author: Cassidy P.

description:
If a birthday rolls around for a spoiled person who doesn't like cake, just be realllyyy thankful for Mission Pie.

The peaches in the peach pie are huge and fresh! The same goes for their pear/raspberry pie. Their banana cream pie is as delicious as everyone speaks of, and it's pretty big! The pie was a hit, It was devoured in a day. They don't write birthday messages on their pies, so I went out and bought these cute gold candy pearls from a bakery supply store and made my own decorations. It was nice to add a special personal touch to the pie and the banana cream is a perfect canvas to do so!

I love that this cute shop is unexpected in the neighborhood! They are all about local resources and after watching tons of Food TV (esp. "feasting on waves" with alton brown), I know how important that is! There is metered parking on Mission, but around the corner is residential parking and in typical-mission-style, you may never find an open spot. Genuinely friendly staff. Please note that this is a cash or check only place.

note to owner: if you ever remodel, please donate all of your wallpaper to me. i love it! :)
author: Stella C.

description:
Mission Pie came through for us on Pi Day.

Instead of settling on a supermarket pie, we decided to honor Pi Day the right way with a pear&raspberry pie and bananaanana creme pie from Mission Pie.

The crusts, which are my favorite on any pie, on both pies were flaky and able to withstand the wetness of the fillings.  Although I am not usually a fan of banannanan creme pies, the crust on this one won me over.

The crumble on top of the pear&raspberry was like the best granola bar I have ever eaten.  Also, we were warned that this pie would be slightly tart, but the tartness was overcome by the sweetness, which was most satisfying.

Although each pie was around $18 even with the Pi Day discount, the enjoyment we got from the pies was worth more.  So, we made the profit that day.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Delicious! The banana cream pie was smooth and sweet. The crust was nicely crisped.

$3.50 for a slice. I'm going back for more.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
MmmMhmmmm. I can't stop eating these pies! 

I've not eaten-in here, but there's a mellow coffeehouse-style Mission vibe. I love to stop by here to grab a few different slices to go, then devour them with a friend while watching TV or something. 

Oddly, when you buy pies to go, they don't have any shopping bags, so you're kind of stuck only buying what you can easily carry. In the end, it's probably a good thing, as this is probably what's keeping me from getting fat!
author: Ryan L.

description: I want to love this place. Great idea and location but... Some of the pies are bland crusted with disappointing filling. For a pie specialist I would expect some of the best home made tasting recipes but not really that great. Fine for coffee and pie and there is no real alternative in the area but not worth a lot of hype.
author: Luke H.

description:
*update* their pumpkin pie is one of the best I've eaten so far, nice texture, great pumpkiny flavor, and flaky crust.

***

Makes me drool just thinking about them.

I had a slice from two last night.  A dear friend acquainted us at a dinner party.  She brought an Apple pie and a Pear+Raspberry pie.  Both had good chunks of fresh fruit and a scrumptious flaky crust. 

I heard the pies are affiliated with Destination Baking Co. - my friend says that's where the pies are actually baked...a soul warmin' slice (or two) of heaven.

I eagerly look forward to having more soon.  Mmmmmm pies....

***

12/30/2007 update
On the way back from a friend's brunch in the East Bay, the divine pie gods guided me to Mission Pies en route home.

The shop is cozy, the pies are enticingly displayed.  I had a hard time deciding which to pick as there are quite a few mouthwatering choices.  I selected the Banana Cream pie ~ delicious!!  My tummy is growling recalling the delightful bites.
author: Cathy K.

description:
After two really positive experiences here, I had to write up my very brief experience there last night. 
A friend and I showed up at 9:00 and, in fairness, they close at 9:00 so I was bummed, but it was my own fault for not checking the closing time before showing up.
The part that burned me was, as I was on the phone with my bf telling him not to bother meeting us there, they let two girls in! They were not employees, they were there for pie. I went to the window and tried to get someone's attention, but, surprise, surprise, everyone was looking away. 
Not cool at all. What it was was annoying and unprofessional. Hopefully next time I go I'll have a better experience.
author: Susie D.

description:
parking is terrible.

cash only.

friendly service.

to-die for banana cream pie. 

MUST give this place a try if you're by this place :)
author: Helen T.

description: I love pie!  And this is the place!
author: Virginia T.

description:
Examine the sidewalk around Mission Pie and you'll see the dark underbelly of West Coast liberalism. 

About a year ago, Mission Pie broke ground, taking a jackhammer to the much-used sidewalk at the corner of 25th and Mission. Children used to wait for school buses there, people used to pause on their way home from work and have conversations there. But Pie thought it would be better to tear up that space and plant trees instead. Extra noise and air pollution? Sure -- no one's using this anyway, they said. The result? A sidewalk so narrow that only one stroller may pass at a time ... and 40 feet by 10 of garbage-strewn dirt. Week after week, the duties of their disempowered-youth workforce do not include cleaning up the jetsam. Week after week, energy is spent on self-righteous murals and promotional materials and not on addressing this growing problem. What kind of a "community-oriented" business is this?

I understand that my brand of liberalism -- in which cities are wonderful gathering places for people of all classes to share ideas and common spaces -- contradicts theirs -- in which cities are cesspools where the lowest of the low are forced to live until their souls are liberated and they may live on a farm. I know I should be talking about their locally sourced peaches and affordable decaf. But as a pedestrian in this neighborhood, I just notice Mission Pie literally and metaphorically marginalizing me.

Rant over. Customer service is spotty. Coffee is good. Pie is great.
author: V. J. L.

description:
I love delicious pie. Apple varieties or walnut. Makes me happy with ice cream. 

That's it.
author: dominic d.

description: I passed this place a lot and decided to go in to see why it was so busy. That was a good idea! There was a small line, and when I made it to the counter, the cashier greeted me with a sparkling smile, and was very courteous. Everyone usually comes here for the great pies which they are famous for, but I am not a fan of sugar, so I ordered the chicken pot pie. I then sat down to wait for my order to be called, and noticed a laid back community vibe that was nourishing to my personality. A girl next to me struck up a conversation, and they called my name so quickly, we did not get a chance to finish the conversation! I dug into my pie, and it was quite delicious, with a nice amount of chicken, and not too much potatoes, but it was on the small side, so  I bought an avocado at the nice little inexpensive Mexican fruit and veggie market a couple of doors down the street to complete a delightful meal!
author: David B.

description:
Speechless.

1st time I had their pies the owner had donated some to an event I was holding at the high school I was working at in bayview.  The walnut tarts were, un-freakin-believable. I'll go there just for those.

2nd time I went for breakfast after finding my friends car in the area (long night...lol).  She needed a latte or would burst into flames and I needed food so I wouldn't punt the next little kid that screamed/yelled/squealed/acted like an annoying little kid near me on the street.  I ordered the summer squash and feta savory "pie" (it kinda looked like a danish more so) and she ordered the vegan carrot muffin.  The two items were HEAVENLY!!  So good that thinking about it now makes me sad I can't just hop in the car and grab one (a 700+ mile drive would be a little crazy for pie).  Upon completing our breakfast, the haze lifted from my head, the sun was a little brighter, the sky bluer, and screaming kids on mission st. were tolerable again.

The staff here is so nice, I can't say enough good things about them the two times we've interacted.  What's really amazing about this place is that they are very invested in the community utilizing local farmers for their items and hiring teens and young adults who have a colorful past and are trying to clean up.  This place is perfect at what they do, major props.

Super sustainable, super friendly, super tasty, super awesome.
author: Kat P.

description:
regardless of the weather outside, pie is always a good decision.  warm it up on a chilly night and have some tea or a la mode it on a summer day.

semi-secretly located in the mission, the neon pie light will draw you in and during the warm summer months the large windows open up and the breeze pours into this great little restaurant... it kinda feels like you're hanging out at a friend's house, especially with the large communal table.

oh, you wanted to know about the actual pie?

well it's delicious of course.  i have not had any of their savory pies, just sweet, and can say that it is damn good.  the fruit fillings are made with fresh fruit and i think they use mostly local ingredients (if not all local).  the pies are not overly sweet, which i totally appreciate - i'm glad they let the natural sweetness of the fruit do most of the work.  their flavors change often though i am certain they have a few daily staples you can always count on.

the coffee and chai are good and pairs nicely with a slice and it's easy to pass a few hours here over good pie with a friend.
author: Lauren P.

description:
Vegan Apricot & Blueberry pie, you will be the death of me.

I FINALLY made it into this delightfully cozy cafe to sample some pie, after years of faulty planning and neglect (usually something along the lines of "we'll go by later for dessert!" and then: "...ugh, now I'm too full of burrito"). 

Mission Pie: Please accept my deepest apologies.

After just one lazy afternoon with a slice of sweet pie, I decided it would probably be a great idea to return the next day. Okay, so I've only tried the Vegan Apricot & Blueberry / Pear & Blueberry (it changes?) and the Summer Squash and Herbed Goat Cheese Galette - but they were all so incredibly, luxuriously tasty that I can't wait to try other flavors.

(And the babe that works behind the counter rounds out this pretty convincing argument).
author: Sam S.

description:
I enjoyed the ambiance of the restaurant. They had a cool little quartet playing live music when my friends and I went. It was pretty crowded which is also a good sign. 

The food itself looked very home made which was a great sign. We ordered a slice of banana cream pie and plum frangipane.

The banana cream was very sweet with a flaky crust that had a bit of sweetness to it but was mostly a compliment to the filling. I wish there would have been more banana flavoring, it tasted a bit too custardy and sweet for me.

The plum frangipane was definitely a change of pace from your typical pie. I've never had it before so I don't want to say whether it was great or not but I certainly thought it was pretty tasty.

A quality pie place. I would go again and try some other stuff.

Cheers!
author: Andrew B.

description: This,place,was nasty cool environment they don't take debt cards which sucks like  duh who Carries cash anymore then   my pie tasted old it was cold sorry but this will be my 1St and last time ever going out my way to come to this place
author: Jasmine B.

description:
Love  this place! The pies during the holiday season smell delicious and it's a wonderful place to come and enjoy some freshly baked pie and a cafe latte. 
I enjoy the free kid friendly section they have so mommy can enjoy her capuccino 
I love coming here to study
Great place en la mission
author: C. M.

description:
Banana Cream
Walnut
Plum Almond

All with whipped cream.

TO DIE FOR.
author: Jen D.

description: Went here on a mission for late night dessert. My boyfriend and I had banana cream pie and apple, both were kind of tasteless but it was a cute cafe.
author: Lauren K.

description:
So, I am a banana cream pie nut and have been on a quest to seek out the next best banana cream since the bakery in Millbrae decided not to make them anymore. (bad move on the new owners part)

I have read the reviews and everyone claims that THIS IS the place! 

When I arrived to Mission Pie, I was very pleased to see such a clean and trending little spot in the Mission. Very friendly with people enjoying their coffee and pie. The entire top row of the display case was filled with non other than the infamous banana cream pie. It looked like any other pie with a cream cheese top and pie crust. 

I asked the woman behind the counter "so I heard this was the pie to get!" she replied "it's good". That was not convincing so I asked her where she had her best banana cream pie. She told me that it was not her thing but many people buy it so I decided to buy two of them. 

They were $20 each, I am not a miser but that is not cheap when you consider Marie Calendar has a pretty damn good banana cream pie for $7 but I bought them and took it to the office. 

Upon my arrival, the staff was in anticipation because of the wonderful things people have written about this pie. Well.........out of six people who ate it, not one person was impressed with the $20 pie and here are the reasons:

Pie crust was not flakey at all, pretty thin but dense and offered no buttery flavor. It is just something that holds it together and nothing special.

The inside cream was pudding which could be an overall good texture but was thick and help little favor

Bananas were plentiful in a way but not ripe to the point of a superb banana

Top layer of cream cheese, once again, just an addition without too much substance.

Overall as stated from eight people now, good pie for $10 but I would not go back for $20. I will visit because I do like the environment.
author: Ed N.

description:
My husband is a huge banana cream pie fan so I popped in to grab him a slice (gotta keep the hubby happy).  The pies look like my Auntie's fresh, homemade deliciousness!
The banana cream slice was the best ever (ofcourse I had to sneak a bite)!  We won't be going back to Nations!  I'll be returning to try some of the other flavors..
author: anne m.

description:
I've walked by Mission Pie a couple of times, never stopping in as a friend said the pies are "just OK".   Finally, I decided I needed to put a slice of pie to my own taste test.  

I walked in and ordered a slice of the Shaker Lemon pie.  The name should have given me a clue.  Not only did the Shakers make great furniture, their lifestyle was one of frugality.  See where I'm going with this?  Nothing is wasted.   Hence, when I bit into the pie, there was a long piece of lemon rind in pie.  It was a surprising contrast to the mild sweetness of the lemon filling and whipped cream topping.  

I didn't try any of the other offerings, but they did look appealing.  One slice was $3.50.   I'll have to try something else, before I'd consider giving them more (or less) stars.
author: Scott S.

description:
August 16th I ventured out to this place b/c I saw it so highly Yelp'd.  My husband loves pie and it was his birthday.  Easy to find; plenty of meter parking.  Lots of ppl were chillaxin' here also.
I bought a mixed berry pie.  Very rustic looking on top.  Not a bad price for $20, I think.  It was very good.  I'm not a pie person so I don't really know my pies very well.  I did think it was better than what I've bought at Trader Joe's and Andronico's in the past. 
I do want to try their savory pot pies next time!
author: Kekumukula N.

description: Sigh. I Soooo want to love Mission Pie. I've gone half a dozen times just because I love the granola, sustainable, locally sourced, heavy wooden farmhouse tables, bohemian vibe. So "Haight Ashbury" in the old days. Unfortunately, the pies suck. The crust is like tasteless cardboard. The fillings sparse and odd. Hardly sweet. They have a lemon pie and don't even peel the lemons! Gross. About the only interesting pie is their walnut. If you can get past the crust. But you don't get much filling. Two stars for the generous dollops of whipped cream.
author: Anthony B.

description:
Family and I wanted to have pie/coffee on Easter Sunday afternoon, but the place, as usual, was crowded.  We purchased a banana cream pie and a small walnut tart to go.  Once we got home, our treats were devoured in less than half an hour.  Guests commented on the fresh pudding taste, flakey crust, delicious whipped cream.  A definite success.  

I loved the walnut tart..  I prefer the tart to a slice of walnut pie....more yummy crust.
author: A O.

description:
Coffee and pie, oh my!
Neglected my pie eating duties for far too long.  Berry pies here are decently sour, and the crust isn't overly sweet.
author: Darlene W.

description:
oh pat me on the back while I vomit.  I am not sure if it is a symptom of the Mission or being a curmudgeon but this place stinks.

Venue - Noisy and full of privileged people who hadn't showered that morning (and should have).  The crowd could lecture you about bikes, REI, Google and how Facebook is great for catching up with their friend in Portland - thats all.

Food - Pie is not hard to get wrong but it looked like it was served by a lethargic teenager with something else on their mind. I ordered a chai tea and I am certain that it had the same chemical composition as water (with trace elements of tea).

Service - They forgot our order, this is forgivable.  The service was okay.
author: Duanne G.

description: We had the peach pie and the peach blackberry pie... Pie perfection! Perfect fruit to crust ratio... Flaky and not too thick. Filling was the perfect consistency! The Straus ice cream was the icing on the cake! Or pie in this matter!
author: Christine P.

description: The chicken pot pie was a thin cut above that you can buy from the grocery. Ok, a modest to think cut above. Served lukewarm in the middle and with a crust so flaky, you couldn't peel it off in pieces. Love the idea of the place, just eh on the execution.
author: matthew g.

description: Great Coffee.  Good pies.  I think their pies have a good quality to them.  They use really good ingredients and they aren't too sweet.  I hate very sweet desserts so I hit this place up a lot.  I have to say that the crust can be a bit crispier.  The service is also very great.  Customers are super pleasant and helpful.  I never tasted their savory food.  I imagine that is the vegetarian are crazy about this place.  They have a chalk board list of all of the farms they work with and food vendors.  Hipsters galore.
author: A K.

description:
In the Mission and want Pie = Mission Pie!

I came out on a weekday night with friends and we just needed to top our meal with pie.  First off, part of the 4-star vote is due to the fact that it is hard to find a place that will give you such a variety of just a slice of pie.  So kudos to this place!

Ordered:
Banana Cream Pie- DELISH!
Mixed Berry Pie- Yum!

Quiet evening, so shockingly easy to find seating for 8.  Reasonable prices and well-made pie.

Definitely want to come back and try the savory pies...
author: Christine K.

description:
Go here all the time with friends. Good for a late night dessert. And,if you get there close to closing sometimes they'll give you free pie or baked goods they know they won't be able to sell ;)
All the pies are good but my favorites include: walnut (hearty and not too sweet), banana cream pie (light and creamy and fresh!),lemon (they include the peel for an extra kick).
Really nice staff too!!
author: Shirin M.

description: I love pie. And I especially love pie shops that have an inviting and cozy atmosphere while helping at-risk youth by hiring them to work in their store. All of their vegan pies that I've had have been hands down the best vegan pies I've EVER had. Make sure to stop in while in the Mission!
author: Priscilla M.

description: This place is exquisite. I went here with my husband the other weekend for breakfast. I had the tart and my husband had a breakfast pocket. The pie crust is to die for and the fillings of both our dishes were excellent. The prices are more than fair (cheaper than I thought it would be) and the setting is really cute. Great picture windows to watch the world go by. Coffee - free refills and very tasty as well. I highly recommend this place.
author: Erin B.

description: Awesome homemade pies! Can't go wrong with any of the sweet pies here. We ordered the apple blackberry & plum frangipan tonight.
author: Mao X.

description:
If I believed in any kind of deity, I would be singing their praises for coming to earth and gracing us poor, unfortunate humans with the presence of this pie shop. Since I do not, I will instead be praising the lovely girl who was working the counter last night, and the incredible pies awaiting us when my friend and I came in, (at about 5 minutes to closing time). 

A sudden craving for pie on a cold San Francisco evening and a glowing recommendation from our longtime, mission-dwelling, artist-in-residence friend led my fellow-foodie pal and I to the softly glowing neon sign that marked the entrance to this mecca of sweet, flaky decadence. We had no idea of the delectable, orgasmic goodness that lay in store for our unwitting taste buds... all we knew was that our desire for pie and hot coffee was insatiable.

The girl at the counter could have been rude to the two eccentric-looking weirdos who marched determinedly through the crowded room with a glazed, pie-hungry gleam in their eyes... The staff was collecting dishes, pulling pies off the shelves and packing up to go home after what appeared to be a very busy day, judging from the fact that the place was still packed. Instead, this lovely pie fairy welcomed us warmly, told us they were closing, but we were welcome to order, as long as we didn't mind takeaway containers. We ended up getting 2 slices to share, banana cream & pear-raspberry, accompanied by free coffee and a warm, casual atmosphere.

All I can say is that upon tasting each pie, I instantly realized that if my friend hadn't had the foresight to divide up the slices before we dug in, there was the distinct possibility of a fight to the death breaking out between us over them. These pies were a miracle of modern science, and definitely, as our highly esteemed friend had proclaimed, the best pie in the city of San Francisco. Seriously, 100% pure awesome.
author: elizabeth d.

description:
Do fruit pies at Mission Pie count toward the USDA's daily recommended intake of fruits and vegetables?

I nearly let this good opportunity slip right through my fingers, when I was at the intersection of Mission and 25th, and thought Mission Pies was a pizza joint.  However, by the time I got to 24th Street, curiosity was getting the best of me, and I made a U turn.  As I walked in, I saw patrons seated, with colorful baked delights, some of which were topped with ice cream, and I knew that I needed to experience some of what I was eye witnessing.  On the menu, a list of seasonal fruit pies made it hard for me to chose just one.........so, I went home with more than one!  Gravenstein apple, peach, and plum franginpane, were my escorts on the way home, and immediately upon walking into the house, I had a bite of each.  Of the ones that I had, I can't say that I had a favorite.  Each was equally delicious.  The characteristic, which stood out most, is that they let the fruit be the true star of the pies.  Very little, if any additional sugar was added (maybe to the crumbly topping).  They let the fruits speak for themselves.  Buttery, delicate crust, enveloped the juicy, tender fruit, making it difficult to stop at just one bite.  

The location, itself, has a generous amount of seating.  The warm, sun-filled space was accented by friendly staff, and the scent of buttery goodness in the air.

Mission Pie has definitely achieved their pie making mission!
author: Damon Z.

description: Best banana cream pie in town! Awesome crust and freshest filling. Highly recommend it!
author: Liquidfairy L.

description: WHOA DANG - Mission Pie is awesome! Not usually a fan of pure fruit pies, but the one I tried here was crazy good. My fam and I tried the banana cream pie, walnut pie, and the peach/blackberry pie.  All three were really good, but the peach/blackberry was seriously awesome. It wasn't too sweet, but sweet enough, and the fruits were sooo fresh.  As far as the other two, I liked the banana cream pie, but it wasn't as good as ones I've had before (if you're ever in LA - you have to try the mini one at Urth Caffe - phenomenal). The walnut pie was just OK.
author: Taz M.

description:
Prior to my visit I have craved banana cream pie exactly never in my life. Now it borderlines on obsession. 

Yes, pie is no longer just for diners any longer. Golden and flaky butter and just the right touch of salt, the crust smacked of butter and contain a fantastic wonderland of rich pudding, rounds of banana and a healthy dose of whipped cream. The fruit itself was ripened to the ideal sweetness, with enough brown and give to be just the right amount of mush. This creation should constitute its own food group, but there's decidedly not enough of the stuff nor is it pretty looking.

It's clear the emphasis and care is on what goes in: locally-sourced, seasonal and sustainable ingredients determine the half dozen or so flavors. There's also several savory quiches, a gratin and several varieties of tarts and muffins. My ass (and I literally mean my behind) is lucky I'm no longer dating the dude whose house is located such that I'm "forced" to pass by here on my way from the subway.

What also sets Mission Pies apart is their commitment to the community, creating social advocacy programs to hire and train local youth. Sometimes it feels like their staff moves in slow motion though, so maybe they've gotta work on that last bit. Yet from kid to plant, they've got their priorities straight from the ground up.
author: Ligaya T.

description: After I heard of Mission Pie by friends I decided to go and try their pastries. I ordered a pear galette and it was simply delicious made with a crispy and flaky dough, it was baked to perfection with a balanced sweetness. I  also ordered a mini apple huckleberry pie to go which was just decent, nothing exceptional. It didn't taste any better that some frozen pastries from Safeway. I liked the cool casual ambience of the place. I definitely dislike the fact that when you pay with a credit card they use the Ipad/Square system and you are practically forced to tip 18 or 20 percent for an over the counter service that wasn't any different from a convenience store. Really?? Overall I would say the place is a little overrated. I may come back to try again.
author: Edgar C.

description:
Two words: VEGAN PIE
Uh, four words: VEGAN POT PIE TOO!

I can only comment on the vegan pies here, and let me say they are great! The sweet pies I've had (apricot, apple cranberry, pear ginger) have all been amazing. Not too sweet which is good, and the crust is usually spot on (which is difficult with vegan pastry). Once or twice toward the end of the day I've had a soggy crust, but that doesn't bother me. 

The savory pies are totally worth the trip and the price. They usually entail lentils and vegetables, and they come perfectly seasoned every time! My one complaint is about the use of peanut. Why oh why provoke my food allergy? It's quite a common thing to be allergic to peanuts and you ruin the one option I have!
author: shawna v.

description:
I love absolutely love Mission Pie.

I am a pie connoisseur.  I am always seeking the place with the best fruit pie.  My problem with most pies is they are what I call gelatinous.  Sometimes you get pies that have more gelatin compound than actual fruit.  I hate that.  I have never had a fruit pie at Mission Pie that was gelatinous.  I love fresh fruit in a fresh pie and that's what Mission Pies delivers.  The whole pies are relatively small as far as pies go, but the freshness is worth it.

The atmosphere is fun.  It's coffee shop meets pie place.  It's a great place to take a date after dinner for dessert.  You can order a pie and coffee and sit there and talk in a relatively quiet and comfortable setting.  If you're not feeling like dining in, my advice: buy a pie to go then get Mitchell's Ice Cream and make a delicious pie ala mode at home!

Cash only = not really cool.  But conveniently there is a Chase bank across the street.  

Mission Pie is one of my favorite places in SF.
author: Michelle V.

description: While perusing on Yelp, I stumbled upon some reviews for pie places. Worst mistake ever. My cravings started to kick in and I forwarded these cravings to some girl friends of mine. They decided we had to try the banana cream pie. I ordered the pie for pick up (doubled as a birthday pie) and set it up so that I would pick I up on a Saturday. When we arrived the place was packed! Patrons were enjoying at their tables and the line was looooong. The pie was $20 which to me, was a bargain. Fast forward to birthday party where the pie was revealed. Creamy, delicious, not too sweet, not too bland..perfect. I will have to come back and try the fruit pies. 5 stars for Banana Cream Pie.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
I was driving down to the South Bay from Sonoma County and I just had to make this ever so slight detour for pie.  I was racing against the clock wanting to make it before they closed and managed to make it just in time! Banana cream pie is my favorite kind of pie and Mission Pie does it splendidly.  A nice and flaky crust, creamy banana goodness on the inside (and not too sweet at that) with a nice whipped cream finish.  It doesn't get much better than this.  

I think comparing it to a Tartine Banana Cream Tart is unfair because after all, this is pie and Tartine's is a tart.  And that tart has a lot of other  things in it like caramel and chocolate which can get a little overly sweet.  They are both good, but Mission Pie does pies.  

I'll be returning for some of the other flavors of pie!
author: Amy W.

description:
This place is a coffeeshop style space specializing in pies. But there is no WiFi, so you should get coffee somewhere else. 

The Pie is great! They do some good Vegetarian and Vegan pot-pies.
author: Adam B.

description: Delicious pie. Good coffee. Open until 10 on weeknights. Plenty of seats, good location, chill, fun, snap snap.
author: Mandy H.

description: This place is so cute. I found it when I had to do a work related job nearby.  They had so much options but they only accepted cash or check so I was limited to what I could get. I opted for the apple pie.  But next time I am going for the lemon pie.  The slice was a decent size for the price I paid and it was yummy.  The only thing is there was an apple pit, like the whole middle part of the apple, stem and all in my pie.  But it was so delicious I didn't let it affect my pie eating experience. And no I did not eat the middle of the apple.  I will definitely be back to get more pies. The place was very spacious with a good amount of seats and the guy that helped me was very friendly.
author: Zara-Maria S.

description: Wow was this place a nice surprise.  I stumbled across mission pie on my way to cat's corner to go dancing, and just happened to pick up the last slice of vegan mixed berry pie that they had.  WOW was I lucky.  I stashed it in my car to eat after dancing and man was it awesome.  So much fruit and the perfect crust for not a high price.  Totally recommend.  I think they have one vegan pot pie...but I am not sure.  Highly recommend this super cute place :)
author: Courtney R.

description:
Not bad, but not excellent. I had high expectations for the savory pies since the flavors were so unique. My friends and I ordered the Potato Radicchio pie and the Malaysian Curry Garbanzo pie. The presentation is adorable. The Potato Radicchio pie was good but the slice was small. The Malaysian Curry came in a little mini pie tin and it was very filling. Unfortunately, it lacked flavor. The pie was too watery inside, it needed a stronger curry flavor, and basically more spice. My friends liked it, but I prefer a stronger flavor in my foods. Overall, I give it three stars because I have yet to try their fruit pies. 

*Beware of extreme hipsters.
author: Jessica W.

description: Just like my grandma used to make.  Ummmm, OK, so it's better than my grandma used to make and they have pies with flavor combinations that would make my grandma blush.  She might even say they were "unnatural."  Ha.  Anyways, these pies rock!
author: Peter S.

description:
This place is solid!  My friends and I came by on an all-things-sweet culinary tour of the Mission, but we decided to try a savory and a sweet pie here because it all looked so good.  We were torn between all the options, but we ended up settling on *pear-raspberry pie* and a *potato pie with radicchio*.

The prices were pretty reasonable, and overall I'd say that the items we chose were pretty much what you'd expect.  The pear-raspberry was particularly good, and there was a really tasty crumble on top.  Mmmm yeah it was good.

Next time I'm back, I'll definitely want to try some of the savory vegan pies.  Vegan or not, they just sound downright tasty.  West African Peanut Stew pot pie?  I can do that.  See you soon!
author: David W.

description:
I had a slice of walnut pie. It was delicious.
Great service too. The person behind the counter was very friendly and helpful.
author: Johanna S.

description: Love the pie flavor selection. I had an apple rhubarb pie and almost licked the plate clean. Tasty crust and a filling that wasn't too complex or sweet, just representing the awesome flavors of the fruit. Great customer service! Will be back for savory pies and salad.
author: Theresa S.

description: This low key place is quite cute. We saw so manny people here having " banana cream pie" so we tried it too and now I understand why almost everyone in this place were having this pie- it's heavenly - I ended up walked back and bought the whole pie!
author: Dom G.

description:
I was able to get a seat right away, and the decibel level was low enough to have an effective meeting.

I did select a tea which was incredibly strong though. I would do that different next time.

Otherwise, this is a convenient spot for meeting. The shame is that I did not even try the pie on this visit!
author: Jason W.

description:
If I weren't so afraid to walk by myself in the Mission at night, this would be my go to place to relax and read.  The atmosphere is so relaxed and cozy and I love the big windows that look at into the street.
Five stars is probably a bit generous considering that 2 slices of pie and 2 cups of coffee cost more than our taco/quesadilla dinner down the street.  But the pies really are delicious and that whipped cream is so wonderfully thick.  And to top it off they have good coffee.  I'm still can't decide whether Tartine's banana cream is still better...I guess I'll have to keep going back for pie until I can figure it out!
author: Jen C.

description:
If you love pie, you will love this place. The banana cream pie is by far the best I have ever had. 
End of story.
author: Melissa F.

description:
sweet, sweet yam pie, 
emollient bed of gluten 
gleam of your water bathed filling
and the generous give of your salt butter crust 
I could cry
 :') ' ' ' ' ' ' ' ' '
author: Emily C.

description:
Got here just in time before it closed so there were little people. Great looking place with awesome windows.

Just had a banana cream pie and it was pretty good. I wanted to try the apple pie, but they had so much variety I had to try something new. The crust was awesome, but I think they could have used more crust for the bottom, so there can be a more even crust/pie ratio.

$3.50 for a slice was kinda pricey for me, but I guess it's way better than buying the whole pie. Never having tried pies like this before so, worth trying.
author: Hui L.

description: I've only been once, and will have to try it again, but I wasn't that impressed with Mission Pie. We were three and tried a scone, slice of banana cream pie, and a strawberry something-or-another that wasn't too memorable. The banana cream tasted fine, but the server sort of slopped it down on the plate so it didn't hold together. The scone was not that good at all. It was rather dry. I can't remember much about the strawberry "something" we had. Also, I asked for coffee at the counter, thought I was charged for it, but wasn't and never received it. The cashier/server is what you would expect in some of these Mission places: moving at a snails pace, not listening to the order, and way too hipster.
author: Brian J.

description:
I've been on a 2 month mission to find good pie. What a funny thing that I should accomplish my "mission" at Mission Pie. 

Not only did I want good pie, I really wanted good Banana Cream Pie, and I got what I wanted and more. My sister had the Pear Frangipane Tart and that was another mind blowing experience altogether.

I guess my new mission is to see if I could find pie half this good in LA.
author: Regina B.

description:
Love their Pear-Raspberry pie!!

Its a nice cafe environment, great place to study or just hang out.
Will go back to try their other pies :)
author: Grace C.

description:
Chicken pot pie was awesome, though I wouldn't have minded it a bit wamer.

If this restaurant accepted a form of payment that didn't date back to 500 BCE (eg credit cards), I would give it 5 stars. I feel bad not being able to adequately tip because I don't have more cash.
author: Jeremiah L.

description:
Fantastic home made pies (and not disgustingly sweet), complimented delightfully well with fantastic bold espresso.

Fuck yes.
author: Alex M.

description:
I go to Mission Pie if:

I need to write and not be distracted by web surfing.
I'm on my way to a party and want to make a tasty contribution.
I need pie.

All three of these things happen to me all the time, so naturally, I find myself at Mission Pie rather frequently. There's a nice, big community table where folks actually talk nice to strangers, and the space is spacious and bright.

And the pies--it doesn't matter what pie you get. And now you can get savory pies there too, so it's not just for breakfast anymore. Get a slice. Get a whole one. Get a cute, little, single-serving galette. They are all homemade and delicious. These kids know their pie. 

And they know their coffee and tea too. They've got one of the finer tea selections in the city, and they are happy to brew a hot or iced cup for you, something most coffee places have no idea how to do.

Service is top-notch, and the restroom is clean and has homemade air freshener. It's pi week, so you should go.
author: Kristy L.

description: After reading all of the great reviews I had high hopes, but was sadly a bit disappointed.  We had actually planned to have lunch at Hot Press and go over to Mission Pie for dessert, but failed to note that Hot Press is closed on Sundays!  So, we decided to just get lunch at Mission Pie.  Perhaps it was because we were really craving hot sandwiches, we were underwhelmed by the offerings from Mission Pie.  We each got a stew - one veggie and one pork - and while they tasted ok, it was a very small portion for the price.  We also each got a slice of apple pie and again, it was just ok and a very tiny portion.  Will have to come back and give the banana creme pie a try since it seems to be quite popular!  On a positive note, the decor is charming and the people who work there seemed nice.
author: Linda J.

description:
Mission Pie was kind of a letdown. When your establishment has pie in the name, then I expect your pie to blow me out of the water. We tried the pear frangipane and shaker lemon pie. Something was off with the pie. This is going to sound horrible, but I think it's because half of their pie crust is made with whole wheat flour. It throws the consistency off and I felt like the crust wasn't as buttery and flaky as I'd like it to be. I guess that's the lesson learned-don't be healthy (I kid). The pear frangipane taste had an almond filling and I like the fresh pieces of pear on top. The pie almost didn't have enough almond flavor though and I also didn't like the grainy consistency. The shaker lemon pie had thinly sliced layers of lemon in it and so it had a great sour, citrus flavor (I really like my lemon desserts sour). But the lemon pieces kind of made the pie awkward to eat because it was hard to cut into without taking slices of lemon with each bite. I was disappointed in the pie. I think the pie at Marie Callender's is better.

Read more reviews and see photos on my blog: http://rbjello.wordpress.com/2012/02/07/tuesday-mission-food-crawl/
author: Jackie T.

description:
This place amazing. Read the blog post I wrote about it. 
http://www.sweetlemonandsalt.com/2013/03/mission-pie.html
author: Nazanin S.

description:
First, the good: Mission Pie, not surprisingly, has amazing pies. 

I love the lemon pie (not that godawful yellow pudding-y crap, but actual, discernable lemons) and the walnut pie, and really, well, all of the pies. Sweet, savory, vegan, you name it. You can buy by the slice or by the whole pie, and you can load up a pie plate with a selection of slices to take home, which was a big hit in my household last Thanksgiving.  Also: good coffee.

You can buy local honey and other Bay area edibles here, and you can eat with a clear conscience, regardless of calories consumed, knowing that all the ingredients in your splurge were locally sourced, and in many cases grown on the organic farm that Mission Pie is affiliated with.  Plus the restaurant and the farm both employ and train at-risk youth, and do a lot of other cool stuff that works for the greater good.

However: Mission Pie's counter service is wildly inconsistent. One time it's all johnny-on-the-spot, and the next time you need to explain what iced coffee is, beg for a fork, and help count out your own change, so that by the time you get your order it's time to touch up your roots.

But hey, waiting is good for the soul - especially if pie is the reward.
author: Judi A.

description:
Just like that I am a convert...

The first time I came here a couple of years back, I got their famous Banana Creme Pie but I never really liked it that much. I meant its not bad but its not that great either and I really dont know why this place is always packed.

Well, now I know. Thanks to Tb's sweet tooth, we came here. At first he said we's share a slice (sure, i say...*wink...lol) but then, I saw them serving a walnut pie with fresh whipped cream to another customer and my mouth watered. So I ask him if I can order another pie on top of his banana cream pie, of course he wouldnt say no, he said go for it.

So we ordered and the Cashier and the Servers were all great. Our order was sent to a different table, and the schmuck put his finger on the whipped cream and walked away. So when I told the Server that it probably was our order, I told him I dont want that one because the guy already put his finger on it, he apologized which is all good, no harm done, I just dont want that peice of the the pie. So the Cashier/Manager came over to our table apologized and brought us our order and gave us complimentary cards for a free pie and coffee for our next visit. Now isnt that awesome customer service. I declined because there's really not much to it for us, but he insisted. 

So after enjoying our Banana Cream Pie and Walnut pie and a glass of whole d milk for me, we were happy and came out smiling.

Customer Service really does the trick. So the 5 star is not only for the walnut pie but for the Cashier and Servers that worked that night.

Made the whole pie eating experience truly worthwhile.
author: Malou C.

description: Can someone mop me up? Because i'm melting over my pear ginger pie..
author: Susy C.

description: We got the banana cream, pear blueberry, and shaker lemon slices. MUST GET: banana cream pie!!! It is sooooooo delicious with real bananas and amazing cream! The pear blueberry was pretty good, but the the shaker lemon had real lemon peels. It was a little too strong, but still pretty tasty. Overall, this is a must go to place if you want spectacular pie.
author: Andrew J.

description: I really like the vibe at this place. I love the location and the people here are genuinely nice. Me and some ladies in my organization met here to have a meeting and I loved how nice and chill it is in here. I didn't get a chance to try the banana cream pie but I heard it's yummy, so I'll have to return to try! The place is decorated really cute!
author: Marie P.

description: Awesome pies.  Banana cream has real bananas.  Imagine that .    Mixed berry is great too.  I had the peach pie with whipped cream and it wasnt' as good.  That's all.  $4 each slice $22 for a full pie.
author: Michael C.

description:
Pardon the language, but this place is so F@#$% cute!!!!! 

Seriously. Great place with fantastic decor! Without even getting into Mission Pie's magnificent pastries and super tasty coffee, let me just start by saying how wonderful and involved they are with the local community.They use fresh veggies and ingredients from a local farm up north, they participate in an apprenticeship program involving SF youth AND they feature art of the wall of local Bay Area artists. How rad, right?! 

The food (notice I didn't say "pies," I said, "food") is delicious!  Try their potato quiche or their fantastic banana cream pie. MMM. And their coffee roaster, Taylor Maid, does not joke around.
author: Dean R.

description: Not as good as I expected. Apple is my all time favorite, but I think mission's apple is little overly too sweet.
author: Susan H.

description: Pumpkin pie is to die for! And especially comforting and delicious around the holidays. As a San Francisco native, Mission Pie is always at the top of my list when it comes to satisfying my gigantic sweet tooth. If you really want to go crazy this holiday season, loosen your belt a notch (or several) and check out these other sinfully sweet SF must-eats: http://www.travelsages.com/2013/12/16/snowmen-santa-and-seasonal-san-francisco-sweets/
author: Anna P.

description:
Stopped in here recently.  The walnut pie and coffee were fine but the service has slipped.

* First: they were out of almost everything good.

* Second: the girl at the counter couldn't hack through the walnut pie of which I ordered a slice, so she reached in the tin and tore it out with her hand.  I hope it was clean, but I have no reason to assume it was or wasn't.  Good thing I'm not afraid of germs.

* Third: a slice of pie is supposed to be roughly 1/6th of the pie.  I got around 1/10th, with most of the interior leaked out.  I still got charged full.

* Fourth: they didn't have any utensils ready.  Then the staff got pissed off when we asked for some.

* Fifth: Mission Pie has this supposed instruction of local youth component whereby they're teaching kids how to run things well.  Given the previous four complaints, it's pretty clear they're doing a lousy job at that.
author: Suo L.

description:
I went in here because I had an hour to kill before an appointment, and my sweet tooth was aching...  so Mission Pie to the rescue.  Or so I thought.

Upon walking in I liked the feel and decor of the place - very lounge-y and relaxed.  Not being able to make up my mind about their pie, I got a slice of the peach-raspberry and a slice of the mixed berry to go with a cup of coffee.  When I asked the cashier if they had ice cream to go with my pie, he said they didn't serve ice cream, only whipped cream.  A place that specializes in pie and no ice cream?!?  Really?  I asked him how many times a day someone asks for ice cream and he said, "A lot."  That should have been clue #1...

I served myself coffee from their table (they DO have good coffee), sat down and five minutes later two small slices of pie were brought to me.  Cold.  I suppose I should have realized that when I ordered, they didn't ask me if I wanted it warm or cold.  I was too impatient and hungry to wait, and while I prefer it warm, well - good pie is pretty good at room temperature, so I dug in.

I will forgive many things in a restaurant if the food is good - bad service, mixed up orders, dirty bathroom among them - but I wasn't impressed.  The pie wasn't bad, but it certainly wasn't anything memorable.  Between finding a giant piece of peach that single-handedly took up most of the peach content in one slice, and the overly sugared filling in the other, well...  it was just disappointing.  The fact that it was room temperature didn't help either.  I know pie.  All Mission Pie's offerings managed to do was make me miss my mother and her 8 sisters' baking.

During the hour I spent at one of the window tables drinking my coffee and reading, I watched several people get up and refill their coffee mugs.  I had gotten mine in a paper cup because I wanted to take it with me to my appointment and was under the impression that one refill was free.  I figured one cup in Mission Pie, the refill for the road, so when I got up to leave I went over to refill it.  As I was walking towards the door, one of the staff came up behind me and informed me that refills cost $1.25 in a "to go" paper cup, and that the free refill was only given in one of their "for here" mugs.  He didn't charge me, but wanted me to know the policy "for next time."  Instead of having a conversation about the lack of signage informing customers of this policy, or the fact that the coffee is self-service, I happily walked over to the cashier and forked over $1.25 for my refill before walking out.

I really wanted to like this place, especially because it's in my neighborhood and the thought of being able to walk a few blocks from my house to get a warm slice of pie was extremely appealing.  But for me, there will not be a "next time" at this establishment.

2 stars given solely for their social mission and their coffee.
author: Dirty D.

description:
Strangely, there aren't too many pie places in the city where you can walk in to grab a decent slice of pie without having to pre-order in advance.  Mission Pie is one of the few, and while their pies aren't amazing, they are decent. I'm a fruit pie type of person, and there are usually decent options to choose from. 

Looking forward to the day someone opens an amazing pie place you can walk into and buy a slice on the spot. I'm guessing pie shops don't exist because you can't make that much money on selling a slice of pie. Fruit is expensive and psychologically, spending more than a few bucks on a slice is about all someone can handle.  I've tried the delivery service places; pies better be good since they are made in small batches but I still really can't figure out how the owners make any money.
author: E. L.

description:
P.I.E.

Perfectly Incredible Eatables.

Mission Pie's pies? 

Pricey, Informal Eats. 

The banana cream pie was forgettable (not as good as Nation's), and pear tart, dry.

Macaroons are a must eat. Massive and dense, flaky and soft.

I finished my pie with no smile, just a little utterance of "I'm done."

I will do the same with this review, "I'm done." Nothing more.
author: Hana J.

description:
I immagine this is what people knew pies to be way back before food people stopped caring what they ate.

My friend, after drinking announced "we should all go to pie". Of course, me and the rest of us followed her thinking she said "rye" which would have went well with the cocktails we had been drinking. Instead, we ended up at a place with pies and absolutely no alcohol.

It is funny how you can go all over a city like this and find terrible cappuccinos made by people advertising that they use the best beans in town. Well this place didn't even look like they had coffee on arrival but this was a nice delicate cup which was not too bitter. Just a smooth cup at the right temperature. 

I ordered the sweet potato pie. There was no sour cream and compared to the other pies looked a little boring and simple. Don't let it fool you. This pie had a lot of character hiding behind its crust. So much flavor for one slice. I truly enjoyed it. 

As usual, I am a huge fan of the community table and this one seemed to appreciate our mildly drunk banter.
author: Eric G.

description:
This place was pretty cool.... except the pie was disappointing.
My boyfriend and I stopped at Mission Pie for a slice before heading to a show at the Makeout Room, and I thought the decor was pretty cute. The pot pies looked yummy, but we had a sugar craving so we got a slice of raspberry-peach pie to share.
It was a very itty bitty and stingy serving for $3.50 plus tax. And the peaches were from a can or jar. Uh...???? In August? No excuse for that. They even had some fresh stone fruit in a basket, so why is that not going into their PIE? Yucky.
They do have a cute little kids table/area. And interesting art. But I don't  think I'd go back again for pie.
author: Kat W.

description:
I went here with no clue about it except that it is CASH ONLY!!!

Got a fig gallette and loved it.  I wanted to order a whole pie, but I had a few hours to kill before I was going home, so I didn't.  I for sure will come back for one though.

Nice staff and cute little shop
author: Theo T.

description:
I almost cried when we didn't see Mission Pie at 2901 Mission. After running the half marathon, all I wanted was some fresh, homemade pie. How can it be gone? I just read about how great the pie is last week. Then my grief turned into outrage. You know what, no matter where you relocated to, I will hunt you down and eat your pie. So I called the bakery and it turned out the store is located on the east side, 25th street. Two big smiles on our faces, we sprint down the street, and there it is.

The ginger pear pie was unique, just not my cup of tea. The ginger definitely adds a kick to it, but the flavor is too strong and overpowering. The pear was hands-down, from texture to taste, top-notch. The plum tart is absolutely delicious. The caramelized sugar on top is crispy and compliments the sourness of the plum. So good.

My expectation was too high, otherwise it would totally be a 4 star.
author: Tingting H.

description:
Banana cream pie = delicious light and refreshing pie, with thick layer of whipped cream. I don't normally like whipped cream, but this one was paired nicely. Not a fan of the type of crust they use. I think its the same type of crust at Tartine's banana cream pie.

Oh, kinda pricey for a normal sized slice...
author: Carol L.

description: I LOVE me my Mission Pie! All the products are bought from local farmers. They hire students from Mission High School and teach them skills. The fresh real bananas pie are beyond rico...it is RICISIMO!
author: Roberto H.

description:
1 star for the staff, 1 star for the facility, and 1 star for the food.  After I have been hearing about this place for the past year or so, I had the chance to try it with a couple buddies last night.  I had built up my expectations to a fairly high level because of all the praise I had heard for the pie.  

I was impressed the minute I walked through the door.  Staff was super nice, ask for your name, and even hand deliver your slice of pie after you sit down.  Classy.  This place also embodies the quintessential hipster element of the mission neighborhood -- I liked how the menu was scrawled out in chalk on the support beams and how vegan and vegetarian options were provided on the menu.  The pie on the other hand -- not so great.  I ordered a slice of the mixed berry.  The pie was somewhat warm, no complaints there, but there was hardly any crust on that pie at all.  It just felt like I was eating some sort of berry soup.  Definitely nothing to write home about.  I felt like I would have been much more satisfied if I had just gone to Costco and bought a whole pie.  I will probably be back because I liked the feel of the place and want to try their other pies.  I would still recommend a visit to someone that hasn't tried it.
author: Jordan J.

description:
If you have never been here.. certainly come, but time it a 1/2 hour or so before they close.  Such a tres cool crowd, and so beatnik... I had a blast.. computers cranking away, the coffee is like still warm, but perfect for drinking.  Everyone inside is in a really cool space.. 

Savory
Sweet

Ymm  i could decide, so since i had dinner i selected the sweet of the pies.. as i as fortunate enough to get a slice of wonderful BLACK WALNUT pie...and this ain't the cheap ass nasty old walnut pie in the frozen food counter, but fresh.. and huge black walnuts graciously spread over a delicious filling and such the flaky crust... Flaky.. like flaky when you make great plans to go to the museum with someone and they FLAKE... still back to the pie.  So delicious that when you have your slice and cutting into it with your FORK.. yeah.. eat a pie with a FORK...just like that same friend with a FORK tongue... sticking it out telling you ..."oh yeah.. lets go to the museum" and instead of showing up..they FLAKE.   Oh well.. back to the pie.. and as i was eating the pie, people around me finishing up their camped out spoils at the many tables... its was quite the treat.. 
I loved the staff..so.. nice.. really..  so funny.. very!!!

So stick your fork into my flaky friend.. oh.. i am sorry.. PIE make that your mission.
author: Tito Y.

description:
I really wanted to like this place when i heard about it and read the reviews but i hate to report that i was underwhelmed with the pies. I split the banana cream, walnut and peach pie with 5 other people.

The banana cream pie was good but didn't have as many bananas as I'd hope with each bite. The walnut was really  good that I could have eaten one all to myself. I like how it's wasn't as sweet as other nut pies. Lastly, the peach was average. I had high hopes since it's peach season but I  felt it lacked in sweetness.

Overall:  I like how the pies look and taste like homemade pies. I also enjoyed the coffee and atmosphere; however, I didn't like it that much that I'd come back here again to satisfy my sweet tooth.
author: Michelle B.

description: I'm the type of person who wants to try every. single. pie. on the menu because I just don't function well with large selections of delicious goods. They ran out of savory pies by the time we arrived but, I had my first slice of chess pie topped with vanilla ice cream and boy were my taste buds s-i-n-g-i-n-g.
author: Karen H.

description:
We came here after binging at La Taqueria and the Pupuseria next door, and so I was naturally stuffed.. However... 

the pie selection was quite tempting.  

Lots of sweet pies: a delicious pear tart, a lemon pie that had candied lemons in it, a strawberry pastry looking thing, mini walnut tarts, and I think a pecan pie... but, what caught my eye... 

were the savory pies.  Chicken pot pie, a chile tamale pie, a great looking potato gratin tart, some sort of chard and feta pastry thing...  YUM..

i'll be going back to this place...
author: Mac L.

description: I don't know about the quality of their pies but their service is crap. I ordered some pies for thanksgiving in advance and their store was so chaotic for pickup that I will never go back. I ended up waiting 50 minutes while all the staff wandered around both frantically and aimlessly. Rather than improve their dysfunctional pickup process, they merely offered oranges to all the pissed off customers. It took all my energy to not hurl one of those oranges back at the smug employees who could have simply said "sorry this is so chaotic but the pies are worth the wait". Next time I will go somewhere else.
author: Mark D.

description:
Things I love about MISSION PIE....

* Their MISSION...specifically their commitment to fairness and social justice in business ... and their contributions to the community 

* Their PIE...specifically their plum frangipane tart
author: Mo M.

description: I took 3 different pies. There are good, but the portions are small and the flavors are not very original.
author: R G.

description:
At long last you have entered my life. I have been meaning to invite you into my world for months but Saturday was the big day. Thank you for providing me with the most happy experience. Your pear and blueberry pie was dancing in my mouth. I will be calling you again soon to pre-order a large chicken pot pie to enjoy with many of my fellow San Francisco friends. They too will then be your friend and you will be invited to many parties. Until we meet again. 

xo 
Scott
author: Scott P.

description:
UPDATE:  So now, I've actually forked my way through the fresh banana cream pie. Crust - yum! Bits of banana -- wow!  Cappucino was good as well as the green tea.  Plus you feel like a do-gooder. Huge crowds come and go -- somehow, this place is drawing people in.

This is an adorable spot.  Actually, i have yet to try the goods but I really liked the airy space filled photographs and the sign on the corner in magic marker pointing to the mysterious cafe, plus the hand-written sign of prices seems to indicate the place needs all the help they can get.  We'll be back to sample the goods, which include 4 kinds of pie and savory pie pockets.
author: Vanessa H.

description:
Mixed berry and banana cream pies are amazing. Not too sweet, but full of flavor. 

Crust is minimal, but buttery, and not too dry. 

Savory salads and iced coffee are great, too. 

Right price, great location.
author: David F.

description:
A few weeks back, I biked here based solely on Yelp reviews. I'm kind of out of shape so this represents a bit of effort on my part. This is an easy way to end up disappointed... but Mission Pie was totally worth the trip!

I got one slice each of the quiche and the potato pie, and both were amazing! I wish I hadn't eaten them so quickly so that I could talk at length about the details. Consider this yet another endorsement to go try it yourself.

They're cash only, but there's a Bank of America (with ATMs) a few blocks north along Mission.
author: Sharon W.

description:
My sister and I had just finished a delicious dinner in the Mission and were taking a stroll in hopes of finding an appropriate venue for dessert. We weren't really seeing anything and thus figured we might as well just grab a box of donuts from Walgreens. Enter: Mission Pie.

Walking in from the windy, brisk evening weather we were greeted by a beautifully cozy and warm interior in this little mission pie shop.  I was actually a bit skeptical--I had not had a good piece of pie in literally years and thus had developed the opinion that pie was in general just not that great.  Boy was I wrong.

My sister and I decided to split a piece of their fresh peach raspberry pie. The guy manning the counter was very friendly, adding to the homey ambiance of the place.  The pie arrived with a generous dollop of cream on top, and just the appearance of the pie was beautiful--this was clearly homemade.  The flavors were exquisite, peach blending with raspberry in a sweet tangy mixture of oh-my-god-foodgasm-yumminess.  Even the crust, which I usually don't notice, was absolutely delicious.  

The pie was so good we decided we needed a second piece.  When I went back and expressed my desperate need for another slice of that peach-raspberry heaven, the guy behind the counter smiled and gave me the second slice on the house because apparently it was "too small to sell." If by too small they mean bigger than my original piece, that's totally fine by me!

I cannot wait to go back here and try more of their pie flavors. Also, they have a great selection of jams and honeys for sale, and they made the best chai latte I have had in years. I basically want to live in this place. Mission Pie forever!!!
author: Cat H.

description: Wife: "stop eating my [banana cream] pie and get your own!"
author: James G.

description:
the pies from Mission Pie is like manna from heaven!  my only regret is that they do not accept debit cards, so be prepared.

I will keep coming back for more.  hmmmm pie!
author: Princess P.

description: Veggie goat cheese quiche, fluffy and flavorful, two thumbs up. "Best I ever had," says my friend. Quick to deliver to our table, though it was slightly cold in the middle. We want an option for gluten-free. Pleasant atmosphere and generous service.
author: Zena B.

description:
I really love their pie. I'm not vegan or veg but I adore their vegan apricot pie. I like their strawberry rhubarb and their nut pies too.

I like the banana cream pie better at 1300 Fillmore.
author: Marina N.

description: This is a go-to dessert place for me.  The combination of laid-back casual atmosphere, great mission (connecting youth with local farms), and exceptional pie is a winner.  It's often difficult to find parking...
author: Brad B.

description:
Great Pie

Had a slice of mixed berry with whipped cream, amazing!
author: Michael D.

description:
Eat more pie!

Eat pie here.  It's pretty good.  They have vegan things that I'll never sample.  They seem to always be sold out of things I like.  It's not the BEST pie ever but it's tasty enough and a fun place to hang out with your friends.
author: Poppy C.

description: I am on a pie binge right now.  What fat ass doesn't like to eat pie?  I was driving back from 99 ranch in Daly city when I had a major craving for some pie.  I finally had the energy to roll my ass to Mission Pie.  They have a pretty good assortment of pies but nothing stood out except for the banana cream.  When I saw it in the display case I knew I needed to buy a whole pie.  I saw some skinny weiner guy buy a slice for $3.50.  I would have finished it in one bite.  I figured $20 for the whole thing would give me 5 minutes of enjoyment.  The pie was delicious but I wanted more banana flavor.  Heidi's banana cream pie in San Mateo is still the best I've ever had.  This is the second best because this is the second banana cream pie I've eaten.  Pwned.  My next stop is to find three hoes I mean babes.
author: Fatty A.

description: 5 stars for the pie. 1 star for the ridiculous everything else. This has GOT to be someone's social experiment. Pay $24 for a pie to go. Then wait 30 minutes for them to have it ready. And they're pissed off when you ask what's taking so long. And get this. When you order at the counter they give you an iPad screen asking whether you're leaving a 15 percent, 20 percent or 25 percent tip. Never again
author: Andrew W.

description:
I have tried their vegan apple raspberry pie and it was super delicious!  If you are vegan and looking for a good pie hands down come here.  

I like all the windows that gives you a clear view of mission street and all the crazy people walking by.  They also have window seating with super comfy stools perfect for your butt. ; )

They have good quality loose leaf teas.  But I don't recommend the lattes, the few times that I have ordered one there was barely any foam on top and not enough espresso.
author: Elisabeth B.

description:
I really wanted to like this place, they source their ingredients locally and also sell confections and jams by local artisans. 

The food: I got a chicken pot pie and a slice of banana cream to go. Neither had very much flavor at all. Also the pot pie only has pastry on the top, so it's not really a pie at all.

The atmosphere: Ack, raucous suburbanites. You'll trip over 3 strollers before you can even get to the register. I would not recommend eating here at all, if you must get something get it to go. 

The service: Disorganized at best. I had to ask for reheating instructions, which were dead wrong, as soon as they handed me my stuff they tried to shoo me off,  I had to ask them for my change. Not welcoming at all. 

I agree with the reviewer who said you're better off stopping by Tartine. I've had freezer bought pot pies better than this one.
author: Beth D.

description: Only been there once to get pie and it was amazing!!! Had their banana cream pie and it was amazing ended up leaving with a whole pie :) only downside a little pricey
author: Nina M.

description:
How hipster is the mission that we have a dedicated pie place...

Savory curry pie was boring, strawberry rhubarb was decent.
author: Jack K.

description:
Great place to socialize and spend an afternoon or early evening with friends, however, the pies that this visitor sampled, both sweet and savory were somewhat disappointing and boring. 

The banana cream pie was too dense with few fresh banana slices, it tasted more like a blob of thick pudding. The potato pie was flat and needed seasoning. The "Tamale Chili" pie would have been better labeled as simply a "Chile Con Carne" pie.

Unusual light fixtures were created from Victorian rosettes and what appears to be tin ceiling, great lighting from large floor to ceiling windows.
author: Rafael R.

description:
Banana Cream Pie.  Yep.

I love the homey feel at Mission Pie.  I love all of the programs they have to support the community.  I love that I can go for dessert after a dinner out, unlike many pie joints and bakeries.  

But mostly, I love the banana cream pie.  The custard is creamy, but not too custardy.  The whipped cream is just the right sweetness.  The crust is thin and flaky.  Sometimes it's a little burnt, but it still tastes great. 

I've also tried the pear/cranberry and the candied lemon.  The pear was tart and the lemon was a little curdled, but both were good.

I'm not a fan of the chai at Mission Pie, it's cold and spicy.
author: Kristin M.

description:
Strange that my favorite thing from Mission Pie was not pie at all...  It was the scones!  Black currant, rich and buttery with just a hint of sweetness...  Perfection!

  Prior to my scone scarfing, I partook of the chicken pot pie and the plum pie.  The pot pie was delicious, though not life changing.  It was nice to have a pot pie that didn't require me to chug a gallon of water afterwards because of high salt concentration...  The plum slice was very subtle and understated, combined with the fresh whipped cream it was a nice treat.

  Bottom Line:  While I feel Mission Pie merits an overall 3-star, they definitely deserve a 5-star for their at-risk youth outreach program.  It's places like Mission Pie giving back that make our community that much better.
author: Greydon U.

description:
I'm not what you would call a pie person, so for me to really enjoy one is pretty rare. 

I ordered the walnut pie and absolutely loved. The flavor was great and flavorful without being too sweet. The crust was also very good and not too crispy. I also had a small taste of their apple pie, which was also really good. One of my new favorite pie places in the city. I still need to go back and try some of their other flavors.
author: Ajay K.

description:
So I came to mission pie because a coworker had told me about them and I've partnered with the non-profit they work with, Pie Ranch.

I came in and the place was pretty slow for a Saturday around 2, but they had only one person out in front making espresso drinks and running the cash register, so it took us a while just to order our food.  We waiting in line for about 10 minutes with only 2 people in front of us.

After ordering a ton of people started to pour in.  We got our pie first since the savory food took a while.

I got the vegan apple pie which was really good.  I would have never known it was vegan.  My boyfriend got the plum tart, which was okay but I'm not a huge fan of plums.  To note, the pies are good, but not good to look at, they are pretty mangled when they get to the plate, but the pies are made by at risk SF kids so I can't complain too much.

We then awaited about 10 minutes and my boyfriends potato tart came out.  It was also okay, but to me a tart is sweet not savory.  But anyways the potato tart was really good.

We were waiting for at least 15-20 minutes just for a three sisters vegan pot pie and a mixed bean salad.  The pot pie finally came out, but the pie was very bland.  Plus, there was no bottom crust on the pot pie which was disappointing.

Not sure why it took so long to get the bean salad when its probably already premixed and requires no cooking, but was pretty refreshing.

I'd come back again but only for pie, its not the best place for actual food, due to the service.  The seating is very limited and its crowded fast.

The place also doesn't accept credit, only cash or check.
author: Kameron K.

description:
+ plum tart: absolutely delightful!
+ mind-blowing .. sweet not in a sugary way .. bursting with fruit flavor 
+ crust - perfect, not the least bit soggy

- ginger pear pie: surprising combination . . very refreshing & distinctive with the ginger kick but not necessarily something I consider tasty
author: Dana W.

description: The staff is very nice. The pot pies are almost always great. The supper is tasty. Kid friendly. Nice details.
author: Sophia L.

description: Laid back neighborhood feel. Price is right and the pies are light, fruity and delicious. A good option for desert after a filling meal at one of the nearby restaurants. The plum and frangipani tart was surprisingly sour, but the almond paste balanced it well. Tasted the vegan apricot blueberry. Sweet and floral. Yum.
author: Chris P.

description:
I love their walnut pie. Love it, love it, love it. I'm traditionally a fan of pecan pie, but most pecan pies are all corn syrup. This walnut pie is made with cane sugar, so I feel a little better about eating it. I also rationalize that it's good for digestion because walnuts have a lot of fiber. :)
