However, when he asked if they could sub one slice of banana cream to make a whole pie, the woman absolutely refused saying it was "against policy". Another employee wanted to do it, but she said that she just could not. I don't know why it would be so difficult to oblige to a customer's needs especially since it helps to sell the left over inventory for the day.

The pie crust is the flakiest I have ever tasted, but unfortunately the service makes us not want to go back ever again. The banana cream pie filling was the best I have ever tasted (custardy goodness) and the mixed berry pie was also very delicious and not too sweet. Maybe if I had another extreme and intense craving for pie will I return despite the service. 

For just the pies itself: 4.5, but the service was so horrible I had to knock it down.
author: Angela L.

description:
This place no longer deserves five stars, as the products are a little hit or miss nowadays.  You can buy a $5 gallete, only to find out they really skimped on the fruit filling.  I like that their muffins and scones are not too sweet, but they are really skimpy on the fruit/nut ingredients.  

Their coffee is disappointing and it would be great if they could switch to whole wheat flour in their pie crust.
author: Amy D.

description: FABULOUS walnut pie.  My only complaint of this place is there is no free wi-fi.  Seems kind of odd for a coffee/pie place.  Otherwise, terrific pie!
author: Emily S.

description:
I was utterly confused with the address since it stated Mission St so my friend and I paced up and down on Mission right by the 25th intersection and did not find Mission Pies! We got desperate and grew tired of pacing back and forth and decided to go into Red Door Cafe to ask if anyone knew. The staff didn't but another patron immediately jumped up and pointed us across the street! 

Ahhhhhhh, soooooo, this place is actually on 25th! Or at least the entrance is on 25th St and not on Mission.
The banana cream pie was divine with chunks of bananas, the walnut tartlet was great and not overly sweet and the sweet potato pie was decent too but my fav is the banana cream pie and yes the crust was a nice crisp, not overly oily, just plain good!! Sooooooooo good.
author: Yan M.

description:
As someone with a dubious relationship with squishy food items and conservative with the dessert menu, I was pleasantly surprised by the oh-so-tasty, modestly superior, homestyle goodness of the Peach-Raspberry Pie. 

There was a reasonable selection, perhaps 8 or 10 different savory and sweet pies to choose from. I ordered a full Peach-Raspberry pie to-go. The employees were more than happy to heat it up for me. The potluck brunch for where I delivered it a few minutes later was ecstatic and the pie was a hit. 

Clearly, I'm taking pie off of my do-not-travel list and will definitely be back to Mission Pie! Maybe the chicken pot pie or the banana cream next time.
author: Dina H.

description:
Pie is great to eat
Stuff it in my big fat face
Run to Mis-sion PIE

Pie, Pie, Pie, I love Pie! Oh, this place is GREAT! Yes I had to look up how to write a haiku but it was WORTH IT! The only reason it's not getting a 5 star is because when I went there they didn't have much of a selection, but maybe I just went at the wrong time. It's soooo good. I had the Sweet Potato and ate it in less than a minuet. It worth driving cross town too, but if you're walking around the mish don't miss it! It's just across the and around the corner from La Taqueria. It says it's on mission, but the entrance is really on 25th. If you like pie, you won't be disappointed.


Hey Look below for my sister's review. YEAH KRISTEN!!!
author: Garrett H.

description: Would love to come back and order something different.  I got the mini apple and huckleberry pie ($7), which was not that flavorful.  I guess that means they don't add very much sugar, which could be a good thing if you're not into super sweet pies.  The crust and topping was good, but just wish the filling was more tart or sweet.  I love the atmosphere, high ceilings, lots of sunlight coming through the big windows, and plenty of seating.
author: rose h.

description: o crap is this place slow!!!! i work nearby and each time i go they easily take 15 or 20 minutes to give me my food and coffee. mind you, i am the only person in line most of the time because i figured if i went on off peak hours that might help. yea right! i service wasnt so slow i might like the food more, but 20 minutes ia seriously insane! will not go back.
author: Christina M.

description: Great Pie. My favorite are banana pie and the pear frangipane. I do not think coffee is their speciality.
author: Antonino S.

description:
3.1.2008: I finally made it back here, hoping to catch the last slice of banana cream before someone else did. Yesss! Three of us get slices and the fourth one in our party wished he got one too, because OMG! I'm usually really good about sharing my food, but I took the first bite and entered my own little heaven...no way I was gonna share this one. 

My first visit: 

I try to buy organic whenever possible...the food tastes BETTER, it's BETTER for the environment, and it's BETTER for you. 

And what's even BETTER than BETTER is finding a place that churns out good food using organic ingredients. Mission Pie is one of those places: Cranberry in french custard (has a name that starts with a "C"), apple pie, raspberry/pear pie. They've got just the right amount of sweetness and the crust rolls around on top with that little bit of crunch from a sprinkle of sugar. If you like, they'll serve it to you with a dollop of whipped cream.

Mission Pie supports the efforts of an organic farm in Pescadero. You can read all about it on the walls of this little pie shop. The same employees that serve up the pie, also work on the farm. So, it's kinda cool that they see the product from beginning to end.

Check it out. You'll feel good that you can have your pie and make the world a BETTER place too.
author: Virg Y.

description:
This was definitely a great find. I did a few thesis interviews over pie at Mission Pie. I picked it because it was near Bart and I hoped it wasn't too loud to conduct interviews there. It was fabulous to enjoy some delicious slices of banana cream pie, walnut pie and mocha while getting some work done in an adorable and relaxed environment. The staff was friendly and the vibe in there was very mellow.

I can only think of 2 negatives.
1) My mocha was more lukewarm than hot although it was very tasty. 
2) As I enjoyed my pie and conducted my interviews I should have been studiously paying attention to every word the participant was saying; instead, I was thinking  things like "I wonder what I should write in my review about this place?" and "mmmmm, pie." I am sure I didn't miss anything important.
author: Lilly O.

description:
I'm going to admit that I'm not sure that I can identify an AMAZING pie. 

But, I can identify a bad pie (the walnut/pecan tartlet was terrible) and I can also identify indifferent service (dude at the counter whose skills included mumbling and not having an opinion). 

I wanted to be charmed by this place, but I just wasn't. I hope it hasn't been spoiled by their success, like so many SF establishments.
author: Shal J.

description:
Some people for some reason don't like pie. They would chose cake over pie. I don't trust these people. That being said, I love pie and was slightly disappointed by my trip to Mission Pie. We had the Banana Cream Pie which was tasty, but not great, and an adorable strawberry galette that was so cute that I didn't want to eat it. However, I did and it was decent, but again not great. 

I'm sure we'll go back and sample their other flavors. Plus I dug the low-key hipster vibe, even though I shouldn't dig it because I like to make fun of the hipsters on their laptops, sucking back their soy lattes, eating their vegan rhubarb pie. I probably mock because I secretly want to be like them.
author: Alyssa B.

description: Good decaf, great peach pie! Sure wish they'd do a gluten-free crust too.
author: Will R.

description:
Mission Pie is a cooperative that teaches high school age people about the process of growing food, transporting it, preparing it, and bringing it to the table.  Kids work out on the "pie ranch" where the fruit is grown, they make it into pies in the Mission Pie bakery, and they sell it to their friends, neighbors, and local customers at the Mission Pie cafe.

I do not care about any of this do-good nonsense.  I am serious about pie, and I would buy pie from the Devil himself if it was tasty.  Fortunately, Mission Pie also makes the best pie I have ever eaten.  You can tell that the fruit filling has been made from fresh, high-quality fruit (not frozen or canned).  The crust's taste and texture is absolutely perfect.

Whether you're a big-hearted earth mother who loves helping children or an Ayn Rand quoting, self-interested capitalist, "Mission Pie" has both the fuzzy vibes and blue ribbon quality pie to make everyone happy.
author: Akdov T.

description: This was AMAZING. We got the chicken pot pie and the potato tart for dinner, and the banana cream and peach pies for dessert. The pastry is absolutely amazing, especially for the savoury pies. The wait staff were also super friendly and were happy to recommend options. You should go here!
author: Olivia C.

description:
Ridiculously small portion of apple pie for Nick H. = -9999999999999 stars!!!!! Nick mad! Ok, I'll give them the benefit of the doubt and only deduct 1 star.

Atrocious, raunchy un-showered for 2 weeks armpit smell from the grungy looking register guy = -1 star. Normally this would be a deal breaker, but the pie still does taste quite nice.

Mom, you not only smell nice (well, most of the time anyways), you also never skimp on my serving sizes. Since I can't visit all the time, can you give Mission Pie a call and tell them how to treat your boy right? Thanks Mom, Love Nick.
author: Nick H.

description:
Lately I've been on a hunt to find delicious, one-of-a-kind, hole in the wall spots. So far, Emmy's Spaghetti Shack tops the list and Mission Pie has just joined the ranks.

This discreet little place serves up pies that hit the spot unlike any other. Try their Strawberry Rhubarb or Banana Cream pies and trust me, you won't be disappointed. Jamie T. noted that the crust wasn't bitter, which was so true! They also offer homemade whipped cream to top off your order. My slice was good till the last bite, which led to the ordering of a 2nd slice to take home & devour.

Sidenotes:

-Seating's minimal w/ about 5 tables, so make sure you have a back-up plan if you can't snag a seat.
-Strong, tasty coffee or a tall glass of milk is available to pair with your treat(s).
-Bring cash! No credit cards accepted.
-They're environmentally friendly. Their to-go boxes are compost friendly.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
So this is loooove..dodododo..so this..is looooooove - or at least freaking delicious! 

We came a bit late in the day and they were out of everything except these little walnut pie-lettes topped with home made whipped cream and hot holy damn were they good. This place uses organic ingredients, they socially responsible, and makes a fantastic flaky crust..I can't wait to go back and try more of their amazing pie! ((drools))

Once I try others I will be able to say if it is truly a 5 star joint..but I'm pretty sure it is..
author: Natalie G.

description:
First time going to Mission Pie, not sure why, as a vegan this place really is  a slice of heaven since it carries a couple vegan ones. I've past by this place a couple of times going to wherever I am going, I just thought it was  a coffee shop, I mean there is not clear signage saying Mission Pie - I guess that's reason enough to lose half a star, not enough marketability for a really good product is a crime in some states. 

Fact of the matter is the pie here is excellent, I got the Pear Blueberry. Make sure you ask them to warm it up, or they won't do it, which is kind of weird it you ask me. Who would want a cold pie slice in January? Service is here suspect. 

Overall, decent place, more importantly good pie!
author: Brian S.

description:
San Francisco seems to lack outlets that serve pie and only pie. Thank goodness for Mission Pie! 

Like many I've had to settle for supermarket pies that were over-crusted and under-filled over the years. The banana cream pie is fantastic! I've had it twice now. The small space can get pretty tight so I try to get out there in the middle of a weekday to get my pie. Thank goodness for flexible working hours too.
author: Sara A.

description:
Puny Pie Portions.

This place was highly recommended by a friend who raved about their pies. When I saw the prices on the menu, I thought they were a bit pricey but at least it's for a good cause.

The pear and ginger pie was good but the portion was minuscule. For a second, I thought I was purposely handed a smaller slice. I looked around and turned-out that everybody's pieces look tiny too. I also ate a savory pie which was good but also tiny. I don't need an endless buffet-size meal to make me happy, but I hate feeling like I should have spent my money elsewhere.

Anybody who has ever made pie may feel disappointed by the portion and price. Also, do not come here if you are hungry b/c you'll probably leave still hungry. I was considering giving this place 2 stars, but I thought the food was good...only pricey.

I admire the good intentions of Mission Pie, and its help towards the community. I would consider eating here again, but with different exceptions.
author: Mike L.

description: The overpriced pies are well, if you are in the area and too lazy to go to a better place ,then they are acceptable but the service sucks big time. I went ordered a slice of pie and paid for it but kept waiting for no apparent reason while the next 5 customers were served and left then I was handed my pie no sorry for the wait or nothing,  this is not the first bad service experience that I get there, I am generous enough to overlook it once or twice but when it is the norm then I won't. obviously I won't go again and will warn everyone I know not to go there, there are many great alternatives in the neighborhood
author: S I.

description: 5 Stars - had the banana cream pie.  So good.  My mouth is watering just thinking about it.  Cute space, too.
author: Kevin M.

description:
best banana cream pie, EVER!!!

seriously, where can i find something like that in LA? : ( i'm so sad i moved.. 

you don't even have to try anything else. just banana cream pie!!
author: Amy S.

description: The pies are great, and the ambiance is great.  I like the metal saddle seats at the front window.  The people who work here are awesome.
author: Alf O.

description:
It's funny, I feel like I want to give this four stars, but I honestly can't think of anything wrong with the place. Perhaps it might be a little on the spendy side, but the deliciousness made up for it. 

The staff was super-friendly and helpful. I was worried that--at the end of the day--they might not have their full selection available, but I had my choice. I picked up a full Pear Raspberry pie. Now, I'm not even really a pie fan, but this was perfect. The pear was crisp and sweet and the hints of raspberry rounded out the flavor with a little tartness. Thinking of the crumble topping is making me drool as I type. It wasn't a huge inch-thick crust on top, just delicate, sweet and simply accentuated the pie.

Full pies are $18; and I'm tempted by the mini pie for $5, it looks like the perfect serving for two people. So cute!

I'll definitely be back. Great for a last minute hostess gift or dinner party contribution. Although, I think it's equally appropriate when you just want sweet delicious pie, no event required.
author: Erin M.

description:
atmosphere - typical coffee shop....
all kinds of pies & tarts... so far we have sampled the huckleberry pie and the potato pie (savory)... both very delicious.. The price are a bit high...i.e. small huckleberry pie, maybe 5in in diameter is $7.00...oh yes, shaker lemon pie is very delicious
author: Jay S.

description:
My first visit to Mission Pie was before its big remodel.  I was uncomfortably full from lunch, but I'd heard such wonderful things about the pie that I still wanted a slice or two to sample after my long BART ride home.  At the time, I got Banana Cream and Walnut.  Both were absolutely delectable.  The fresh whipped cream is what really makes the Banana Cream special and the Walnut was not too sweet as many nut pies tend to be.  At the time, I was in love with the pie, but found the space to be awkwardly crowded.

I went in for my second trip and was pleasantly surprised by the remodel.  Mission Pie is really nice and spacious, and I really love how they've changed the space.  They also make great use of having a bunch of large, communal tables rather than overcrowding the space with too many two-person tables and a sea of clunky chairs.

Today, I sampled the Mixed Berry pie with the crumble topping and it was just as delish as I remembered the other pies to be.  Their coffee is really yummy and I love that they support a local beanery!

Hurray for pie, and an extra Huzzah for Mission Pie!
author: Grace K.

description: Simply a damn awesome pie! Scones are not to be overlooked!
author: Gregg M.

description: A coworker brought four Mission pies in for a work going away party (apple, lemon, banana cream and some kind of berry/pear combo).  I was really excited to finally try them because I've heard such great things about Mission Pie but I was sadly "meh'ed" with the samplings.  I only tried the apple (fruit filling was OK) and the lemon (which tasted super pithy and bitter and I'm a major lemon fan, I eat them like oranges some times but the bitter flavor of the pith was all I tasted).  The most disappointing part was the crust which was both soggy and flaky in the way a croissant is flaky not the typical tender, flakiness I associate with a pie crust.  Sad to say, I wouldn't go out of my way to try them again.
author: Gelsomina L.

description:
Banana cream pies oh my!

oh so good...yummy yummy pie! Such a great mission, concept, and goodness that I'm sure will be in my dreams tonight! I also fell in love with the craft table in the back to create your own valentines...cuteness all around!
author: Paola W.

description:
Strawberry Rhubarb cannot be beat at Mission Pie. It's been a dream come true having these lovely pie makers buy this dilapidated but gorgeous old Victorian building. They've spent good time (and money) restoring the building. And now, at last, they are in the front space with their new pie shop. It's beautiful. When I admired the huge marble sink in the new space, which looks original, the owner said they had reused scraps of marble from other parts of the building. So clever.

But sorry, back to the pies. Always the freshest ingredients, often from their sister farm. Nothing is too sweet. The crust is reliably light and crisp. Besides Strawberry Rhubarb, we also like the Pear Ginger and straight up Apple. Esther cries for it, she loves it so.
author: Vivian B.

description: Had chicken pot pie. Meh. Not worth $7 but it seemed healtier than comparable pies if that's important.
author: reza n.

description:
I'm not a pie fan but, WOW.  This place is great.

Variety = thumbs up
Taste= MMM good
Social Ethics= Hell yeah!  They have a partnership with Mission HS and a local farm.

I feel like singing the circle of life (while eating pie ofc ourse)
author: R M.

description:
I love the idea of an all pie shop.

I also love the fact that Mission Pie uses all natural ingredients that come from Pie Ranch, owned by graduates of the UC Santa Cruz Farm Apprentice program. They grow all the wheat, berries, and goodness that goes into Mission Pies!

I've had the apple and pumpkin pies here. They're expensive and don't particularly blow my mind, but I like the nice shop and convenient location.

I also dig the communal table, free reading material and wi-fi in the shop. My friend uses it as his office away from home. The wi-fi hasn't worked for me in the past, so I don't go there to work.

Oh, I do remember this time I spent a few hours at Mission Pie transcribing an interview (one of the most tedious things you could do). After a few hours, one of the guys came over and hooked it up with a free slice. Sweet.
author: Valerie L.

description:
Good things:
The cranberry pear pie is soooooo yummy. 
It's a pie shop with good intentions.
Quiches are pretty tasty.

Bad things:
Employees are a bit surly and none too enthused about being there.
Pumpkin pie is bland.
Cash only.

I'm still giving it 4 stars because of the cranberry pear pie.  It is that good.
author: Melanie R.

description: Tasty banana cream in a soft and flaky casing topped with smooth and fluffy cream. Excellent! And one of the best macaroons I have ever had!
author: M A.

description:
I SAID GODDAMN!!  *falls to the floor, crumbs adorning mouth*

...time elapses...

"Hey, what happened to Gabe? Why is he on the floor?"
"Dunno. Why does he have a stupid smile on his face?"
"Why are there crumbs everywhere? Is that a Mission Pie bag?"
"Hey. Looks like he was typing a Yelp review when this happened. What should we do?"
"I don't know...hit the Post button I guess."
author: Gabe M.

description:
Situated comfortably on the corner of 25th and Mission, with windows fronting two sides, Mission Pie is a light-filled, people-watching treasure. They serve up a delicious bottomless cup of coffee. I've eaten slices of their pumpkin and walnut pies, which are heavenly and made from wholesome local ingredients, and also one of their quiches, good too. I like the view into the kitchen, and the art decorating the seating area walls. 
I've also bought jars of honey that come from local folks, and that are very good. On my first visit I was pleased and a little surprised that no music was playing (every cafe seems to have its soundtrack), allowing me the pleasure of a little peaceful introspection.
author: Brian G.

description:
For a reason that would bore everyone, I ran from the Ferry Building to the Mission and I ended at this pie shop.
The guy at the store asked if I was OK.

I like cream pies (so if you are trying to make Marcus Happy, cream pies)
author: Marcus R.

description:
Banana cream pie is still just as good.  But they've remodeled since the last time I was there.. so over a year ago.  now it looks more like a coffee shop and they have a lot more choices.

this time I also tried the pecan or was it walnut pie?  It was damn good. 
Def. coming back again.  Thinking this might be the place to get my thanksgiving pie?
author: AhLin C.

description: Slice of blackberry apple pie. Needed a bit more I don't know texture to the crust. Pie was a bit soggy even though it had a crumble type topping in addition to the crust. Not too sweet which was a plus.
author: Alyssa A.

description: Went with the fam yesterday and fell in love. Ordered multiple slices and sampled them all. The best: a tie between the chicken pot pie and the pear raspberry. Both were yummy and the crust on both were good. The worst: the shaker lemon. It was too tart. Like the selection and hope to go back.
author: Erica S.

description: Yep I am also a banana cream pie lover. The banana cream pie here is delicious. The ratio of banana cream and whipped cream is perfect. Both are not too sweet or overpowering. I was a little sad that the crust was so thin on the bottom however the outer one was great and flaky. Maybe the crusts are thicker on the other pies. I will definitely come back to try out  test this crust theory and their other pies!
author: Jayne A.

description:
One peach blackberry pie.
Eighteen dollars.
Eleven spoons.
Two minutes.
author: Tommy V.

description:
Since I'm orginally from Virginia, I've been searching high and low for some good 'ol sweet potatoe pie.  Glad to say I found it at Mission Pie!  Ordered a slice and after taking one bite, I rushed up to the counter and ordered two mini pies to go for my dear friends Adriana and David who love them some pie too.

Heard about it through Daily Candy.  When I read that the shop is linked with educating local students about food production, I just had to find this place.  Don't cha love it when you can eat yummy pie and do something great for the local community.

BTW, the space is super cute to boot, with pictures of participating students on the wall.  One of the kids in the picture served up my pie and he was just darling.
author: Jennifer H.

description: I had purchased the shaker lemon pie and was not impressed. I shared a slice with my husband but both could not eat it! I could not even think of giving to some or taking it to work. What a shame and loss of $20 dollars. Threw pie in garbage! What ever happened to regular pies!! So very disapointed. Customer service had a lot be desired.  As one yelper said what's the hype!
author: SP G.

description: Mission Pie is awesome!  The sweet and the savory pies are both really tasty.  They also give of a tremendous 'social conscious' vibe to make you feel that eating pie is somehow helping society.
author: Ivan L.

description:
I think the pie here is OK, I really like the pot pies and I LOVE the politics behind this place. The concept is amazing!!  

I wish I could go here more considering it's less than a block from my house. I can no longer take the sour puss faces and the unpleasant service. These people must be the most unhappy folks ever. Who wants to have the energy sucked out of them when all they wanted was a slice of pie and a cup of coffee (especially first thing in the morning). 

C'mon guys lightin up, you could smile, or say hi or show some kind of human like quality.

I guess I'll go back in a few months and see if it's gotten any better!
author: Kara S.

description:
I read the reviews for this place and heard a lot of my friends extoll the virtues of this place as the "best pies in the city." 

With such a buildup, I was expecting to see my dead grandmother propped up in the back baking away.  No such luck.  The pies are good but nothing spectacular.  I tried the sweet potato pie and purchased a small banana cream pie for later.  A good sweet potato pie should be creamy, rich and full of flavor.  It didn't reach that level here.

The banana cream pie was up to my expectations.  I think the homemade crust really stood out on the miniature pie and made it a tasty treat.  

Minus one effing star for bad placement of the address.  If you go looking for the address you won't find it on Mission.  That is because the entrance to Mission Pie is around the corner through a side entrance.  If you are looking for signage, look for a posterboard with handwritten script.  It is easy to overlook.  The quest for the best pie continues.
author: Richard R.

description:
the first time I came here. I decided. I wasn't going to eat one. 

now, mind you, this wasn't bc it was pie. but it was bc I had just got done eating a massive lunch of mexican food and I felt that it was unnatural to mix pie and mexican. 

I mean, you wouldn't mix mexican food with english food, right? its just unheard of.

not too mention, I was looking like Oprah circa 1989 after that meal, but not feeling like her, you know, all rich and creamy and full.

but as I saw my friends buy slices of pie. they brought them to the table.

and a strange attraction had occured. something that hadn't ever hit me before. no woman had ever quite caught my eye like a banana cream pie.

my friend slid a fork over. 

and said, 'just have a bite....'

and I said, 'nah...' but in my mind, it was the most devasting thing I could ever had said, its like turning down sex with a VS model. but I stuck to my guns. 

as I watched them eat and eat, they got to their second slices. and I was asked again.

'Cmon man, have a bite?'

so I just said, slyly, of course, not to make myself eager like a virgin after prom, 'just a bite'

this then turned into, 'eh, you know what? maybe just a sliver?'

'which turned into me playing a game of interference and distraction. until finally, I had ate the slice.

next time, I just ordered two for myself. bc theres nothing like it either.

go ahead, boo me, hiss me bc I had one pie slice too many, but the next I come in, there might not be anything left.

PS: I'm not fat.
author: Derek Alistair J.

description: Eh...it was a bit too bland for me. I LOVE chicken pot pie, and it was very mediocre as well as the quiche.   I do like their sign outside though.  I would say their sweet pies (esp. pecan) are better than the savories.
author: Kris O.

description:
Do you ever think "I feel like a slice of pie, I think I'll go to my local pie shop." Neither did I, till my coworker told me about Mission Pie. 

I went down there on the weekend with my brother who was in town. My brother is a great pie maker. He learned the art from my grandmother and can make a pretty damn amazing pie.

We both got the walnut pie and it was great. Not too sweet it came with freshly whipped cream. Exactly what I want from my local pie shop.
author: Ian M.

description:
I am not as clever as all these other reviewers.  Or as funny.

So, all I have to say is SOOOO GOOOD!

Some day I would like to celebrate Pi Day at Misison Pie
author: laura g.

description: What a sweet little spot to grab a slice of fresh pie, whether it be Banana Cream, Walnut, or Pear & Berry a la Mode.  It feels like you're in someone's living room after dinner, cozying up with some tea and a chat.  LOVE IT!
author: Danielle B.

description:
I've never been that much of a pie person, but this place has overwhelmingly won me over. The mixed berry pie was sweet but not too overpowering... as the person at the counter explained, they usually let the fruit do the talking for itself. The crust was savory and  warm, and lastly but almost my favorite part, was the home made (I believe) whip cream that is intensely different and amazing. 5-stars.

I'd definitely bring friends visiting SF here.
author: Drew L.

description:
It was 9:30 on a Saturday night.  I have never been happier to see a sign for "Walnut Pie."

I've never had Walnut Pie.  I will never go back to Pecan again.  This place makes me happy.  This place makes me think that I may even give in to my fiance's idea to have pie at our wedding instead of cake.  Well, maybe not.  Perhaps at the rehearsal dinner?

Good coffee.  Good vibe.  Great pie.
author: Melissa Q.

description: Great by-the-slice or full pie options.
author: Vicki L.

description:
Actually not a fan of fruit pies.  No hate mails please!  

But the walnut pie was super tasty!  Lot of other places make the mistake of making their pies sugary sweet, but the one I had got the balance of sweet and buttery just right!

Not a fan of paying $3.50 per slice.

Eating this dessert reminded me of "Revenge of the Nerds."  If you're a child of the 80s, you know what I'm talking about...hehe
author: Liezl C.

description:
I got a serious craving for pie the other day and of course had to consult .my Yelp moblie. :)
after figuring out that butter love is a delivery only pie maker and that I can't really eat six whole pies (minimum order)
I headed over to Mission pies :) 
I had three different slices and they were all equally wonderful.
Banana cream friggin just stop it!
Pumpkin ... so fluffy.. so good!
Pear rasberry .. the fruit was nicely slightly undercooked ... making it juicy and crispy oh yum!

After all it's pie .... it has to be good....
author: Jeremy R.

description:
I heart pies. There's something homey and comforting about eating a slice of pie with milk. It's unbridled joy. 

The banana cream is really yummy. We tried the pecan pie and that's worth a shot. The apple/ginger pie was our least fav, but worth the delectable experience.

It's also awesome that they have a sustainable farm a couple hours away. The owner even invited us over for a square dance they're  throwing in October. Not really my thing, but my heart goes out for them and their pies.
author: Karen L.

description:
I went to Mission Pie and all I got were the grumble cakes!

Went here for a friends Birthday brunch.  The bright spot was that the banana cream pie was pretty good.  However.....

The staff was inattentive and seemed unsure of what they were doing.  The Quiche was lukewarm and merely ok , but the real kicker was that they charged 50 cents per plate for the banana cream pie "because we were eating the pie in the store."  I ended up having to quietly  pay 5 bucks for 10 extra plates so my friend could have a good time.  

Overall, disappointed by the lack of customer service and the store policies, I'm sure the pies are all fantastic but I'm not going to go back to find out.
author: Eric L.

description:
I adore pie and can never turn down a slice. So of course, after eating tacos at La Tacqueria, I was thrilled to see that Mission Pie was still open. My friend and I shared a slice of Banana Cream Pie. It was divine. So divine I'll never go back to Nation's for Banana Cream (unless it's in the middle of the night!). The pie -- a paradigm of Americana perfection -- overshadowed the brusque service we received. Subordinate points about Mission Pie's greatness: more-than-decent coffee and the bright airy space of the one time art gallery. 

Tacos + pie + coffee = unlimited combinations of culinary fireworks in my mouth
author: Kari M.

description:
The Atmosphere:
Cozy, strange amalgamation of tables + chairs, some communal, some too small.

The Food:
Banana Cream Pie. Great filling. Not sold on the crust.
Coffee became cold hella quick.
But I was thinking + writing + staring out the window for a while.
I pledge to return once a week to stare + write + think + eat more pie...
I want fruit next time.
author: Eboni H.

description:
First off, I am not a big pie person. I had the occasional forays into Baker's Square when I was in college, but that was it. 

I went there twice, and the last time I went, I noticed that they had a lot of savory pies. I like quiches and stuff--but I had just come from brunch, and we were here for dessert. Maybe next time I'll come back and try them. 

Banana cream was a good pie. The cream was light and fluffy--which was quite unexpected. Also had the strawberry-rhubarb, and peach-something pie. All very good, but I don't tend to like fruit pies all that much. I mean, I used to buy those McDonald's apple pies, and squeeze out all the fruit and eat it just like that. I STILL do that! 

Overall it's a decent place, but (as someone else commented) not mind-blowing though.
author: Mary V.

description:
I have a sweet tooth.

Mission Pie satisfies my addiction.

The only problem is I think I have become a junkie.
author: Patrick B.

description: Awesome food, ambiance and staff, with a purpose. Mission Pie I love you!
author: Luiza L.

description:
I love pies.  I bake pies all the time.  

I expect my pies to be warm.  I understand they were going through renovations but that doesn't excuse cold pies.  ALL my pies have been COLD here.

I came here at 9:30am, and somehow they were out of breakfast pastries.  WTF!!!!

 I have to say that the high schoolers have great service but I'm disappointed by who I'm assuming are the owners who could give a crap about you.  Their lack of friendliness, customer service, acknowledgement of your existence, and overall nonchalant attitude.

I go into the pie shop 3x/week enough to be a regular.  But I have yet to get a smile or even acknowledge that I'm there.  The workers are on the phone, washing dishes, or staring at me blankly without them offering me their assistance.  So sad for a great location but bad service.
author: Nezza F.

description:
They have excellent coffee, with free refills. The pie is amazing! It doesn't hurt that it's a block away from my girlfriends house. Sometimes you might have to get a little cozy and share a table with a stranger, but sometimes, you have the cafe to yourself. I love it here, and I can't wait for them to expand.

I'm pro-organic/sustainable/youth outreach/local farming and everything, but I'd keep coming here if it was Wal-Mart. It's that good. Okay, maybe not Wal-Mart...
author: Phillip M.

description:
Okay I like what they are doing and for the cause behind it all. You guys rock! I am still reading about them in the newspapers of why and how they were started and their mission.
I like the wholeness and the fresh taste that comes with it, as well.
The very first time we went was just after a month of opening. It was a hunt! Down one street then the next, then around the corner...! They were not Kidding about the small space. It was a shoe box of the most wonderful smells! 
Each time I went there, I found some pies were seasonal, with their time and paitence, they explained with pride how they choose to bake. No problem here! As far as I am concerned any problem in life can be cured or the pain diminshed with a slice of their (what i consider to be) perfect pie, and if that doesn't work add some of their fresh whipp cream.
author: e.s.s. A.

description:
Walnut Pie. Yummy. Casual. Organic. Eclectic. 

My husband had the potato tart and he loved it. Loved it enough that he ate the whole slice to himself and didn't over me a taste. I'll take his word for it.

I think I'll make a stop over there tonight for some pie. 

FYI- They don't take debit cards, or credit cards. Cash or Check only.
author: Jenn V.

description:
So I resisted going here for a while because it just scream hipsters and I have escaped one too many narrow collisions with stupid people on fixies to enjoy anything hipster related. 

However my boyfriend and I were apartment hunting in the mission and I was getting very hungry. The kind of hunger that makes other people wonder why your stomach is making so much noise. Long story short he dragged me there.

I had a slice of the asparagus and ham(??) quiche. Once a like salt and pepper were added it was fantastic, tasted exactly how homemade quiche should taste. Nothing like quiche tarts that sit in counter window cases of so many cafes in the City for hours upon hours.

For dessert we had the pear ginger pie! It was delicious! Very gingery and spicy. I loved it!

I shall return for the chicken pot pie and possible a fruit pie slice of some sort.... but I like savory so much more than sweet.
author: Sara K.

description:
Had to update my review to add a fifth star.  I love the newly remodeled cafe - the corner storefront is now the perfect place to sit a people-watch over a slice of pie.  The banana cream is still my favorite, but the peach pie and the fig tart are close seconds.  Also, am currently loving the tomato tart, it makes a great breakfast treat!
Bonus points for carrying local honey.  And by local, I mean SUPER local.  This honey is made by a bee keeper in the Castro.  Very cool.
author: Becca V.

description: It is not all that. Just another place in the mission with snobby, jaded hipsters behind the cash register serving mediocre food.
author: Raquel R.

description: i heard so many wonderful things about mission pie and my son and i were beyond disappointed.  the pies were literally terrible- the apple pie had raw apples in it and was basically crust with 3 apples, the berry pie was a big lump of nothing and even worse was the tomato/arugula quiche; it was all eggs, like an egg pie.  very disappointed.
author: Samantha B.

description: Decent pie - fruit pies are a bit tart for my taste.  I wish they made chocolate pies . . .  Nice touch that they gave out free scones at the end of the night.
author: B. Y.

description:
I feel like Mission Pie is full of mixed messages:

- Your mixed berry is delicious, but you need to offer more varieties of pie. If you only do one thing, give me more than four options.
- Your shop is so lovely and calm (love the pew seating option), but I can't stay for long if there's any sun as it gets boiling in there! Maybe I should stop drinking coffee with my pie, or well, maybe you could put in a fan or two?
- Speaking of coffee, you offer free refills (yay!), but either one of the canisters is empty or you're out of sugar. More, please?
- Your whole pies are expensive, so why are you cash only?

Kthxbai,
-Carla
author: Carla C.

description: I've never been to the actual Mission Pies location yet, but I got to try it through LuckyBolt yesterday. I had the vegetarian pot pie with side salad, which was on the 7x7 list of places to go in the mission for under $10 or something like that. Since it came with a side salad, I was expecting something small, but no, it was big for a lunch! It's the same personal pie size as the Whole Food pot pies they sell (which are still my personal fav).  Like many SF places, this uses food fresh from the farms, and their bakery is green certified. The crust was some sort of soft, sweet, whole wheat sort of thing, and inside was full of a bunch of different veggies. The sauce wasn't your typical white cream sauce, and it had spinach and I don't even know what in there. Stuff that's in season. I love that. It was really tasty, and the only thing that kept it from being my fav veggie pot pie is that I don't have a sweet tooth and it was a bit sweet for me. The salad it came with was a side of cole slaw or rice salad. I chose the rice and I was STUFFED after my pie, so I ate the rice with dinner. YUM! Short grained chewy rice with greens, maybe kale? Lightly seasoned. Great. I for sure will be stopping by the actual bakery one day to try out one of their dessert pies, or maybe a quiche!
author: Merredith L.

description: In a post-cupcake meltdown world, give me pie!  Pie that isn't cloying.  Crust that's crisp.  It's perfect, whatever the flavor.  A go-to for potlucks when you can't bother to hunt down your rolling pin.
author: K W.

description:
I read about this place at another bakery out in Glen Park, Destination Bakery.  Apparently the head baker is also in charge of this wonderful, heartwarming project which gives the youth at Mission High a little taste of real world work potential.  I was on my way to pick up an order of tacos from La Taqueria, but couldn't resist, especially when I saw they had banana cream pie, my husband's fave.  He loved his mini pie, as did I my strawberry crostata.  Tacos and pie might sound like a bit much, but instantly supplanted my childhood ritual of picking up some cookies from Dianda as a post-taco indulgence.

Love it.  Will be back.
author: Teal H.

description:
Two words:

Banana. Cream.

Obviously, there are a million other wonderful things about this place, but their banana cream pie on top of the whole "good cause" makes this girl feel like she's gonna banana cream her panties.
author: Melanee N.

description:
In Mexico City it is common to break in the afternoon for coffee and a slice of pie. The best pecan pie I have ever eaten was in Mexico City. Mission Pie is a natural fit in the neighborhood. 

The key to a great pie is a great crust. It must be flaky and tender both at the same time. The folks at Mission Pie have nailed the crust. I have tried the pear ginger and their apple and both are just great, sweet but not sugary, you get the full flavor of the fruit. The fresh whip cream is an excellent counter point.
author: Seamus M.

description:
Stopped by this marvelous Mission Dessert locale the other night on the way to a dinner party at a friend's home. Decided to get a couple of their walnut tartlettes and a slice of their delicious banana creme pie. What a treat to be able to find such a great business that serves great desserts. My understanding is that local high school kids work here in order to help them learn business skills. Impressive!

The desserts, but the way were excellent, with perfect crust and just the right about of creme and bananas with the pie.
author: David G.

description: Tasty enough banana cream pie. Dig the ambience, what with it's mellow pie shop vibe. It's just, the pie didn't blow my mind, or anything. I'll probably try some other flavors, for sure, but this isn't something that will keep me awake at night with unmet cravings.
author: Genevieve S.

description:
Spent $16 on 2 pies and we were left hungry - not much chicken in the chicken pot pie, and the filling was nothing special. Stick to the sweet pies. 
The place was full of people just camped out for the night so there was nowhere to sit, thus we got to experience the cast iron window seats which were colder than cream and had an interesting mound on which to rest ones meat and veg.
author: Chris W.

description:
How can a place this cool really exist? A friend that recently moved to SoCal was back in town for the weekend. We wanted a place to sit and chat before heading out and, since I had heard about Mission Pie/Pie Farm's, well, mission of teaching kids about farming and the environment, I thought that this place would be a good spot, even though I thought I didn't like pie (seems I was wrong).

We walked in and were welcomed by a friendly staff (and friendly patrons, happy to offer up a suggestion when they heard us trying to decide what to order). We ended up going with a slice of banana cream pie and a strawberry galette. Both were delicious. 

The cafe is tiny and simple (they will be moving into a new space soon). As far as I am concerned, they need not change a thing. I loved it. 

At one point, the guy who suggested the banana creme pie asked me what I thought of it and I actually said, "It tastes like my childhood." What!?!?!?!? I promise that I am not normally that cheesy. Something just comes over you at this place. I don't know if it is the fact that you can see pictures of the adorable kids behind the counter working on the farm, the fact that some of my favorite books are on the bookshelf, or just that the pies are so delicious. Still, I am not complaining, just looking for an excuse to go back (even if I do find myself saying something else embarrassing).
author: Nata B.

description:
so i go here every day. yep. i said every day. for a while, i was eating pie here every day, but that's a whole nother story that you will most likely see on "the biggest loser" or "dance your ass off" one day on reality tv, i hope. 

so about a year ago i decided to limit myself to just walking in, buying some single-source Goat Rock Blend coffee, saying hello to the pies, and walking out. i DO get to eat a piece of pie once a week, but i'm allowed to wave to the pies every day. 

thats how good this place is.

but not only do i go in every day, i also make every first date i have meet me here for coffee. lol. 

i make every person from out of town meet me here and buy me a pie.

i make every friend's friends from out of town meet them here for pie.

do you see a trend here?

AND, one time a company name ooVoo (yeah, i'm not making that up) asked me to do a promo for them (u know, i'm a micro celebrity) and they said they would donate $1500 to my favorite cause. so i did the promo and donated the $1500 to pieranch! that's where all the organic stuff is grown for mission pie and where the kids from mission high school go and learn about real food.

what more do u need to know. go eat a pie.
author: irina s.

description:
I love pies to the extent that if I ever get married, there will be no wedding cake, there'll be wedding pie. So imagine my excitement when I heard about Mission Pie. Pooping my pants just doesn't cut it here.

The pies are fresh, uses great ingredients and most importantly, YUMMY. 

There's also the added benefit of the teenagers from Mission High playing TI or Young Jeezy in the background. Sweet.
author: Jackie I.

description:
I totally understand how people miss this place all the time. There's no sign out front, besides the "EAT PIE" signage on the side of the cafe on 25th. But if you can't find it the first time, try harder! This place is good! 
Their ingredients freshly grown and they always have a good variety of pie flavors  to choose from. My favorite is their strawberry rhubarb. It's about $5 for a slice and I believe $25 for an entire pie. Go for the whole thing! They also serve coffee too.
author: Pet O.

description: I get the high end high quality food part of the business. They obviously put a lot of care into their food. But what I don't get is a pie crust that is 2/3 whole wheat. Duh - of course it is going to be leathery and wooden tasting. It's one thing to add a little flours of an exotic nature to your white flour base to make the crust interesting. But to overwhelm the dough with whole wheat, fail. You might as well add marmite to the mix. Hello, I don't eat pie as a primary food group, so I don't need to have it be super healthy.
author: jim m.

description: The Banana Cream Pie, and the Lemon Rind pie. No words can describe.
author: Cherish P.

description:
This is the closest coffee shop to my apartment, and I think it's great they are moving in to the larger Southern Exposure space in a few months.

I think the pie is decent, and I love the savory scones, but I wouldn't suggest getting espresso drinks here.

I don't think the beans or roasting are bad, it's just that the training should probably be better. I've been served lukewarm lattes several times, scalded milk others. Sometimes the amount of espresso that is put into the drink varies, etc. 

I should mention that most of the senior staff know their way around an espresso machine, but if a newer employee is also working, they will probably be the ones to make your drink while the more knowledgeable Batista's cut your pie slice.

They do offer ice coffee now, so that's a safe bet, but if you ask for an ice latte you may just get a blank look. An iced latte is espresso, milk and ice. If you have those 3 things then you can make an iced latte.

At first, their pies didn't really hit the spot. If I wanted apple pie, the closest thing they had was pear, if I wanted pecan pie, they had walnut. The pies are really good though, just not the flavors I find myself craving.

I keep hoping I can get a decent cup of coffee here since it's so close, but it's often just a waste of money. If you want great espresso drinks walk to Ritual. If you want really great service there's Nervous Dog. If you want a good slice of Walnut Pie, Mission Pie is your best bet.
author: Doc P.

description:
This place is orgasmic! Their crust is wonderfully flakey and made with whole wheat flour adding a nice toothy texture. I sometimes stop for pie for breakfast on the way to work - what a great way to start the day. Their peach and their banana creme pies are the best i've ever had! The banana creme is made with vanilla bean, and the peach has a perfect consistency, not runny or to gelatinous. Recently had a slice of white peach and olallieberry pie. Ohhh.. and all of their pies are organic.

The other great thing about this place is their mission - they have teamed with local high school students who contribute to the baking of the pies and also visit the ranch to learn about sustainable agriculture. 

If I could I would give this place 6 stars!
author: Suzi S.

description: The best banana cream pie ever!  A great neighborhood bakery and cafe that also does a lot of good, working directly with local farmers and providing work opportunities for clients of local non profits.
author: marcie v.

description: Alabama and Clarence would have loved to talk about the Sonny Chiba triple feature over some banana creme pie!
author: Wakako U.

description: It's just so damned PLEASANT in here. Friendly folks behind the counter, lovely light, big ol' table, and then the banana cream pie? Let's just say you'd ASK someone to throw a pie at your face if it was this one. Yumyumyum!
author: Vandana M.

description:
I am not a pie fanatic, and generally not a big dessert person, but their walnut pie is fracking good.  Having pretty middle American preferences where pie is concerned, I wish they had a better selection of more common pies to balance their rhubarb, peach-raspberry, and pear & ginger pies but, hey, that's just me not wanting to try new shit.

The slices are a little bit on the small side, and their "savory" pie slices are a bit on the costly side ($4.50), but there were enough other things that were good about Mission Pie that those shortcomings could be forgiven.  We went there on a Monday evening, when they have live music; the group was a funky mix of a fiddler, clarinetist, bass player, and someone playing a small unidentifiable stringed instrument that looked for all the world to be homemade, down to the pickup running to the amp.  The singing was out of key and barely audible, but it was all homey and perfect.  Couldn't think of any better music to eat pie by.
author: moosedog i.

description:
It's so rare that a mission and product come together into a beautiful whole.

Mission Pie is supplied by their very own pie-slice-shaped Pie Ranch and runs an urban outreach program to youth that involves them in the organic food process in order to educate them (and thus, their families) about sustainable and healthy eating.

They carry a range of seasonal pies with the banana cream pie being a regular and favorite. It is so much better than other banana cream pies I've had that are mostly cream. This one has a wonderful custardy, banany, creamy balance and fullness to each bite.

We've also tried the walnut, strawberry rhubarb, pear, frangipane berry, and peach pies all of which are lovely, especially toasted with a dash of homemade whipped cream on the side! 

I wasn't too keen on the lemon pie and haven't had a chance to try their savories. I love that their clientele morphs slowly from students and moms with their kids in tow during the day to hipsters at night, but pie-lovers all. 

The staff is friendly, the coffee delicious, they showcase local produce, and there's nothing quite like reading the paper with the sunlight streaming in, savoring one's fresh, warm slice of pie.
author: Sharand N.

description: Super cute, bright, sunny, cheerful place!  And though they didn't have key lime that day ( which would have made my entire sf trip), they did have awesome banana cream pie. Wow.  The hot chocolate wasn't chocolately enough, though. Seemed more like steamed milk than anything.
author: S M.

description: It's kinda disappointed after trying out two pies from them after all these good reviews.  I had high hope on their pies.  I got two pies from them, the banana cream and a vegan peach pie.  Banana Cream tasted regular to me.  Crust didn't taste buttery enough and texture just like a regular pie crust.  The upside is that it's not too sweet.  The vegan pie is more of a surprise compared other vegan pies.  They did a good job on the crust, making it tasted crunchy and not too dry even without butter.  It smelled like a real buttery crust, too.  The inside of the pie was full of fresh peaches and they were fresh and juicy.  And again, it's not too sweet.  But still, it wasn't as good as enough to make me go back for their other pies.
author: Charcoal B.

description: The only good thing I can say about this place is that it has a beautiful location. If I lived in the neighborhood, I would probably want to go here just to hang out. As it was, we were just passing through and grabbed a few of their vegan items to go. We tried the carrot muffin that was just so-so, the apricot pie that was bordering on being good, and the lentil pot pie that was terrible. I hate to give a bad review to any place that attempts to serve vegan food, but their attempt was just sad. The pot pie in particular had a crust that was so undercooked in the middle, it made me gag.
author: Marie D.

description:
aw man I thought I was going to get to create the listing for this place! They also have SAVORY pies, so if you are running late and need a perfectly lunch-sized nosh, hit them up for a chicken-curry or rosemary-beef pie. I eat them cold, though you are supposed to warm them up -- whatever, I'm in a hurry! 

THUMBS UP. My new favorite neighborhood haunt.
author: Amy K.

description: These days I measure most places by whether or not they live up to the hype. And in my book, Mission Pie is one place that doesn't live up to the Hype. I think Mission Pie has an unfair factor playing into the hype equation though that inflates its buzz... it's for a good cause. Taste-wise it's just ok. I've had better. But you still feel satisfied when you leave and know your hard earned dollars are going to a happy place, so I'm "a-ok" (aka 3 stars) with that.
author: Shoshana D.

description:
Yes, the banana cream pie is out of this world...and this is coming from someone who usually hates banana-anything. The first time I had it...MMMM....i couldn't stop thinking about it for days.

But, I have to subtract a star. Why? Because the first time around, (a couple of months ago) they had "mini" banana cream pies, $5 each. It was perfect - I shared it with my girlfriend and we were in pie crust heaven...everything about that mini-pie was perfect and I made a promise to myself that the next time, we'd get our own mini pies - yes, it is that good. A perfect dessert for two. 

To my disappointment, however, the next time we went (about 2 weeks ago) they no longer had the mini pies! We had to buy 2 small slices...at $3.50 each. A lot less pie. A lot less joy. 

BRING BACK THE MINI-PIE.
author: Dora A.

description: The idea of a pie shop in the Mission was more than I could handle.  In a good way.  Yet, the reality was pretty bland.  I got a slice of apple pie.  The crust was nice and I loved the addition of homemade whipped cream on top.  However, the interior of the pie was extremely watery.  I have had my fair share of apple pie and this just didn't cut it.  I would rather get some from the grocery store.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
This is the kind of place I'd give points to for do-goodery but I don't even have to because the pies are so amazing. 

I used to think I didn't like sweet potato pie. "I'm a pumpkin pie person," I explained, "and sweet potato always seems to, well, not be pumpkin." But with 5 of us at Mission Pie tonight, we sampled strawberry rhubarb, walnut, apricot, and, even, sweet potato pie. 

Sometimes god gives you a second chance. My first bite of sweet potato pie at Mission Pie made me realize that other potato pies I've experienced have all been drag pumpkin pies. But this sweet potato pie knew who it was -- knew its flavors and the spices that were right for *it* -- and it sang the most beautiful aria of sweet potato flavor. 

Similarly, the strawberry rhubarb was epic deliciousness. Chunky, tart, and fruity with a light and flaky crusts. 

Extra points for letting us sit and finish our pies and teas as they swept the store and put up chairs around us. And even more extra points for supporting community students, helping put on the community dialog event on June 9, and being responsible stewards of the earth.
author: Lilly I.

description: Amazing Apple Pie,  tasty and different Meyer Lemon pie, and always something with pears.  I love these pies!  And the staff is really friendly.  They have good coffee to boot!  I have a new pie slice every time I'm in the area.
author: Natalie Y.

description: I am always happy I came here. It could be because of the healthy, interesting salads, it could be because the potato leek tart is always delicious, it could be because I don't know that I've ever had a better banana creme pie, it could be because my wallet is always like - we just had dinner? I can't believe it, I am so full! Regardless, a winner everytime.
author: Ara S.

description: Mission Pie mixed berry pie... get in my mouth!!! You are so delicious!! The crust is the epitome of flaky deliciousness and the crumbles covering the top of the pie are the perfect topping to the fresh, sweet, fruity insides. Hands down best pie ever.
author: Kelly N.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!! 

I am so happy that they were able to expand into the new space, which is absolutely beautiful. The new space is totally inviting, airy, and welcome hours of eating, drinking, reading, and people watching. 

Of course, their pies are amazing (had the plum tangerine last night) but the coffee is very good as well. 

Their mission is so amazing and they have the most friendly and delightful staff who obviously cares not only about coffee and pie, but also about community and education. I have half a mine to quit my job and seek employment there :)

Thanks Mission Pie for creating an awesome product, and awesome business model, and an awesome space in our neighborhood.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
I love pie. I really do. I used to eat a pie every week, without fail.

That said, I'm saddened by my trip to Mission Pie. I thought we could form a loving relationship and turn me into a fatty that knows not when to stop digging into pie. 

Instead I found myself getting a single slice of the one pie they had left and a nice little galette. The banana cream pie was ok, but nothing special. The strawberry galette on the other hand was 92% mediocre crust, 8% tasty strawberry. It was over priced and under-delicious. Oh, and cash only? If I had bought a whole pie to take home (as anticipated) then my tab would have been a healthy number I'm sure.

I feel like I need to come back again with hopes to score another pie flavor -- perhaps they will have more than a single pie left.
author: Dave B.

description: Saw this on TV recently and just came from Tommy's disappointed. So happy to end my day at Mission Pie. Not fancy by any means but decent pies, we had Banana Cream & Peach (a la mode, YUM) pies, coffee and a mocha. My only complaint here was my mocha didn't come out until the ies were almost all eaten and when it did they serve it in a cute little GLASS. Yes, a glass. It was so freaking hot, with no handle to pick it up by, it burned my hand. Really inappropriate way to serve a boiling hot beverage. However, when it did cool down enough to drink, it was enjoyable. It was quiet, not crowded and very cozy. Definetly would go here again. A very pleasant experience for all ages; my 67 year old mother-in-law, 65 yr old father-in-law, husband 46, and even our 13 yr old daughter. Give it a try if you're in the area.
author: Trish T.

description: pies are so good here that they are just too busy. hipster-dufus activity ensures entertainment. pies are on the pricy side. but it's a good place to pick up a pie on your way to a meetup.
author: Steve F.

description:
A little story about Mission Pie:

A couple friends and I went at closing time, and they let us pick up some pies to go. We ordered a mixed berry (delicious and sweet), a nectarine/blackberry (juicy and tart), and an apricot/almond paste (a bit dry, but still good). We also ordered a walnut tartlet that we would eat later. After we arrived home, we found VEGETABLES in the box where the tartlet was supposed to be. VEGETABLES. We're talking green beans, red-skin potatoes, and a shallot in a lot of olive oil! THAT IS NOT THE DESSERT I ORDERED. VEGETABLES VEGETABLES VEGETABLES.

So while the pies were delicious, we got vegetables instead of a tartlet. Were they trying to tell us to eat less pie, or something?
author: Camila F.

description:
A small store in the Mission that offers fresh, locally sourced pie. I've had the apple pie and the rhubarb - both delicious  like grandma would have made. Buying a store bought apple pie - Safeway, Andronico's, Whole Foods etc will never compare to the freshness and flakiness of a Mission Pie.

The space was a bit small but cute. I think that they hire local students as employees, which is a terrific idea.

I also hear that the pies are not baked on the premises as they do not have the space, but they are made at Destination Bakery on Chenery.
author: Spoon G.

description: Such a treat to find well made flavorful savory pies!  Tried this place on a whim and it is now high on my list of  must-return-to places.
author: Ash A.

description:
sigh....their banana creme pie recipe changed, SAD this was my favorite!!  The good news is that they took out the corn syrup...the bad news is
it now tastes little to jello-y for me taste:(  I still love this place but my favorite pie has changed.  Go for the mixed berry.  It is mind blowing!!!
author: R L.

description: Being a person who worships at the altar of pie pans, I'd love to give Mission Pie a full on 5 stars, but realistically it's subjective to what you order.  The banana cream pie is consistently good. The seasonal pear raspberry is even better!!  But then they have tarts that have a massive amount of crust, which is unfortunately flavorless.  My mom made pie crust out of lard, which makes the flakiest, lightest, most flavorful crusts ever. I wish it was the same here but i understand the clientele, I guess. Anywho, the coffee is YUMMY and it's a really great place to hang out and eat pie!!
author: B B.

description: Mission pie has NO PIE.  8pm we drive across the city and look for parking all eared up for oh so yummy pie and un one slice left of one pie and one mini ditch pie.  Ugh.  We ask for a repeat of the two options and they are repeated to us like we are mentally disabled morons who are wasting the servers time and I can't imagine why since you have no pie to serve.  Oh wait you make the pies on site - make some pie lady.  Anyway, seriously, no pie?!
author: Casey J.

description:
Pie is my favorite food.  I love pie.  I did not love this pie. 

I had the Shaker lemon.  Husband had the pear-ginger. Both were fine.  Crust not particularly flaky, but not hard either.  Fillings were acceptable but not "Wow".  

I grew up in Sonoma County so I know a thing or two about organic hippie coffee shop pie.   I was hoping for something more complex, exciting, and delicious than average hippie pie.  If you have PIE in the name of your store, you should try an' kick it up a notch, piewise.

If I was getting coffee anyway, I might go for a slice of pie, but I wouldn't go out of my way for Mission Pie.
author: Miss Information X.

description:
I recently went back to Mission Pie with my parents. One again the mixed berry pie was incredible, but what changed my rating of 4 stars to a new one of 5 is the banana cream pie.

Seriously, it is the closest to bliss you're likely to get. The horrible parking be damned, I would walk on hot coals for the Banana cream pie!
author: Lin B.

description:
I like pahh.

especially banana cream pie. 

the apple pie was good. the pear/raspberry pie had a delightful crumb topping.
I really wish I'd tried the sweet potato pie. And I can't wait until summer berry pies.
And sure, it's a big bonus that you can feel good about eating pie.
author: Margie L.

description:
Not quite on Mission st, this took me a minute to figure out (on 25th, south of Mission), the place needs a better sign

Cute place (well during the day), Ann L. told me to go and I listen to her. 

Great
- banana cream pie
- walnut
- espresso, $1.50
- strawberry galette was pretty good, solid though whipped cream put it over the edge, $3.80


To try: sweet potato?

Cash only


I loved this place, I really did. I've gone there like 5-6 times, it's just a cool spot. My last trip there I found a hair baked into my pie. The young staff didn't really know what to do with this discovery.. yeah I dunno, that ain't fly at all. I is sad
author: xo x.

description: Forget the sweet pies, go for the savory! Braised fennel or zuccini/feta....tough choice to make so get both. I bought the smaller version ones that are perfect for lunch and took them to share with some friends. Hands down, the best pies ever and we are all connoisseurs of all things homemade, delightful and well-made! The crust is pretty flaky, maybe a little too thick at times but still to know that they made it from scratch, to me is perfect! Great bakery with a homey atmosphere that makes you just want to hang out there all day ......and their book shelf has a bunch of great cookbooks that you can browse at if you do choose to do so!
author: P G.

description:
Finally got here after a long time coming.
The guy behind the counter could not have been older than 17 but he was a light of sunshine.  Wonderful warm smile and actually wanted to answer my questions.  I asked him what his favorite pie was and he told me the Mixed Berry....Sold!
I then ordered an Iced Coffee and asked for whip on top of my pie.  I noticed it was definitely homemade and perfectly whipped to just under peaks with a touch of vanilla.  Excellent.  The pie was perfect!  Quality fruit with just the right amount of sugar and the Pie crust was flaky and wonderful.
I am so lucky my Sig. Other's friends all live in the Mission.  Now I know where to go to get dessert for dinner parties....Cha-Ching!
author: Sheila Y.

description: I never liked banana cream pie until I tasted Mission Pies BCP.  Unfortunately, I haven't really tried any of their other pies because I love the BCP so much!
author: Deb J.

description:
Pie + a good cause = absolutely no guilt.

Excellent banana cream, as others have said here...
author: Beth T.

description:
These pies aren't going to dazzle you with their looks.
But the problem is, their personality ain't gonna knock your socks off, either.  

However, these folks are politically righteous, and they grow most of their own ingredients, including organic apples for seasonal pies. 

I plan on going back, because I want to  believe. But so far it's been pie in the sky for me at this joint.
author: Kathleen G.

description:
Nice ambience with good pie - we had the plum frangipani, pumpkin pie, and apple pie...

All were tasty without being overly sweet - the biggest plus!

Plus, the guys behind the counter are accomodating without any attitude(we wanted the apple pie warmed and whipped cream only with the pumpkin pie)...yum!
author: Ching-Pei H.

description: We had banana cream and pecan.  It was ok.  Good for SF.  But We lived in South so not as good as there but people were very nice  Maybe try again to see if we like pie better.
author: John K.

description: A friend recommended a banana pie from here that we had at a party and it was great.  Decided to stop by Mission Pie to pick one up and glad I did.  The entire pie was about $20 but was well worth it, since it was very good.  They have plenty of various pies, but I recommend the banana cream pie.
author: Ronald L.

description: YUM! I'm going to lay my cards on the table-I would take cake over pie any day of the week...but, the walnut pie here is scrumptious. Everything is so fresh and yummy. We got our pie to go (and it was late, which led the very nice man behind the counter to serve us an extra large slice), but the atmosphere is really great - a few groups of friends ending their Friday night with pie and coffee at the tables. So close to bart, which I love. Whenever I am in the neighborhood-I'm stopping by for pie.
author: J E.

description:
The only thing that bothers me about Mission Pie is its price. Maybe if a slice were $3, I could justify my purchases there a little better. 

I have never been a really big fan of banana creme pie. I hate extremely sweet banana cream; moreover, I think whipped cream is really disgusting. And then I tried Mission Pie's banana creme.

It was AMAZING. It wasn't really that sweet, and the chunks of banana were like little delicious treats inside each bite. 

I had the pear-cranberry as well which was also good, but too autumny for a spring day. 

I also love how the kitchen looks so clean!
author: stacy c.

description:
We just served Mission Pie at our wedding, and it was amazing!  We had a selection of Mixed Berry, Peach/Blackberry, Vegan Ginger/Asian Pear, and Plum Frangiapane, and all of them went like gangbusters. The pies also kept very well being transported in the back of a car from SF to Healdsburg on a hot day. 

The staff at Mission Pie were extremely helpful and accommodating. They even got together a little gift box of some of the non-pie items they sell there as a thank you. And the best thing was that they didn't up-charge us because it was a wedding. 

Thank you Mission Pie!!!
author: Kier V.

description:
Pie, Saturday night
Tart apples in flaky crust
Love forevermore
author: Tracy R.

description:
Funo and I were driving through the Mission on our way to La Palma for some hand made tortillas.  I was complaining about changes in my metabolism.  "You know I had the abs of a 20 year old until I was 34.  
But now I'm 35 and something's changed.  It's like SNAP I can't eat whatever the F I want and still have a six pack anymore."

"Well you look good," Funo replied lovingly and appropriately, "but it's hard to be a foodie AND have six pack abs.  Maybe you could try to show more discipline about avoiding dessert."

"What? STOP THE CAR!"  I had seen a discreet little sign out of the corner of my eye.  "Mission Pie," it said.  Mission Pie?  I've never heard of that!  

Mission Pie has been open since January, the ghettofab counter lad told me.  They are a retail extension of the non profit Pie Ranch Rural Center for Urban Renewal.  I don't know what that means, but I figured it has something to do with growing sustainable produce and Mission High School students.  Well that's a worthwhile enough cause for me so you are damn right I'm ordering the banana cream pie.  The pie filling was creamy and light and probably not sustainably grown in the bay area.  But it was yummy.  The crust was okay.  I thought it was a little chewy rather than flaky, but Funster says he likes it that way.  And seeing Funo happy and enjoying the banana cream filling makes me realize that a six pack ain't so important.  

At least not until Gay Pride.

I'm such a shallow bitch.
author: wineporn S.

description: Worst ever pie!! I hate to give a place a bad review, but after two tries this is what I have to say. Not only is the pie the worst I have ever had-safeway has better-but while looking at the counter we were actually harassed by the staff. My husband had unknowingly pick a vegan option-which I know he wouldn't enjoy-so I pointed that out to him and from no where this woman who appeared to be the baker said to us with much attitude "Just because it's vegan, doesn't mean it's not good" Really lady? How about you let the customer decide what I'd like to eat. Unbelievable.
author: Shaleen C.

description: Amazing pie had to listen to a twit ream out the cashier because he did not want to pay per slice for him and his friends he wanted to pay for the whole pie. it would have saved him a dollar. I told him he was rude and he swore at me. This place is a gem i feel sorry for the staff if those are the over entitled people they deal with regularly if your in the mission check it out.
author: tahlia b.

description:
There's something awesome about a place that does one thing and one thing only...

...and nails it.

I'd say "awesome" a few more times, but my Mom taught me not to talk with my mouth full of pie.
author: Anthony T.

description:
Mmmmm...pie.
Cute space, good coffee, great pie.  Answers the question, is there anywhere around here where we can just get dessert?
author: Jen S.

description:
Met up with a few folks this evening for a meeting over pie and coffee. I got a slice of the plum galette, which the staff said was new on the menu and no one had tried. I took one tiny nibble and blurted out, "Oh my GOD,"  which pretty much stopped the serious political wonkage around the table. I mean, I felt my pupils dilate. 

I also tried a bite of someone's berry tart and someone else's strawberry rhubarb pie, and both were lovely. Now I need to go back and try that banana cream pie everyone's talking about. One of those teeny pies seems just about right for a single serving...
author: Fawn F.

description:
This place is good, I like the walnut pie.  It tastes like pecan, but it's made out of... walnuts.  I know, weird, right?  

And there's some good cause associated with it, I can't remember what.
author: Mike H.

description:
I could repeat all the great comments, but don't really need to.  Let's just put it this way- at the office, the gal who always passes on dessert took one look, then one bite of the banana cream, walked over to the box and walked away with the whole pie!  She left money on my desk afterwards in the empty tin and a smiley face on a post-it note.  Plus, they are non-profit, so you are improving the world as you improve your waist line.

On the whole accessible issue, you can't get up their little steps, but they will sell out their window on the street.
author: tiffany m.

description: I am a fan of galettes and theirs are my favorite.  Seasonal fruit that melts in the mouth and just enough crunch in the crust.
author: Patrick H.

description: Pie here is OK. My boyfriend absolutely loves this place but he loves pie. I guess it's not necessarily fair to rate Mission Pie if I'm just OK about pie but nonetheless I feel the pies could be flakier. There is a pretty big selection of pie. I also am pretty sure my pies at home could stand up to these. Gotta hand it to them for the concept and there just aren't a lot of good dessert places in this area. Fruit pies could have more fruit. Um, coffee is good though. They have decaf coffee at night so props for that. Oh, and no ala mode pie! :( Wha?
author: Kristin S.

description: Since this was my first time there I can't give it all the stars just yet also because I was in and out of this place and only got one thing. I took home a slice of their banana cream pie (I'm a sucker for it).  I would have to say that it was good in that it wasn't too sweet....But...that was about it. I didn't shout to the heavens but I didn't want to throw it up either. It was about even. Will I go back? Sure. The other items sweet and savory looked good...hopefully, I'll find that something that will make me want to shout to the heavens....
author: Mel P.

description:
If you like pie, especially vegan pie (as that's the only kind I've tried) there is nothing not to like about Mission Pie. The staff are always cheerful and friendly, the coffee is good (one free refill), and I have never been disappointed by the pie itself. With so many vegan treats tempting me from every corner in the Mission, Mission Pie is the most guilt-free, as their ingredients emphasize local (i.e. seasonal) and organic..and of course, fruit, as opposed to shortening.  There is also a wide selection of foods, not just sweet pies, but savory ones, as well as other baked goods, and sometimes a salad.

The atmosphere is also quite pleasant, with ample seating and reading material.

If I had to think of one complaint, it's that their vegan pies tend towards the tree fruits as opposed to the berry, even when the season is right...I would love to see a vegan berry pie, but I'm guessing there's a good reason why a vegan berry pie is harder to pull off than apricot or nectarine. Or maybe they are just trying to keep things simple by sticking to certain fillings for vegan/ non-vegan. Hard to complain too much, in any case.
author: Tamara F.

description: My Bf's dad loves apple pie over cake. So naturally for his birthday I yelped apple pie. Ding! Mission Pie came up. I called to let them know ahead of time that I was on my way to pick up the pie. I arrived to a nice clean cafe in the Mission. The place felt a little out of place in comparison to the rest of the shops nearby.
