(in a good way) Everyone was inside enjoying the nice atmosphere and keeping warm, since it was pretty chilly outside. Anyways the nice cashier rang me up and I was out of there in like 5 minutes. My bf's dad liked it, but was not his favorite apple pie. I thought it could be sweeter, but that is probably because I like really sweet desserts. I wouldn't mind coming back and checking out what other tasty desserts they have waiting for me.
author: Stephanie L.

description: This has become a weekly stop.... sweet & savory pies, made fresh daily with new pies every time... The Chicken Pot Pie is always a must...  Goat Rock Roast coffee here is also a favorite...  The best part is coming with a friend, ordering 3-4 different pies, sharing, and just chatting for hours in their casual but cozy location...
author: Cathy F.

description: Their banana cream pie literally calls to me as I am walking home from the BART. I love the social consciousness of their business plan and the atmosphere in general. It's a wonderful place to run into neighbors, study, have a cup of tea and eat amazing, fresh, organic pie! So happy this slice of Heaven exists near my home!
author: Tracy B.

description: After hearing about Mission Pie for years, we finally stopped by last night for dessert.  Although the quality of the ingredients is obviously high, the end result was disappointing.  The mixed berry pie was too sweet, and crust on all of our selections was too thick and dense for our palate...the crust almost flew off the table when we tried cutting through it with the knife!  There are a lot better places for pie here in the Mission.  The place was packed, however, so there are obviously a lot of people who love this place!
author: Rachele F.

description: The pie here is delicious and the staff was helpful. Seemed like quite a popular place. Can't wait to go back!
author: O'Brien J.

description:
The last time I was in here, the place was literally yay big :::stretches arms out not so wide::: I was impressed not only with the quality of the pies, but the social and sustainable aspect of the business. 

Came in here today and the place is huge now and the selection of pie has blossomed into several varieties. I picked up the cranberry apple pie and am stuffing my face with it as we speak (or I guess in this case, type) and let me tell you that it has the perfect buttery but substantial crust with delectable chunky fruit filling and the most heavenly cobbler crumble topping I've ever tasted in my life. Everything necessary for it to join the upper echelons of pie-dom. 

It's the new year and myself, like 99.9% of the population, had resolved to lose weight.  Now, I say resolutions be damned! With sweet treats like this in the city, I don't care if I have to wear huge sweatpants and oversized tee shirts for the rest of my life to accommodate the extra chunk that I will certainly gain from eating this stuff on a now regular basis.
author: Clarissa S.

description: My girlfriend and I were wandering around the Mission looking for a good place to get some Sunday morning brunch. Neither of us really wanted to wait in a line, so we came to Mission Pie for quiche. She got a cheese and asparagus quiche and I got a pork pot pie. The quiche was rich, creamy, and delicious. The pork pot pie had a nice savory flavor with nice bit hunks of meat. It was a good experience all around and I definitely want to come back for some dessert.
author: Jeremy J.

description: great place to have enjoy the end of a date ... its fun to share some pie and ice cream while sitting near the window and watching people walk up and down mission (plus they have a magnet board and alphabet letters that are fun to play with)
author: Micah W.

description: Awesome banana cream pie!!! Almost as good as Tartine
author: chad H.

description:
Bethany and I stumbled over here sleep-deprived this morning and gorged ourselves on perfect apple pie with a generous dollop of creme chantilly. 

The political element went mostly uninvestigated by groggy me, but having grown up in Eugene, I can sense the vibe. And I gathered something about them growing/sourcing their own wheat, which is rad.

We sat at their ultra cute seasonal Valentine's Table and made a glittery card for one another from the free craft supplies they have offered. We sipped our shade-grown fair-trade organic sustainably-harvested locally-roasted Colombian coffee. It tasted good, to both me and the planet. We bussed our own dishes. The boy behind the counter was cute. The pie was fairly priced. The sun was shining, and I have nothing to complain about - except maybe that rhubarb is not in season.
author: Olivia P.

description:
I am right now sitting in my apartment eating a to-go banana cream pie.  I'm in serious heaven overload right now, and loving it.

But honestly, I have only been to Mission Pie once before today, and to say that it was magical is pretty accurate.  Only because it's this tiny place, that's so damn charming and cute it makes me want to open up my own bakery just so I can sit behind the counter and watch people play Parcheesi like I did while eating pie.  Have you watched Waitress with Keri Russell?  Go rent it, watch it and then go to Mission Pie and see how you feel.  If it's warm and fuzzies in your belly from the thought of a warm Saturday afternoon baking pies with sunlight streaming in just perfectly into the kitchen, we've got something in common.

And I understand other reviewers feelings about the customer service being a little lack-luster, which I'm actually totally cool with.  I mean, is it wrong for me to want to purchase my pie and then be left alone so that I can pretend that they're not there while I shovel deliciousness into my (ha!) piehole?  I get a little eeked out when employees are overly friendly anywhere anyway.  I mean, I'm sorry, I've got a mouthful of food, I really can't answer your barrage of questions right now.

Worth a try, and I definitely recommend the banana cream pie over the apple pie.  Unless you like cinnamon, then go for it.
author: Asha H.

description: Great atmosphere, friendly staff, the banana pie is amazing. Don't get the chicken pot pie, my bf got that and it was pretty bad.
author: Claire R.

description:
Sameer said that I couldn't hold out.  I even thought I was smart coming here on a full stomach... thought I'd share a piece.  That was until I got to the counter and saw them.  So, I'd have a "small" slice of the Walnut pie... even tried to turn down the whipped cream, to which they said "Are you sure?  It's freshly whipped!"  The French colonial/grandmother's kitchen decor made me feel even more obliged.

So you see, I was forced to enjoy my walnut pie with whipped cream on a full stomach.  I left with a smile.
author: Shea G.

description:
Think you've had pie? Check out Mission Pie. I was ready to be wowed but I was surprised how amazingly flaky the crust was, and how perfectly portioned the crust to fruit ratio was in our pear ginger pie. 

The story of Mission Pie and Pie Ranch makes it all more worth the trip to pick up a pie. They grow their own wheat! The ingredients are organic! It's all about sustainable.

Come on - the price is not what you'll pay at Marie Callender's, but why do you want to give your money to a faceless machine? $18 for a pie that feeds a crowd is absolutely the right thing to bring to your next host/hostess.
author: Mariangela S.

description:
The banana cream pie is so good, it's the only thing I've tried.
I could easily get another slice... easily. But it's all about self control.
author: Geordie E.

description:
Been here a few times to the same result. Very average taste of pie, sub average crust (no taste, weak texture) small serving size.

Tried the lemon rind pie.. Horrible. Peach pie is decent, plum tart was very good, banana creme pie was dilapidated and bland.

Wonderful idea, nice ambiance. really bad pie.
author: luke o.

description: Wow! $23 for a whole banana pie and a slice of sweet potato pie.  I took both to go for a fam bbq.  The sweet potato was for me.  I bit into it when I got to my car and was not impressed. Something about the texture threw me off, even I can make a better pie than this.  I remained hopeful for the banana cream so when it was time for dessert, I was first in line.  Sooo disappointed, all it tasted like was a heaping glob of jiggly mess with hardly any sliced bananas in the pie. Only positive comment i have is that the crust was semi decent. I will not return.
author: Lauren S.

description: Fresh ingredients! The Best PIES with that home made taste. This crust can not be beat.
author: Ron M.

description:
I've been coming here quite often since it opened. I'm not a big pie person, at least according to my track record, but I can see Mission Pie possibly changing that, sometime in the near future. I do quite enjoy their coffee, and it is one of the more reliable coffee spots near my house. Lattes have been a bit inconsistent, however, but based on my observations, this is more due to a lack of experience with the making of espresso drinks in the staff, over anything else. In any case, I'm glad they opened, and I will be patronizing them, even if just for caffine's sake, on probably a weekly basis.

ps-the spinich and cheese mystipie was a winner!
author: Shannon R.

description:
You think you know, but you have no idea.

My boss had me run out to get some pies for  party a few weeks back.  As I was walking out of the office, my co-workers stopped me individually.

"Are you getting pies now?"

"We heard we get pies today..."

"Did you get us pie?"

I was confused.  What was with all these California folks and their pie.  I mean, I like pie alright, but I don't think about it in my spare time.  It's just there - like Nilla Wafers and Cheez-Its.

So, I went on over to Mission Pie - and it was adorable!  Really cute and homey and happy and the boy/baker was super cute and we made funny jokes about all the pies I was getting, and I like to think that he checks Yelp daily hoping to find this review.  Yes Pie Boy, I do think you're cute!  I do, I do!

Sorry.  So, I headed back to the office with an armload of pastry, and was immediately swarmed by the coworkers.  I went into the basement for a moment to get something, and when I came back up the entire company was sitting around in silence, chewing meditatively.

"When in Rome..." I thought, as I went over to the ravaged pie boxes.  

My boss slowly brought his eyes around to meet mine, and warned me, "You might want to sit down for your first bite."  Whatever.  So I sat on the floor near some other pie eating co-workers of mine (my boss was sprawled on the stairs).

Upon the banana cream pie entering my mouth, I was glad I was sitting because my knees would have buckled from the pleasure.  It's amazing the effect that one bite of perfectly prepared bananas and cream can have on a person.  Sooooooooo good.

Similar stories hold true for such pies as apple and sweet potato.  But I am always looking to expand my pie tasting repertoire.
author: Melanie D.

description:
I am embarrassed to say I have been to Mission Pie many, many, many times. I have never had a bad slice. The Mission High School kids that work there crack me up. I remember being an awkward teenager! 

Anyway, the pies are fantastic, the tea (I get the Earl Grey) is amazing and the service, is, well, mostly done by teenagers, who are doing their best. Support Mission Pie!
author: Mitsi M.

description:
OH. MY. GOD!!!!

(and, it's SUSTAINABLE!!!!)

YEAH.  That's what I'm talkin' bout.

UPDATE:
by now I've cruised through pear ginger, banana cream, apple, pumpkin, and two savory pies (not all at once, but separately) and each are wonderful expressions of their particular kind, well executed and quickly eaten.  the crust is really good.  And I love the quality of the fruit pies. . .not too syrupy or sweet; the natural fruit flavors shine, a lovely balance between tart and sweet, incidentally qualities I appreciate in people too :)
author: Mark N.

description:
Another great way to start the weekend.
Beautiful pies in a nice atmosphere.
loved the Rhubarb pie :)
author: Eitan S.

description:
What can I say that hasn't already been said in 200+ reviews? 

I had the banana cream pie and peach blackberry pie. Oh my! Of the two, the banana cream was the superior -- it had actual flecks of vanilla in it, along with silky smooth banana puree (pudding?) and subtle, not overly sweet cream. The crust was total perfection -- buttery but not heavy.

It was clear the peach blackberry pie was made with uber-fresh fruits. I liked that the pie wasn't sour or tart as many fruit pies are -- it just tasted naturally sweet, like, well -- peaches and blackberries. The crust on this one, though, was not perfect like the other one. It was dry and a tad overcooked, with less buttery flavor. 

I recommend enjoying your pie with their coffee. Though it could've been a tad hotter, it was very flavorful and was the perfect accompaniment. 

The restaurant itself was well-lit, felt homey, earthy, and I loved that there were several tables of varying sizes scattered throughout. Makes it convenient to go there whether you're by yourself, with a sweetie, or with a whole gaggle of people. We were there from 8:30pm til 10pm on a Friday night -- it was full but not crowded, and my friend and I didn't have trouble getting a table.

The service was courteous enough but a little surly and curt. Hey, it's the Mission -- you kinda expect it. Very salt of the earth.  

This is a GREAT place to hang out for an after-dinner treat with friends. Very down home, sweet, and relaxing.
author: SfMom O.

description: A friend brought us here for dessert and coffee after lunch. I had a delicious banana creme pie with an iced coffee. It was nice to sit and catch up with friends in this bright restaurant. I definitely want to come back again for the pecan pie with vanilla ice cream! Also kudos to the refills on coffee!
author: Vanessa C.

description: I stop in at Mission Pie every weekend for their Banana Cream.  Best cream pie in town.  Pairs nicely with a cup of freshly brewed coffee.  Season to taste.
author: Nick H.

description:
Open Late. Delicious Pie.  $3.50-$4.50 per slice.  Staff a little spacey.
Excellent Pie crust, firm and sweet - but not too sweet.  The selection on any given day is limited, but the ingredients are fresh.  Highly recommend the Walnut Pie.  Don't be afraid by the address if you are coming from the marina, it is jogging distance from Medjool and Bruno's.
author: Michael C.

description: The banana cream pie is one of the best pies I have had anywhere. I wished I lived in SF because I would eat here everyday. Can't wait to come back and try all the other pies.
author: Thomas D.

description:
I went to check this place out because I was told that they made "the best pumpkin pies." It's good but not AMAZING (like my friend Tina's homemade organic pumpkin pie). The crust was tasty and flaky but I will continue my search.

The customer service was excellent!
author: Dianne N.

description:
My first but not last visit.
My friend and I got the last 2 pieces of banana cream pie. Thank god because it was deelish!  Not overly sweet and a crisp flaky crust. Just perfect with their wonderful coffee. 
Next time I'll sample a slice of savory.
Also love the free coffee pin wheel.
author: L A.

description:
Really great, cheap slices if goodness. Where else can you find a delicious sustainably made piece of joy for $3.50, and also benefit a good cause? 

The slices are not huge, but are very well made with fresh ingredients. I had the apricot blackberry pie a few nights ago. Nice, bright flavors and toothsome crust. I can see why people love the Meyer lemon pie, but a bit too strong for me. Then again, I don't love lemony desserts...

My only concern is that some of the young staff who're part of their (very cool) employment program can be very much on the sullen and s-l-o-w side. How much is customer service part of the employment program...?
author: Bernie S.

description:
It's complicated. Yes. I'm using a FB category cuz it is perfect in this case.

I am just thrilled that there is a pie shop in SF and close to my house.
I am surprised that I have, on 2 occasions, said to my man, "hey, is there anywhere we can get a piece of pie at this hour?" and the answer was yes, thanks to Mission Pie.
It's great to have an alternative to going out for an entire meal just to have dessert.

My one reservation, and this is meant as a suggestion, is that the pie is not consistently good. There are only a few choices, which is good, but the crust is often burnt and that ruins a nice, simple pie. I also feel that the flavors are somehow lacking. Perhaps a bit more consideration of spice and butter would be nice.

Keep it up, Mission Pie! I'm coming back for more.
author: G Z.

description:
This shop supports seasonal, sustainable organic local agriculture.
It also trains high schoolers in job skills, so be patient if that young person behind the counter hasn't mastered it yet.

The pear raspberry pie, the four-bean vegan pot pie and Goat Rock coffee are great.
author: Raina M.

description: I don't get it.  We drove down to this area based on Yelp recommendations and shouldn't have wasted our time.  We chalked it up as an "experience".  Maybe the ratings are from locals that don't get around much?  A pie store that doesn't serve apple pie?  Doesn't serve soda?  Two strikes but we persevered. Chicken pot pie was runny soup with carrots and turnips and if you were lucky a dash of chicken.  Berry pie was a disaster:  Smushed strawberries that had seen better days.  Potato flan was good, so that justifies the 1 star ( well yeah I know you can't go any lower).
author: Neale R.

description:
I have pre-ordered pies for pickup before from here -- they are always pretty delicious.  Additionally, they will tell you what is in season & so probably the best thing they have the time -- most recently we got peach pies & they were kind of amazing.

Everything I've eaten at the restaurant was good. 

And, they have responsible ingredients & are giving people job-training and introducing teens to farms -- it's a super business to support!
author: Lady A.

description: Phenomenal. Best pie I've had since i was a little kid. Perfect amounts of sugar and tart. Amazing. Also, this was a vegan pie and it beats all pies vegan or not. The wood tables, floor and openness of the joint really gives a welcoming feel and the staff is always super kind.
author: Benjamin W.

description: Banana cream pie is so good! Great mix of banana and creaminess. Coffee is also simple and delicious. Perfect place for a slice and a drink. As an extra little tip: do ask for the little slop of whip cream on your choice of apple or pear/berry pie.
author: Brittany H.

description: I'm on a pie mission and Mission Pie is FANTASTIC! Okay I'll say it, "I LOVE PIE!" What a lovely spot for coffee and pie on a Sunday afternoon. The Lemon Buttermilk pie is bright and satisfying, perfect for any time of day, even breakfast. I'll definitely will be back soon!
author: Fancy G.

description:
I randomly stumbled across this place a couple of months ago when they had just opened.  At the time they didn't have a lot of inventory (I don't remember seeing any desert pies at all) but out of curiousity and a desire to help a new local business I bought one of the four meat pies (the steak one) in the display and took it home to heat it up.  It was pretty good, a little greasy and that was that.  Let's just say that I didn't hold much hope in my heart for a place with only four menu items lasting too long in that location.

Well a few weekends ago I was out on a sunny afternoon in the Mission with a few friends and we decided to do a quick food tour.  We went to El Faroltio on 24th and Mission (best place for a burrito that I've found yet btw) and stuffed our faces with mexi-goodness.

All during lunch my friend V kept going on and on about some amazing new pie shop nearby that we had to try and so we followed her down the street a block or so to Mission Pie.

The place had totally changed.  Its still a small, hole-in-the-wall sized shop, but instead of four sad little meat pies sitting on an otherwise empty shelf their display case was full of more traditional pie fare (think sweet potato, apple, bananna cream etc).  Luckily I had three friends with me so we got to do a little sampling.  By far the best was this pear and raspberry-crumbled joybomb that we all fought over like 4 toddlers with 1 crayon.  The reason I'm leaving off that last star is that it's a little pricey and the meatpie grease made my tummy rumble.

Although, writing this has made me think that today might be a pie day...
author: Jonathan B.

description:
I am all about pie... in fact, for birthday celebrations with my parents there is never b-day cake, but b-day pie.  I have to give very high marks for Mission Pie's apple pie--  it was perfect.  The filling was not too sweet (very important!) so I could savor the apple/cinnamon combination.  The crust was good, and it was wonderful to have it served with real whipped cream.

I also nibbled on their  walnut tartlette which was super, as well.  The custard under the walnuts was so tasty;  it was similar to a pecan pie, but with walnuts instead.

I give this place a high rating for its intentions: teaching kids all about growing different things, and how to run a cafe'!  Great spot, and I'll be back to try the banana cream pie~
author: Karen W.

description:
I'm satisfied with Mission Pies.

The people who work there are incredibly helpful. When we asked the kid working behind the counter which pies were which, he did not give any attitude. He happily let us know, down to which flavored scones they had on hand. Very, very helpful.

And for the pies we ate? Apple, walnut and banana cream. Fresh tasting and delicious. 

What more can you ask for?
author: Mark G.

description:
Pleasant surprise in the mission district.
Yummy pies with straight forward flavors.
But it all looks good you will be standing in front of the show case twisting your head for a while.
So close to public transportation!
Eating area is cozy. 
It's not like a fancy cafe, but good place to sit down and chat.
I brought in a sweet potato pie to work. 
Everyone, even a non-pie-lover  loved it!
author: Mai K.

description:
Why have I not discovered this place sooner?

After eating at La Taqueria, I wondered into this place for a little sweet.  It's a tiny little space and the entrance is on 25th Street.  No large sign outside but a listing of their pie flavors for the day.   This place had to be serious about their pies if they're making "mincemeat" pies.  So we decided to walk in.  

It was nice and warm inside with just a few tables.  It looked like the place was getting ready to expand into the empty space to the right of the cafe.  I started to read about the cafe as I waited in line.  It helps learning disabled kids by teaching them the ins-and-outs of running a business.  How cool is that???  

To be honest the pies didn't look that great.  They initially looked a little flat so I was wary.  The pies didn't have that gorgeous looking crust with fancily piped cream, etc...  (e.g., Tartine).  I asked what their specialty was and the polite guy behind the counter  suggested pumpkin or apple, but we decided to go for the pear raspberry.  

It was heaven.   The pie crust was thin and super flaky to really let the fillings sing.  The pear was perfectly ripe before cooked because of its perfect texture and super sweet profile.  The raspberries formed a nice duet with the pears.  It was a good thing we asked for the whipped cream on top.  It was homemade, fresh whipped cream and it was nice alternative to heavy ice cream which would have drowned out the pie.
author: Tom K.

description:
I went here for the pies.  Parking wasn't difficult since I went about 10:30am on a weekday but it's close to the 24th street Mission bart stop.  The pie was okay.  I got apple and it seemed like a slightly better version of a Safeway apple pie.  Nothing amazing.  The crust was so-so, not that flakey as if it sat for a couple days and the filling was a little dehydrated and deflated.  

More expensive than a Safeway pie but I guess you're paying for the locally sourced ingredients and small business profit margin.  If I get a pie at a place that has 'Pie' in their name, I expect it to be a-maa-zing!  If you want a great slice of pie and are willing to pay $6, go to Mission Beach Cafe.  You can even get whole pies there if you order ahead.
author: kiwi l.

description:
The pie here is good, not amazing, however I heart Mission Pie for all they're trying to do in my old hood.  Love the whole Mission High Students to Organic Farm to Sustainable Pie Cafe connection.  That ups the stars for them.  
Mission Pie pies are like  a decent version of almost homemade.  Not perfect, but lovingly prepared and I appreciate how seasonal and organic their offerings are.  I so far, knock wood, haven't had bad pie from them.  Love the walnut pie- like pecan but not so cloyingly sweet, just rich & nutty, the homey looking fresh tasting banana cream pie, the shaker lemon pies, and whatever seasonal flavors.

I know some people aren't thrilled with the service, but were you awesome at your first job in high school?  No, you probably weren't.  Can you imagine having to deal with annoying hipsters and yuppies grilling you 97 times a day about whether each pie has nuts or dairy or agave syrup instead of processed bleached white sugar or not so their macrobiotic purity is safe or little hyperactive allergic Tyler Ashton can eat it?  Really.  I've had way worse service from adults in coffee shops who thought they were too cool for me, so I give the Mission Pie kids a pass. Mostly, I feel like they're trying, that's all I need.   I do wish you could buy warm slices with ice cream to eat there (maybe you can now, haven't had a slice in recently) but it's cool.  

p.s. I miss Bepples.  We really need someone to do the sustainable seasonal local organic  working with at risk neighborhood youth version of Bepples.
author: Shona M.

description: This place has fantastic pies. Fantastic. I will crave the walnut pie (no one ever cares about pecan pies anymore) for weeks at a time before i get around to heading to the Mission. Other great pies they have are the banana cream pie, pear blueberry, and apple cranberry. They also have pretty good coffee.
author: Phuong M.

description:
banana cream pie -- very good
generous cream with real bananas inside, smooth and perfect
try to get one when they are just made to get the best crust
author: Rob C.

description: OMG thee best banana cream pie I've ever had.  It's kinda expensive...$20 for a whole pie or $3.50 for a small slice...but dude, I don't care.  I'll pay good $$ for delicious food anytime!  yum yum yum
author: Cin W.

description: I really like the coffee, the full windows are great, but the music is way to intrusive (its loud, echoes, and has lyrics and big beats) for peaceful working conditions. I even used ear plugs! Wah, b/c I really like the vibe of this place on an otherwise quiet monday afternoon.
author: Dina G.

description:
Mission Pie.  Just the name makes you want to go in and order one of everything.  I had the sweet potato.  I like the location,  the sign out front more than I actually enjoy their pie.  

I'm rooting for a chocolate pie.  I know this doesn't fall under the traditional pie types but if they have a chalk board out front in theory they could erase one and put something different up there every once in awhile.  how bout some rhubarb?  now we're getting serious!
author: Melissa Y.

description: I got nothing but love, love, love for Mission Pie. The space is perfect for meeting someone for coffee and pie or doing homework on a rainy afternoon. There is no wireless, which works in my favor as i get the most studying done without internet distractions like yelp. And that also keeps out competition for outlets. Anyway back to the important stuff. The pies are nothing but the freshest ingredients and there are so many. Yum. As far as the savory pies, I've only had the chicken but I suspect the pork and veggie ones are excellent as well. Mission Pie isn't cheap but it is worth it!
author: Nina B.

description:
1 Star for the Banana Cream Pie, I agree with the others it was bland and would not order again. They have many others but it seems this one is most important to people when they go, so I give my opinion.
1 Star for the size of the Quiche, I order a slice of Quiche ($4) and they give you this tiny piece, not good. 

1 Star, does not accept credit cards

5 Stars for the location, sunny area, open windows and overall atmosphere

5 Stars for giving free refills on their house coffee

5 stars for the wonderful service


I go there often to read or just get a cup of coffee and a piece of pie (can't resist), it's a great place indeed but will not order Banana Cream Pie and for the delicious Quiche (since is not a dessert) I would need two slices ($4 each) to get full! 


Overall, if you live in the area or happen to be by, great place to grab a slice of something and a cup of coffee. Their pies do much exceed expectations of other cafe's pastries.
author: Geena T.

description:
Upon arriving, the atmosphere of Mission Pie is casual, like a coffee house. A friend and I ordered one Chicken Pot Pie and one Beef Cottage Pie and a slice of Apricot Frangipane Pie. After waiting 10 minutes for our pies to be heated, both arrived cold. We sent both savory pies back for another 10 minutes only to be disappointed when the pies were still cold. Not warm, definitely not hot, but cold. Rather than waste another 10 minutes to get the pies heated to lukewarm we decided to eat, despite the danger of improperly heated food and the risk of food poisoning. Plus, my chicken pot pie desperately needed salt. By the time I salted it myself I was just not into it because of the temperature. One nice gesture was that we were brought a free side of cole slaw as an apology for the wait and the ice cold pies. Too bad the cole slaw had a strong flavor of cumin and nothing else. We couldn't finish it. 

This place seems like it excels more in the sweet pies because our Apricot Frangipane pie was excellent. Buttery delicious crust and fresh ingredients. Yum.

The coffee is excellent! Service was friendly and nice.
author: Foodie F.

description: I love pies, both sweet and savory.  I've yet to master the perfect homemade pie crust, so I try not to miss the opportunity to try other people's perfect pie crusts.  Mission Pies has a big variety of delectable pies with tender flaky crusts.  I ordered the chicken pot pie and banana cream pie to go.  I was a little disappointed that they didn't ask me if I wanted my chicken pot pie heated up (even if it was a to go order).  I didn't have access to a heating source, so I ended up eating it cold  :-(  But it wasn't bad cold, and I sensed that it would have been excellent at the right temperature.  The pie itself with pretty big and full of big chunks of chicken and veggies.  The banana cream pie was flavorful and appropriately creamy.   If I had time, I would have eaten my pies at Mission Pie, as it has a very homey cafe feel to it (although it was a bit crowded when I was there in the early afternoon on a Saturday).
author: Sirinda S.

description:
i really love this spot. i'm pretty into pie and their seasonal menu always offers many delicious options. my favorites are the strawberry-rhubard (spring/summer), mixed berry (spring/summer), and many of the frangipane tarts. 

my mom got me pie from here for my birthday. three pies. for breakfast. because that's how we roll in my family. don't judge.

every once in a while i'll have a slice that's missing a little something, but it's rare and still generally good. the shaker lemon isn't one of these, but as it's not as sweet as most others, it's not always as popular. eat it with whipped cream.
author: Casey P.

description: I imagined this place as a diner with tons of pie, but really its like a coffee house/cafe with pie. They had about five kinds when I went. We split banana cream, walnut, and strawberry. Can I just say how awesome the strawberry was? I polished off two slices! It was more like an old-fashioned crumble. Great great stuff.
author: Alissa S.

description:
Savory pie - Good to great. My friend has the quiche and it was a tiny amount of food. I had the chicken pot pie and it hit that comfort food target. I was still hungry, but I came in at Empty, so no surprise I didn't leave at Full.

Sweet pie - Good. I had the banana cream and, while not life-changing, it was solid.

Service - Meh. My pot pie was still missing twenty minutes after I ordered it, yet miraculously came out right after I asked about it. Then the server gave me a dirty look when he brought it to my table. Nice.

Prices - Could be better, but I understand it's labor-intensive stuff and they use quality ingredients.

Mission - I love that Mission Pie is doing job training for young folks with difficult circumstances. Hopefully the service is usually better than it was the day I came.
author: Mike B.

description: Had banana cream pie and a fancy puff pastry with cheese, nuts and apple.  Pie was "meh" but puff pastry was unique.  Local organic thing is a little heavy handed and the packaged goods are a little too precious.  But the staff was really really friendly (maybe a little slow) and the coffee - whatever the brand was wish i knew! - was amazing.  It's the kind of place that just needs a little more attention to detail in basic pies to differentiate them a bit more.  Maybe a little hardier pie fillings?
author: Norman P.

description:
It almost feels redundant to say that I love Mission Pie; it's like saying I love sunshine, or I love breathing! Oxygen totally rules!

But those things are all true, and I am just so glad that Mission Pie is in the world.   Their savory scones were the best bakery items I'd ever eaten, and I'm sad they only have sweet scones now.  But the pecan pie is ridiculously divine. I am also in love with the building itself, and the local honey for sale.  love.
author: Ivy S.

description: MmM a homey place to eat some great pie ... love it! :)
author: Anthony S.

description:
I feel like I keep giving places 4 stars.  I guess that's the great thing and problem with SF dining scene.  All these good places, at reasonable prices - however, very rarely do things wow.

Like Mission Pies.

It was a good piece of sweet potatoe pie.  Not too sweet, you can taste the sweet potatoe.  The crust was good but a little tough (it was flaky but dried out).

We had a scone - it was a good scone, but for the same price ($0.25 more), you can get a significantly better scone from Tartine.  

So there it is, another good place but not great - Especially for the price of the pie here.  $3.75 for a slice.  Not cheap.
author: Hanson L.

description:
I'll back up all the five-star reviews.  

The crust is...perfection.  Flaky, crunchy in the right places, buttery, just a little sweet, and light as a feather.  I had the pear-ginger pie.  Awesome flavor, and fairly unique.  I want to go back to try the banana cream and lemon pies.  Each pie comes with whipped cream, which I highly recommend.  They're not messing around with any of that Redi-Whip BS.  This is the real deal.  

And then, of course, there are all the do-goody things they...do.  I had fun reading about all of their projects on the walls.  The very definition of ethical business.  And reason enough to support this wonderful little shop.
author: Christy T.

description:
Man, how do you start a food fight in this place??  You have to get the pies out from behind the counter first.  So basically you and me we go in, pretend to be normal customers, you know like maybe we have laptops or something, order coffee and a slice each, and whatnot.  Then at some point you just stand up, close your computer and smack me upside the head with it!  Then, and this is key, I hurl you through the plexiglass case containing said pies and away we go!!  It'll be pie and more pie everywhere, so much yummy tasty goodness flying in all directions!  In three dimensions!!!  God, I can't wait....

Ok well now they've moved next door.  Wonderful location, spacious, airy, corner shop with windows on two sides, all that good stuff.  BUT: pies are now behind much sturdier, what looks to be glass, cases.  So, above scenario: too dangerous!  Oh well.  It would've been a waste of lovely pie anyway.
author: David B.

description:
My dining partner and I went here around 3:00 on a Saturday afternoon. Ordered one slice of the Shaker Lemon to split, two slices of the potato gratin tart and a glass of milk. $13.56 for three slices and a glass of milk. Could be worse.

Got the Lemon right away. Crust was nice and flaky, filling was tasty. Potato tart took them 15 minutes to heat up. I was concerned that they had forgotten about it. A woman came over halfway through and said she was shutting off the oven and to not forget about the food in there. Wasn't worried - ovens stay hot. When we got the slices, they were warm-ish. A little frustrating, but at least they weren't cold. 

When I went up to get the potato slices, I asked for the glass of milk we had never received. The guy behind the counter asked what kind I had wanted, I told him, and I sat down. (They had been bringing everyone's drinks to them and I had sort of been lurking looking for my tart slices, so I figured I should sit.) I kept looking back at him to see if my drink was coming, but he was just sort of hanging out behind the counter, doing nothing. Okay - I ordered it, paid for it, waited, reminded you that it was missing, waited... We'll just get a refund. When we asked for a refund, he gave it to us, but seemed unconcerned that he had forgotten twice.

So, the pies are super tasty - I can still taste the potato gratin, I swear - but the service was awful. It's a super cute space, but I agree with some of the other reviewers. No one seemed particularly  happy to be there. I'm sure I'll be returning for more potato goodness, but I might see if I can just get it to go instead.
author: Jen R.

description: Good pie, and not terribly expensive given that the pie is fresh and delicious.  My only negative is they don't take cards!!!! luckily I had enough cash to buy my pie, but I would have bought a second one AND a savory dish as well.  Please, start taking cards!!!!
author: Hanya G.

description:
I really really like the pies here, and like that hey now have the larger space to sit and enjoy your pie with a nice cup of coffee or tea.
I like the ginger pear pie..in fact I have never had anything from here that is not delicious. Perfectly balanced sweet and savory yummy eats. I have never tried the pot pies yet...but they look so good. 
They always seem to have a few vegan options of both sweet and savory items. 
my only 2 grips about this place are: 
1. I wish they had vanilla ice cream or gelato as an option instead of only hand made whip cream. Not the end of the world but sometimes I like my pie with ice cream......I suppose I could do this myself if I got my pie to go. However I really like sitting and drinking a cup of coffee with my pie too....really just trying ti have my cake, or pie in this case, and eat it too.
2. I want a bigger piece!!!! C'mon...Cant the portions be a bit bigger? For $3.50+ It just seems that maybe the portion could be a bit bigger.
on the upside...this is a good place to meet up with a friend....cause then you can usually get to taste a little of whatever they ordered too.
author: Kelle K.

description: so this is my first yelp review and i was debating who would be worthy enough to receive it. mission pie or el farolito. i hit both spots last night...back to back. and because i cannot stop thinking about mission pie's banana cream pie, it had to be them. i don't even know what to say about that pie except OH...MY...GAHH. freaken amazing. party in my mouth. that cream was oh so delicious. not too sweet, not too heavy but just puuuurfect. and the thin slices of banana with their homemade whipped cream. ahh this is horrible writing about it. it's just making me crave it more and more. check their website too. extra star for that community involvement and sustainability effort.
author: Jessica P.

description: If your craving pie ! better try this place
author: Sulaiman B.

description: Yes. Thank you. So fresh-like. Love the whipped cream.  Thanks for being near BART. While I was in peach raspberry pie heaven, I was thinking about how feasible it would be for me to start a branch in Oakland. I'm like man this is better than a cupcake because it has actual, identifiable fruit so it must have vitamins.
author: Mei G.

description:
Best.  Coffee.  EVER.

I don't like pumpkin pie, but I like theirs.

They're open until 10 on Saturdays :)
author: Sara P.

description: Cool coffee place, the selection was pretty empty mainly because I came here pretty late in the day. I would have enjoyed a sweeter crust.
author: Eric A.

description: Loved the crust but my quiche was bland. The potato pie could be cheesier. The apple cranberry was ok wished it was warmed.
author: Rose O.

description: Mission Pie was one of our stops on our Taste of the Mission tour.  We sampled some of their delicious mini walnut pie/tarts (buttery flakey crust, toasted sweet walnuts, and a filling that was not overly sweet), and also talked with Kristin, the owner, about their use of locally-sourced and seasonal ingredients (hence the walnut and not pecan pie).  Kristin also talked about the youth advocacy efforts at Mission Pie, which we thought was super cool of Kristin and the Mission Pie staff.  We bought a savory Red Bean, Collard Green and Andouille Pot Pie to take home and enjoy.  The savory pie was super flavorful and weighed a TON (for $7, the pie fed both me and my husband).  We'll have to come back to try other menu items.  For about $5, you can come in and enjoy a slice of pie and some coffee.  If you ask me, that's a great way to spend $5 and ~45 minutes.
author: Beth K.

description: This place has more Yelp reviews than I have LinkedIn buddies, and that is saying something. Might I endorse one aspect of Mission Pie heretofore not sufficiently cherished: the multi-ply bathroom tissue. This place gets everything right...event those little details most normal people totally miss.
author: Cameron K.

description: Fantastic walnut pie. Wow. Great atmosphere too. Definitely coming back next time I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Evan K.

description: I haven't yet been to the mothership but a plum almond tart and apricot almond tart someone brought me were simply perfect: Flaky crust, , with ground almonds in the crust, flavorful fresh fruit, and an overall great taste without being too sweet. Definitely will seek out Mission Pies!
author: Susie W.

description:
Great new coffee and pastry place at Mission and 26th.  

Friendly staff, good coffee, quite a bit of seating and (oh yeah) pies.

This is a much needed addition to the neighborhood.
author: Keith B.

description:
Hmm--I'll never turn down a slice of pie. But three-fifty for an anemic slice of moderately tasty pie? Think I'd rather hold out for the bread pudding at parent Destination Bakery on Chenery...
I think a good 50% of the patrons must be parents and supporters of the Mission High kids who work here--it's a good cause; just overpriced.
author: Dave H.

description:
what have i been doing all my life!!!???
why haven't i been here enjoying the delicous pie!?
I definitly sold myself short by always eating baker's square pies, because it was easy and convient, but i will never EVER do such and evil sinful thing again.  Mission pies is seriously the greatest, the staff is super nice (they didnt give me the eye when my friend and i ordered 3 pieces of pie to eat there, and then we proceeded to scarf it down while repeating this is so good!), and it is so mellow.   Love it love it love it!
author: Gina B.

description:
I'm late on the boat for Mission Pie - But have to put my 2 cents in.

YUM!  Crust that is flaky buttery crisp and tender bliss.  Filling that compliments each different crust to perfection.  The apple tart I ordered was amazing.  I was hesitant because it looked like the crust to apple ratio was a little crust heavy - but no.  Absolute perfection.  The Banana Cream Pie... let's be honest, I ordered it for my husband.  I had no intention of liking it.  Wow.  It was also just so well matched - Filling and Crust.

Try the savory Pies as well.  I got a chicken curry hand pie that was very satisfying.

So very excited to know about this spot!  Has changed my feeling on Pie.
author: Alicia W.

description:
I just spent two weeks on the Oregon and N Cal coast.  There pie is made from scratch at every coffee house, greasy spoon, bakery and fine dining establishment.  San Francisco is not a pie town.  Pie is too red state.  Pie is too country.  Pie is too basic.  That said, it's nice that Mission Pie is here because I do love pie.  I was there yesterday and had a curry pie and a strawberry rubarb pie.  The curry pie was bland.  Curry = bland...no.  The strawberry rubarb had a nice bite to it, flavorful w/o too much sugar sweetness and a dolup of whipped cream - the real stuff, not from a pressurized can.  Alas the crust was only ok, not flaky and buttery.  From the other reviews I thought there would be lots of pies but the area where the pies are displayed is pretty small so unless they stack them up in the back I can't believe they would have a large number of pies.

If they ever move, they should look for a space where the baking and the eating spaces can be next to each other.  There is nothing like pie fresh out of the oven, hot with a scoop of ice cream on it.
author: John S.

description:
Well, I've been jonesing for some decent apple pie for awhile, as all one can get from the major grocery stores are over-sugared, additive filled pieces of crap. It's the sole thing I miss my ex-mom-in-law for - she was an evil witch, but she made a killer apple pie.

Anyhoo, my g/f has a quick hunt on yelp, and we go with the recommendation of Mission Pie. Good, good decision! We had apple, pear & ginger, walnut, and pumpkin pies...it was like there was a party in my mouth and everyone was invited! The crusts were glorious, a perfect balance between flaky and crunchy, the fillings were generous and sweetened with just enough sugar to do the job...all in all, a mouthgasm. I'd kinda forgotten how much better food tastes when created from pure, unadulterated organic ingredients. If there was any criticism I could make it would be that the staff could benefit from a touch of customer service training...but hey, they're teenagers, and they're doing a damned fine job in all other respects. Its not like they were surly or ignorant, just a little lacking in confidence.

The overall mission of Mission Pie is laudable and deserves support, and the end product (both in terms of teenagers with valuable social & work skills and fabulously delicious pies) is outstanding. Bring plenty of cash (they don't take credit) and have a sample of everything - I guarantee you won't regret it!
author: Terry H.

description:
"Can we go to Mission Pie?"

This was the greeting I would get most often when I pIcked my boys up from the summer camp in the neighborhood. Full disclosure, my kids (and I) love going to any bakery, but there's something about Mission Pie that's irresistible. We have never been disappointed with any of the pies we have bought and consumed. I love to meet friends here and catch up over coffee and pie.

And throughout the year, my kids often ask, "When are we going back to Mission Pie?"
author: Diane A.

description:
Sustainable agriculture and to die for... not possible! At least, that's what I thought before I checked out Mission Pie. 

When it comes to pie, they take the cake! Soft, delectable and just the right amount of sweet in a variety of seasonal fruit. They also carry quiche and coffee, but I didn't stand a chance because the apple ginger pie would not go untasted. Wooo! That was quite possibly the best pie I have ever had. This place is a little pricey, but you won't miss the extra money after you've tried a slice.
author: Astrea W.

description:
I say this very seriously:



This place is one of the greatest businesses in San Francisco! They not only make beautiful food, but they actively involve and help the community around them. Seriously, please support this mom and pop business. They have SO MUCH HEART, in every way!


...This is what San Francisco was founded on; small businesses helping the community while building their own dreams...
author: pat s.

description:
The pie is always delicious, both sweet and savory and I like the work with local organizations that goes into making it. The coffee is great, too. The service tends to be great, usually friendly.

But last time I went the counter Dude not only forgot my order (warming in the oven) but would blatantly ignore me when I was trying to get his attention. I have not been back since.
author: Karen C.

description: Dosn't get much better then this people.  Don't believe me?  Perfect more for me. ;)
author: Colin M.

description:
I've been there once and it was very tasty!! Cappucino was the best I had in SF so far...
and the sweet pie I had was delicious. a little pricy, but definetly worth it!!
you pay less if you bring your own mug! so go for it!!
author: Christina P.

description: Banana cream pie filling is OK but not enough bananas and the crust is too thin for my tastes. Atmosphere is relaxing and sunny. Near BART and I should probably try other pies before I give a final rating.
author: Ingrid D.

description: I'm not really a pie person but i came here on whim when i was passing by.  This place has awesome pies. I ordered a mixed berry pie and banana cream.  Both were very good and savory.  I found it to be a little too sweet, but then again I don't eat too many pies to know.
author: Cedric F.

description: Excellent pies especially the Lamb and cabbage  pie. Has lots of veggies and crust  is very good. I make it at least a once a month stop for dinner to go.
author: William S.

description:
Doo-rag'd Lil Wayne lip syncing employees
+
Apple pie w/whipped cream goodness
+
Friendly, relaxed, sit-down areas
=
Win
author: George D.

description: Thank the lord that I don't live closer to here. I suspect gym memberships of people who live within a block of here have risen since it opened; because once you've had Mission Pie you must have more.   The other night at a dinner party I had the pear cranberry pie and jeez, wow, I really don't know what to say except that's the best piece of pie I've ever eaten.  The  combination of pears, a sprinkling of cranberries and a little bit of crumbs on top is making me want to head over there now for another slice.
author: Natasha R.

description:
I love pie for breakfast and was thrilled when this place opened.  The coffee is good and the pie is fantastic.  It felt like the day after Thanksgiving all over again.

Good work kiddos!
author: Sofia M.

description:
Yum!

Homemade pie, fresh whipped cream, local ingredients, providing a safe, productive place for urban high school students.  This place wins on all counts: my mind, my heart, and my stomach.
author: aekta s.

description: Great pie and coffee. Very good other food. No wifi which can be a plus or minus, depending. It's a plus for me often enough. And local and sustainable in the best way.
author: Rob M.

description: The banana cream pie was alright -- nothing to write home about.  It probably didn't help that I came in an hour before it closed, so the pie was probably sitting on the counter all day.  The staff was nice but they seemed a bit rushed and distracted, regardless of how empty the place was.
author: Chiara H.

description: We had the mixed fruit pie. I think it's the best pie I've ever had.
author: Natasha P.

description: Mission Pie sells a variety of pies and quiches. Try the berry pie. Delightfully delicious!
author: Claudia B.

description: Awesome pie. But come on guys, what's with the puny slices? Maybe they should call it "Mini Pie".
author: Nick R.

description: I've heard great reviews about Mission Pie and had to give it a try...and was really disappointed.  The crust was flaky-good, but nothing special.  The peach pie was not very exciting to my palate...it missed on flavor, probably because of the spartan serving of peach.  I decided to give Mission Pie a second chance with a pie that had received good reviews. Again, I was not impressed.  The banana cream pie was just okay.  Overall the portions served tend to be really small...stingy to be blunt.  However, the service is good, people are friendly.  My friends and I have re-dubbed this Missing Pie.
author: Art W.

description: I write this, having just devoured day old banana cream pie.  We had that and the mixed berry pie for a dinner party last night, and there is nothing left of the berry pie.  This place is awesome, and the pies are very reasonably priced. ($20).  Best of all, part of the proceeds go to support job training for youth (they source a lot of their ingredients from their own farm).  I would highly recommend grabbing a take out pie anytime you need to impress someone with a homemade-looking dessert.
author: Christine H.

description: Nice atmosphere. I went with a group and we split both savory (pot pie & quiche) and 4 sweet pies- all were amazing!
author: Stephanie P.

description:
These pies were so good - as everyone else has said...

I tried the banana cream and strawberry rhubarb and both were delicious - light and crispy crust and perfect filling! I would definitely go again and its a nice bonus that you can feel good about supporting the co-operative as well!
author: Louise Z.

description:
It's easy to feel guilty eating pie. That's why Mission Pie rocks. With a forward recycling program, organic ingredients and a farm that helps underprivileged youths escape the city, Mission Pie is totally guilt-free indulgence. 

It helps that pies like peach and walnut are incredible. You can order by the whole pie, slice or often tarts. Delicious.
author: Erin H.

description: All of a sudden I wanted pie. And I was on a mission for one! Was in the area and stopped by. It had that sweet butter, bakery smell to it. I couldn't put my finger on it, but it brought back memories of my childhood. Sweet nothings! ohhh. Had the vegan apple cranberry and the pear raspberry. Not too sweet, great pieces of fruit and the crust was soft not hard and crunchy. But overall, I could probably get a better pie elsewhere. Thats just me. Parking sucked but thats typical
author: Lola D.

description: At this very moment (hehehe) I am watching Pushing Daisies and eating pie. The best thing ever! We got a slice of each: banana cream, mixed berry, and peach. I NEVER liked banana cream pie until now. OMG it's so good here! The others were also good, not too sweet and just a little tart. Wish there could be more crust! We'll definitely be back to get more banana cream and to try out the walnut pie!
author: S. D.

description: Meh.  I had higher expectations for this place based on the reviews.  I am continually on the hunt for good pie in SF - and the hunt continues.  I'm a pie-lover from way back.  Growing up, my mom thought I was nuts because I never wanted birthday cake - always birthday pie.  I sent my husband to pick up a couple of their signature banana cream pies for a dinner party last night.  The pies were not terribly flavorful - just alright.  Seems like there was a lot of pudding filler and not a lot of bananas to be found.  The cream on top was fairly tasteless.  The crust hard as a rock.  I could barely chop through it with a large serving spoon.  Why a large serving spoon you ask?  Well, we had to serve our guests banana cream pie crumble in bowls dug/scraped out of the box with said large serving spoon.  You see, the cashier offered to have one of the girls working there tie up the two boxes so it would be easier for my husband to carry them back to the car.  A block away, the strings gave way and, voila, we had banana cream pie crumble.  So I did take off an extra start for no string-tying skills - and having to deal with a crabby and disappointed husband when he got home.
author: Bobbi C.

description: There really aren't many places in the Mission - probably none at all - that sell pies. Mission Pie has a great location and the pie and other desserts are great! The apple and mixed berry are my favorite fruit pies, and the pecan pie is great too. I love the seating there, especially sitting by the windows and playing with the magnets.
author: Stephanie C.

description: I started with the apple pie. The guy behind the counter almost didn't want to serve it to me. "It's vegan, are you sure you want it?" Nice. You have to beg them to eat their pies, I thought. Then I moved on to the pumpkin. Not bad at all...and then, still curious, I ordered the Shaker Lemon. Now THAT is a fine piece of pie. The rinds of meyer lemon are unmistakable, and the slice was not too sweet. I regretted the apple and pumpkin at that moment, which means I wasn't going to go full five star. Then again I think I can give a fiver on account of the best lemon pie I've ever tasted. I guess it should say a lot that I went through three slices in one sitting, no? Well, it should say more than I'm a glutton for pie.
author: Mulberry S.

description: Rude staff, so-so pies, big attitude.  I asked for one of the pies that they were out of and was criticized for my choice.  Overpriced.
author: Gregory L.

description: Wonderful sweet pies and they have a tasty organic vanilla icecream to accompany. They keep it real.
author: Amanda M.

description: the banana cream pie is unlike any pie you've ever tasted!
author: Sydney L.

description:
My girlfriend had been bugging me about this "Mission Pie" place for a while now. Every day we'd pass through the Mission, she'd say "Hey wanna go get some pie?," or every morning she'd say "Hey lets go get pie for breakfast!" Who the hell eats pie for breakfast? That's just crazy talk.

I finally gave in and gave Mission Pie a try, and it looks like I am going to be eating pie for breakfast more often now. We shared a savory spinach and cheese pie and an apple galette, and both were delicious. The ingredients were fresh and organic, and the organic orange juice I had was very good. I was surprised, yet delighted, when I saw they did not use canned whipped cream. The crusts were so good, I could probably eat them by themselves.

Parking has the posibility of being a major drag in this area, but we found easy parking on Sunday. The 14 and 49 MUNI lines run right past the building where Mission Pie is housed, and the 24th Street BART station is only a few blocks away. Public transportation is relatively easy to Mission Pie, and is worth the trek.

As for the address, it's not technically wrong, but it's a little misleading at the same time. 2901 Mission Street is Southern Exchange. On the side of the building (down 25th Street) is Mission Pie. They didn't really have a visible sign (the sandwich board wasn't out when I went), but they do have a small paper sign above the door.

Overall, I'd definitely recommend Mission Pie. I'll definitely be going back again.
author: Alexis C.

description:
so....those who know me know 2 things: 1) I LOVE, adore, cherish pie. it is my favorite food. and 2) i am nice and I don't like to criticize folks.

but. i have to give mission pie a 3.5 ish.

I got the banana cream like so many folks recommended. it is good in that it is not artificial tasting -it tastes fresh, not like it came from a supermarket.  and it was not too sweet. but it didn't have that luscious banana cream flavor-it was a little plain-ish, and just creamy.  I much prefer the Banana Cream Pie from Fat Apples in Berkeley-and it costs about the same.  The one from the fat apples is so luscious, so banana cream pie ish, not to sweet with a delicate crust. can't compare them.

and the other reason i give it this rating, is sadly, the people there were not so nice. i had such a great feeling when i was on my way there-i was like "pie! and it helps the kids!! it can't get any better!".  but when i went in, expecting nice folks who believed in the mission of mission pie, i got some not so friendly person who acted like it was a bother to help me.  and then i decided to buy more pie than i had originally asked for, and this person acted like that was even more of a bother.  i was nice, i was apologetic for adding more to my order. but the person helping me was none of those, and seemed so happy to get rid of me.  

i came in happy and left thinking i will probably not go back there for a long time. and you all don't know what that means...when i found out there was a place that sold just pie....it was a DREAM come true. living in dc for the last few years, i have searched the city, the internet, for a good pie. for 3 years i have asked, googled, yelped, and all. so when i found there was a place in the bay that sold only pie i thought i will never search again.  it really meant a lot to me.  but, this experience broke my dreams of my pie in the sky....


when the apple pie is in season i will try again to give it a fair chance.  and i will update my review, because i really don't like giving negatice criticism.  and i always give a second chance.
author: maya m.

description: Great concept and great-tasting pies!   Sunny cute spot in the Mission, they said they're going to expand to the corner too...  Organic ingredients from Pie Ranch or local food purveyors (like Mistipies, another great food biz from La Cocina incubator. Get the veggie coconut curry, wow.).  Staffed after school by the local students.  Really good-vibey place.
author: Melanie C.

description:
While I was eating what was possibly the best pie slice of my entire life, I thought to myself, "Oh great! All I need is another fattening place to add to my weekly list of 'must eat'".  

It was amazing! I had a slice of pear/ raspberry with a crumbly top.  I don't know how else I can get my point across.  It was so f***ing good!  Mission Pie also passed one of my most important standards for good dessert - FRESH whipped cream.  I hate canned whipped cream, so I was thrilled when I saw them spooning fresh onto my pie.  My friend ordered banana cream pie, which was just as well made.

Besides the skill that goes into the pie baking, the ingredients also make this place 5 star worthy.  Everything comes from the farm run by mission high school and a staff of volunteer farmers.  Even the flour is made from the grain grown on the farm just south of Pacifica.  The pie varieties change depending on what ingredients are available from the farm. Totally awesome!  And, each pie slice is only $3.50 or $18.00 for a whole pie.  You would have to spend about $7.00 for a slice of lesser pie at Whole Foods or any restaurant.

The interior is really cute too.  Just steps off of crazy Mission Street, I felt like I was in wine country when I was inside.  Totally quaint space.  This place is gonna cost me an extra hour at the gym every week, but it will totally be worth it for what I anticipate to be weekly splurges.

Note: The entrance is on 25th Steet.  After walking up and down Mission, determined to have pie, I finally called 411.  It may have added an extra $1 to the expense, but still absolutely worth it.
author: t l.

description: 5 stars for the ambiance. 5 for the delicious pear-raspberry pie. 5 for their philosophy of being green and part of the community. The only thing less than a 5 was the banana cream pie; something was a bit off but not sure what. But overall, a 5-star rating, and my wife and I will return!
author: William S.

description: What a great way to end a night in the mission! The banana cream pie was ridiculously delicious and I had a few bites of the Walnut Pie with fresh whipped cream and it was incredible too. Reasonably priced for an SF dessert and friendly servers. I loved this place.
author: Tiffany O.

description: PIE!!! I love pie, and I have to say, their pie amazing. I had the lemon shaker pie, and it was delicious, not too sweet, and not too tart. My friend got the banana cream pie, and she loved it. Really good coffee too. My only regret is that I only got one piece! I definitely want to go back and try all their pies!
author: Kelly L.

description: I went there for something savory, so I didn't try the sweet pies. But the tart I had was pretty tasty -- potato, onion and some other veggies. I'll be back to try the fruit pies!
author: Tamara M.

description: I come here for the coffee and have never had the pie.. haha Ironic.. They have to have delicious pie because there brown sugar is magical! I put it in my coffee... Yum!
author: Samantha R.

description: Mission Pie has a nice neighborhoody vibe which I like but I don't think I'll be coming back for more pie.  I had the banana cream pie and the walnut tart.  The banana cream pie was okay -- not sweet enough to me but my bf really liked it. I took one bite of the pie and was deciding how I felt about the flavor profile when I broke off a piece of the crust to nibble on and was stopped in my banana cream pie tracks.  Blecch! The crust was terrible -- bland, whatever the opposite of light and flaky is, and tasted like it was made of some too-good-for-you grain that pie crust should never be made out of.  I wondered aloud if the crust was gluten free or vegan or something (nothing wrong with vegan, I just like to prepare my palette for it).  Anyhow, that crust left a bad taste in my month and forced me to switch to a different pie.  I chose the walnut tart because they were out of every single berry pie  (not cool) and it was okay.  Better than the banana cream pie but that crust was equally unflavorful.  Overall I was left thinking fondly of every good slice of pie I've had over the last year and scheming on how soon I could have another slice of great pie.  So three stars to Mission Pie for putting me in a pie-frame-of-mind and sending me into my own kitchen to whip up a three berry pie with a delicious, light, flaky, and buttery crust.
author: I. B.

description:
A friend of mine -- let's call him "Chris Crane" -- and I were in the middle of a marathon viewing of "Twin Peaks" Season Two on DVD when we oddly, inexplicably developed an appetite for pie and coffee. Long story short, we decided to try Mission Pie out on a lark and were underwhelmed by the strawberry galette we had on that initial visit. I returned a few weeks later, and I decided to try both the strawberrry rhubarb and banana cream pies. The first was precisely what I was hoping for, and the second markedly surpassed my expectations. The banana cream pie really is a standout.

In general I tend to steer clear of desserts because I feel that most sweet treats do cloy, but these baked confections prove the exception to that perception. Buh-rump-a-bump.

Anyway, "Twin Peaks" is pretty great. It can be a gateway to pie. Initially disappointing but subsequently delightful pie.
author: Eugene P.

description: I went there today, on Pie Day, and they were OUT OF PIE. Sorry, that gets 1 star from me.
author: Stu M.

description: I have no complaints...  Very good pies at very reasonable prices.
author: Demanding T.

description: First time in and I really enjoyed the pear and blueberry pie! I really liked the simplicity of this place and how clean everything is! I look forward in coming back to your place for some orders to go! =)
author: Marco R.

description:
love pie, love mission pie. best pie story.

on the way home one night i was jonesing for some pie.. i was hoping for strawberry rhubarb, but could have been content with banana creme.

arrive 10 minutes after they close.

press noses longingly up against the window and whimper softly.

sympathetic smiles thrown my way as they cleaned up inside. 

mops swishing over tile floors.

then genius strikes.

*PLEASE may i buy a pie, a whole pie right out of that case, right there in front of you and you don't have to make change or anything pretty PLEASE?*

by yiminy they did it.

boxed up that strawberry rhubarb galette for me and i snuck the $20 in the window and they passed the pie out.

now how cool is that?
author: Sara D.

description: Mmmmm pie.  And yummy pie at that.  I got a slice of apple pie, and it was quite possibly the best apple pie I've ever eaten.  I hardly remember what it looked like on my plate I ate it so fast.  It's such a cute little place too, and they're expanding.  I can't wait to see what it looks like when it's a cute not-so-little place.
author: Laura W.

description: My strawberry rhubarb pie tasted like smucker's jam on sliced wheat bread, and that is not something I gladly pay $3.50 for (especially if that jam bread is the size of my palm, like this pathetic slice was).  The filling was devoid of tartness. The pie crust wasn't flaky; it was limp and thin like a soggy cracker. Horror, I was on the verge of laughter whilst eating this gross slice.
author: Allison C.

description: Even though I bake my own pies (with some of grandma's old recipies), Mission Pies gets Double Thumbs Up from me!!
author: SF U.

description: I came here to try some pie I had read a review and thought why not try it out it was a few blocks walk from my house. I tried the Apricot Frangipane ( recommended by the guy behind the counter) and the banana cream pie. I really liked the crust  a lot good texture and delicious. One spoon of the banana cream pie and it was yum!! I would come here again to buy this the apricot frangipane was also nice. I liked how the pies looked as they did have a kind of homemade kind of look !
author: lyn m.

description: Banana cream pie is my favorite pie in the whole world.  That became the case yesterday, after eating a slice of Mission Pie banana cream.  I don't know what my favorite pie in the whole world will be tomorrow.  It depends what they still have by the time I get there.
author: Hugh B.

description: Hmmm.  I love love the idea of this place!  Pie, who doesn't love pie??  Hopefully I can update this review soon with a higher score...but of the two pies I've sampled, I just wasn't very impressed.  I didn't even like them that much.  I tried the Stucker lemon pie and the Steak and Stout pie.  They were okay I guess...Next time I have my eye on the banana cream, sweet potato, or mixed berry and will hopefully think the world of them!
author: Hella M.

description: It's time to abolish birthday cake. Blow out the candles on your pie. I hereby declare a revolution!
author: Stumbalina b.

description: Ever since hearing about this place in an email from 'southern exposure' I've been wanting to check it out.  Conveniently, it's less than a block away from me. I'm predicting a rise in my pie consumption.  Never gave much thought to it or desserts as a genre, but I am now a believer.  Very comfy atmosphere, ok coffee and delicious pie.  also, I can advocate for their greater purpose and ethical side.  five stars.
author: Tim A.

description: Had their banana cream pie the other day. It was like a porno in my mouth! Excellent! Let me explain. Whenever I think of pie I get turned on. Pie and porn conjure up the same feelings for me, romantical feelings, naughty feelings OK! Ahhh, never mind, still not sounding better. Just try their pie, it's better then porn! Errrr, sometimes...
author: Ericka A.

description: Tripped across Mission Pie when we went to Foreign Cinema for lunch. After seeing it on many yelpers favorites list we stopped by after brunch and picked up some tasty treats for later. Everything that we sampled was really good. The walnut tartlet was my favorite. We also tried the sweet potato pie and a strawberry galette. Everything was above acceptable. My only wish is that they had more of a pie selection. It doesn't have to have Bakers Square 40 pies but more than one would have been good. Either way it's a good place to have your sweet tooth sated.
author: Johnny J.

description:
Hands down, the best scones in San Francisco--maybe the Bay Area.  The best used to be at Zuni Cafe, but they don't make them anymore and who knows what semifreddies did with their recipe, but it's way off.  I look forward to more scones at Mission Pie--great space as well.  They should think about making croissants and give Tartine's a run for its money.  lc
Oh, I know this is a pie place, my husband raved about them, but I'm not really a pie person.
author: Lydia C.

description: I like Mission Pie because it's really close to me, the pie is tasty, and they have a great blend of coffee called Goat Rock Roast. The pear raspberry pie is even better than the apple, which I find not sweet enough. Other people seem to like that, though, and the savory crust does compensate for the sweet deficit a little. I only give it 4 stars because I have a lot more varieties of pie to try.
author: Jess H.

description: I have a thing for corner cafes and this one is beautiful. The banana cream pie & mini walnut tart had just the right amount of fresh sweetness. You know when you can spy the black specks of fresh vanilla in the banana custard, it's gonna be good. The crust is rustic and substantial in a good way. Pitchers of tap water & thermoses of single source coffee are available: I had the perfect cup of decaf with soy milk and agave syrup. the ingredients come from pie ranch & there's a program for youth to visit the farm & get gigs at the pie venture.
author: Miz J.

description: Great pies!  The banana cream is my favorite.  I would like to try their chocolate pudding pie too, but they were out when I was there.  They have live music, which is nice.  Be aware that the service is terrible. Don't expect a smile, but do expect a super tasty dessert!
author: K N.

description:
If you have been wishing you could get some pie just like mamma used to make, I my friends, have just the place for you. Mission Pie. The key to a good pie is a good crust and this place does not mess around. I have had every single pie they offer and each one is more or equally as delicious as the first. They currently have a walnut pie (like pecan, but bolder,) a pumpkin pie (served with cloudy home made whipped cream on top,) a banana cream (which they started to put actual slices of banana in that totally sets this pie above the bar), a traditional apple (with monster hunks of succulent granny smith apples) and my all time favorite, the pear raspberry which has literally quater cuts of pear tossed together with tangy raspberry with a little bit of crumble crust on top. They also offer savory pies which, like the sweet pies, can vary due to available produce. The savory pies are individual lunch pies which vary from rosemary garlic beef to curry chicken and spinach cheese. The coffee is fair trade and everything (minus the meat pies obviously) is vegetarian friendly. i.e. no lard in the crusts.

My favorite thing to do is to go to Mission Pie with some friends and order a meat pie each and then order a whole pie and share it between us. There are few things better that fork battling your friends for the last piece of pear soaked crust. 

It is part of an organization that teaches kids how to grow produce and harvest it and then use it to make product and then sell it. You can usually find the two owners sharing a meal and one highschool kid working the counter when you go in.

My only qualm is that it's a bit small inside and they really aren't used to people coming in to get pie yet as they only opened at the begining of the year. I hope more people will go there to help them feel better about food service.
author: bo h.

description: Pies are decent. Nothing amazing. I would agree that the staff doesn't act super enthused to be there. Hmm. But I love that it's open to 10 many nights...
author: Justin And Courtney L.

description: Love, love, LOOOOVE everything about this place. Food is incredible, and the place itself is so relaxed and full of light. I also love the artworks the design of the place. I just went there for a simple lunch break, and oh it made me so happy.
author: c t.

description:
I tried this place three times- mostly because they are pretty close to me, and also because I thought surely if they are going to specialize in pie- it must be fantastic. 

Overpriced, small pieces, and each time left me hungry and wondering where the flavor was. Bought an entire pie with me on a picnic that noone wanted to eat since it tasted burnt. I would have felt bad giving it away to a stranger. 

There is no excuse.
author: katt a.

description: In my 36th year, I continue to grow and learn.  Today I learned that I do not like pear pie.
author: T-Bone L.

description: So Hue L. had bought a Peach Raspberry Pie to a BBQ that we were invited to (ok, he was invited and I crashed) on Saturday.  BUT, we left before the pie was ever brought out of the refrigerator.  It was 102 degrees in Sunnyvale that day so we decided to head back to the coolness of San Francisco.  What's the first thing we did?  Head to Mission Pie so I could try some of that Peach Raspberry Pie I was looking forward to eating at the BBQ!  It was still really hot in the city, so it was quite warm inside Mission Pie.  We both ordered slices of the Peach Raspberry Pie, although I was thinking of trying the Walnut or Banana Cream Pies.  With a dollop of whipped cream, the pie was actually pretty good.  Big slices of peach and a light crust.  I'm already planning to go back to try some of the other pies.
author: Kris L.

description: Was disappointed. The yelp reviews made me believe this was an amazing place, but all the things I tried were moderate tasting. Some of the items even dry. The chicken pot pie was okay, nothing spectacular. The mini pies were not very good.
author: Shizuka L.

description:
Pie baking mentors
Bring slice of life to youth
From farm to kitchen
author: HaikuReview X.

description:
my cooler-than-cool friend, krystin, runs this place.  nothing will make you feel more comforted that eating pie that's made here.   if the eco-consciousness, social responsibility, local and organic ingredients and the fact that each pie is made with love don't warm your heart, krystin's smile will.

you just can't go wrong.
author: Eleanore T.

description: Beautiful and deeeelicious pies, also great macaroons complete with cacao nibs.  I've never eaten in, but it looks like a warm lively place.  The employees are really friendly and prices are right!  A great and sorely needed addition to the neighborhood.
author: Aimee B.

description: My oh my do I love Mission Pie! It seems to me that homemade pie is always a good idea, even more so when made with sustainably organic ingredients. These lovely little slices come from the best stuff that Pie Ranch has to offer. Even if the word organic doesn't strike your fancy, eating a piece of pie from Mission Pie is not just good for your tummy, but great for the community of people who work the farm in Pescadero.
