For those of us who never see the light outside the city, Mission Pie offers a slice of small town inside its' wooden-walled, wide windowed sunny cafe nestled along Mission Street. Sometimes there's just nothing better than a slice of banana cream and a cup of mint tea ala Mission Pie.
author: Michelle K.

description:
i like pie.

i'm not really sure how this happened. i always preferred ice cream, cake, cookies, or candy when i was little.  now that i'm a little older, it's all about the pie. (ok, ice cream and cookies still rock, too.)  seriously, there is something special and magical about pie.

now, i make a mean apple pie.  too busy / lazy to make my own, i was eager to find a place with pie that could measure up.  not supermarket pie. not mass-produced, mushy, breakfast-joint pie. i'm talkin' down-home, fresh-baked, mom and america, PIE.  mission pie delivered, plus it's a great cause supporting urban youth. (check out the website.)

mission pie. easy five stars. i strongly recommend the apple galette; it's even better than the apple pie if you love crust (as i do.) and my boyfriend, the fussy one who it took WEEKS for me to convince to go along with me to mission pie, is now the one who suggests weekend trips there and who contemplates how he might freeze the pies to keep at home. chalk up another convert.
author: Sarah B.

description: I just came home from a film and had my first slice of Apple Pie from M.P. Like many of us, my mom made a killer apple pie. This one was so close I could schvitz! Actually, forgive me mom, I think you went a little heavy on the cinnamon. I traveled all the way across the city after reading all the five star reviews of M.P. And now I add mine. I will be back to try more flavors soon!
author: Dennis S.

description:
I wasn't really hungry for pie when I ended up here.  I was just looking for a place (that was not a an apt filled with guys getting ready to go out for a bachelor party) to study for a test I have next week.  I only intended to get a latte, but seeing those delicious pies all neatly lined up in a row, so prettily topped with clouds of fresh whipped cream . . . well, who could resist?  I ended up with a slice of banana cream pie, or should I say that I was elevated to banana cream heaven?!  One glance at this pie, and I could tell these were not some assembly line, machine-made, frozen pies from the grocery store.  They LOOK like your mom or grandma made them.  The crust was golden, flaky, and buttery.  There was a layer of ripe, sliced bananas, followed by a not-to-sweet or cloying vanilla custard (you can see the actual vanilla bean specks), and then a lovely cloud of whipped cream.  OH YUM!  

5 stars for great pie in a very nice remodeled setting.
Minus 1 star because I think there should be more/better seating.  There's one large table to share, and then a handful of small round tables.  I think there's definitely enough room to put some couches, comfy chairs, and/or tables that fit 4 people.
author: Amy C.

description: Who wants a birthday cake when you can have a delicious banana cream pie instead?  Yeah, that's what I said, too.  Big fan of their banana cream pie.
author: Julie T.

description: This is my favorite thing about my neighborhood.  I'm so glad they got out of their hole in the wall, and into their new space.  Too many good pies to count, and they had to roll me out after I stumbled on to their annual pie baking (pie eating for the rest of us) contest.  If they would ever have chocolate, I would be in trouble.
author: Rochelle J.

description: Banana Cream Pie - yum.  Definitely has that hipster vibe to it (the cafe, not the pie).
author: Melinda C.

description: I love great things within blocks of my home b/c I am a MISSIONITE. and a lazy bicyclist....okay, so this place has great pie, try the pear and berry one. BUT you also can feel GOOD about eating pie b/c you're supporting organic, local farms and youth trainings. ...however, b/c of the youth ran aspect sometimes service is a bit "slow". i love that they are the only ones w/ my favorite Mystic pie on sale ..i won't tell you which one though b/c they keep selling out! it's a  meat pie that i will, reveal. go and try!!
author: shanestar h.

description:
Mission Pie is an awesome place to escape ever-present roommate's boyfriend and study, although it is kind of loud outside (bring your ipod). It's cute and kind of cozy and the pie is like, SO GOOD! I got the pear-raspberry and usually I hate the texture of pear, but I loved it! The crust is flaky and it has a sort of crumble on top. Who doesn't love crumble?!
The guy at the cash register was really nice and he refilled by mug with water for my tea bag like 5 times (which he BETTER for $1.75 a tea bag). I think $3.75 is a pretty decent price for a big piece of pie, too. It sucks though because it's "cash only," words which should be banished from all stores on the planet. Oh well, I'll still be back!!
author: R D.

description: Lovely cappucino's and delicious coffee with a social mission, perfect. I'm a big fan of the banana cream pie, but I'm asian so that's a given I love all creamy deserts, right.
author: Jafon H.

description:
Banana Cream and Mixed Berry are my favorites!
I really miss going here.
Also, look up what Mission Pie is about.  You'll find out they do more for and with the community than most people talk about!
author: Oliver Z.

description:
When it's good it's five stars.  But mission pie is inconsistent.  Sometimes the pie is overflowing with amazing fruit.  Sometimes it's a little wan.  Sometimes the staff is clean friendly and alert.  Sometimes its sullen and slow.  Really, it swings from 5 stars to 2, so I have to settle on 3.

Atmosphere is always terrific.

check this though:  www.stretchyhead.com

yummy.
author: Ian T.

description: I finally stumbled my way into Mission Pie. I was excited to find it hearing all the wonderful reviews of the place. I go in and didn't expect it to be so yuppy but who cares where is the pie! I got the peach and blueberry pie, looked at it and thought, that crust is not even a crust, it was a thin piece of mushy dough topped with fruit filling falling out onto the plate. I was dissapointed by the look of it. Ok now for the taste..hmm..the fruit was very good, the filling was good but the best part the crust, uh it was not there.
author: Karen T.

description: Mission Pie has been generous to my nonprofit.  I never heard of this place before, found it online, mentioned it to colleagues, and they all raved about it.  Tried just their pumpkin pie, and it was incredible.  It had real pumpkin filling and the crust had a wonderful texture and taste.  When I went inside, they have a variety of pies and the space is open and congenial.  I would definitely go back.
author: Nadine H.

description: Ok, so for the longest I bitched and bitched about this place because of gentrification. Come on! is in the heart of the Mission and all I see are white hipsters with their laptops!! But whatever, I give up, the banana cream pie is so so so good! and apple pie is my favorite when I'm flying like paper.....
author: Anabelle B.

description: Best scone in the city.  For all the talk of pie, this gets overlooked and it should not be.
author: Joe C.

description:
I went here tonight for the oft-cited Banana Cream Pie, and it was fine, not out of this world.  The one at Baby Blues BBQ about 2 blocks away kills it.

Still, a nice place, and everything looked fresh and delicious.  I'll come back.
author: Rob P.

description:
"tacos and pie....tacos and pie...were gonna get tacos and pie!"

that is the little song i sing when i am in the car to my wife when we head over to la taqueria and mission pie.

i love the banana cream pie

i dont really get and thing else
author: erik H.

description: The pies of Mission Pie do not disappoint.  Oh, sweet goodness.  The shop/cafe at the corner has what seems to be three times the square footage it used to when its entrance was at the side of the building on 25th Street.  Tonight we had a White Nectarine & Olallieberry slice (sweeter than the other) and a Strawberry Rhubarb slice (tarter than the other) for takeout.  They also sell beans from Taylor Maid Farms in pound and half pound bags; the Goat Rock Roast is an aromatic shiny bean that produces a nice dark brew.
author: Debbie Y.

description: Good pie.  Fair price.  I had the banana cream.  I will be back to try other fruit pies as they all looked delicious.
author: Al K.

description: Anything with pie crust is excellent here.  I had the banana cream and mixed berry pie.  The reason for the great taste was the crust which in my opinion is the main reason to eat pie.  The ingredients were also very fresh and fruits that are currently in season.  It was so good I took home a vegan pot pie and chicken pot pie.  Both were delicious.  I did prefer the chicken to the vegan because I love meat.
author: Ginny M.

description: I like this place--always at least one vegan pie option (sweet as well as savory) and have enjoyed the apple/cranberry pie recently.  Friendly service, willing to go the extra mile to please the customer.  Nice place to hang out.
author: Bob G.

description:
Cute little place with a cozy feel, tiny tables and kind of a hidden entrance on 25th Street. 
Very small selection of pies when I was there-- only strawberry rhubarb and walnut, as well as strawberry and apricot gallettes (like a pie made without a pan, just crust folded over fruit). I sampled the strawberry rhubarb and the walnut and enjoyed them both. The walnut was sweet and custardy and rich. The strawberry rhubarb filling was very jammy with big chunks of fruit, but possibly a little too sweet and syrupy. The crust seemed too heavy and dark to me on both-- but to be honest, I am so violently biased on the subject of pie crust that it is almost impossible to ever completely please me.
The whole concept of this place is so great, with the school kids learning to bake and the locally sourced produce, that I am tempted to give it an extra star. I am going to hold off, however, until I get a chance to sample the coffee and the banana creme pie that others are raving about here. They were out when I stopped by on a Sunday afternoon, alas.
author: Sara G.

description: i'm halfway through a slice of pear-raspberry deliciousness from this unpretentious purveyor of pie, and must say it's the best piece of store-bought double crusted bliss I've had in years.  I'd gone in search of a whole pie to attend some friends' annual observance of National Pie Day (Jan 23) and couldn't resist picking up a little pre-game slice for myself. The woman in charge was fantastic-- she hunted down a scooter-worthy box in which to transport my fresh-baked morsels via the Vespa. Employees were both charming and a pleasure to do business with.  Bring cash or check only!!!
author: Pete S.

description:
shitty. shitttaaaaay.

i'd been excited to check this place out. i heard about it but never got around to actually finding the place. then last night i did.

i had the shaker lemon pie and my boyfriend had the pear ginger. what in the effing hell are whole rinds doing in my pie? it's like all they did was slice up some lemons and shove it in a crust. it's pretty evident that highschoolers made my pie. it was bitter and so horrible i didn't eat more than my first bite of it. i didn't try the pear ginger because i don't like ginger. my boyfriend said the ginger was overpowering and the pie was mushy on the inside. 

with all of that being said, i think their mission is great and i thought that even if they had mediocore pies i'd give them a good rating solely based on the mission. but damn, after having the worst pie i'd ever tasted i can't bring myself to give them even more than one star. how do they stay open with such shittaaaaay pies?


we could do without one highschool, can't we?
(just kidding!!!)
author: Regina C.

description:
The food:
The pies here are friggin delicious!!! The vegan pear-blueberry and the cranberry-apple pies were amazing. My mom wasn't so into the banana-cream pie. The root vegetable and barley side dish was tasty as well, but the curry potato, cauliflower dish was only so so. Maybe it could've been better if it was served hot.  
The service:
I would have given this place five stars if the service matched the food. The two guys working here were definitely not friendly. No smiles, no eye contact, and no character. The guy helping us had no interest in making us feel welcome, and seemed more interested in his cell phone. The other guy just seemed like he was totally depressed.  Maybe his girlfriend just dumped him. Or maybe just a bad day. But we still enjoyed ourselves...
author: Stitch Y.

description:
Pie was bomb! Had the apple and the banana cream...delish!

Customer service, well I didn't get any. The guys at the counter barely acknowledged us as we were standing at the counter. When we were done with our pie and were bringing our plates up to the counter, the guy pointed to where he wanted us to put our plates. GEEZ!
 If I had felt welcome ,they would have received 5 stars.

Boooo to our first experience at Mission Pie. I say 'first' cause despite the lack of friendliness, I must go back for more!
author: Bea D.

description: They have the most AMAZING banana cream pie I've ever had. And I don't even really like bananas that much. But this pie is SO GOOD. The crust is amazing, not too sweet, buttery, not too crumbly. Definitely holds up well against the banana pudding which is sweet and silky and delicious and the fresh bananas and the whipped cream. It's positively sinful how good this pie is! Best. pie. ever.
author: Cathy T.

description: Gets my "proper pie" award.  Had a slice of the peach blackberry with fresh whipped cream on top.  Crusty was tender and flaky, but just think enough.  Nice "tight" crumb on top with just a hint of crunch.  Fruit was flavorful and not over sweetened.  Pie, well done.
author: Wade T.

description: I wanted to love this place, as I love pies - but their strawberry pie was merely a mini pie with semi-tarty strawberry jam filling. Their banana cream pie was definitely a notch up - but you have to expect a little more if their specialty is in pies. Nonetheless....I'll give it another chance, if given the opportunity.....
author: Audrey L.

description: Mmm...pie made with local, fresh, and sometimes organic ingredients?  Yes please!  I got a chance to visit in December 2010.  After reading other reviews, I had to try the Banana Cream Pie - LOVE.  We also tried a seasonal special, lemon pie.  Not lemon meringue - this pie had actual slices of lemon with the rind still on them.  Surprisingly, when cooked, those rinds become very soft and tasty.  The banana cream pie was, well, creamy and sweet.  Perfectly complimented with a cup of coffee.  The lemon pie wasn't quite as sweet - a little bitter with the rinds, but in a unique and yummy way.  I regularly pass by Mission Pie, and it's always packed - and I totally understand why.  Be sure to stop in and check this place out - I can't wait to try the Walnut Pie, and my mouth is watering just thinking about all the local fresh fruit pies that I will get to experience this summer...remember, the pie choices coordinate with what's in season - now that's sustainable!!
author: Jenna C.

description: I didn't notice a neon sign in the window, but then again it was daylight when we went here.  Cozy little nook in the Mission that sells pies (duh!).  Since I'm wild about nuts (heh) I ordered the walnut pie with a dollop of whipped cream.  My friend ordered the mixed berry version, which would have been my other choice if I wasn't so crazy about walnuts.  Perfectly sized slices, not too much nor little and very yummy.  Yet another venue that makes the Mission a cool place to live.
author: Amy Z.

description: I don't get it. No really I love pie but I gave the rest of mine to a coworker. The crust was overworked and dry. The filling was, eh. I'm being generous or feeling peer pressure by even giving three stars.
author: Angela K.

description: I had high hopes for Mission Pie. I love pie. I went here for my birthday dessert. It sucked. The mixed berry had decent flavor but the texture was flat, the pie had no shape and looked more like a sad serving size of a crisp. We asked for whipped cream atop, it came without. The banana cream was bland, like mashed bananas thrown atop a tasteless hard crust. I wouldn't go back, wish I could say differently.
author: Katie R.

description: Mission Pie is nearly back in my good graces again. J purchased a banana cream pie and a vegan apple pie last month. Banana cream delicious. Could have easily eaten 2 slices in one sitting. Vegan apple also good though not as memorable as the banana cream. Unfortunately, something made my throat itch (I have to figure out what is a common ingredient in vegan desserts that make me itch!). In any case, tonight, I arranged to meet friends there. I bought a $7 vegan pot pie. It took quite a while to heat up (more than 10 min), When it arrived at the table, it was only lukewarm and cooled quickly. The pot pie was filling and crust tasty. More importantly, I did not experience any itching afterwards. J got the banana cream (but would have preferred it to be colder) and my friend F&L split a pecan pie (they raved over it). It is very pleasant to meet friends and sit at the long wooden table - if you're the only one waiting, you can reach into the reading bin and read "Farewell my Subaru". Parking isn't usually an issue on Mission Street (side streets are harder b/c filled with residents' cars). Note: pies are now $20 for a whole pie.
author: Grace C.

description: I think I'm in love. Cozy and intimate without being claustrophobic, all organic ingredients, and made with the love of a good cause. Pies are limited to what's in season - I can't wait for berries to come back around. In the meantime, I am having to resist going here every day lest the apple pie lose any of its magic prematurely as this place is also a sweet block from my house.
author: Sarah G.

description: A nice place for an afternoon snack. Good Walnut pie. Flakey crust. I can usually find a parking space near by.  The dining room is comfortable and has always been sunny on the afternoons I have been there. Pretty Good coffee.  Interesting looking people hanging out.  The pie is not bad. The overall experience is even better.
author: Mary H.

description: I love pie. I mean LOVE.  So much so that I went here for breakfast the other morning with a friend.  I know, pie for breakfast?  Who does that. Me, now step off. Anyway, it was delicious. I had the banana cream and my friend had the pear raspberry.  Both fab.  They forgot to make my my mocha but we reminded them and the lady (manager maybe?) was so gracious and kind, offering me a free muffin or pastry of some sort as an apology.  Will definitely be back!
author: Hannah F.

description:
Chicken pot pie was disappointing. The positive: the crust is excellent. Flaky and crunchy. I wish there was one on the bottom too. Though meaty, the filling is watery and bland. A richer, creamier mix would make this pie great.

The guy at the shop directed me to warm in a 300 degree oven for 8-10 minutes. Not nearly enough time or heat. After following his directions, I kept it in the oven for another 30 minutes at 400.
author: Hank D.

description: I'm insane. After stuffing myself with tacos, I waddled to the newly famous Mission Pie for a slice of pie and coffee. Thought I'd share a piece. Nope. Had an entire sweet potato slice to myself and the refill once coffee. I was in pie heaven. Tried a bit of the apple pie. Wow. Usually I'm mentally allergic to apples, but I could be swayed to temporary forget that insanity and just eat apple pie. Sigh! I'll be back.
author: Judy L.

description:
i read about this place in Ready Made and thought it was such a cool concept working with a local farm, who they employ, and who doesn't love pie? (ok, now really, if you don't love pie, who are you???)
so i made my friend take me here.  we both tried the Shaker Lemon pie as I was debating between that and the banana cream and was recommended the lemon.  We should have tried both.  I am all for trying new things, but there was something about eating whole lemons in a pie that didn't settle with me.  the crust was fantastic though - and whole wheat - who would have thought?! although i was disappointed, i would definitely try this place again - and to give them credit, it was spring, and if you are using local ingredients, you can't expect to have a berry pie when its not berry season. oh well.
author: Adriana K.

description:
Amazing deliciousness that lives up to all of the hype.

Needed to pick up some treats for a meeting nearby. Everyone recommended Mission Pie; and, they didn't steer me wrong. The walnut and the mixed-berry pies (each made from locally grown ingredients) were the hit of the meeting. Their work with area farms is also heartening as they clearly draw the connection between consumers and their food. 

Their staff say that each pie feeds about 6, but we managed to satiate many more than that ratio would allow with our two pies.  

Easy walking distance from the 16th and 24th / Mission BART stops. Bring your own bag if you go, bc they don't have any. 

Great mission; great pies: Hooray for Mission Pie!
author: Carmen I.

description:
Well hmm, I've tried several pies and though they've been good, this place hasn't knocked me off my socks yet. It might be that I just have a different sense of what makes a good pie. My taste for pie developed during a roughly ten year Texas residency. Southerners seem to like their baked goods moist and sweet. I remember eating the "best pie in town" during a vacation to Maine and...blech...what is this hard dense little thing? I imagine all those Maine folks vacationing in Texas (hah!) said "blech...what is this overly decadent saccharine mushy thing?"
That said, I think Mission Pie has more of an East Coast influence. My favorite so far is the strawberry rhubarb, the tart filling is the best I've had in the Bay (strawberry rhubarb is my pie litmus test).To me the banana cream isn't quite sweet or bananay enough and the pie crust doesn't say "dessert" enough. I could see it being a quiche crust.  I've never been a subtle dessert person. I want my pie to slap me in the face with its buttery sugary indulgent identity. I am pie hear me roar?
author: Hallie R.

description: It's hard to believe an establishment can survive on a single product offering, but these guys are doing it, and how.  Interesting setting, strange space near the machinations by the showcase glass and cash register lend to an awkward, wasted feel.  Though this is amended by the pair of awesome, archaic, wrought iron bar stools bolted at the counter facing Mission.  Neat pie filling combos like peach/blackberry and soylent green/human shepherd (just kidding) abound.  The crusts are an exquisite precise flake that crumble at the mere intention of a fork.  A $3 medium iced latte helped wash it all down.
author: Sam N.

description:
maybe i came at a bad time. it was saturday around 7pm. they had 2 slices left of pecan (not a fan of) and a muffin (blueberry). the coffee was incredibly strong (a plus). 

the decor is cute. 
i'm a pie fanatic ... but this place felt like it kind of left me hanging or didn't live up to its hype. i re-iterate ... MAYBE i came at a bad time, but it wasn't as great as i was led to believe it was. 

... kind of the same feeling i got when i thought the "PIE RANCH" was all about pie ... instead of a Ranch. it was just SHAPED as a pie. :/
author: Meryl Q.

description: I visit Mission Pie regularly for coffee and pie. It's tasty stuff, but I sometimes wish they had more flavor options to choose from. I know, I know -- they serve what's seasonal. That's  cool. I just sometimes wish they had, say, Blueberry. Or Cherry.  Maybe this summer? I'll be back, again and again, to find out!
author: Elle B.

description: Yum yum yum! A great cause and some great pie! We go here for work birthdays and any other excuse we can dig up... raspberry, pear, crumble top pie! Bring cash!!
author: Pam J.

description:
oh HELL YEAH!

best banana cream pie EVER. 

update 3/21/08: move over banana cream  - lemon shaker pie is now my new BFF.
author: eve l.

description: Oh Mission Pie! This is an adorable little pie shop in the Mission. The inside of the shop is relaxed, comfortable and cozy. The pies? Well, the pies are fantastic. I am a picky bitch when it comes to pies. I am nearly always left unsatisfied, because the pies are usually too sweet and the crusts seem mass manufactured.  However, Mission Pie makes a consistently good pie. All the ingredients are seasonal and locally grown. And the pies are fantastic. My favorite is the peach pie with a dollop of whipped cream. Simple, yet wonderful. My only wish is that we had a pie shop like this in Chicago.
author: Mary S.

description: So I'm at the new job and I offer to go buy bagels for the office, someone suggests pie instead and mentions this place (the last time I was there it was still a florist), the boss offers to put it on his card and I head off...so I get there and guess what: no CC's...ok, I can deal with that, small businesses not accepting Credit cards is inconvenient but understandable. So I get to the front of the line and I ask for an apple pie (that's what the boss had mentioned) and the woman at the counter gives me an annoyed look and says "we don't have apple pies, only apple rubard (sp?), you can look at the pies  we have here on the counter...next" . Are you serious? I thought. I didn't make a scene for getting treated like that, I mean I get better treatment at Starbucks! Needless to say, I walked out, told my co-workers how I got treated at this place and made it a point to let everyone else know.
author: J H.

description: I like them for their pies at lunch and for their cause.  When in the Mission and if I find parking, this is a good cheap stop for a lunch-pie
author: V T.

description:
I've fallen and I can't get up!  Yes, that's the way I want to treat this place.  Mission Pie is simply heaven when you stroll in and feel the warmth of the pies (after your banana cream or raspberry or apple pie, you quickly feel that sensation, which is physiologically comparable to a stroke, is the euphoric cloud that drapes over you).  Coffee, you need this, both to wash what God just served you as pie and to rouse that constriction you're gripped by, will makes things all better.
This place has sentimental value for me, but please don't let that stop you from enjoying P.I.E.
FYI: if you keep missing out on banana cream when you get there, try calling and ordering an entire pie to take home.  They've said that many folks have began calling and putting dibs on a pie as early as 12-2pm.  It's something to think about for that next dinner party you might go to and want to delight your company with by presenting this to them.
Eat pie, it's creamy good.
author: felix c.

description:
after my first bite into their banana cream pie, i knew i was in love!!! the BEST banana cream pie EVER!!! EVER!!! total mouth orgasm! you could tell someone made this with love. the bananas were perfectly ripe, and the cream and whipped cream topping melted together in your mouth so wonderfully. and the buttery crust with a hint of salt was such a wonderful finish.

some friends brought it over the other day and the 4 of us devoured the whole pie, there was maybe one tiny slice left. i realized i had to find out more about them and checked out their website and come to find out what an amazing organization it is. keep up the great work!!!
author: Jennifer L.

description: Mission Pie -- not to be confused with the pizza place "Pi" down the street -- not only offers delicious sweet (and savory!) pies for reasonable prices, but they also support local youth in some fashion. I'm not sure what that has to do with their pies, but the pies are GOOD.
author: Steve L.

description:
continuing on from our fat kid sunday trails, we stopped by from lunch across the street at el farrolito and BFF dee and i both ordered banana creme pie and some milk. damn, the crust alone gets 80 gazillion stars. i admit that the banana filling was a bit lumpy and not as sweet as anticipated, but together as a pie pie it was delicious. we rolled out toting pregnancy-looking bellies and then shopped at big lots totally comatose. all in all, it was a posi experience.

my only sadness is that there was a severe lack in anything related to a berry - no raspberry, blueberry, or my beloved strawberry. there was ginger pear on the menu but i would ask for some berry love to be thrown up in that business for some extra love.
author: Jenz y.

description: I like coming here to relax in the evening. The atmosphere is casual and comforting, and there is complementary water for you. The establishment attempts to be eco friendly, offering local honeys and products for sale and has recycling bins for trash disposal.Their pies are delicious, and there are great vegan options as well. You can get quiche, veggie pot pie, potato salad, etc. but I'd go for the pies. I personally like the mixed berry pie with whip. Their coffee is good as well.
author: Heleena H.

description: Good banana cream pie, but thin.  Not enough layers of the good stuff.  Crust is OK, nothing to write home about.  Prices are very reasonable; friendly & comfortable atmosphere. Wouldn't go out of my way, but I'd stop in if passing by.
author: Jerry G.

description: Mission pie is good, but by no means great. I've tried the banana cream, the mixed berry, and the peach. The banana cream was ok, as was the mixed berry. The peach pie was actually quite good. The crust was a bit lacking on all of them though. If you need pie and you're nearby, then it is a good option. Otherwise a real bakery is probably a better bet.
author: Evan B.

description: A whole pie is $18.00! Call me cheap, but I think thats a lot of money for a medium apple pie! I thought to myself, "This better be some damn good pie!"   I took the pie home "fresh from the oven" and was suprised that it wasn't what I thought it would be.  The taste was good, however, the apples on the inside were mushy and the crust was thin.  Aesthetically, it looked beautiful though.  I'll try again this spot again, but choose a different pie.
author: Josie W.

description: I was driving down 25th and saw this neon sign saying "Eat Pie"...and how could I resist?  I left with two slices of pie, one was the Strawberry Rhubarb which was AWESOME, and the other was this apple thing that just came out of the oven.  The banana cream looked inviting...hell...all of them looked good.  Cool thing is that they are open late...well..relatively late (9pm?) for a pie store.  Service was fantastic.  By the way, it's more on 25th than it is on Mission...just follow the signs that they have on the sidewalk.  Mission Pie...Marie Callendar's got nothing on you!
author: Mark D.

description: It's sort of an inconspicuous joint, off the main drag (Mission St.) and located underneath a house or something. The pies and other assorted pastries are displayed out in front and the cashier also tells you whether a certain type of pie is still available or not. Everything looked great and worth trying...so I opted for something that I've never even had before, ever--the strawberry rhubarb pie. Brought it to work and it was definitely a hit! Was the perfect afternoon snack. Next: the Walnut pie w/FRESH cream. Mmm, can't wait.
author: Chris C.

description: This is the sort of place that really benefits from sites like yelp - tiny, impossible to find (go around the corner from Mission street), and absolutely amazingly delicious.  I am a pie obsessive to the extreme, and this place fulfilled all my expectations of the perfect pie experience.
author: Jess L.

description:
Birthday pie is what I wanted, and that's what I got.  My co-workers threw a little work time celebration for me (thanks guys!)  The main attraction was this gorgeously whipped banana cream pie.  I'm not a big banana fan, but sweet cream pie....yum.  
I've inherited my mother's cake cutting skills, so I was first to slice.  It went easy, the crust was thick, not too flaky, and I was able to dish out the first one in a single sweep.
There could actually be a tad more bananas in the custard.  The whipped top was scrumptious.  Anything with fresh whip cream is amazing.
Last night after dinner, my friends and I ended up to the shop for some sweet treats.  We shared the banana cream, and also the pear ginger.  The pear had great flavor, ginger glaze bursting and lovely pear texture.  The crust wins in my book.  I've grown up with my aunt's amazing pie baking skills, and this crust is very good.  It's not too dense, it's not too light....yum.
The servers are cute, and were helpful.  
I asked about an a la mode.....(curiosity factor)....they don't do it.  They do offer whipped cream....maybe next time.
mmmmm whipped cream
Would love to try Strawberry or blackberry sometime.
author: ERICA E.

description: It seems like I have to come here again after I haven't been here ever since 2007's August. Oh I do miss their pies. I would not mind paying $3.50 for just a slice of environmentally conscious pie. Also I wouldn't mind eating the creme from Mission pie because it is organic! and everything basically is organic. The fruits that they have for sale seem to look rustic and sweet! Their banana cream pie is just heavenly! The bananas are not cooked at all? I am not sure, but it does not taste like it has been cooked because it is firm like how a banana should taste. Their rhubarb pie is not my taste, I thought it was a strawberry pie since it was pink! But it was rhubarb and it is kind of sour, but some people do like it. Their fruit tart is de-lic-ious! Their pumpkin pie taste really good, but I felt like it was missing some more spices, but you can taste REAL pumpkin in it! not like those canned pumpkins! I love their crust because it is made so that the crust is plenty-ful and I mostly eat pies for their crust.
author: Janet Z.

description: My experience at Mission Pie was nothing short of 5 stars. Beyond their amazing pie they have a variety of delicious baked goods. I had my slice with a scoop of vanilla bean ice cream, it was incredible! Their service was great (the nice fellow with the short dark hair and beard) and the prices were surprisingly cheap. This relaxed, homey atmosphere makes for the perfect sweet-tooth hotspot!
author: Chad H.

description: Good pies - not as many varieties as I expected, but what they had was tasty.  Apple was quite good, although the crust was a bit harder than I thought is ideal.  Our friends had banana cream pie, which was also good.  The staff offered to let us try their shaker lemon, which was really quite excellent.  The fresh whipped cream is also an excellent touch.  Fun place to hang out for some dessert.
author: Michelle C.

description: So, the business model for Mission Pie is so cool that I would support them even if the pie sucked. Happily that is not the case. Great pie!!!
author: Ryan C.

description: The roommie and I ventured out to find Mission Pie when his blood sugar level got too low. Luckily they had a small sign propped up on the sidewalk or else we would have never found the place. Quaint little joint with a few tables to sit at. One was occupied by a "Make a Valentine" station, which seemed somewhat wasteful considering the already lack of space. We were hoping for a selection of savory pies because they sounded neat but they only had spinach-cheese or vegetable-curry. They were okay but nothing special. The sweet pies looked much more tasty. I think I would have to go back a couple more times to really get into this place. Props for being original and not another taqueria!
author: Susan L.

description: I love this place! Everything's really fresh and tastes homemade. The crust is nice and thin, there's good filling to crust ratio, and the sweetness is just enough so that the fresh fruit flavor doesn't get lost.
author: E. M.

description: What a great small place to get a homemade piece of pie after dinner and a diffucult day.Its open till 9 on a weekday, i had a amazing pear rasberry yum yum . I will be back soon when im craving pie
author: Chris D.

description: as close to the pie hole in pushing dasies as you can get. order slices of pie at the counter and feast. had the banana cream and a vegan blackberry... pear? dont remember. it was more like a crumble. but so very delicious. their chai tea wasnt great. very very strong. but delicious pies.
author: Pat D.

description: I have found my new addiction! The best apple pie I've tried so far; it was even good in room temperature, and I'm sure it'll taste even better warmed up. Also tried the persimmon ricotta tart. My goodness... I'm hooked. The pie and tart have the right amount of sweetness. I love.. love Mission Pie! =) One advice though... please fix the sign on Mission St. Wouldn't even know it's it had I not make a turn on 25th Ave. Will definitely be a regular. =P
author: Poof S.

description: bring cash or check and just go... not one thing Ive eaten there was not truly yummy. Go and find out for yourself!!!!!
author: Jennifer H.

description: This a great little pie shop. If you've had pecan pie before, then you'll fall in love with their "walnut pie".  The shop has great assortment of teas.
author: Juanita P.

description: so good! and it's for a good cause too.  Very cute decor, friendly staff and the pie (I had Raspberry Pear) was one of the best I've ever had.
author: Carla G.

description:
eat pie.  really good organic fair trade coffee...  sometimes they sell their own fresh picked fruits. 

and it's a non-profit
author: Erika Y.

description:
finally made it here today.   nice, quaint & cozy 'lil cafe.  

3 stars for the pie & 1 star for community support

i really wanted to LOVE this place but unfortunately it wasn't a rock my world experience, especially after having a huge slice of warmed up ollalieberry pie a la mode from duarte's tavern in pescadero a few days ago..........now this pie still stands as THE BOMB of pies & is a TOTAL ROCK MY WORLD experience that had me mmmm-mmm- moan--ing!!!!!!!!! (check out my duarte's tavern review).  price note:  duarte's huge slice of ollalieberry pie a la mode is $7.50 compared to $3.50 slice of mission pie sans a la mode.  now i need to try duarte's  pecan pie so that i can compare it to mission pie's walnut pie.  stay tuned for the walnut/pecan mission pie/ duarte's comparison update..............

had a slice of  banana cream pie everyone is raving about, a slice of the walnut pie w/ a dopple of fresh whipped cream, 2 bites of the strawberry-rhubarb pie w/ a cup of the goat something coffee....... 

- banana cream pie was fresh, smooth & light in texture, not too sweet & yummee........though i'm not big on  banana cream pies, it is one of the best ones  i've had which is comparable to the banana cream tart i've had @ tartine.  

- walnut pie (think pecan pie, but w/ walnuts) was also yummee......love that it was light in texture & not too sweet.   top of pie was perfectly carmelized & was a bit crispy..........& a  dopple of fresh whipped cream was a nice touch to this pie.

-- 2 bites of strawberry rhubarb -- 1st bite was wake up my senses & make a face tart & 2nd was nice smiling sweet......may be good a la mode or w/ whip cream........ 

-- cup of goat something coffee (forgot the full name), which  went really well w/ both slices of the banana cream pie & walnut pie..............
author: Cindi N.

description: We tried the peach galette and a slice of apricot/almond tart.  The peach galette was better, but it was a bit pricey - $5.50 for a small pie.  The apricot/almond tart is too moist, so it was just "OK" for me.  I like the vibe of the store, which is wrapping up the renovation.  It's spacious and comfortable, good for coffee and dessert/snack.  I gave it a 3 star because I expected more given it had average of 4.5 stars.  I'd recommend trying it and we'll probably go ahead when we're in the neighborhood, but probably won't go out of our way to go there again.
author: Irene C.

description: Peach/raspberry: dang good. Banana cream: orgasmic. Lame pun intended, if you like.
author: Maximillian M.

description: i need more walnut pie!  i went back twice in one week, the 2nd time to get a whole one and share with my friends.  the slight bitter of walnut goes well with sweet but the gooey stuff in this pie is not super sweet like most pecan pies are. all my friends can't stop thinking about it.  had a slice of banana cream pie and wasn't impressed. we think we got an old slice cuz the bottom layer was jello texture, not creamy/pudding.  the lemon pie was not what i expected. had whole slices of lemon, including rind.  overall from what i've tried, the pies aren't too sweet but the crust is nice and flaky and tastes even better when heated.
author: C L.

description: Yay! I'm a fan...they bake their own pies, how could I not be. Good coffee, great desserts.
author: Brittani M.

description: Excellent pie. Forgive the awkward service and for God's sake, try the banana cream pie.
author: Alex R.

description: If I ever get married I'm going to serve pie, not cake.  Am not getting married, so I just eat pie anyway.  Bought a small banana cream after the Southern Exposure opening Friday night. Did not have a fork so I just ate it with my hands like a hobo. I love pie.  And coffee.
author: Lisa R.

description:
visited mission pie on Christmas eve with a great friend as yet another friend graciously watched our kids. we went for coffee which was really worth it for the price. we had the green zebra coupon so we got two complimentary slices of pie which really sweetened the deal. otherwise, it is 3.50 per slice.i had the pear blueberry pie which was so good. nice, fresh tasting whole halves of pears with blueberries, loved that it was not too sweet, the crust was buttery and flaky with a granola/crisp type of topping. My friend had the walnut pie which was decadent! Will definitely return for more and try the savory pies too!
love the nice warm feel inside and loved chatting away with my friend, a perfect  unexpected Christmas gift, esp. from a friend who doesn't celebrate this holiday .also love that this is also partly run by high school students. Yet another reason why i love living in the Mission!
author: heather z.

description: Bigger place now, too bad not more pie! Always seem to be out of what I'm in the mood for.  Fortunately, there is always something I haven't tried yet.  Great lady owner and nice people staff Mission Pies.  I found it to be more of a warm and cozy place when it was around the corner.  The gardening and columbine story was prominently featured.  No matter, I still make it a point to get my pie fix here whenever I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Steve K.

description: Mission Pie is a-okay.  They are a very positive organization from supporting fair trade/organic coffee producers to collaborating with youth advocacy organization to providing quality jobs to local youngsters.  Their beautiful corner space is quaint, cute, and mildly rustic.  Their location is just one block from the 24th Street Mission BART station, making it an easy dessert stop for visitors like myself.  The pies are fresh and mildly creative.  We went with a slice of banana cream and a slice of shaker lemon.  Both pies were kind of clumsy looking, making it feel as though the pie production was a little amateurish.  My wife and I differed on our favorite pie.  She liked the banana cream best, though I thought it lacked the richness that I am accustomed to in a great banana cream.  She hated the bitter rinds in the shaker lemon, while I enjoyed the contrasting flavors of tart, sweet and bitter in that pie.  All in all, I say this place alright - a great pitstop after a dinner in the mission district.
author: Thomas S.

description: Amazing banana cream pie... walnut was pretty damn good too. Can't wait to go back and sample others (including the savory pies).
author: Sarah B.

description: Mission Pie is super tasty.  My first taste was a piece of pear raspberry pie that my fiance brought home for our anniversary to top off my home-cooked meal.  It was super, the crust was sweet, flaky and just crispy enough.  The sweetness balanced out the fruit inside which was delicious but not overly sweet (which is a good thing).  Since then I've been there twice to pick up treats for my group at the office when we're celebrating someone's birthday.  The scones are the best - but the little pecan tartlet and mini-apple pie bits are great too.  Go there for something special, or just because you walk by the sign on Mission and can't resist like the rest of us.
author: Kristen H.

description: Mission Pie can really only be defined as "cute." I don't like that word but it fits here. The little shop serves excellent pie for all shapes and sizes of people. To-go pies are fun for a picnic, in particular.
author: R K.

description: Best darn slice of Banana Cream pie I have had.  I just like supporting this place because of the purpose of why they run the shop, and darn good pie.  Not much room at this place, but I hear they're expanding.  I must eat more pie at this place.
author: Ed Y.

description: I hate pies but I love mission pie. It is soooo good. The pies are great and they allow the natural sweetness of the fruits to do the work. It doesn't taste like sugar which is a revelation to me. I'm converted. I might actually like pies now.
author: Andy L.

description: Last Night, Me and My Family went to Mission Pie for our first time,  It was pretty awkward but yet pleasant, The employees were pretty rude, they didn't even smile back at the customer. As we ordered our 2 Mochas & A HC, We sat down near the entrance, it was pretty cozy and sleazy, Very Home welcoming. My Hot Chocolate arrived about 6-7 mins, As i was tasting it, I asked for Whip cream, but the Whip cream was FOAM! The hot chocolate tasted horrible, the size of my hot chocolate was ridiculously small, but when My sister got her Mocha, my Mom questioned about the size of the cup, Cause to be honest I think we were getting ripped off( we all ordered medium sized cups ), the employees explained why the size was small, which was kind of reasonable and unreasonable. As my mom and sister tasted the mocha, they said  It felt like they were drinking hot water with foam, we left the store, and threw away the Mochas and HC, It tasted that horrible, I would of went to a Chinese Donut store and buy a HC For 1.75 with a good medium sized cup.
author: Edwin H.

description: I had high expectations after reading all the reviews. I went there and pick up an apple pie. It was good but could be better. The crust was delicious. The pie is small for the price ($18). I would definitely go back there and try some of their other pies, but it would probably be in the morning went they are nice and hot.
author: Henry L.

description:
one word UH MAZING!
seriously people check this place out! be sure to hit the gym right after!
author: Richard K.

description: Had to try it after reading all the rave reviews, but I am not sure what all the fuss is about.  Bought a whole banana cream pie to take home.  After waiting at least 3 minutes for the girl at the counter to even acknowledge us, she acted as if we were bothering her...and then the pie was just so, so.  Everybody who thinks this is the best pie they have ever eaten must have had mothers who didn't cook.  Skip Mission Pie and spend your money on a St. Honore Rum Cake at Dianda's just down the street!
author: Linda R.

description: vegan peach pie = YES.
author: kate s.

description: Being a baker who has often failed to make a successful pie crust, I can't tell you how excited I am to have this place... not just in the city, but in my very neighborhood!  I'm always excited about finding a place to sit and snack and drink good coffee for hours at a time, but to have such great pie -- and for such a worthy cause -- is just beyond-the-pale fantastic.  Eat pie!
author: Kyle M.

description:
look, everything is a five but the coffee, and mission pie can't help that it is blocks from the superior coffee joint.

so what makes it a five if not the coffee?

the pie, duh.  it is sublime.  the fruit pies are the perfect sweetness that comes only from organic, ripe, delicious fruit.  

the creaminess of the banana cream pie sends my pal racing the clock to get there before the teenagers working the counter have to go home for the night.

and, even though the smaller pies really could be for two distinct servings, you really hope your mate only wants one or two bites, or your two servings are only punctuated by a brief, deeply relaxed breath, rather than by hours and a meal or two.

but oh well, they are damn good pies.

and the seed-to-table hands-on work experience the youth are getting through the program?  that is a business  where i am happy to put my dollar.   yay, pie.
author: Kate M.

description:
Reading the reviews here, I'm wondering if my fellow yelpers might be mistaking its good intentions for the taste. It might very well be a good cause, but does the food taste good enough to keep coming back?

I had high hopes when this place opened. It's not too difficult to make good, American-style fruit desserts, and there wasn't really a place in my the immediate neighborhood that pulled it off.

My first big complaint is that not all of their creations are that good, and any particular creation may suffer from inconsistent quality. Apple pie, banana cream pie and strawberry tortes tend to be pretty good, but apricot tortes can be downright bad. While the fruit filling is pretty consistent over time, the crust is not--sometimes it can be undercooked (and thus doughy) or too salty and not buttery enough.

My second big complaint is the lack of consistency in what's available. Do they just decide what they feel like making for the day and make it? Why else would so many popular things be out of stock so often? The lack of attention to customers' desires baffles me. I'd go there more often if I knew I had a good chance of getting one of my favorite desserts.

My last complaint is that, given the quality issues, the prices are too high. They sometimes charge more than Noe Valley Bakery & Bread, which is a truly professional, consistently fantastic outfit.

If it's open and you can make the trip, I'd recommend Noe Valley Bakery & Bread over Mission Pie any day. But if it's after 6 or 7 pm, or you don't feel like making your way up the hill (or, I suppose, you want to sit and eat your pie where you buy it), Mission Pie is an acceptable alternative.
author: Jared B.

description: Real whipped cream?!  Found this little cafe on my way to pick up a straightening iron.  I've used the iron once.  I've been back to Mission Pie at least once, usually twice a week since then.  No plans to quit.  The best freaking pie, lovely customer service.  Did I say real whipped cream already?  The kids and other young folks that work there are great - can't say enough good things about the place.  Oh, except that one time I went in with my mom right as they were closing, and the woman behind the counter let us eat and gave us a free coupon for free pie *and* a coffee because the slice was on the smaller side.  Not that we were complaining.  Try the lemon one.  I joined yelp just so I could rave about them.
author: Ria F.

description: I love their new location!  The pie is really good but i mostly come here for a $1 coffee in the morning.  they brew taylor maid farms -- yum!!
author: Charly G.

description: I really wanted to like this place but the banana cream pie was disappointing. The flavor was bland and unmemorable. I love pie crust but this one was doughy and gross. I don't know if it was an off day given all the raving reviews here but I was left craving something more.
author: Keromi K.

description: I love pie, and hopefully won't spend my whole paycheck on it, which is hard, considering how close I am to Mission pie.  Their pumpkin pie is to die for and is almost as good as my mother's, and the pear cranberry is also delicious.  Their coffee is pretty good too, and you'll need it so you don't go into a pie coma.  A little more expensive than I'd like, but that's the price I must pay for a little slice of heaven.
author: Julia M.

description: The pies are not bad but I had a bad experience with their customer service.  Make sure you ask for a receipt, if you don't, you might be told that you never paid for it.  That's what happened to me.  So I'll take my business elsewhere.  Dianda's Italian bakery down the street is an incredible alternative.
author: Eduardo M.

description: Everyone was raving about this place so I went to get pies for the holidays. Bought five pies for my two brothers and their family members, my uncle's family, my aunt's family and one for my immediate family. I had a chance to taste 3 out of 5 and overall, I was disappointed. The apple pie was my least favorite. The apple slices were too big to eat and it tasted like apple with some syrup on top of it. The banana cream pie wasn't anything special and even fact I've had better. Also the price for these pies were expensive.
author: Lisa S.

description: beautiful, lovely pies. Good cause. Nice location. What's not to like?
author: Fred A.

description: Mission Pie is awesome. Not only is their pie absolutely delicious, they are a socially conscious organization working to empower local youth. I especially love the Ginger Pear and the Walnut Pie.
author: Jen R.

description:
sometimes i wish that mission pie was further than a one minute walk from my house for fear of becoming hugely obese and diabetic. although if this does happen i'll somehow magically retain the ability to walk my fat diabetic ass that half block for more pie.

that's how good it is.
author: adams l.

description:
My oh my I do love me Mission Pie!  I've been coming here since it first opened it was on 25th instead of right on Mission.  I'm ecstatic to see it doing so well with its location change, more people seem to be noticing it and liking it.  Good for you people.

I give them 4 stars b/c of: their mission, the atmosphere, the owner, the people who work there.  Especially Howie.  He makes one hell of a soy iced latte.  And great conversation.  And he has awesome chops.  I sometimes go in there just for him.  Because I don't actually even eat the pie anymore.  That's why I have to give them 4 stars instead of the otherwise well deserved 5- no vegan pie ;-(  But I am assured that vegan pies are coming when the new, larger kitchen (in the aforementioned old space) is ready.  But in the meantime, Howie and his glorious coffee drinks and awesome chops can hold me over and I will continue to return to Mission Pie.
author: lil' t.

description: Right on! And if you really love pies, visit the source at Pie Ranch, where all the ingredients are grown. Practically across the street from Ano Nuevo State park on Highway One. They have a pie stand, and sell other organic veggies as well!
author: jay C.

description: Oh yeah, it's official I LOVE PIE.. and I love this place.. Everyone should go to Mission Pie and have....well of course PIE! :-)
author: Honey C.

description:
OH MY GODDDDDD!

we stopped by mission pie to get coffee on our evening run to a bar...and at the last moment i ordered a slice of banana cream pie...

this was the best pie i've EVER tasted, banana custard (no chunks) with fresh whipped cream on top  ( i do wish the crust was baked a bit more but...)  just the perfect amount of sugar, not nauseatingly sweet... i've been dreaming about this pie... all the way down here in los angeles.

i wonder if they deliver :S
author: betty k.

description:
Just a little disappointed in their pie selection.
For as long as they have been open, they carry the same old pies.
I would love to try some blueberry, lemon meringue, chocolate, cherry, or rhubarb pies. Anything other than what they have.
author: Cate M.

description:
I can't help but be incredibly grateful to live in a community where Mission Pie is able to exist.  A pie shop is pretty obscure and when I first heard of it I thought it was some sort of sex store.  It is not, it is better:
You can't go wrong with anything you order here.
You won't get crabs.
author: pauline e.

description: I'm pretty much biased about this place cuz it's just a block from my apartment but Mission Pie rocks cuz of it's location (close to BART), it's yummy pies, great coffee (you gotta try their Goat Rock Roast!), and a very nice friendly atmosphere. Big windows with lots of sun, great place to meet friends or write a school paper. Only downside is that they don't have any wifi at all but if you're writing and don't need the distraction from the Internet then this is your place!
author: Izzy A.

description: This place sucks! I went after someone on yelp raved about the banana cream pie......I had it and it was the WORSE banana cream pie I've had!! It tasted like pudding from a box mix!
author: e c.

description: I rolled in here by accident. It was at night and I was with a friend, I had a really bad sweet tooth, as usual, and I was looking for anything to soothe me. I saw this place and it looked crowded so the first thought I had was that there had to be something good in there. I take my ass in there only to realize they have PIE! I felt like jumping and clapping and cheering. I held this all back ofcourse. I glanced over the options and there it was! My soulmate, raspberry peach cobbler.The perfect most beautiful combination of fruits. I quickly ordered and sat with my friend.I took a bite and looked up at my friend with what I could only imagine were eyes that were fully dialated and looking as though they were tearing up. I took a but out of that pie and knew instantly that me and Mission Pie were going to have a relationsip. The pie was perfectly sweet, crisp buttery flaky crust. The fruit inside was so perfect and soft. I devoured that pie in a matter of minutes.I'm usually a very slow eater but magically this pie was gone quickly.I've come three more times since then and each time I fall more deeply in love. The only thing I did not like was the whipped cream. Other then that I'm one happy camper.
author: Peeta B.

description: For some bizarre reason, the past two days have been a veritable pie-pocalypse amongst me and my friends.  I'm not exactly sure how it happened, I think Icka baked a pie for Josh, then he twittered about it, then someone threatened to steal it, then the twitterverse exploded in a veritable piegasm.  Everything from the Peculiar Purple Pieman of Porcupine Peak (Strawberry Shortcake's nemesis) to Warrant's seminal Cherry Pie video were invoked in a day-long, unwinnable contest to proffer the most profound pie-related promulgation.  It may come as no surprise, but this caused my mind (and stomach) to wander towards the idea of actually consuming pie, instead of trading 140 character messages about it.  This led me to MIssion Pie, which offers both fantastic pies and a fantastic mission statement.  Ultra fresh ingredients and ultra fresh baked goods make for some damn fine desserting, and they also offer some interesting looking savory pies (which will be sampled at a later date).  At $18 a pie, it comes out as a little pricey, so I'm reserving a 5th star until I sample more of their wares.
author: Steve G.

description: i have only tried their banana cream pie. an office mate brought it in to work. it was sooooooooooo good. i only wish they had another location cuz it's a bit far for me to trek to get some pie. Seriously, try it!
author: Wendy L.

description: We tried a slice of the banana cream pie and I can't wait to go back for the raspberry-peach or walnut. My older guy is looking forward to the fall in hopes of finding a pumpkin pie there. I am so happy that a business like this is a short walk away and will definitely get a pie here instead of our usual place the next time we head to a potluck or contribute to a teacher luncheon.
author: Amy O.

description: pie? in the mission? i couldn't believe my eyes when i saw the sign advertising pie on mission and 25th. i had sweet potato pie which was pretty good, and i'll be back to try banana cream because it looked delicious. not only is the pie good, but it's also good for the community.
author: Oleya P.

description: Don't get me wrong, both of their sweet and savory pies are very tasty. I only wish they don't add extra inedible stuffs in the pie fillings. I can never forget the moment seeing my husband spitting out rusty pennies from a bite of their banana cream pie. Yuck.
author: Mary S.

description:
MEH, is all that comes to mind...my love and i decided to head over to mission pie after work today, after passing by  a few times recently, and reading all the great reviews; we decided it was a must try asap...what a let down!  it blows my mind how many mediocre to less than restaurants are still in bussiness, aND doing great business at that.  the one huge plus that i give to mission pie is their dedication to helping the community by employing at risk kids and supporting local sustainable farms....so maybe i'd go back just to support this type of business that this country is in desperate need of so much more...
we had the potato and artichoke pie...MEH
we had the chard, garlic, and bechamel tart..MEH
we had the vegan pear and blueberry pie...MEH but better than the savory pies..
we had the lemon shaker pie...i SPIT my bite out as quickly as possible...as a lover of tangy lemon desserts, but also someone who makes the most spectacular citrus desserts,...i am very selective...i know what i like...this pie was horrible....i guess i should have asked what was in a shaker lemon pie, never having one before...aside from the flavor being terrible it also has lots of slices o lemon rind in it...weird and gross...
author: lc m.

description: What a great little hole-in-the-wall find! After drinks at El Rio, a gang of us decided we wanted pie. So we wondered over to Mission Pie for some of the best dessert action I've had in a while. We each got something different, but all were delicious. I had the Banana Cream. One person had Strawberry Rhubarb, and another had the Walnut. Let me just say, the walnut pie won, hands down. It's like pecan pie, but, with, well... walnuts. The prices were reasonable. The space is small though, so you may be better off getting an entire pie to take home with you, or it could also be the perfect ending for a wonderful date that you want to make last a little longer.
author: Andrew T.

description: I've walked by this place too many times with empty pockets and a mean hankering for some pie, but today was different. Today i cashed my paycheck and made a b-line to mission pie and for $3.50 i bought my first  slice of heaven.  They know how to make a pie here. The staff was cool and very helpful to me in making my decision. "Try the apple pie dude"
author: Daniel B.

description: pi day 2012 super wet and rainy and blegh. decided to make the trek from fidi and get pies (11 to be exact) for the office, and glad i did. while we were waiting for our pies to be prepared (slicing each into 8 pieces), we decided to split a mini pie, which they gave to us on the house in honor of pi day (and maybe the $250+ worth of pie we had already bought)! it was absolutely delicious. and the banana cream is to die for.
author: Lia A.

description:
Update: I'be been back here a few times since i wrote my original review and I've enjoyed their seasonal variations, especially their pear ginger pie which is on right now and it's very ginger-y and pear-y and the crust is, while dense, still very flavorful. However, I really, really have a bone to pick: I think the woman who owns this place is unnecessarily unfriendly, to the point of seeming almost hostile. She walks in and out, in and out, like she owns the place (well, she does), her boots thudding on Mission Pie's nice wood floors, and she not once SMILES, not once. Nor does she acknowledge the folks sitting there reading, eating, whatever.... In fact, she almost seems to be not indifferent but actively unfriendly. And as I left last time, I saw her sitting outside, and she just looked at me without a smile or a wave or anything, which I thought was particularly problematic as I had been sitting there, watching her stomp in and out, for over an hour. OK fine, I know that her business is for a wonderful cause and I know that she is doing wonderful things for the community (although I hated the article in the SF Chronicle that mentioned over 3 times that the kids working there have "special needs" or are in "special education"-- hello?"), The bottom line is,  I think some friendliness might also be nice too. 




The pie is super yummy and it seems like they add new flavors everytime I go. And they've also added a VEGAN muffin although they haven't had it everytime I've been. The coffee is great-- super strong and flavorful. I just feel that $3.50 a slice is a bit expensive for a slice of pie and so I feel guilty every time I come here. Yes, I know it's for a good cause and it's nice to see local folks working here (although, I have to say, I've only seen a high school student once-- all the other times it has been mission hipsters and the woman who seemingly runs the place-- she always has a laptop and doesn't come across as super friendly but maybe she is just shy.)
author: Michele F.

description:
nothing special, not the best, not even that great.  but then again, i bake great pies so if i am buying it, it has to be better than mine. :P

wouldn't ever go again.
author: tc h.

description: http://www.weebl.jolt.co.uk/pie.htm
author: Dario B.

description: i love the mission of mission pie: putting kids to work out on the farm and teaching them to bake. delicious organic yumminess yay! we had pumpkin, which was silky good. no can here - straight from the patch fresh pumpkin. coulda used a touch more pumpkin pie spice. also tried pear-ginger - YUM. i'm totally not a fan of pie but love what they got going on here.
author: Mary V.

description: This isn't Baker's Square. You won't get the big sugary gelatinous mess o' pie. You will get fresh and natural fruit pies with refined, concentrated flavors; all intensely delicious.
author: Mr. C.

description: yum! love this place. great chicken pot pie, nice atmosphere. note they don't accept credit cards.
author: Sarah Y.

description: mmmm healthy grilled veggie salad with beets and carrots....savory bread pudding with asparagus, lemon pie (with the rind in).  i saw some yummy looking banana cream pie come out of the kitchen.  this is a great space with art and healthy eats.  the whole concept of bringing organic food to the city, making jobs for teenagers and appreciating where your food comes from is something that has been lost.  i go just to support the attitude of respecting the tradition of food preparation.
author: regina k.

description: MISSION PIE! PIE ON A MISSION! Ok, I only write reviews of places that I am obsessed with, and that includes Mission Pie. Because not only do they make extraordinarily delicious pie (I recommend Banana Cream and Shaker Lemon) but also they are busy saving the world. And what could be a better combination than pie and saving the world?
author: Alisa W.

description: For some reason I thought I had already written a review of Mission Pie. After all, I have regular hankerings for banana cream pie for breakfast (like today for example!) and I just can't get enough of their hand whipped cream (but then again, anything related to whipping would catch my attention- ha!). All the pies I've tasted have been delectable: sweet potato pie, meyer lemon pie (thinly sliced meyer lemon pieces soaked in sugar water overnight, then slathered between layers of pie crust then topped with, you guessed it! hand whipped cream), strawberry rhubarb pie, berry pie and my favorite of all, banana cream pie. And what's more, they are directly related to Pie Ranch, which practices sustainable agriculture, provides leadership training and education to youth and gets them to be more in touch with growing your own food. Shade grown coffees abound in their selection of beverages (i'm a sucker for shade grown). Nope, I definitely cannot shut my pie hole enough about Mission Pie.
author: ray e.

description: dangerously close to work and home, figure the rest out . raspberry pear ,. banana cream , sugar sugar sugar ,love it
author: NAEL K.

description: i agree with all the comments about the friendly ambience, etc.  and i like the pie fillings ok, too.  but come on, where's the crust?  these crusts are flavorless and dry.  i mean, when you think about great pies, or when you hear people talk about great pies of their pasts, what's the first thing they mention:  THE CRUST.  you can open a can of canned gooey, yucky apple-pie filling from safeway and turn it into magic with a great crust, but for some reason, mission pie is happy to serve up these average (a generous description) crusts.  i don't get it.  (NOTE:  i haven't tasted any of their savory offerings.)  still it's a good place to sit, nurse a cup of coffee and watch the comings and goings.
author: jake d.

description: Pies ok (tried Banana cream, ginger pear, apple) and served as SMALL slices. Receive confused looks from behind the counter when I asked if they could warm my pie slice. Lady in charge the morning I went seemed really irritated, impatient, and bossy (towards others behind the counter). Latte was not very good at all!
author: E M.

description: Wonderfully intimate. Awesome pies/pastries. If they had hot chocolate they would get my five stars.
author: Tom R.

description: I had a blueberry muffin here.  It wasn't great. -a lot of blueberries but kind of dry.  I would consider coming back to actually try pie.
author: Anne G.

description: hands down the "best banana cream pie" anywhere...
author: William W.

description: I went to Mission Pie  Shop today because a co-worker said the pie was awesome. Having grown up in the Mission I thought I'd give them a try. When I reched the counter I asked the counterperson what kind of pie they had today. Since there were no visible signs and I could see a cream pie.The woman at the counter said "the pies in the case"....That was alot of help since they were covered with a top crust....I couldn't see inside them...so I chose a banana cream pie since I could see the cream...No problem! maybe the pie is really terrific...I could excuse her for being vauge and rude. For each piece of pie I cut for the family we all got one slice of banana and it cost us 18.00$ for this pie....Now I'm a great pie maker and I think I'll take my next 18.00$ and make a really awesome pie for less than 18.00$ Lean to make a pie !and save the time going to bussineses that treat you like a customer.
author: bette r.

description: they have a really nice tea selection, quiet atmosphere, and some very nice   youngsters who work the counter and don't harass you at closing time.  the other night a friend and i walked in close to closing, but they let us stay while we finished our tea.  my fave pies are banana cream and walnut.  i found the strawberry rhubarb a little too tart, and would have liked more sweet.  in general though it's nice that the pies are not too sugary, you can really savor the fruit.
author: wendy p.

description: lemon pie was good. it was a new kind of pie for me. we went saturday evening and they had little left to choose from; couple slices of lemon pie, one slice of vegan apple, a buttload of some nut pie and some savory stuff (but we were here for dessert). the cashier didn't seem too thrilled to be there.
author: Kan L.

description: great pie, the only problem is it goes down way to fast
author: Tim G.

description: such an amazing addition to our neighborhood. and incredible pies too. we buy them anytime we need to bring a desert somewhere, it is always a big hit.
author: A H.
